description: McLEAN, Va., March 3 Brig. Gen. Lloyd R. Leavitt Jr., U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Leavitt have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Christine Leavitt, to Richard David Whitmyre, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Murray Whitmyre Jr. of Taipei, Taiwan, formerly of Mount Kisco, N. Y.

title: On Land Once Toscanini's, Disharmony Is Heard
description: The sprawling lawn that once was part of Arturo Toscanini's estate on the Hudson River in the Riverdale section of the Bronx has become controversial construction site.

title: FOES AT INSTITUTE DIG IN FOR A FIGHT
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 3 The institute seethes and simmers, said Prof. Morton White, a philosopher at the Institute for Advanced Study.

title: Storefront sociology in behalf of the young, the poor, the obscure
description: Portraits of Loss, Separation and Neglect. By Thomas J. Cottle. 232 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $7.95.

title: Bold Victor 2d at Big A
description: Jacques Wimpfheimer's Champagne Charlie, in his first 1973 start, won the Swift Stakes at Aqueduct yesterday with a strong, finish that enabled him to beat Bold Victor by a head.

title: Divorced Find Help at L. I. Agency
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.My divorce was a liberation. I feel more alive and confident than I have in nine years.

title: Ski Areas in the Mountains A 2Hour Drive from L.I.
description: Long Islanders are intrepid autoists. They battle the Long Island Expressway every day, and on weekends, when the weather is warmer, the battle is continued in the parking areas of the many Long Island shopping centers, beaches, and parks.

title: Wives Urged to Send Food Receipts to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (UPI)  Representative William R. Cotter, Democrat of Connecticut, has urged housewives to send President Nixon their grocery receipts to protest soaring food prices.

title: POLLUTION FOUGHT ON LAKE SUPERIOR
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 3 In what environmentalists are calling a classic pollution case, Federal and state agencies were again preparing this week to move against the Reserve Mining Company.

title: SEE ME, SEE My KNEE. Return of the short evening dress
description: Okay, so there aren't as many galas as there used to be. That leaves New Yorkers with virtually nothing to dojust art openings, better jewel auctions, theater, opera, teteatetes in East Side bistros, the symphony, the country club and other occasions when peaceable people assemble after dark.. For those little evenings? Lots of leg. Maybe even some shoulder. An honesttogoodness waistline. That's the short of it for evenings, black tie or not. It's a time for natural stockings, strippy sandals and masses of pearls. Unless you prefer the simplicity of the unadorned neckline:

title: HANDBOOKS ISSUED BY A RIGHTS GROUP
description: Handbooks on The Rights of Prisoners and The Rights of Mental Patients are being sent into the nation's 300 prisons and more than 500 mental institutions by the American Civil Liberties Union. The group said yesterday it was prepared to sue any institution that censors the books.

title: Adriane Andreae Is the Bride of Delano de Windt 2d
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., March 3Miss Adriane Andreae, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Maynard Rudolph Andreae, was married here this afternoon to Delano de Windt. 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Mandell de Windt of Lyndhurst, Ohio. The Rev. William Swift performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church, Cranbrook.

title: Jeanette Kaye Johnson, 79, Retired Lawyer Here, Dies
description: Mrs. Jeanette Raff Brillas, who had practiced law here under the name of Jeanette Kaye Johnson, died Tuesday in Orlando, Fla., where she lived. Her age was 79.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: March 9Grumman Antique and Sports Car Club and Porsche Club of America rally school at Pickwick Motor Inn, Plainview, L. I. (exit 48; Long Island Expressway) 8 P.M.; second of three sessions with third on March 23. Information: write Grumman club at P.O. Box 313, Old Westbury, LI I., or phone (516)3345944.

title: Student Groups Providing Recreation at Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I. State University students no longer have to travel off campus for a hot pastrami sandwich, an ice cream soda, a beer, or just a cup of coffee. A studentrun program now provides these services right on campus. Facilities include coffee houses, a hero sandwich store, a pub, an ice cream parlor, a science fiction library.

title: Environment Co. Presents LowKey Multimedia Works
description: The Environment Co.'s Ten Hundred Inch Radii, Thursday night at the Washington Square Methodist Church, was the kind of event that would, probably appeal in a lowenergy sort of way to anybody who likes nonthreatening, none  too  original but often pleasant multimedia experiences.

title: Governor's Drug Bill Splits Black and Puerto Rican Legislators
description: ALBANY, March 3Governor Rockefeller's proposal for tougher penalties for drug traffickers has posed problems for the Legislature's, black and Puerto Rican members.

title: Michael Baldwin Weds Miss Bailey
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., March 3 Miss Margherita Bailey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Horace Converse Bailey of Bedford and Cotuit, Mass., was married here this afternoon to Michael Baldwin, a vice president of White, Weld & Co., investment bankers. Mr. Bailey is a senior vice president of the Chemical Bank, New York.

title: Janice Marie Molesworth Wed To. Anthony drown of B.O.A.C.
description: Miss Janice Marie Molesworth was married yesterday afternoon in Epsom, England, to Anthony Allen Brown, a cadet engineering officer with the British Overseas Airways Corporation. The Rev. Derek Bedford performed the Anglican ceremony in Christ Church.

title: INDONESIA REVISES SCHOOL PROGRAM
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia Feb. 27 Indonesia has started a vast revamping of her educational system in an effort to make it more effective.

title: What's Opened Recently At the Movies?
description: TEN FROM YOUR SHOW Of SHOWS, directed by Max Lieaman, got 11 favorable reviews (Roger Greenspun, Times; Kathleen Carroll, News; Archer Winsten, Post; Howard Kissel, Women's Wear; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Andrew Barris, Village Voice; Gene Shalit, NBC; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Jay Cocks, Time) and 2 mixed (Joseph Gelmis, Newsday; Pauline Kael, New Yorker). At the Festival.

title: ACROSTIC PUZZLE
Maria Regina Engaged
description: HARTSDALE, N.Y., March 3Mr. and Mrs. Henry M. Regina have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Maria Theresa Regina, to Thomas Michael Rogers.

title: The Ghosts Dance Once Again at Wounded Knee
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D.  In the fall of 1890, a new religious fever, Ghost Dincing, spread among the Indian tribes pushed to the far edge of the prairies by broken treaties and the advance of the white man. Their religion held that floods would come, destroying, the whites. And then, game would return; dead Indians would be resurrected, and living Indians would be protected from all harm by wearing painted ghost shirts and performing the special dance.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE RUSH TO CONVERT DOLLARS ABROAD forced the closing on Friday of foreignexchange markets in Frankfurt, London, Brussels, Amsterdam, Vienna and Tokyo. Gold in London at the weekend closed at $86.30 an ounce Major U.S. banks raised their prime rate to 6 per cent following the increase of onehalf of 1 percentage point in the discount rate.

title: What Labor Want on Trade
LIGHT OPERA GROUP OFFERS PINAFORE
description: The Light Opera of Manhattan, solidly into its fifth year of Gilbert and Sullivan at the Jan Hus Playhouse, seems to be getting better all the time. It's new production of H.M.S. Pinafore Thursday night had had zest, charm and the unpretentious sense of fun that remains the company's most distinctive calling card.

title: The Forgotten Factor
description: WASHINGTON, March 3You can hardly read a newspaper or tune in on the evening news these days without thinking that this is a demented world. Israel, living in a state of siege, shoots down a Libyan civilian plane with the loss of over 100 lives. Arab terrorists retaliate by murdering two U.S. diplomats in Khartoum and the obvious conclusion seems that we are living on the verge of anarchy.

title: Steiner of Switzerland Wins Ski Jump in Lahti Games
description: LAHTI, Finland, March 3 (UPI)  Switzerland's 22yearold Walter Steiner today glided 103 and 114 meters from the new 90meter hill in the 48th international Lahti ski games to win the event by more than 25 points ahead of Hans Schmid, a teammate.

title: Shari C. Jochem, Nurse in Capital, To Wed June 16
description: QUINCY, Ill., March 3 Miss Shari Christine Jochem, A graduate of the Georgetown University School of Nursing, and James O'Neill Duffy Jr., also a graduate of Georgetown, plan to be married June 16.

title: Specialties Endless At Paramus Shop
description: PARAMUSWhen a gourmet shop has 10,000 items on hand, that would appear to be more than enough for the most eager cook, but, according to Bud O'Brien, there is always someone looking for Item No. 10.001. It's hard to believe that sometimes we don't have the particular preference of a customer, said Mr. O'Brien, partowner of the Jugtown Mountain Smokehouse outlet here, but we always try to finds it.

title: Las Vegas Hotel Sold
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., March 3 (UPI) The Riviera Hotel has been sold to Aits, Inc., a Bostonbased travel company, No sale price was announced.

title: Rutgers Training Mediators
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  A shortage of trained mediators to handle the growing number of disputes involving public employes in New Jersey has led the Extension Division of Rutgers University to establish a Mediators Training Institute.

title: Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia teachers' strike, the second longest on record, had all the elements that are becoming increasingly common to urban education: The refusal of teachers to subsidize public education, as they put it; the power of organized labor to back up that refusal; the reluctance of taxpayers to pay for the demands; the growing black enrollment of the schools; the use of the school system as a political pawn. As such, the strike had lessons for other big cities.

title: Newark Teachers and School Board See a New Era of Peace
description: NEWARK  While school boards and teacher unions elsewhere in New Jersey and the nation have found themselves embroiled in bitter contract negotiations andc strikes in recent weeks spokesmen for this city's chief educational factions are looking toward a period of reconciliation and progress.

title: B AS IN BASIC
Trends
description: WASHINGTONNone Is Fun, read the lapel buttons sent out by mail.

title: Mexico and the Odd. Men Out
description: NADI, FijiThe lovely little reef and atoll islands that dot the South Pacific have particular reason for being pleased with the forthcoming world tour this month of Mexican President Lufs Echeverrfa Alvarez.

title: 4 Women Get Into the Act In Reporters' Show Here
description: The first four women members of the Inner Circle signaled their entry into the organization of present and past political reporters last night by singing a song with a character portraying Representative Bella S. Abzug.

title: ACTRESS OPPOSES ORDER ON INQUEST
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 3An inquest into the death of the business manager of Sarah Miles, the actress, has pitted two prominent Arizona lawyers against each other in a legal dispute over whether Miss Miles and Burt Reynolds, the actor, should be required to appear at the inquest.

title: Miss Bechtel Bride in Jersey Of J. C. Green
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.J., March 3Miss Barbara Jean Bechtel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Warren Bechtel, was married here this afternoon to James Colbert Green of Steamboat Springs, Colo. The Rev. David Van Sickle performed the Protestant ceremony in the Upper Ridgewood Community Church.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: My Gallant Runs Head Behind Favorite
description: MIAMI, March 3Our Native a hardworking colt who ha?? laboriously accumulated $105, 083 in 19 races, won the Fla mingo Stakes today in the 20th start of his young life, collected another $91,520 in on?? chunk and delivered a rousing testimonial to the clean, hard oats that grow in the Re?? River Valley.

title: Nader Report Says V.A. Is Failing Vietnam Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, March 3The Federal Government, the Veterans Administration in particular, has failed to meet the problems of returning Vietnam veterans because of the V.A.'s orientation toward older veterans, a Ralph Nader report charged today.

title: CARL M. BOWMAN, PSYCHIATRIST, 84
description: Dr. Karl M. Bowman, who directed the division of psychiatry at Bellevue Hospital here and was professor of psychiatry at New York University Medical College from 1936 to 1941, died Friday in San Francisco, where he lived. His age was 84.

title: GUIDO MARCH!
description: Guido Marchi, a retired banker and uncle of State Senator John J. Marchi, died yesterday at the Verrazann Nursing Home on Staten Island. He was 90 years old and lived at 25 Hanenwood Road, Stapleton, S. I.

title: Gardens
description: AMERICANS like to do things, in a big way, even when It comes to vegetable growing feed catalogs boast of the yields to be expected from giant and jumbo varieties. At harvest time, the newspaper photo always features the most mammoth pumpkin grown in the county. And grocers prefer to stock the biggest fruits and vegetables available.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The arrival of the first major shipment of Soviet heating oil in Boston and New York early last month is a measure of how far politics and trade have moved in recent months. Who would have thought as recently as three years ago that the day would come when Bostonians and New Yorkers would be warming their homes with Red oil and be delighted at the prospect?

title: A's Count on vida Blue From Start
description: Three optimistic managers, one expensive stadium, one bulky set of owners and a bunch of peddled players are new in the American League this year, but the most significant newcomer is the designated hitter.

title: Harwood at Democratic Helm
description: MINEOLA, L. I.About 12 hours after he was elected chairman of the Nassau County Democratic organization, Stanley Harwood began discussing another election that could well determine how successful a leader he will bethe upcoming race for Nassau County Executive.

title: B. H. Knox Marries Mrs. Emily Crafford
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., March 3  Mrs. Emily Charlotte. Brown Crafford and, Benjamin Hughes Knox were married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church. The Rev. David W. Brown performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. John Haynes.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:The overall attitude of Peter Steinfels and Robert Veitch, as well as of the four books on the drug problem they recently reviewed for you, bothers me: they suggest that we must deal with an abstract drug problem rather than with a group of human beings who are addicted to drugs.

title: MYAKKA PRINCE TRIUMPHS IN PACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 3 Two years ago, the first Saturday, of that season at Roosevelt Raceway, 32,988 fans were present and wagered $2,736,052 on a clear, 36degree night. Tonight, in a steady rain, only 21,924 turned out and bet $2,156,819. The answeraccording to managementis that OTB didn't become a factor until April 8, 1971.

title: The Good Word
description: Just to put a little suspense in this thing: What do you suppose the following people would have been if they hadn't been writers  Philip Roth, Jean Stafford, John Updike, Kurt Vonnegut, Murray Kempton and Norman Mailer? Is there some shadow career that lopes alongside their prose and occasionally sticks its disappointed bloodhound face into their dreams?

title: Miss Howard Gains Final
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., March 3 (AP)Topranked Mel Howard of Radcliffe and Barbara Sands of Dartmouth, gained the final in the women's intercollegiate squash racquets championships today. Miss Howard defeated Sally Fields of Princeton, 151, 159, 1418, 1510, and Miss Sands beat Mel Tobin of Wellesley, 157, 1512, 1315, 155.

title: Nixon's Presidency: Expansion of Power
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 Richard M. Nixon, in what he achieved in his first term and what he has undertaken in his second, is attempting an expansion of Presidential powers that could have mole impact on the national Government than that of any President since Franklin D. Roosevelt.

title: Deborah Ringgold Is Bride on L. I.
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., March 3  Miss Deborah Caines Ringgold, daughter of Mrs. James Richard Ringgold of NeW York, and the late Mr. Ringgold, was married here this afternoon to William Edward Mulvey Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Mulvey of Wollaston and Marshfield, Mass.

title: Planners Set Curbs On Homes For Elderly
description: Builders of nursing homes and similar facilities in Brooklyn and Queens face some restrictions under a zoning amendment approved last week by the City Planning Commission.

title: Bans on Sharing Houses At Resorts Are Imperiled
description: SOUTHAMPTON, LI., March 3Nearly a dozen local village and town ordinances designed to discourage the phenomenon known as grouping, which over the last several years has changed the character of a number of resort communities on Long Island, may be in constitutional jeopardy as the resuit of a Federal Court decision this week.

title: Banana Boats Spark Boom in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 3  Five days out of Tela, Honduras, a British ship, the Roatan, carrying 6.8million pounds of bananas, sailed up the icechoked Hudson River this week to Albany.

title: Better Hurry, Caball Is Retiring in Three Years
description: MONTSERRAT CABALLE is a veritable grab bag of surprises, but the shock that jolts the most is her matteroffact announcement that in three years she is going to retire. It was a mere eight years ago that the soprano exploded on the international operatic scene when, in the classic unknownreplacesstar situation, she substituted for Marilyn Horne in a concert version of Lucrezia Borgia at Carnegie Hall. Before that historic night, the lady from Spain had been traipsing around Europe doing her thing and attracting little or no attention. Then, suddenly, the nobody became a somebody. Today at 40, and most definitely in her prime, Caball is a prima donna sui generis. So why is she planning to call it quits?

title: Palmer Signs for $90,000
description: BALTIMORE, March 3 (UPI) Jim Palmer, a 20game winner for three, consecutive seasons, signed with the Baltimore Orioles today for an estimated $90,000. The Orioles' two major holdouts are Boog Powell' and Dave McNally.

title: News Summary and Index SUNDAY, MARCH 4, 1973
description: International

title: Photography
description: THE retrospective exhibition of Paul Strand photographs it the Metropolitan Museum through April 15 is an edited version of the one that opened at the Philadelphia Museum of Art in November, 1971. Where Philadelphia saw nearly 500 photographs, New York is seeing only 139. However, what the show loses in scale, it gains in concentration. Five hundred photographs are really too many for most people to comprehend at a single viewing, and the edited version covers all the main aspects of Strand's work.

title: Glassboro Ponders the Future of Hollybush, 1967 Summit Site
description: GLASSBORO  Glassboro State College officials are grappling with the question of how best to utilize and restore Hollybush, the site of the 1967 summit conference between President Johnson and Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union.

title: Kerr on The Hot L Baltimore
description: I CAN'T give you the name of the ingenue in Lanford Wilson's The Hot L Baltimore because the keeps changing it almost dailyshe's just dropped Martha because there are too many Georges aroundbut I can tell you one thing she's poticed. She's noticed that whenever you stop by a bench in a city park or on a traffic island the normal people sitting there won't open their mouths. It's only the crazies that'll talk to you, she murmurs, letting just the least trace of worry mar her absolute confidence that a major miracle will occur during her lifetime.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the last paragraph of the article Developers Turning to West Midtown [Feb. 18], Seymour Durst gets to the heart of the fight to preserve Clinton with this comment: Mobility is more important a choice to move elsewhere.

title: Nopersonsclature
description: WASHINGTON, March 3Cummings is the soul of frivolity. Nothing is serious to hint Nothing even sacred. The tightest of causes cannot squelch his childishness. Just a moment ago he popped into the office here, mind giggling over the belated discovery that in the feminist movement a chairman is usually called a chairperson.,

title: AIRLINES CRITICIZED ON CARING FOR PETS
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP) Consumers Union has warned that the temperatures of airplane compartments where pets are stewed can go from freezing to frying.

title: Newsmen in Italy Attack Bid to Buy Prestigious Daily
description: ROME, March 3The professional organization of Italian newsmen in a leadership meeting this week discussed what it termed ominous developments in the information media and issued a warning that freedom of the press in Italy is in danger.

title: I Knew Some Day I'd Be a Star
description: HAYS, KANSAS. I HOISTED 6yearold Charlene Budke onto my hip. My size 9 feet wedged into size 6 shoes were killing me. I was tired, so tired I could die of tiredness. It was partly that I was a recent widow, but it was also the eight kids. Eight kids take a lot out of a weak, scrawny woman.

title: Out of the East Captures $25,000 Stakes on Coast
description: ALBANY, Calif., March 3 (AP)  Out of the East, the favorite, charged to a twolength victory over Chios in the $25,000 Contra Costa Stakes at Golden Gate Fields today.

title: The Summer Rush Is on at Long Beach Island
description: BEACH HAVEN  The sun glistened in a cold, blue sky, the temperature hovered in the teens, pounding breakers hid most of the wide, white ocean beach and ice etched the shores of Barnegat Bay.

title: Music: Tokyo Quartet
description: The Toyko String Quartet which has been winning international prizes and mak ing a fine reputation for itself in the three short years of its existence, appeared on the Friday evening program of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center. These four young former Juilliard players.  Koichiro Harada and Yoshiko Nakura, violins; Kazuhide Isomura, viola, and Sadao Harada, cellofully lived up to the quartet's own reputation and the, Chamber Music Society's ideals.

title: One Man's Vacation Is Another Man's Bemusement
description: THE beauty, the economy and the ease of a houseboat vacation in the Thousand Islands area of the St. Lawrence River are evident enough to most people who have tried it, but there are cumulative side effects for the island dwellers that are not so evident. For one thing, the houseboat traffic has become so heavy the people who live in the area have taken to calling the watergoing apartments St. Lawrence Sampans. For another, the level of seamanship on display is such that some day cartographers may be mapping the Nine Hundred Fifty Islands. The typical renters are a young couple with two children who live in New York or New Jersey and who have never been on water a day in their lives before they arrive in the Thousand Islands. If they rent from a marina called Holidays Afloat, at Ivy Lea, on the Canadian side of the river, they will be given an instruction booklet that completely describes the maintenance and operation of their houseboat, down to and including the correct micrometic gap for the sparkplugs of their 40horsepower outboard engine.

title: U.S. Urges Commission Appeal For a Halt to Vietnam Fighting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 3 (Reuters)The United States today proposed another joint appeal for a halt to hostilities in South Vietnam.

title: Mohammad, All Set Pace For Pakistanis in Cricket
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, March 3 (Reuters) England lost its hold on the first cricket test with Pakistan today. In the morning, England carried its total from 272 runs for four wickets to 330 for five, then collapsed in the afternoon, losing its last five wickets for 25 and going all out for 355.

title: 151 Shot Firsi After Hobeau's Bowie Score
description: BOWIE, Md., March 3Like homesteaders defending a wagon train loaded with gold, local trainers threw 22 horses against two New Yorkbased raiders today in the divided John B. Campbell Handicap.

title: Music: Midnight Show
description: Columbia Records managed to fill the Radio City Music Hall to its artdeco gills Friday night at midnightf or a pleasantly trivial classical concert of sorts. The question is, though, how many, members of the same predominantly young audience would turn out for another such concert. Another question might be whether the pursuit of profit is the best motive for musical pedagogy.

title: Point of View
description: Housing chairman, Metropolitan Council, American Jewish Congress.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:FOR whom does the architect build today? What is his responsibility? asks Ada Louise. Huxtable in Nothing Is the Way It Was.

title: The new Fashions of The Times/Spring '73
description: Spring used to be a navy blue coat and a flowered hat. And today? A waistlength jacket. A flaring topper. A pair of pants. A slinky dress.

title: Pages of Time Flip Fast for SecondhandBook Stores
description: When Murray Dauber is happy he whistles brisk bits of Bach as he works among his 250,000 used books. But there was a sad tone to the Bach passage that he chose for whistling the other day and he drew the low notes out long.

title: Plan to Install Team Ministry Upsets Bergen Parishioners
description: ORADELL  Most of the 8,000 parishioners of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church are looking forward to Lent with mixed emotions. The Lenten season is the time that Archbishop Thomas Boland has set to replace the St. Joseph's pastor and curates with a threemember team of priests.

title: Writers Group Names Monzon Boxer of Year
description: Carlos Ivlanzon: of Argentina; who successfully defended his world middleweight crown four times last year, has been named to receive the Edward J. Neil Trophy as fighter of the year fer 1972 by the Boxing Writers Association.

title: France
description: PARISAfter pondering long and hard on how to break the Gaullist hold on the French electorate, Socialist party leader Franois Mitterrand came up some time ago with what he hoped would belt winning strategy. He would give France, for the first time in 15 years, a choice between the Gaullists on the right and the Communists on the left. He would transform the Socialists, a poor third, into a viable alternative. And he would do so by entering into a tactical alliance with the Communists at the polls that the Socialists would dominate.

title: RIVALS OF MAKARIOS WARNED BY GREECE
description: ATHENS, March 3Greece has come to the support of Archbishop Makarios, President of Cyprus, in a move by three rival bishops to topple him as head of the Orthodox Church Cyprus.The three prelatesMetropolitans Yennadios of Paphos, Anthimos of Kitium and Kyprianos of Kyreniasent Archbishop Makarios an ultimatum expiring Wednesday asking him to resign or be deposed for violating a church law that bars clergymen from holding temporal offite.

title: March Sunlight
description: Regardless of what happens now, winter is almost past and spring is immediately ahead. Don't expect too much of March, which can be as whimsical as a butterfly in June. But March will pass and April will come. Meanwhile, go out on a sunny day and just sit in the March sunshine and know, without counting days or looking at a calendar, what is going to happen. Don't ask how you know, but bare your head and hold out your hand and feel the sunlight, and simply know.

title: Revenue Sharing Defectors From the Nixon Plan
description: WASHINGTON  When President Nixon started impounding Congressional appropriations and trimming his budget, part of his plan was to prod the Congress into finishing its work on his new Federalism. But his moves have had an unexpected side effect, scaring the wits out of his natural alliesthe state and local officials whose money and power were supposed to blossom under a rain of Federal tax revenues.

title: Instant Spa for Europeans
description: PARISIn the beginning was the spring, and when more and more people came to drink its water, there came the spa. One day in the Middle Ages, an unknown genius dreamed up the idea of bringing the water to the people rather than the people to the water. He had just invented the bottled water industry.

title: HAAREN,CLINTON GAIN CITY FINAL
description: Clinton and Haaren gained the final round of the Public Schools Athletic League basketball championship yesterday at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. Clinton had little trouble beating Erasmus Hall, 7149, but it took a remarkable rally and an overtime for Haaren to stop Jackson, 9594. Jackson had led by 15 points with 2 minutes left in the fourth quarter.

title: OPENING THIS WEEK
description: THE TOOTH OF CRIMETonight, Performing Garage, 8. A play by Sam Shepard.

title: BRUINS TROUNCED BY CANADIENS 51
description: MONTREAL, March 3 (Oil) YyanCournoyer scored twice in the first period tonight the Montreal Canadiens took 40 lead and coasted to a 51 victory over the Boston. Bruins before a crowd of 18,960 a record Mr the Forum.

title: PRISON HEAD TELLS. CHIEF HE IS QUITTING
description: WALPOLE, Mass., March 3The Walpole prison superintendent, Raymond E. Porelle, told State Corrections Commissioner John O. Boone last night that he was resigning, but a spokesman for the Commissioner said today that he believed Mr. Boone had persuaded him to reconsider.

title: Libraries In Suffolk Are Cutting Services
description: BELLPORT. L.I.Suffolk County's 48 public libraries are curtailing services because of declining Federal funds and rising costs, while serving the fastest growing county in the state, the library director said last week.

title: Cindy Schorr Engaged
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., March 3  Mr. and Mrs. Lionel Schorr have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cindy Heide Schorr, to Randolph Jay Goodman, son of Mrs. Cohen Goodman of Great Neck and Norman P. Goodman of New York.

title: Hearings to Open on Alternative Solutions to Smog Problem in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, March 3In a major milestone in the national air pollution abatement program, the Environmental Protection Agency will open three weeks of hearings here Monday to find out what sacrifices the 10 million citizens of the Los Angeles basin are prepared to make to meet Federal air quality standards.

title: 70 Hospitalized in Florida In Typhoid Fever Outbreak
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., March (AP)Seventy persons, most of them children, have been hospitalized after an outbreak of typhoid fever at a migrant labor camp here.

title: Television
description: THE basic idea was not complicated. Take a single family, record its daily activities on film over an extended period, edit the footage down to a closeup portrait that might provide a few enlightening glimpses of contemporary American life. The result was An American Family, the public television series conceived and produced by Craig Gilbert and initiated by Jim Day with Curtis Davis as executive producer, within the nowdismantled. NET.

title: Gray Days Ahead for the F.B.I.
description: No wonder the Administration and so many Americans hold Congress in low esteem; why should they not, in view of such an illprepared and inconclusive performance as the socalled confirmation hearing conducted last week in the Senate on the nomination of Patrick Gray to be director of the F.B.I.?

title: Ireland
description: DUBLINIreland, said one columnist in the course of the election campaign, is not the fatherland any longer but the Godfatherland. He was not suggesting that the Mafia had a hold on the country. But he was saying that the Fianna Fail party, in power for all but six of the past 41 years, had become too complacent, too oossridden, too much of a clan, and that it needed shaking up.

title: The pearls of cookery
description: Mushrooms, once called the pearls of cookery, have had their ups and downs. The Romans prized them, but in the Dark Ages they were shunned. Today they are considered pearls once again, often pearls of great price.

title: Mrs. Erbsen Wed To James Posner
description: Mrs. Jill P. Erbsen and James R. Posner, both of New York, were married here last evening by Rabbi Alan Miller at the Society for the Advancement of Judaism.

title: Terror in Khartoum
description: The brutal, coldblooded murders in Khartoum constitute an act of barbarism that has appalled the civilized worldand it is only the latest in a string of similar acts of criminal insanity that civilized nations can no longer tolerate.

title: Drugs
description: A series of police raidsconducted after months of secret investigationopened up pockets of youthful drug users and sellers last week in area schools, from the college level down to junior high.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fee Outlook Jars Brokers
description: With a swiftness that is surprising even to its, most ardent proponents, a revolution is sweeping through Wall Street. Radical changes are occurring and many of the people involved are not convinced that it's all in the public interest, much less their own interest.

title: The Maestro Who Never Takes a Bow
description: When he is on the concert stage, Louis Yelnick never wets his thumb or his forefinger. It would help mechanically, but it would be an unseemly breach of the best etiquette of his craft.

title: Who Could Resist These Women?
description: I HAVE my reservations about A Little Night Music, but they are the kind of reservations you like to tuck in your pocket for later reference so as not to interfere with your pleasure in what is going on. The show itself, adapted by Hugh Wheeler from an Ingmar Bergman film and set to talkative tunes by the restlessly inventive Stephen Sondheim, is a thing of considerable gracesometimes a bit selfconsciously sowith the courage of its quaintness, a love of the halflight, and open arms for the talents of three irresistible women.

title: AROUND THE
description: Here we go again.... Get out the pruning shears to be sure they are sharp and clean.... Use them to trim up grapevines... fruit trees... latepruning tools on thinbarked trees such as maple and pruning tools on thinbarked trees such as maple and dogwood; trim them up when they are in full leaf. ... Wait until forsythia blooms to trim roses.

title: 1 Killed and 2 Hurt as Car Veers Into Oncoming Lane
description: DIX HILLS, L. I., March 3One man was killed and two others were injured early today when an automobile going east on the Long Island Expressway veered across the center mall, rolled over several times on the westbound lane and was struck by another car.

title: Movies
description: THE studio cut off my legs and then said, Next time, you go out there and win a race for us. But what they didn't know is that the mind can grow any kind of legs it wants. Im the original rubber man, and Tin bouncing right back. I may be starting at the bottom again, but I'm feeling good. I just, refuse to feel bad any more.

title: Caryl Chaiken Will Be Bride
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., March 3Dr. and Mrs. Bernard H. Chaiken have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Caryl Joy Chaiken, to Douglas Nathaniel Gordon, son of Mrs. and Mrs. Eugene H. Gordon of Stamford, Conn., and New York.

title: Progress Is Seen in Roosevelt Poverty Program Despite Rise in Welfare Roll
description: ROOSEVELT, L. I.While the poverty program may fall to the national verdict of failure, it is providing a narrow margin of hope and support to many poor people here who never counted on it being a total success.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Housing demand has kept pace with last year's record production, and environmental factors are becoming important restrictions in many local markets, according to the semiannual report prepared by the Advance Mortgage Corporation, a subsidary of the First National City Corporation.

title: Reds, Pirates Rank High Again
description: It wasn't easy, but spring training has finally arrived.

title: BREGAR BREAKS WEIGHT RECORD
description: PRINCETON, March 3Ted Bregar began Navy's bid for its first I.C. 4A indoor track and field title today with a meet record performance in the 35pound weight throw.

title: Letters
description: The best of whose worlds?

title: Ruth Couldn't Resist
description: IT'S a safe bet that the busiest pianist in New York this week will be Ruth Laredo. Some months ago she accepted an invitation to appear in George Cree's Great Pianists at Lincoln Center series at Tully Hall. That recital will take place Wednesday night. Then a few weeks ago her old and good friend Alexander Schneider said that he was putting on a small Brahms festival. Would she like to take part and would she give him an immediate yes or no. The offer was irresistible; the pianist said yes. What she was committed to three programs scheduled at the New School, to be played within 26 hours next Saturday evening and next Sunday afternoon and evening. She will have to function in all of the nine chamber works to be played, performing with Schneider, the violist Walter Trampler and the cellist Leslie Parnas. Mrs. Laredoshe is the wife of the violinist Jaime Laredoshipped her 3yearold daughter, Jennifer, off to her parents in Detroit, began eating her Wheaties and dug in.

title: PENN FIVE TAKES IVY TITLE AGAIN
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 3 Pennsylvania won the Ivy League basketball championship for the fourth year in a row, clinching the title tonight with its easiest league victory of the seasona 7446 rout of Dartmouth in the final game of the regular season.

title: Dave Anderson
description: On Friday the New York Football Giants, alerted to eviction from Yankee Stadium after two home games there next season, will have their request to play at Yale Bowl debated by the Yale Corporation, a group of buttondown noblemen who consider Frank Merriwell to be more of a living legend than Norman Snead. In their desperation, the Giants trust that the Yale Corporation will remember that the Giants wear blue jerseys, too. But the shame is that the Giants must search for a site for their other five home games, although it's really City Hall's. shame. City officials insist that the reconstruction timetable for Yankee Stadium demands that demolition begin Oct. 1 for the ballpark to be retooled by, the 1976 baseball season. But before the timetable was announced, a wellplaced city official was heard to snarl:

title: Waiting on France ...
description: France's parliamentary election, to be held today and next Sunday, has aroused concern among that country's partners in the European Community and the Atlantic Alliance. Throughout the campaign, polls have shown the ruling Gaullist party well behind the Union of the Left, an alliance of Socialists and Communists.

title: Decision in France
description: PARIS. On the platform, listening to the words of welcome, the introductions, the strictly local speeches, Francois Mitterrand's heavy, swarthy face remains absolutely impassive. When it is his turn to speak, his approach to the lectern is diffident and hesitant. He makes no effort to reach out to the audience with a smile, a wave, a friendly gesture. The applause and cheers he could do without. His job is to speak, and to speak sense that those people out there will understand.

title: Heath Under Pressure Over the Pound
description: LONDON, March 3The spotlight of the world money crisis has fallen squarely on the Government here this weekend, tripping Prime Minister Heath in its embarrassing glare.

title: Taipei's Snack Alley Is Demolished
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 3One of the most colorful areas in Taipei, a night market where crowds gathered each evening to partake of such Taiwanese delicacies as oyster omelets and dried squid or to quaff tonics of fresh turtle blood or pulverized snake mixed with wine, is being demolished to make way for a new thoroughfare.

title: South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  Who the hell does the Government think it is that it should tyrannize our children like that? asked the Rand Daily Mal An act of unmitigated disaster for South Africa, said Mrs. Helen Suzman, the only Progressive party member of Parliament. A draconian measure and not the outcome of normal judicial processes, said the principal of the University of Capetown, Sir Richard Luyt.

title: Woman May Hold The Purse In Suffolk
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I.Jean H. Tuthill considers herself somewhat of a novelty.

title: Housing Authority Solicits Art Work
description: ENGLEWOODThe Housing Authority here has invited artists to submit designs for sculpture, murals and mosaics suitable for the public spaces at the, agency's Vincent K. Tibbs Housing Project.

title: STRIKE POSTPONED A MONTH ON PATH
description: A strike that was to have shut down the Port Authority TransHudson Railroad today was postponed for a month yesterday at the behest of Federal mediators in Washington, who said they needed more time to resolve the yearold dispute over carmen's wages.

title: Written in Tears And Blood...
description: THERE is a relentless logic in the fact that Eugene O'Neill, America's greatest tragic playwright, ended his career with the writing of a starkly autobiographical play. Long Day's Journey Into Night is the story of the four O'Neillscalled the Tyrones in the playat a moment of anguished crisis in the summer of 1912. The play's names and events are, so thinly disguised that there is no disputing the literal nature of its revelations.

title: 5 Colombians Held Here in Raid On a Marijuana Smuggling Ring
description: Warning five Colombian nationals that they can give the word to their friends in the consulate and down in Colourbia that they'd better be careful, a United States magistrate yesterday held them in $250,000 bail each on narcotics conspiracy charges involving 1,500 pounds of marijuana.

title: Resignation of Cardinal O'Boyle, Capital Archbishop, Is Accepted
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP) The resignation of Patrick Cardinal O'Boyle as Roman Catholic Archbishop of Washington has been accepted by Pope Paul VI, the Vatican announced today.

title: ARE YOU READY? IT'S TIME TO MEET YOUR PUBLIC
description: The assumption, of course, is that the elegant Mrs. Sidney Lumet always wears ivory silk to read Baudelaire in the original French. Not so. Sometimes she wears blue jeans. Or, as Mrs. Lumet, a French major at Radcliffe, put it: I always wear blue jeans when I'm not wearing ivory silk. Eh bien. Ralph Lauren's ivory silk starts with a flared skirt ($80) and silk shirt ($60). The jacket is mantailored ($ 190). Third floor, Bloomingdale's.

title: HotelRoom Inventory Off
description: New York City experienced a net loss of 2,950 hotel rooms last year, according to the annual survey made by Stephen W. Brener, senior vice president of HelmsleySpear, Inc.

title: Moscow Joins the Outcry At Killing of Diplomats
description: The Soviet press joined in the international outcry yesterday against the murders of the hostage diplomats in Khartoum, the Sudan.

title: Twelve Works of Naive Genius
description: This is a singular book. Students of American painting have long recognized a deep, primitive streak in our native art, a strong, selftaught often mystical element which reflects the independence of the national spirit; but Walter Teller seems to have been the first to detect the same, naive quality in our literature. Where primitive painting is usually gay and affirmative, however, the dominant theme in Teller's collection is either defeat or a sense of unrecognized accomplishment. Several pieces end on a note of mute despair. Yet it is hard to think of the idea of naive literature in America without remembering the journalist who, like a number of these writers, printed and distributed his own testimonial of selfand Leaves of Grass is nothing if not affirmative. Type and symbol of the selfpublished author, Walt Whitman is proof that few Miltons would sleep mute and inglorious in a democratic churchyard.

title: COMMON MARKET WEIGHS JOINT STEP IN DOLLAR CRISIS
description: BRUSSELS, March 3  The executive authority of the European Common Market worked on a recommendation today for a joint float of the member countries' currencies, and stiffer controls on international movements of money, as defense against the influx of dollars that has thrown financial markets into a new monetary crisis.

title: D. PAUL REED, LED CHARITY AGENCY
description: D. Paul Reed, executive director of the National Information Bureau, Inc., since 1941, died at St. Luke's Hospital Friday evening following a stroke. He was 67 years old and lived at 140 East 83d Street and in Ridgefield, Conn.

title: Surfacing
description: Margaret Atwood's Surfacing invites comparison with Sylvia Plath's The Bell Jar: both novels by poets, both about a young woman who has been made desperate by a stifling social milieu and who can find relief only by abandoning what those around her have defined as sanity. Yet Plath's novel, written 10 years ago, expresses only a pure and private suffering; her heroine, Esther, can make no more impression. on the conditions of her lifethose of New England suburbia in the Eisenhower yearsthan a fly on the walls of the jar enclosing it. The sixties, whatever else they left unchanged, at least broke open that particular doll's house.

title: Early Days Revived at Airport
description: COLTS NECKSurrounded by cornfields, but with suburbia creeping closer each year, is one of the oldest and most rustic airports in the metropolitan area.

title: Mads Madsen Weds Diana Davis
description: ST. LOUIS, March 3Miss Diana Vietor Davis of New York and Mads Peter Madsen of Plainfield, N. J., were married here this afternoon in the Episcopal Church, of St. Michael and St. George by the Rev. Jack E. Schweizer.

title: Chess: What Looks Odd and Seems To Break Rules, Yet Works?
description: Hypermodern play often smacks of the arcane. If occupation of the center is the formidable weapon it is supposed to be, how can the hypermodernist afford to delay it? And why would he?

title: DABNEY CAPTURES MILE RUN IN 4:13.6
description: Bill Dabney, who had some doubt that he could run a topflight mile indoors, proved himself wrong yesterday and he was happy that he did.

title: HANOI TO CONFER WITH U.S. ON AID
description: PARIS, March 3Key American and North Vietnamese officials plan to hold private talks in the next few days on details of the establishment of a joint economic commission, which would play a major role in channeling United States aid to North Vietnam, wellplaced diplomatic sources said today.

title: Illegal Aliens: Thousands Fear Risk of Exposure
description: NEWARKTwo years ago, Juan and Rosa met and fell in love while working on a production line in a factory near here. They decided to marry.

title: Zoning Plan for Jericho Is Approved
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I.  The Oyster Bay Town Board voted last week to adopt a development plan and approved amendments to the Town Building and Zoning Code to help insure the planned development of almost 700 acres of undeveloped land in Jericho.

title: HANDBOOKS ISSUED BY A RIGHTS GROUP
description: Handbooks on The Rights of Prisoners and The Rights of Mental Patients are being sent into the nation's 300 prisons and more than 500 mental institutions by the American Civil Liberties Union. The group said yesterday it, was prepared to sue any institution that censors the books.

title: THERE'S A HOLE IN CENTER FIELD
description: For the third straight year, the New York Mets are in training camp as the defending champion of third place in the National League's East. Some of the faces are newWillie Mays, Rusty Staub, Felix Millan, even Yogi Berra as managerbut the issue is old: Can they recapture the lightning that struck in 1969?

title: Office Market Improves Slowly
description: Leasing activity in the Manhattan office market picked up somewhat last year, but the record amount of new space that became available left a substantial inventory that is still vacant and rentable.

title: U.S. Is Studying Its Options in Sudan
description: WASHINGTON, March 3A State Department task force kept in steady contact today with developments in the Sudan, after the killing of two American diplomats by Black September commandos, but there seemed little that could be done to capture the commandos without endangering the remaining hostages in the Saui Arabian Embassy in Khartoum.

title: Andrew Sether Plans To Wed Miss DeFina
description: The engagement of Miss Louise Marie DeFina, to Andrew Sether, a member of the Nassau County (L. I.) Police Department, has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. DeFina of Brooklyn. Mr. DeFina is a sergeant in the New York Police Department.

title: FRENCH ELECTIONS WILL BEGIN TODAY
description: PARIS, March 3France will vote for a new Assembly tomorrow in the most unpredictable and probably closest election she has had in years. The vote will be the first half of a tworound election to be completed next Sunday.

title: AND A WORD FROM OUR LEADER
description: Once upon a timein October, 1964, to be exactGloria Steinem was photographed at a Manhattan Discotheque for L.B.J. party wearing a lowcut olive wool dress by Rudi Gernreich.

title: M'CUNE TRIUMPHS IN BOWLING FINAL
description: MILWAUKEE, March 3 (UPI) Don McCune, of Munster, Ind., won the $80,000 Miller High Life open, today on the strength of 32 strikes in four finalround games.

title: Chou Plans Pakistan Trip
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 3 (AP)The newspaper Mashriq reported today that Premier Chou Enlai of China would visit Pakistan, possibly in June.

title: 3 Shot in Attacks On City Policemen One Suspect Slain
description: Three persons were shot early yesterday in three separate incidents involving attacks on policemen.

title: Participants Recall Bizarre Lindbergh Kidnaping Trial
description: HOPEWELL  It was 41 years ago last Thursday that the 18monthold son of Charles A. Lindbergh was kidnapped from his home three miles from this rural village.

title: Plainfield: Long Live the Queen City
description: PLAINFIELDEver since the racial riot of 1967, this city has been striving to attain the reputation it had years ago: the Queen City of New Jersey, a place where innovation, camaraderie and progressive policies were merged. The rebuilding has been slow but steady, and all of it appears to be uphill. The 47,000 residents, 40 per cent of whom are black, seem to have adopted the common goal of updating the educational systern, making government work and reinvigorating the business district.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastem Standard Time

title: LibraryGetsDeGaullePapers
description: PARIS, March 3 (Reuters)The family of the late Gen. Charles de Gaulle has turned over to the French National Library all the manuscripts of the general's books in their possession, the library announced this week.

title: Unshakable Will to Survive Sustained P.O. W.'s Over the Years
description: LOS ANGELES, March 3One man did sitting up exercises for four straight hours. Another made bracelets and rosaries from bits of rock and wood. Some prayed, or wrote poetry or worked out complex mathematics in their heads. Most studied new subjects ranging from auto mechanics to psychology. All became experts at stretching out even the smallest task, such as folding a blanket or chewing a piece of bread. In these ways, the American prisoners of war fought their fiercest enemy, timetime and such factors as isolation, boredom and

title: INTERPEX Opens Friday
description: CELEBRATING its 15th anniversary, the International Philatelic Exhibition INTERPEX one of the premiere annual stampcollecting events of the early months of the year  begins at 10 A.M. next Friday with a whirl of activities that will fill the hours of the weekend through Sunday night.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Home Improvement
description: SOLDERING is a useful and fairly simple technique that is essential for many electrical and plumbing jobs, and it is handy for making numerous repairs to metal articles around the house. However, like most other established techniques, there are a few rides that must be followed if longlasting satisfactory result are to be insured.

title: Upstate Prison Goes From Crisis to Crisis
description: COMSTOCK, N. Y.Around a bend on N. Y. 4 in the rolling upstate farmland, the grim yellowbrick walls of the Great Meadow State Correctional Facility loom out of the snow like a mirage.

title: They PleaseBut Do They Satisfy?
description: JIM DINE'S retrospective at the Whitney Museum three years ago was, or so it seems in. memory, one of the most various, insouciant and at the same time flimsiest major shows in recent years. The 126 mostly somewhat inventive, somewhat beautiful and somewhat ironic or whimsical works in that show were dearly all by the same artist; but even in orderly chronology they somehow seemed ajumble, like the unsorted contents of an attic. One sensed the presence of artistic intentions but was hard put to reckon what those intentions might be.

title: Up from the kitchen floor
description: It is a decade now since the publication of The Feminine Mystique, and until I started writing the book, I wasn't even conscious of the woman problem. Locked as we all were then in that mystique, which kept us passive and apart, and kept us even from seeing our real problems and possibilities, I like other women, thought there was something wrong with me because I didn't have an orgasm waxing the kitchen floor. I was a freak, writing that booknot that I waxed any floor, I must admit, in the throes of finishing it in 1963.

title: BULLETS TROUNCE KNICKS, 97 TO 75
description: If last night's 9775 victory for the Baltimore Bullets over the New York Knicks was truly a playoff preview, the National Basketball Association playoffs may turn out to be a lot shorter for the Knicks then most people anticipate.

title: New Route Enriching ExCarrier
description: As a boy of 14, Mark Brelsford was earning $30 a month on a paper route in the San Francisco suburbs. After a year he bought a motor scooter, a foresighted purchase that enabled him to triple his business. Entering amateur motorcycle competition, Brelsford won 200 trophies in two years. When this palled he turned pro. In his first year as a professional motorcycle racer, he grossed $20,000, all while he still was in high school. Last season; his sixth as a pro, Brelsford reached the $100,000 bracket in winning the Grand National championship of the AmeriMotorcycle Association.

title: Tampa Fills Void Today In Jumping
description: The American Invitational show jumping event, successor to the American Gold Cup in a rather complicated and confusing series of switches, is scheduled for today in Tampa, Fla., Stadium.

title: the travelers world
description: OUR Jan. 28 lament on the horrors of eating in turnpike restaurants evoked many comments from readers. Mrs. Ruth S. Ernst of Scarsdale, who took refuge in verse, Wrote: I know just what you mean, having suffered the insults of highway fare many a time...I hope you will enjoy the enclosed poem. It follows:

title: World News Briefs Plane Crash Kills 25 in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, March 3 (Reuters) A Sovietbuilt airliner of Bulgaria's Balkan Airline crashed while landing at Moscow's Sheremetyevo Airport today, killing all 25 people aboard.

title: PUZZLES
description: IMPROPER NAMESBy Eugene T. Maluku

title: Woman, 92, Reports Rape
description: A 92yearold woman was allegedly raped by a thief who had entered her Bronx apartment yesterday through a bedroom window. According to the police of the High Bridge station, a husky man in his middle 30's climbed through the window, demanded money from the woman and when she told him that there was no cash, he allegedly assaulted her. She was treated in Lincoln Hospital and was released

title: Freedom of Press Is Described As the Leading Consumer Issue
description: Herbert S. Denenberg, the Pennsylvania insurance Commissioner, told the annual New York consumer Assembly yesterday that the No. 1 issue facing consumerism was the Nixon Administration's wrong, outrageous and dangerous attempts to control the press.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Metropolitan
description: Well, I'm the last of the old breed of grand acquisitors of works of art. I've done it since 1959 and I guess personally tally up about a quarter of a billion dollars that has come in to the Metropolitan in works of art since then, and I'll probably stick with the Metropolitan through this particular kefluffle, you know, and stick with it until this is cleared up, which I'm sure is going to be cleared up in our favor....

title: An Oscar Night for Kearny
description: KEARNYOn Wednesday, 10 Oscars will be awarded here. They are not Hotlywood's Oscars, to be sure, but they are of great interest to northern New Jersey theeter1overs. These Oscars, 10 ceramic statuettes of a furry black cat, will be presented at the 10th anniversary dinner of the Halfpenny Playhouse.

title: TV Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: IF IT RAINS, TAKE COVER.
description: Wrap yourself in a blue denim rain topper with white saddle stitching and loose, rollup sleeves. The mandarin collar and the deep armholes accentuate the vaguely oriental feeling. Since rice paddies are in short supply in these parts, you might wear this getup on a rainyday trek to Chinatown in search of the latest Szechuan or Hunan restaurant. The topper, of polyester and cotton denim, is $50; matching pants are $30. By Pembroke Squires for Main Street. Available later this month on the third floor at Bergdorf Goodman.

title: 4 WORKS PRESENTED BY STEPHEN DANCERS
description: There was nothing sublime, but there was plenty of the ridiculous in Friday night's concert by the Edith Stephen Dance Weapons Company in the LouisNikolais Theater Lab at 344 West 36th Street.

title: Son to Mrs. Schaeffer
description: ROCKVILLE, Md., March 3 A son was born on Feb. 21 to Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Schaeffer at the George Washington Hospital in Washington.

title: Pornography Throat Cutting
description: This is one throat that deserves to be cut. I readily perform the operation in finding the defendant guilty as charged. On that scornful note, Judge Joel J. Tyler last week convicted Mature Enterprises Inc.the principal exhibitor of the pornographic movie, Deep Throat of promoting obscenity.

title: The Bonnyclabber
description: Nine out of ten times when open a new novel I'm overcome by a great mental yawn. And I'm a novelist, not your ordinary bibliophobe. I think the real reason for the decline of the novel is the increasing popularity of sleeping pillswho needs fiction? This state of affairs will probably continue till literary folks stop confusing the serious with the ponderous. Austen, George Eliot and Hemingway are among my favorite writers, too, but who wants to read the same thing again and again and again? As a rule of thumb I would suggest that any novel that appears to have the sacrosanct cachet of the serious fiction of yesteryear is likely to be a bore.

title: Minor Quake Reported
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., March 3 (AP)A minor earthquake jolted the town of Arvin, about 15 mites southwest of here, today, the California Polytechnic Institute Seissmological Laboratory reported.

title: Economic Problems Dividing Leftists On Eve of Chilean Legislative Election
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 3 When President Salvador Allende Gossens was elected in 1970 with little more than third of the vote, the key slogan of his Marxist, coalition of Socialists, Communists and other splinter groups was, A united left will never be defeated.

title: The Region
description: During his first quest for the mayoralty, almost eight years ago, John Lindsay answered the telephone at one of his neighborhood headquarters.

title: Use of Firemen to Patrol Cities at Night Stirs Controversy
description: IRVINGTONEvery night at 6:30, four Irvington Fire Department station wagons, each manned by two firemen, are dispatched on eighthour patrols of the city's streets. Their mission? To seek out both fire hazards and other potential dangers to the public safety.

title: Arthur Daley
description: COCOA, Fla., March 3I always said that Willie Mays was the best ballplayer I ever saw, said Leo Durocher making an obvious observation sound like a pronouncement from on high, because he talks with a brassy assertiveness that defies challenge. No one wanted to argue the point with him anyway, but it's Leo's style to keep a chip on his shoulder at all times. A lot of chips have teetered on the Durocher shoulder over the years because there have been air awful lot of years. There have been so many of them that Leo the Lion began automatic collection of his baseball pension of $25,000 a year as soon as he advanced into the Medicare set in July of 1971. It didn't embarrass him a bit. Leo has too much gall for that.

title: Father of a Foster Child To Help Pay Her Expenses
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., March (AP)The father of a 15yearold girl who became a ward of the state despite a family background of wealth has stepped forward to offer payment toward his daughter's expenses.

title: Sheila Young Captures Sprint in Speed Skating
description: INZELL, West Germany, March 3 (AP)Sheila Young of Detroit swept to victory today in the women's 500 meters for sprinters at the international amateur speed skating tournament

title: Helen Rumsey Fiancee Of Lieut. Michael Barr
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., March 3Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Maxwell Rumsey have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Helen June Rumsey, to Lieut. Michael Charles Barr of the Navy's Judge Advocate General Corps. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Barr of Fairmount. The wedding is planned for March 17.

title: Flageolet et Petit Pois
description: FOREIGN VARIETIES of vegetables often adapt well to conditions here, and have the appeal of a slight differentness in flavor and looks. As a child, I thought the English marrows in my father's Massachusetts garden were prettier than the conventional warty yellow crookneck squash, and more delicious, too (but they're blander). The small fruit of the French marrow Courgette also has delicate flavor.

title: BLAST TO DIVERT ICELAND LAVA OFF
description: A plan to set off an underwater explosion to divert lava from the threatened town on an island off Iceland has been shelved after two scientists reported that such a blast could blow up the entire island.

title: Marisa Knowlton Wed in Capital to Andres Domeyko
description: WASHINGTON, March 3In St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Marisa Knowlton, became the bride of Andres Domeyko. He is the son of Alan Domeyko, a retired Chilean enplomat who held posts at the United Nations and in Canada, and Mrs. Domeyko of Santiago, Chile. The bride's parents are Mrs. Robert Almy Knowlton of New York and Santiago and the late Mr. Knowlton, who was an author and a former managing editor of The United Press.

title: NORTH VIETNAM FREES 3D GROUP OF U.S. PRISONERS
description: CLARK AIR BASE, the Phillippines, Sunday, March 4 North Vietnam today released a third group of American military prisoners of war.

title: Music
description: Pairing Julian Bream and John Williams for a duoguitar concert seems a lavish expenditure of talent, but that is what happened at Town Hall on Friday night and again last night in a repeat performance.

title: The World
description: The gleam of a tommygun on a balcony. The captor's face masked by scarf. The cries of hatred, the demands. The passage of the hoursand then the shots. And the dreaded announcement that the Black September commandos had slaughtered some of their hostages.

title: Pop
description: EVEN though it is five years sate the Nashville Sound achieved national recognition, country music performers have continued to omit New fork City from their itineraries. Artists who could easily draw an audience of 3,000 in western New Jersey or Connecticut, knew that to play in Manhattan would mean playing to less than halfempty houses.

title: The Ultimate Trip Is All SelfPromotion
description: HERE I was in America, traveling clear across the country and back at the expense of my publisher. And the marvelous thing about it was not only that it was travel, not only that it was free, but that it gave me the feeling of actually doing something, not just writing about it.

title: Soviet, Starting Purge, Puts Lenin on Party Card No. 1
description: MOSCOW, March 3 (AP)Lenin's name has been inscribed on Card No. 1 as the Soviet Communist party begins an exchange of membership cards. It is the first general purge of the elite in 19 years.

title: MINNESOTA BEATS PURDUE, 79 TO 66
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., March 3 (AP)Minnesota, the Big Ten's basketball leader, scored 10 straight points in the final four minutes today, beating Purdue, 7966. Jim Brewer led the Gopher with 19 points.

title: The Autograph Hound
description: I don't care what happens in Nebraska, no matter who writes about it, an early critic of Willa Cather once exploded. This book could almost make one feel the same way about New York.

title: Cook Sworn as Chief of S.E.C. Nixon Rules Out Age as Barrier
description: WASHINGTON, March 3President Nixon looked on as G. Bradford Cook took the oath of office today as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the President then said that age should not prevent appointment to high office of a young man of proven ability.

title: SUSPECT IN HOLDUP IS SHOT BY VICTIM
description: A man accused by the police of having robbed several social clubs on the Lower East Side in the last two months was shot: and critically wounded by a patron early yesterday in another alleged holdup at a social club at 78 Forsythe Street.

title: Ads Seeking Nominees For Three Judgeships
description: A reform Democratic group has placed classified advertisements in Monday's edition of The New York Times and yesterday's New York Post asking qualified persons who would like to be judges to apply by Tuesday.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: BrooklynThe Etchers of Paris, 18801900, in the Print Gallery, Brooklyn Museum. Also, All Communities Arts, Community Gallery, and Roland E. Vega: A Sculptural Enviromnent, Corner Gallery. Hours: 11 A.M. to 5 P.M. today, Wednesday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 5 P.M.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Miss Conover Betrothed
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., March 3Mr. and Mrs. George R. Conover have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Catherine Conover, to James C. Albisetti, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Albisetti of Wilmington, Del. A July 14 wedding is planned.

title: A book for children because it doesn't treat them as children
description: Books pour from the writing factory known as Vera and Bill Cleaver in a succession so rapid as to be frightening, and like all writers of prolific production they have their low moments along with their high. The Whys and Wherefores of Littabelle Lee is, happily, one of the latter. Their first book under the Atheneum imprint, it is a tight, controlled, touching and unsentimental piece of work  a novel that is charming but not cloying.

title: Criminals At Large
description: It was only a short time ago that J. G. Jeffreys's The Thieftaker, a mystery novel about the Bow Street Runners in the England of 1798, was published. And it was a good one. Now, by coincidence, comes another historical mystery novel in which the central figure is a Bow Street RunnerBLACKSTONE, by Richard Falkirk (Stein & Day, $6.95). And it also is a good one.

title: Mailbox: Ski Touring
description: To the Editor:

title: Allen Scales Ruth's Pay Plateau
description: While the baseball world has had its eyes focused on Henry Aaron's pursuit of Babe Ruth's record, Dick Allen has sneaked in and broken. Babe Ruth's record before Aaron could.

title: LYLE AND MURCER POSE PROBLEMS
description: By acquiring Graig Nettles and Matty. Alou during the winter, the Yankees took what thay considered to be two giant steps forward in their attempt to climb back to the top of the American League after an absence of eight years.

title: An Inmate at Rahway Writes and Illustrates Two Books
description: RAHWAYThomas Trantino is 34 years old and an inmate in Rahway State Prison. When he was barely a teenager in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, he played hooky and was expelled from school. He became a drug addict at 14, and spent six years in a New York prison before he was 20.ink on black paper. It was confiscated by the prison authorities, and Trantino followed it up with another letter to himself in which he demanded to know why he had not answered his own letter.

title: Ca. Tech Promotes Baughan
description: ATLANTA, March 3 (AP) Maxie Baughan, a former allpro linebacker, was promoted today to assistant head football coach at Georgia Tech. Baughan, a former Tech star who played professionally with Philadelphia, Los Angeles and Washington of the National Football League, joined the Tech staff last season as the No. 1 defensive assistant.

title: Brookville Foes Say Work Starts On Road
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I.Construction began this weekend on a controversial road running from the State University of New York's college at Old Westbury through this village to Route 107 despite a pending court decision on a request for a temporary restraining injunction.

title: CROSSING THE HEM LINE
description: There was once a poor young woman who yearned to be a rich young woman with closets full of clothes, boxes of jewelry and three dozen pairs of shoes all in a row. She wanted more than anything to become a Beautiful Person and be on the BestDressed list. She pored over fashion magazines and dreamed of herself as a sleek beauty who would be harassed by photographers outside expensive restaurants and at fun parties. But she had no charge accounts and she couldn't be a BestDressed Person in her thrift shop coat and sneakers:

title: Job Discrimination Charges Grow
description: The comparatively low profile that has prevailed in the Government's antidiscrimination efforts since the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 was strikingly altered in January when the American Telephone and Telegraph Company agreed to a multimilliondollar settlement for alleged discrimination against women and minority males.

title: New &Novel
description: What is it like to be young, Czech and politically suspect? Miss Salivarova answers these questions in a bitter, sometimes funny and touching evaluation of the Prague social climate. When Jana Honzlova is not allowed to tour Finland with the rest of her singing groupthe Daisy Chorus  she appeals to the appropriate Government ministry to clear up the misunderstanding. If the truth were known (and it is by the ministry), Jana's father has skipped the country illegally and her two brothers are doing time in labor camps. The singer's naivet only gets her into hotter water.

title: Mr. Clurman Reacts
description: The most welcome aftermath of my hellfire and brimstone entreaty was that I did ask for  nay, demanded help and am now getting it. What I was describing was a method, the only potentially successful method I know, involving a new collaboration between an improved, motivated and responsive Parks Department and an awakened, helpful, responsible public. Together we might succeed. In conflict, with the department restoring and maintaining and the people destroying and littering, there is no possibility of success.

title: More Butley For Bates
description: WHAT'S going to happen to that fascinatingly fiendish chap Butley, now that he's said goodbye to Broadway? Don't worry, you'll be seeing him againin the movies. Ely Landau, whose American Film Theater is now preparing cinematic versions of such distinguished plays as O'Neill's The Iceman Cometh, Ionesco's Rhinoceros and Pinter's The Homecoming, reports that he will put Simon Gray's carbolic study of a selfdestructive English professor before the cameras in London on May 14.

title: NEW TRIAL TO OPEN IN YABLONSKI CASE
description: ERIE, Pa., March 3Under the tightest courtroom security measures yet imposed during the threeyear prosecution of those accused in the murder of Joseph A. Yablonski, yet another trial in the case will open here on Monday.

title: Janet Mary Goldberg Fiancee of Dentist
description: Mrs. Harold H. Goldberg has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Janet Mary Goldberg, to Dr. Barry Lewis Behrens, son of Mrs. Max Behrens and the late Mr. Behrens. A June wedding is planned.

title: The Swiss Image and the American Dream
description: ZURICH, Switzerland  For an American, it is curious to watch movie like A Clockwork, Orange in Zurich. The young here are so well behaved. There is rarely any violence in Swiss life, and when the Anthony BurgessStanley Kubrick film finally arrived in Zurich, there seemed little sympathy for its ultrasadistic hero in a city where every social comfort and need has been thought of and where nobody, seemingly, has any complaints. This was brought home during the intermission, or the interruption, as it should be called; while Americans in the audience groaned when it came right at a crucial point in the movie, the Swiss dashed for the lobby to get soft drinks, cigarettes, candy and ice cream.

title: What's it like to play for Heifetz? Nice
description: I first heard Lilit Gampel play in a televised performance with the Boston Pops. I liked the unselfconscious way she held her violin, her earnestness as she played the Mendelssohn violin concerto, her small, quick, undramatic nod to the audience when she was done and her almost awkward, humble exit. She didn't leave the stage like someone aware of creating a stir. But she did, of course, create one, not just because she played the Mendelssohn so well but because she was 12 years old.

title: Gambia Wrestles Problems of Underdevelopment
description: BATHURST, GambiaGambia celebrated the eighth anniversary of her independence from Britain recently with great public joy and with private expressions of surprise that the nation of 370,000, where peanuts are the economic mainstay, survived at all.

title: Sammy Davis Offers To Stage P.O.W. Gala
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (UPI)  Sammy Davis Jr. suggested to President Nixon tonight that entertainers stage a gala honoring returning prisoners of war and give the proceeds to the families of servicemen who died in the Indochina war.

title: Pres,
description: WASHINGTON All documents, papers, letters, photographs, audio and video tapes . . . all manuscripts, notes, tape recordings . . . all drafts, copies and final drafts of stories, columns and/or reports which in any way relate to a) the breakin at the Democratic National Committea headquarters . . . and/or b) . . . alleged political espionage againit . . . any candidate for the Democratic party nomination for the office of President of the United States.

title: Tribal Fighting Is Feared in Rwanda
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, March 3A campaign of harassment of the Tutsi tribe in Rwanda, particularly of Tutsi students, has been reported, and diplomats in neighboring Tanzania fear this could lead to fighting between Rwanda's Tutsis and the majority Hutu tribe.

title: IF IT SHINES, OH BROTHER!
description: We don't want to hear any complaints that there are no dresses around this spring. We've shown you gobs of shirtdresses as well as punchy prints. Now, in glorious black and white, here's a checked polyester dress with bloused top, pleated skirt and demure crepe bow at the neck. By Mario Forte for Rona, it's $75 on the eighth floor at Bonwit Teller.

title: East Stroudsburg Captures North Atlantic Gymnastics
description: East Stroudsburg State captured the championship of the North Atlantic Gymnastics League last night at Queens College's Fitzgerald Gymnasium. East Stroudsburg scored 49.8 points, out of a possible 180.0, topping West Chester State which had 147.8.

title: A master of role playing, strategem, power
description: Booker T. Washington was a relatively neglected figure during the revival of interest in AfroAmerican history in the mid 1960's. The general view of scholars and civil rights activists black and whitewas that Washington was indeed the epitome of the Uncle Tom and whiteman's Negro and that there was not much of relevance to be gained from any further study of his life. August Meier's major revisionist study Negro Thought in America, 18801915 (1963) was read initially by only the few interested specialists and laymen, and remained in relative obscurity. Then the outburst of cultural nationalism following the 1964 65 ghetto rebellions brought it, and a host of other books on the black experience, to the attention of a larger audience. Subsequently, the revisionist view of Washington was given a great push by the publication of a number of books in which his career was reexamined.

title: Japanese Says the Commandos Punched and Kicked 2 Envoys
description: TOKYO, March 3 (AP)A Japanese diplomat who was in the Saudi Arabian Embassy in Khartoum on Thursday said today that the Black September commandos who invaded the building punched and kicked the two captive American diplomats unmercifully.

title: wages The Magic Number Is A Blur
description: A thick fog settled last week over the Nixon Administration's Phase 3 yardstick for curbing runaway wage increases. It left many unions and employers groping for an answer to this question: How much would be too much in this year's negotiations covering nearly 5 million workers in trucking, automobiles, electrical manufacturing, rubber and other key industries?

title: Hour of Gold, Hour of Lead
description: There's absolutely no space limit on this story, a city editor told his reporters when the Lindbergh baby was kidnapped on March 1, 1932. Only a war would be of equal interest. Charles Lindbergh had come to feel after his famous flight to Paris in 1927 as the lone eagle that he was at the mercy of the public.
