After his marriage in 1929 to the intensely shy, very literary, 22yearold Anne Morrow, daughter of a Morgan partner who was United States Ambassador to Mexico, the Lindberghs were always in the news as they flew back and forth across the country to survey and plan transcontinental routes for commercial aviation. They were regularly on the front page when they made their pioneering flights to Latin America and the Orient.

title: State Is Preparing a Program To Give B.A. on Basis of Tests
description: The State Education Department has received a $300,000 grant from the Carnegie Corporation to develop a bachelorofarts degree program through which a student could meet all requirements solely on the basi of examinations.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Mimi B. Bowler, Dr. R. P. Younes Plan to Be Wed
description: BOSTON, March 3  Miss Marianne Bianca Bowler, plans to be married in July to Dr. Robert Paul Younes, deputy director of pediatrics and ambulatory services at the Carney Hospital in Boston. Miss Bowler, a student at the Suffolk University Law School here, is managing editor of This Week in Public Health, the publication of the Massachusetts Department of Public Health.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The securities and commodities markets were buffeted last week by the rekindled crisis in European currency trading. The value of the dollar plummeted and, for a while, so did the securities markets in this country.

title: Rutgers Youth Gets Highland Park Vote
description: HIGHLAND PARK  Michael Holdowsky, a 19yearold. Rutgers sophomore who won a seat on the Highland Park Board of Education last monthstill finds it hard to believe that he emerged as the top man in a field of seven candidates running for three seats.

title: The new Fashions of The Times/Spring '73
description: Put away the chains, the sharks' teeth. fetishes, the mixedup, patterns and the aggressive belt. Designers are talking coolth and couth this spring and the problem of getting it all together is simplified. There should be less trudging from department to department looking for the right sweater, the perfect scarf or expensive belt. In many cases, it comes packaged with the dress or suit.

title: Guerrillas Defend Killings at Khartoum
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 3Black September, the Palestinian guerrilla movement whose raiders killed three diplomats in Khartoum, the Sudan, last night, said today that the act was meant to tell the world to take us seriously.

title: JOFFREY PERFORMS PIECE BY HARKARVY
description: The simplest dances are often the most difficult to perform. Benjamin Harkarvy's Grand Pas, Espagnole is not complex choreographically but demands a sense of classic style that was achieved only intermittently Friday evening by the City Center Joffrey Ballet.

title: ISRAEL'S PREMIER SEES PEACE HOPE
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 3 Premier Golda Meir of Israe told 3,000 Israel bond buyers and supporters tonight that she believed that hostilities in the Middle East would someday cease and that Israel would survive.

title: Laura Evans and Dan Perin, Bank Officers, to Be Married
description: DETROIT, March 3Miss Laura Kathreen Evans and Edward Bridge Denson Perin, who are officers of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in New York, plan to be married here on April 7. The ceremony will take place in the Westminster Presbyterian Church.

title: Administration Reassesses Role in Transit
description: WASHINGTON, March 3During its second four years, the Nixon Administration says, it plans to look more skeptically at some of the exotic transportation systems that fascinated it during the first four years.

title: Cost Threatens Midstream Mail Delivery to Great Lakes Ships
description: DETROIT, March 3  As many as 70 times a day during the last 25. shipping seasons, the 45footlaunch J. W. Westcotelt has pulled alongside the massive ships that sail the. Great Lakes. The launch provides, midstream mail delivery, the only service of its kind.

title: Islanders Set Mark in Beating Canucks, 93
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., March 3 The Islanders, who had been unable to beat the Canucks in four previous games, cut loose against them tonight and rang up a 93 triumph. In their exuberance they scored the most goals on their home rink, equaling their record road total of nine when they manhandled the Bruins in Boston in January.

title: BUILDING WRECKAGE WILL BE DISMANTLED
description: BAILEY'S CROSSROADS, Va., March 3 (UPI)Rescue squads decided tonight to demolish a section of the wreckage of a 23story building in an effort to speed the search for 10 missing men.

title: REAGAN MAN GETS COAST COURT POST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 3 The appointment of William P. Clark Jr. to the California State Supreme Court was confirmed today by the State Commission on Judicial Appointments, 21, despite a controversy over his qualifications.

title: Britain
description: LONDONOn the face of it, the strikes, slowdowns, absenteeism and general disruption that plagued Britain last week were over wages. More fundamentally, they were symptoms of a bitterness that, in the opinion of some veteran politicians, has not been equaled in Britain since the general strike of 1926.

title: L.I. Group Bound to Books
description: It's a beautiful sickness, and we're all similarly ill, said Herbert J. A. Runsdorf of his fellow bibliomaniacs, the Long Island Book Collectors.

title: I LOVE YOU IN WHITE. ITS BEIGE. I LOVE YOU IN BEIGE.
description: Mrs. John Jakobson (far left), chairman of the Museum of Modern Art's Junior Council, is certainly no slouch in Stan Herman's silk shirtovershirt and raw silk skirt. $225, Lord & Taylor. Mary Sykes Cahan (center), assistant to the Metropolitan Museum of Art's development director, wears Mollie Parnis's fake sude cardigan suit. $395, Lord & Taylor. Then there's Mrs. Harold Reed, the art gallery owner's wife, in Chester Weinberg's flannel skirt, silk shirt and sweater jacket. $275, Bergdorf Goodman.

title: The Peace Conference
description: The Paris Indochina conference has neither added nor detracted from the possibility that one day real peace will descend upon Vietnam. Its importance is probably only that it took place, not that it accomplished anything of substance to enhance the settlement terms already accepted by the warring parties.

title: The Anxiety of Influence
description: Poets and prophets, like magicians, learn their craft from predecessors. And just as magicians will invoke the real or supposed source of an illusion as part of the patter, or distraction from what his hands are doing, the most ambitious poets also take some stance about sources in the past, perhaps for an analogous purpose.

title: RIEGER TRIUMPHS IN GIANT SLALOM
description: STE. ANNE DE BEAUPRE, Quebec, March 3 (AP)  Max Rieger of West Germany captured the World Cup men's giant slalom today after Patricia Emonet had led a French sweep in the women's slalom.

title: Congress Conservatives Found Losing Influence
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP)A waning of conservative efficiency in Congress is noted in vote ratings published by the American Conservative Union. The ratings were based on key votes of members of the 92d Congress during the last half of 1972.

title: COUGARS DEFEAT TAMS 134 TO 114
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 3 (AP)  Billy Cunningham scored 22 points and grabbed 14 rebounds today as the Carolina Cougars beat Memphis, 134114, in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Deadline For the Media
description: This is one of those tracts on the press that confine indolence with a conspiratorial pattern. James Aronson surveys th0 stuffiness and stupidity of America's leastcriticized institution and bemoans most its diversity. The Nixon Administration's singleminded campaign for monolithic media could be defeated by an equally singleminded resistance by the media. But the directors of the media will not accept a direct challenge, he writes.

title: Moondust Speck Missing, One 10Millionth of Ounce
description: LOUGHBOROUGH, England, March 3 (Reuters)A mystery about missing moondust remained unsolved this week, but scientists decided the whole thing was too small to worry about.

title: Japan's First Defense Plan Since the War Is Disclosed
description: TOKYO, March 3Authoritative Government officials said today that Japan's armed forces had drafted their first military doctrine setting forth fundamental plans for defending the nation from any attack by the Soviet Union or China.

title: Aged Get a. DayCare Unit
description: WOODBRIDGE  The doors of a 50yearold mansion and an adjoining building were opened last week to house a Middlesex County daycare center for the elderly.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: About 100 high school studentssome throwing bottles, rocks and pieces of woodclashed with the police in White Plains Friday night after an emotioncharged basketball game that the home team lost 63 to 61 in the final seconds. Three policemen suffered minor injuries and two youths were arrested, the police said yesterday.

title: SHOP TALK
description: ROSELLE PARK  The Leisgre Arts Center, which Mr. and Mrs. Marvin Maltz opened almost two years ago, is a captivating place.

title: Stamps
description: CANADIAN Mounties celebrating their 100th birthday, and American Quakers, lead passel of new issues timed by various participating countries to coincide with the opening on March 9 of INTERPEX, the International Philatelic Exhibition held annually in New York City.

title: The Lover
description: Malcolm Boyd has been writing books at a fast clip over the last few years. He did some on religion and the mediaa logical subject for the television producer turned priest. He wrote on civil rights  not unusual for an activist clergyman. Then he did a book of prayers, Are You Running With Me, Jesus?

title: Ira Tellers Have Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Ira Teller of Paramus, N. J., on Wednesday in Mount Sinai Hospital, Mrs. Teller is the former Miss Virginia Shelley, daughter of Mrs. Morris Oberhardt of Brooklyn. The child, the couple's second son, has been named Ryan Michael. His father is director of advertising and publicity for the National General Pictures Corporation.

title: Vermont Backs Hitchhiking
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., March 3 (UPI)  The Vermont Senate adopted an amendment yesterday to make hitchhiking in the state legal again.

title: Hanoi's Long Bien Bridge, Hit In 1972 Bombing, Is Reopened
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, March 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Long Bien Bridge across the Red River was reopened to road and rail traffic today, two months and three days after the end of the heaviest American bombing.

title: MISS WADE BEATS MISS GOOLAGONG
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 3 (AP)Virginia Wade used her strong serve to defeat the Australian star, Evonne Goolagong, 76, 63, in the semifinals of the $50,000 S&H tennis tournament today.

title: IF YOU ?? RED, WE'RE THROUGHT
description: Never mind basic black. 11 Nothing's more basic than a gototheparty red dress, this one of silk georgette. Teena McConnell, a dancer with the New York City Ballet, barely had the dress on before she was twirling around, at which point the pleated skirt and ruffled hem whirled open like a giant rose. The matching scarf is skinny and tied high on the neck. Bill Blass, who always knows exactly what he's doing, finished it off with a very basic red silk rose at the shoulder. At $695 (fifth floor, Saks Fifth Avenue), your basic red is not for little evenings. Wear it in public, and even the Columnists will notice. Why Dick Cavett might even invite on his show. Your basic red production number could stand a decent helping of your basic red rubies, with or without your basic big diamonds. Van Cleef & Arpels put them together for a pair of very basic ruby and diamond earrings.

title: TV on Guard at School
description: Michael Shapiro leans forward in the simple wooden chair, a telephone receiver held close to his left ear, his yes riveted to one of nine television; screens on the gray metal control board in front of him.

title: Rigney Named to A's, Post,
description: MESA, Ariz., March 3 (UPI) Bill Rigney, former manager of the San Francisco Giants, California Angels and Minnesota Twins, was hired by the Oakland A's today as an administrative assistant. Among his duties, Rigney will providess the color and some play by play for Oakland's televised games and many of the club's radio broadcasts.

title: Wheat for Russia Tied Up on U.S. Docks
description: HOUSTON, March 3The billion  dollar Russian grain deal is causing dissension on the Houston docks.

title: Son to Mrs. Krasnor
description: A son was born on Feb. 10 to Mr. and. Mrs. Robert Krasnor at the Lenox Hill Hospital. The child has been namedWilliam Samuel.

title: Friends and Fans Pay Tribute To Rodriguez at St. Patrick's
description: About 200 friends and fans of Tito Rodriguez, the singer and band leader who died Wednesday evening, paid him tribute in a memorial service yesterday at St. Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Nepela Takes Title In Figure Skating 3d Straight Year
description: BRATISLAVA, Czechoslovaka, March 3 (UPI)Ondrej gepela captured the men's world figure skating title today or the third straight year to he thunderous applause of an excited crowd in his hometown.

title: WILLIAM F. CASSEDY JR.
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., March 3William F. Cassedy Jr., who retired in 1960 as president and a director of the Aircraft Radio Corporation of Boonton, died yesterday in a nursing home in Chatham Township. He was 77 years old and lived at 17 Farley Road.

title: Best Seller List
description: FICTION

title: F.B.I.'s Gray
description: WASHINGTONIn the 47 years that J. Edgar Hoover ran the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Congress was nothing if not obsequious. If there were Congressmen who questioned his standards and values, they did not do it to his face.

title: Condominium Rejected By Glen Cove Planners
description: GLEN COVE, L. I.A proposal to turn 42 acres of the Arthur M. Loew estate into a 240family luxury condominium has been turned down by the City Planning Board.

title: Martine Cherau Fiancee of Lawyer
description: SUDBURY, Mass., March 3 The engagement of Miss Martine Cherau, daughter of Mrs. Bernard Gaston Cherau and the late Mr. Cherau, to Owen Sullivan Walker, son of Mrs. Norman S. Walker of Ashfield, and the late Mr. Walker, has been announced by the future bride's mother.

title: Want to Ski The World? Join Army
description: CRYSTAL MOUNTAIN, Wash., March 3  Do you want to learn how to ski? Join the Army.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Although at the moment it may be hard to believe, spring is just around the corner. So it's time for the airlines to unlimber the promotional big guns they'll be aiming at the vacation traveler.

title: Caesar Conquers And Coca, Too!
description: TEN from Your Show of Shows, is a collection of 10 sketches originally seen on Max Liebman's Your Show of Shows, the extraordinary 90minute, Sid CaesarImogene Coca Saturday night television series that began in 1950 and went off the air four years later when the partners split, the production costs rose and sponsors became scarce.

title: WOMEN'S BENEFITS ADDED BY A UNION
description: In a step described as a breakthrough for women, the trustees of the welfare fund of the Social Service Employes Union, Local 371, announced yesterday that they would begin making disability payments to women incapacitated because of pregnancy or childbirth.

title: OMBUDSMAN BUSY WITH ALIENS HERB
description: In a glasswalled cubicle in nondescript office building near the World Trade Center, Cono Trubiano sits, listens to complaints and appeals for help.

title: Miss Sills Excels In Maria Stuarda At the City Opera
description: Maria Stuarda returned to the New York City Opera Friday evening, but you'll have to hurry if you want to attend Donizetti's bel canto history lesson: it closes out its run for the season: with the second performance tonight.

title: Let Me Hang It All Out
description: MUCH has been made in recent months of the fact that this year marks the silver anniversary of A Streetcar Named Desire which most people interested in my writing still regard as my best work for the theater. I am more inclined toward Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, that is, toward the play in its original and true form without the anticlimactic reappearance of Big Daddy in Act Three with nothing to do but to tell an offcolor story about a male elephant being visibly influenced by the seasonal aura of a female elephant in the adjoining stall.

title: Death of a Bookstore
description: Once every five or six weeks, on a day when my work has gone very well or very badly, I take the 104 bus up to Columbia University, where I lunch on ghastly food in those Broadway joints the students seem to like, glance through the little magazines in the nearby stores, and spend half an hour at the Columbia University bookshop. I've been doing this for eight or nine years now, as a way of passing some time in contented aloneness. Usually I buy a book or two at the Columbia store, telling myself that I need them, and sometimes that's even true.

title: Schools Get State Edict Not to Use
description: SPRINGFIELD  In a steppedup campaign designed to combat air pollution, the state's Department of Environmental Protection has ordered public schools to stop burning coal for heat.

title: WILBUR J. BERNARD
description: ORANGE, N.J., March 3Wilbur J. Bernard, senior partner of the law firm of Bernard, Netchert, Silverlieb & McDonough, a specialist in real estate law and a former professor at the John Marshall Law School, died Thursday at his home here. He was 75 years old.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The Environmental Defense Fund (E.D.F.) has joined with other conservation groups seeking the right to intervene in Federal hearings involving the operating licenses of four Connecticut River hydroelectric dams.

title: Catherine Healey To Be Wed in July
description: Mrs. Raymond B. Healey of Jamaica Estates, Queens, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Catherine Healey, to Richard Gerard Sheehan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jeremiah R. Sheehan of Peabody, Mass. A July wedding is planned.

title: Air Fares
description: The man on the telephone was persistent: Exactly how much would cost him to fly from New York to London this summer? Finally the Manhattan reservations agent for Pan American World Airways said tartly: Fin sorry, sir, but we don't know. Nobody does.

title: Peter Goelz Weds Diane deSimone
description: HANCOCK, N. H., March 3Miss Diane Adele deSimone, a state probation officer in Keene, was married here this morning to Peter Goelz, coordinator of program development for the Antioch Graduate School's Harrisville Center. Justices of the Peace Thomas Herman and Sherwood Vachss performed the ceremony at the home.

title: Jazz Group Finds A Horne in Jersey
description: SPRING LAKE  Back in 1966, four musicians who had enlivened the New York jazz scene in the nineteenfifties and sixties were lured to New Jersey to play at the Ferryboat in Brielle. They stayed on long after that job evaporated, have settled in the area and are now playing four nights a week at Sullivan's Lodge.

title: Angus of England Captures U. S. Court Tennis Crown
description: Howard Angus of London won the United States amateur court tennis championship by defeating Pete Bostwick of New York, 65, 62, 63; yesterday at the New York Racquet and Tennis Club.

title: Convenience RunnerUp
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 3  Susan's Girl won the $100,000 Santa Margarita handicap at Santa Anita today by three lengths.

title: ALLIN'S 198 LEADS CITRUS GOLF BY 4
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 3Brian (Bud) Allin, who served in Vietnam as an Army artillery officer, was right on target today. With a third round of 67 in the Citrus open tournament, the 135pounder equaled the 1973 pro golf tour's 54hole scoring mark of 198.

title: GROUP DISCUSSES FOOD COOP HERE
description: A group of farmers from farming cooperatives in the South met with a small group of Harlem residents yesterday in an attempt to spark the development of cooperative buying clubs in poor communities that would serve as a market for farmers' produce.

title: A TERRORISTS GIVER IN SUDAN; FREE 2 HOSTAGES
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Sunday, March 4Seven Black eptember commandos, who killed three diplomats on Friday, surrendered this morning to the Sudanese Government. The two remaining diplomats held hostage by the Palestinian commandos since Thursday, were reported safe, ending a threeday war of nerves.

title: Tristate Area's PollutionControl Aides Are Concerned Over Nixon Budget Cuts
description: Budget cuts ordered by President Nixon are causing confusion among pollutioncontrol officials in the tristate area and are threatening to slowor even bring to a haltpollutioncontrol programs at a time when pressures are growing to clean up the air, the water and the land.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONA notable aspect of this capital, and probably this country, is that hardly anybody seems to object much to a devaluation of. the dollar but hardly anybody apart from economists thinks it will do much good.

title: Dolphin Credits Redskin For Help in Super Bowl
description: Manuel J. (Manny) Fernandez, one of the outstanding performers for the Miami Dolphins in their Super Bowl victory over Washington, gives some credit to John Wilbur, the Redskins' right guard who played across the scrimmage line from Fernandez, for making his afternoon so pleasurable.

title: A LITTLE OUT OF JOINT
Respectable pillagers of the community
description: You are poor, old and black. You have a rundown home in the ghetto, but at least it is a home, your home. Until one day when a nice homeimprovement salesman persuades you to glue an ersatz brickfront onto your home to enhance its value and somehow consolidate your debtsall for only $1,500. So you sign a blank contract (the man said he'd fill in the right numbers afterwards), sign a mortgage on your home, and later find yourself saddled with a $7,000 debt for $500 worth of renovation.

title: Recordings
description: IT'S hard to believe, but at last the record companies seem well on their way to presenting us with a complete cycle of the Verdi operas. Last year we had I Lombardi from Philips, next month promises a Giovanna d'Arco on Angel, and integral versions of Un giorno di regno and I vespri siciliani will be forthcoming in the near future. Presently at hand is a handsomely recorded, notecomplete edition of Attila (Philips 6700 056, two disks), the composer's 9th opera and the 19th of his 26 stage works to receive a commercial recording.

title: Struggling now for human rights
description: At 9:50 p.m. March 5, 1953according to the official communiqudJosef Vissarionovich. Stalin, for nearly 30 years dictator of the Soviet Union, died. In the 20 years since that time great changes have occurred in the world and in the Soviet Union. Many of the massive crimes of Stalin and his henchmen were exposed in Nikita S. Khrushchev's famous secret speech in February, 1956. Russia experienced a thaw.

title: SKYLAB ASTRONAUTS HAVE RESCUE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (UPI) America's Skylab astronauts this spring will be the first men to go into space with chance of rescue if things go wrong, a veteran astronaut, Capt. Charles Conrad Jr., said this week.

title: Professor's Ketch Stirs Dispute
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, March 3When the little, homemade sailboat named Cascade missed by a buoy's width of winning the Southern Ocean Racing Conference championship, the world of boat manufacturers, designers and sailmakers must have breathed a collective sigh of relief.

title: 2Fam Hse, Eklyn, Built 1747
description: The door to the old white frame house set back from the quaint picket fence at 1640 East 48th Street in the Flatlands section of Brooking. has often swung open to the curious and the nosatgic, the student and the scholar. Now it is unlatched to admit real estate brokers and prospective buyers.

title: ...WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM SOME FRIENDS
description: In recent years, the big word around the cosmetics empires has been intensified, a code for the darker, frankly zowie madeup look. The colors were intensified, which explains why women went around slathering their eyelids with lipsticky purple and pink, installed bright green eyelashes and matched their lips and fingernails to the family mahogany. Now comes a pastel spring, and with it the passing of those intensified painted faces. The new word, if there is one, is radiant, which means either lifted but not intensified color or the glow of good health.

title: MARSHALS TRADE FIRE WITH INDIANS
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., March 3 Federal officials said today that 20 rounds had been fired at one of their armored personnel carriers by militant Indians entrenched in the historic settlement of Wounded Knee last night.

title: Crusaders Defeat Raiders, 43
description: The New York Raiders, struggling for a spot in the World Hockey Association playoffs, lost a strenuously contested game yesterday to the league, leading Cleveland Civsaders, 43, before a crowd of 7,141 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Defense Contracts
description: Two of the nation's largest defense. contractors got some rough handling from the Navy last weekand critics of the Pentagon's procurement record Offered some tentative applause. They hoped the decisions would be enforced, but they warned that the game had not yet been played out.

title: Dr. Jonathan Cohen to Wed Miss Koppel
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, LI., March 10  Mr. and Mrs. Alfred I. Koppel have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Shelley Ruth Koppel, to Dr. Jonathan Francis Cohn, son of Judge and Mrs. Charles Harris Cohen of Long Island iCty, Queens.

title: Getting Hooked on Bottled Water
UMASS FIVE DOWNS FORNIAM BY 7259
description: AMHERST, Mass., March 3The University of Massachusetts basketball team won its 12th straight game, and improved its chances for a bid to the National Invitation Tournament by defeating Fordham, 72.59, tonight.

title: Protecting Wildlife
description: In the most farreaching move yet made to save the endangered animal species of this planet, eighty nations have signed a convention to act in concert for their protection. What is most remarkable and encouraging about this agreement is the willingness of the signatories, including all the major powers except China, to include maritime creatures taken beyond national boundaries and all products derived from the animals specified.

title: Juilliard Uncooperative?
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Thomas, Biologist, Plans To Be Married
description: NEWPORT, R.I., March 3The engagement of Miss Beatrice Frances Thomas to Chester T. Dziobkowski, son of Mr. and Mrs. Chester W. Dziobkowski of Ridgewood, N. J., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Stewart Thomas of Newport.

title: HAROLD C. CASPERS
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., March 3Harold C. Caspers, who retired five years ago as vice president of Einson Freeman Company, Inc., lithographers, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived here.

title: PEKING STEPS UP MIN APPEALS
description: Felting has in recent weeks stepped up its propaganda broadcasts to Taiwan, appealing to sentiments of nostalgia, patriotism and pride to gain the support of different segments of people in Taiwanthe young and the old, native Taiwanese as well as those who fled from mainland China in 1949.

title: Mary Mapes Married To Gordon O. Watson
description: TUXEDO PARK, N. Y., March 3Miss Mary Marvin Mapes was married here this afternoon to Gordon Owen Watson. The ceremony was performed in Our Lady of Mount Carmel Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Richard Joyce. He was assisted by the Rev. James Leo, pastor of St. Mary's Episcopal Church here. A reception was held at the Tuxedo Club.

title: Ban on Armbands Voided
description: MIAMI, March 3 (AP)A Circuit Court judge this week struck down a Miami Beach city ordinance banning the wearing of Nazi swastikas or Communist insignia. The wearing of an armband as a political symbol is a right pro??cted by the Constitution, Judge Grady Crawford ruled.

title: Assembly Group Is Planning Hearings on Marijuana Penalties
description: TRENTON  A legislative review of the state's revised penalties for smoking marijuana is expected to generate a major controversy later this year over whether the penalties should be abolished altogether.

title: Gazumping Phenomenon in London Fades
description: LONDON The practice of gazumping has become an unlamented casualty of a dramatic change in Britain's housing market.

title: A Saxophonist Finds Music in Photography
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I. Mention the name of Hal McKusick to a jazz buff any time between 1942 and about 10 years ago, and the automatic reaction would have been alto saxophone, the instrument on which he achieved his fame in the big bands and in quartets and quintets.

title: The Key Man Is Park
Reflections on a spawn of hell
description: I doubt that in the whole history of the world there has ever been a murderer whose death was wept over by so many people, and so sincerely, as was Josef Stalin's 20 years ago. While it may be easy to explain the number of weepers by the size of the population and the power of the communications media (in which case, Mao, if he dies, will hold first place), it is extremely difficult to explain the quality of these tears.

title: VOLCANO HIT ISLE GOING INTO LIMBO
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 3The Icelandic island of Heimaey is going into temporary limbo.

title: Sports Week
description: PRO BASKETBALL

title: Acting Defense Minister Is Appointed in Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Mar. 3 (AP)President Idi Amin has appointed the army quartermaster general, Lieut. Col. Mondo, to act as defense minister after the Uganda Cabinet begins a month's compulsory leave on Monday.

title: INQUIRY AFFIRMS NAZI ROLE IN FIRE
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, March 3 (AP) A Swiss historian says that a new inquiry disproves an assertion by a West German investigator that the Nazis played no part in the Reichstag fire, which occurred 40 years ago.

title: Mayoralty
description: A current political maxim holds that the strength of a Democratic mayoral candidate can be gauged by the timing of his formal announcementthe earlier the announcement, the weaker the candidate. By that standard, and other more substantial indices, the heavyweights began moving into the ring last week.

title: Music
description: Despite an anonymous telephone call to the Metropolitan Museum of Art early Friday afternoon threatening his life, Itzhak Perlman went ahead with his recital that night in the Rogers Auditorium as scheduled. A security search delayed the concert a half hour, but all proceeded smoothly thereafter.

title: A Pearl of Taverns In Dublin Is Doomed
description: DUBLIN, March 3 (AP) The Pearl Bar, centuryold haunt of Dublin's literary set, is going to be torn down to make way for a bank, the owner, Gus Weldon, has announced.

title: Big County, $20,20, Wins By 2 Lengths at Lincoln
description: LINCOLN, R. I., March 3 (AP) Big County pulled away from Motor Ting in the stretch and won the, $7,500 Woonsocket Handicap today at Lincoln Downs.

title: Providence Defeats St. John's, 9390, for the 12th Triumph in Row
description: A recordbreaking, 41point performance by Ernie DiGregorio of Providence led the Friars to a 9390 victory over St. John's yesterday before a capacity crowd of 6,008 in the Redmen's Alumni Gym.

title: Ann P. Van De Water Plans Bridal
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y. March 3 Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Van De Water have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Peelor Van De Water, to Donald Reid Parfet. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ray T. Parfet Jr. of Hickory Corners, Mich. A wedding in the summer is planned.

title: Jersey to Purchase 27 Buses for Lease To State Operators
description: TRENTON, March 3Governor Cahill announced today that the state would purchase 27 new buses at a cost estimated at $1million and lease them for nominal amounts to bus companies throughout the state.

title: Nader's people keep shovelling it out, higher and higher
description: Sowing the Wind; A Report From Ralph Nader's Center for Study of Responsive Law on Food Safety and the Chemical Harvest. By Harrison Wellford. 384 pp. $7.95.

title: Opera
description: In view of the highpowered ask the first performance this season of Verdi's Il Trovatore at the Metropolitan Opera on Friday night did not quite fulfill its promise. It was still exceptional in quality, and audience ovatione for the singers (plus long waits between scenes) prolonged the opera a good half hour.

title: Gold Calls for Realistic Laws on Drugs
description: We've got to toughen the laws on pill abuse, heroin and cocaine, Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold commented last week, hours after announcing the arrests of 21 alleged drug dealers. On the other hand, while marijuana should not be legalized, the laws against its use ought to be made more realistic.

title: Prisoners of Psychiatry
description: In 1968, the New York Civil Liberties Union hired Bruce Ennis to direct its Civil Liberties and Mental Illness Litigation Project. For the next three years, Ennis investigated a wide range of legal issues affecting mental patients and foughtsometimes successfully, sometimes notto extend their civil rights. In variety of test cases he contended that judges could not simply dispose of mentally ill defendants by declaring them incompetent to stand trial and incarcerating them in hospitals for the criminally insane; that the state could not hospitalize a person if less drastic forms of treatment were feasible; that mental patients who had been committed on the grounds that they needed treatment must be offered meaningful treatment or discharged. He also contended that hospitals could not force medication on unwilling patients or exploit them in menial jobs rationalized as therapy; that employers and educational institutions could not automatically reject applications from former inmates. Prisoners of Psychiatry is report on some of those cases, their results and their implications. It is also a cogent polemic against forced confinement of the mentally ill.

title: The new Fashions of The Times/Spring '73
description: Truman Capote, whose world is populated almost entirely by beautiful welldressed women, is optimistic about spring. He likes the idea of all those pastel classics. He thinks clingy caftans are elegant. He can hardly wait for the new slim shoe to replace what he calls the big clunky.

title: Every Prospect Pleases, and Only Man Is Vile
description: RICHARD M. CLURMAN, newly installed Parks Administrator, promises a hellfire and brimstone approach to the problems of this city's greenswards. And maybe that is the only way of approach, but he sounded a little frightening when, in taking command of the goodguy army I have . . . been commissioned to lead, he proclaimed: We will not contribute to the ideology of irrationalism by over and over again rebuilding what is instantly destroyed. . . . We will go elsewhere to do constructive work. No more Park Permissiveness. Visions of the Further Wasteland. He talked of vandalism and how, after one determined fixing, the damage will then go unrepaired. In pursuing this policy, he said, the Parks Department would not be abandoning certain wayward parks, but merely withdrawing our servicesa positive way of saying the same thing? (Withdrawing its services is what New York Telephone does regularly and it feels like abandonment.) It sounds as if Mr. Clurman is about to abandon some of our Alliesand New York needs every tree and forsythia bush that dares grow.

title: It's cool. It's bright. It's subtle. It's new!
description: Hot colors are out. Cool naturals are in. The thirties are big. And that's not the only news in interiors. The eclectic interior has been reversed. In the nineteensixties, eclectic meant a traditional room with an occasional glassandsteel accent. Today it's just the opposite. Modern furnishings, natural woods and textures dominate; period objects have become the accents. Designer Bob Patino heartily approves the whole (undoubtedly fleeting) new status quo, which is reflected in his small apartment. His former color scheme spiced with bright red and yellow has been replaced by a cool offwhite with accent colors of palest pastels in subtle textures. There's a thirties echo in the living room's pyramidbased ottomans, in the mirrored foyer archway, and the plump rounded bed that doubles as a sofa in the bedroomstudy. Accent pieces are authentic to the period, such as the chromelegged console and Art Deco mirror off the foyer. In the kitchen, the designer played up the naturals: butcher block counters and natural wood shelves studded with baskets, and a tiny garden four glass shelves in the window.

title: 7 Killed in Ohio Car Crash
description: SWANTON, Ohio, March (UPI)  Six members of one family, including five children, and another youngster, all on their way to church services, were killed late yesterday when their station wagon crashed into a tree on Ohio 64. south of here. The victims were identified as Lois Cook, 35 years old, of Swanton, and her children, Charles, 11; Michael, 4; Keith, 10; Andrew, 6; Julie, 12, and a neighbor child, Kelly Green, 9. Another Cook child, Dean, 9, was in critical condition.

title: Jean Ocker Sets May 12 Nuptials
description: PLAINVIEW, L.I., March Mr. and Mrs. Edmund A. Ocker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jean Beth Ocker, to William A. Foxen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Foxen of Laurel Hollow. A May 12 wedding is planned.

title: Catch 22 for mothers
description: Motherhood is under assault. Many women are wondering whether there really is a need for them to fulfill the traditional role. They want to. They feel they have something unique to offer their children. But they are told that the daycare center offers more, that mother surrogates can do better.

title: Music
description: THE symbol for operatic genius at an advanced age is Giuseppe Verdi, whose last two operas Otello and Falstaffwere the products of a septuageilarian (Verdi, was almost 80 when he finished Falstaff). But everybody. seems to forget Claudio Monteverdi,. who composed L'Incoronazione di Poppea in 1642, at the age of 75, a year before his death.

title: Nonsmoking Tenants Aided
description: WACO, Tex., March 3 (UPI) The Spenco Medical Corporation, a health education and medical products concern, has announced that it is offering a month of rentfree living to nonsmoking tenants in a new apartment project it is opening.

title: Kenneth Noland and the New Romanticism
description: FOR anyone whose attention may have wandered, in the last year or two, away from a close observation of developments in color field abstraction, the new paintings by Kenneth Noland at the Andr Emmerich Gallery, 41 East 57th Street, will come as a slight, shock. Mr. Noland has long been regarded as one of the leaders of the color field school, and the pictures he produced in the latter half of the sixtiespictures cif enormous size consisting of unbroken horizontal stripes, or bands, of colorwere, for many con noisseurs of advanced art, a standard. for determining what was (and what was not) permissible and desirable so far as abstract painting was concerned. Many people spoke of this style as maskingtape abstractiona reference to the technique the artist employed in separating one straightedged band of color from another.

title: STEWART VICTOR IN BORROWED CAR
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 3Jackie Stewart of Scotland overcame bad luck, a bad position and a damaged aerofoil today to win the South African Grand Prix in a borrowed car.

title: License Standards Studied
description: WASHINGTON, March 3 (AP) The Federal Highway Administration said this week that it was trying to determine the minimum amount of training that should be required before granting certificates to drive trucks and buses.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Pamela Thune Engaged
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y. March 3Miss Pamela Susan Thune, a senior at Russell Sage College, and Jerome O. Jacobs, a student in the fiveyear management engineering program at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, plan to be married here June 9 in the Congregational Church. Mr. and Mrs. Sidney F. Thune have announced the engagement of their daughter to the son of Mr. and Mrs. T. Edward Jacobs of Baltimore. Mr. Thune is executive vice president of the National Starch and Chemical Corporation.

title: Riggs vs. Margaret Court A Mismatch?
description: A $5,000 tennis match between 55yearold Bobby Riggs and 30yearold Mrs. Margaret Court has become a tantalizingr prospect for fans and players. Billy Talbert, director of the United States Open championships, is so enthusiastic that he wants to stage it on the center court at Forest Hills.

title: Arnheiter Divorce Is Off
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 3 (AP)  Janice Blair Arnheiter has withdrawn a divorce suit against her husband, Lieut. Comdr. Marcus Arnheiter of the Navy, retired. She said Tuesday that she filed the suit in a period of depression after publication of The Arnheiter Affair by Neil Sheehan, a book about the officer's removal from command of a destroyer escort off Vietnam seven years ago.

title: Wehle's Dogs Point to Value of His Breeding Ideas
description: Robert Wehle is a man of determination, vision and dedication.

title: THE BIG. TEN OFF BROADWAY
Great Neck Opens School Within a School
description: GREAT NECK, L.I.  The public school system here, which for the last few years has been noted for its experimentation in education, has added another experimental program to its curriculum.

title: Cashier and Customer Shot In Discotheque in the Bronx
description: The cashier and a patron at a Bronx discothque were shot early yesterday by members of a group that had been refused admittance, the police reported.

title: How 16 Towns Attack Drug Problem
description: RIDGEWOOD  A little more than two years ago, 16 towns in Northwest Bergen County, shaken by evidence of a spreading drug subculture in their area, mobilized to confront the probleim

description: BAXTERLionel Jeffries' movie, written by Reginald Rose and starring Patricia Neal, Lynn Carlin and. Scott Jacoby, today at the 68th Street Playhouse.

title: GOOD FOR MUSIC FESTIVALS
description: Or even for Southampton next summer. After all, the orange sweater, in a washable acrylic, is sleeveless and the flowerprinted crepe shirt has loose, puffedup sleeves for maximum cool. And those pants that look like shantung are really machinewashable polyester and rayon: JonesNew York has thought of just about everything. Shirt, $18; sweater, $14; pants, $25. All, third floor, Abraham & Straus.

title: SPOTLIGHT
Nixon's Presidency: Crisis for Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 You just think we're dumb, Senator Clifford P. Case, Republican of New Jersey, told George P. Shultz, Secretary of the Treasury and Counselor to the President, during a recent hearing on Capitol Hill.

title: Harvard Victor in Squash
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., March 4 (AP)Harvard won its seventh national intercollegiate squash championship in the last eight years today. The Crimson led a field of 21 colleges with 37 points. Pennsylvania was second with 26. Peter Brin??s o Harvard won the individual title for his second straight year.

title: Board of Higher Education Fails in Bid for Apartment
description: The tenantowners of a new cooperative apartment building on the Upper East Side have turned down a $97,000 offer by the Board of Higher. Education to buy an apartment to house the president of one of the branches of City University.

title: Manhattan Captures Track Title
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 4 Manhattan returned to Eastem track and field dominance today after a 17year absence by winning the 52d annual I.C.4A indoor championships.

description: MORA, Sweden, March 4 (AP)Pauli Siitonen, of Finland overcame Sweden's top skiers in the final miles today to win the 53mile Vasaloppet, the world's biggest ski marathon.

title: LEFT SHOWS GAIN IN FRENCH VOTE; GAULLISTS DOWN
description: PARIS, Monday, March 5The French Left scored heavy gains in yesterday's legislative elections, but almost certainly they were not enough to upset the Gaullistled Government.

title: Europeans, Seeking Wider Money Talks, To Close Markets
description: BRUSSELS, March 4The nine member countries of the European Economic Community decided tonight to close their foreignexchange markets this week as they pursue efforts to establish a European defense system in the latest monetary crisis.

description: WASHINGTON, March 4United States refiners are now paying more for some foreign crude oil than for domestic crude, according to unpublished Government data that are Confirmed by trade sources.

title: Scali of U.N. Weds ExAide of C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)  John A. Seali, chief United States representative to the United Nations, today married Miss Denise St. Germain, a former employe of the Central Intelligence Agency, at Spring Valley, Md., in the home of Raymond Brophy, a realestate broker. Chief Judge Gerard Reilly of the District of Columbia Court of Appeals performed the ceremony.

title: Prestige of Stalin Now Reviving
News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, MARCH 5, 1973

title: MILTON ROTHENBERG, HEADED U.S. TOBACCO
description: Milton Rothenberg, chairman and chief executive officer of the United States Tobacco Company, makers of snuff and smoking and chewing tobacco, died Saturday in Chicago, apparently of a heart attack, while attending a company banquet. He was 56 years old and lived in Stamford, Conn.

title: PRICE RISES FOUND DESPITE PHASE 3
description: A majority of the agents who purchase materials for use in the nation's industrial production believe that, so far, Phase 3 of the government's economic stabilization program is not working, according to a survey in February.
