title: Plan to Cut Auto Travel in Los Angeles Basin Scored at Hearing
description: LOS ANGELES, March 5A Federal proposal to reduce auto travel in the Los Angeles Basin by 82 per cent was roundly criticized today as the Environmental Protection Agency opened hearings on ways the area might meet the Federal air quality standards.

title: Trial for Khartoum
description: Sudan's President Nimeiry has made an admirable start on legal proceedings against the Palestinian assassins who butchered three foreign diplomatstwo Americans, one Belgianin the name of Arab nationalism last week in Khaitoum. Already the pressures from militant Arabs elsewhere are building up to whitewash the Black September gunmen as some kind of folk heroes; this perverted logic attempts to portray coldblooded murder as a glorious national feat, a repulsive argument that degrades the reason and dignity of the Palestinians and the whole Arab nation.

title: Lockheed Ea Prudential A
SUDAN IS PLANNING TO TRY GUERRILLAS FOR CAPITAL CRIME
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, March 5 The Sudanese Foreign Minister said today that the Black September commandos who killed two American diplomats and a Belgian here last Friday would have an early trial on murder charges.

title: BRITISH FOOTBALL
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: 2 Researchers Show That Narcotics Attach Themselves to Sites in Brain
description: WASHINGTON, March 5A research accomplishment, described by a government agency as a major advance toward understanding and treating narcotics addiction, was announced at the John Hopkins University today.

title: ABORTION LAW UPSET Br COURT IN INDIANA
description: INDIANAPOLIS, March 5 (AP)A threejudge Federal panel ruled today that Indiana's abortion laws were unconstitutional, applying the United States Supreme Court's decision in two recent cases.

title: TV: Paris Shown in Imaginative Cities on Film
description: Public television, especially New York's WNET, is constantly forced to demonstrate how to produce the most imaginative programing with the least amount of money. And Channel 13's Dateline 13 has compiled a remarkable record in that type of artisticeconomic hustle.

title: Novotny Enters Guilty Plea In Texas Stock Fraud Case
description: DALLAS, March 5 (AP) Joe P. Novotny, former president of Sharpstown State Bank and a figure in a Texas stock fraud scandal, switched his plea to guilty today, leaving former state Attorney General Waggoner Carr and former state Insurance. Commissioner John Osorio to face trial on mail and wire fraud charges.

title: COUNCILMEN CLASH WITH TRANSIT AIDE
description: Three City Councilmen clashed yesterday with Daniel T. Scannell, senior executive officer of the Transit Authority, when Mr. Scannel appeared before the Finance Committee hearing on his agency's proposed 197374 captal budget of $137.4million.

title: Air Collision Kills 68 in France During a Strike of Controllers
description: PARIS, March 5Two Londonbound Spanish jetliners, flying over western France during a strike of air controllers, collided today in clear, fine weather. One exploded and crashed, killing all 68 aboard, and the other made a safe emergency landing with a damaged wing.

title: 13 Brooklyn Track Records Are Broken
description: Pete Gaughn of Nazareth captured the onemile and twomile runs yesterday as all 13 meet records were broken in the Brooklyn Catholic high schools indoor track championships at the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Cities' Aides See Easing Of U.S. Stand on Funds
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Officials of city governments, holding their annual Congressional conference here, reported today, what they considered to be signs that the Nixon Administration might be softening its position on temporarily funding some programs facing cutbacks.

title: DR. LOUIS SNIDER
description: Dr. Louis Snider, a dntal surgeon in the Bronx for 35 years, died Friday night while visiting friends in New Rochelle, N.Y. He was 59 years old and lived at 1101 Midland Avenue, Bronxville, N.Y.

title: HORSE SLAUGHTER CHARGED IN IDAHO
description: HOWE, Idaho, March 5 (UN) An official of the Bureau of Land Management said today that the Government agency was investigating the reported roundup and slaughter of range horses by ranchers in Idaho's Lehmi Mountains.

title: Ban on SugaryCereal TV Ads Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Warning that sugary breakfast cereals harm children's diets and teeth, nutrition and dental experts urged Congress today to ban childrenoriented television ads for the products, and food makers reacted by boycotting the Senate hearings.

title: Fire Bomb Thrown at School
description: A fire bomb was hurled last night at an entrance of Leonardo da Vinci Intermediate School 61 at 5050 99th Street, Corona, Queens, scorching the doors. A passerby told the police she had seen two men running from the school grounds as the device burst. They sped off in a car, she added.

title: Zoo to Get New Cages for Gorillas
description: Recent publicity about the antics of the Central Park Zoo's sixmonthold gorilla. Patty Cake, has brought forth so much interest from the publicas well as money that the Parks Department has decided to rebuild the gorilla cages with private funds and make them more attractive. Richard M. Clurman, the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administrator, said yesterday that the principal donor was Friends of the Zoo, a private group interested in bettering the city's zoos.

title: New Music
description: The line between homage and parody is thin and hard to draw, sometimesProkofiev's Classical Symphony stands as one fine example of that difficulty, but there also are others in which both the composer and his listeners seem to hang suspended between fondness and ridicule. Max Pollikoff's Gallery of Music in Our Time program st the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. on Sunday night offered such a composition, Stephen Paul Hartke's Passion, Poison and Petrifaction, subtitled The Romantic Gesture in Aspic.

title: Nixon's Daughter Rents Rebozo Maryland Home
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)Julie Nixon Eisenhower started moving furnishings into a $100,000 Bethesda, Md., home today that she and her husband have rented at a special rate from the President's friend, C. O. Rebozo.

title: Film Deep Throat Is Seized by Police In Newark Theater
description: NEWARK, March 5 (AP) The film Deep Throat, banned in New York City last week as pornographic, came to Newark today, but by nightfall officials had confiscated the film.

title: City Center's Financial Ills Worsen
description: The financial crisis at the City Center of Music and Dramafirst revealed Iast October when the center said it was unable to meet an operating deficit of 31.3million is worsening. As a result, at least one of its constituents, the CityCenter Jeffrey Ballet, is in jeopardy, and all of the others, including the New York City Ballet and the New York City Opera, have been asked to tighten their belts.

title: Audubon's Birds Return For Rarae Aves at $6,960
description: With the spring birdwatching season in the offing, a kind of inflation has come to the birdbook industry. A subsidiary of Harcourt Brace Jovanovich is selling a big (39 inches by 26 inches), fourvolume reprint edition of John James Audubon's masterwork The Birds of America, for $6,960, plus tax.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Atlantic brant will probably be protected from hunters for at least two more years, according to Nathaniel P. Reed, who is an assistant secretary of the Department of the Interior.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given to Esstern Standard Time

title: HANOI TO BOYCOTT TALKS IN DISPUTE OVER ITS P.O.W.'S
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, March 6  A North Vietnamese official said yesterday that the Communists would boycott further meetings of the FourParty Joint Military Commission because of a dispute over the exchange of Vietnamese war prisoners.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: S.E.C. ENJOINS PASTOR ON SECURITIES SALES
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 5 The Rev. Rex Humbard received another injunction to day, but he managed to keep control of his financially troubled Cathedral of Tomorrow.

title: Mothers Fear End of mayCare Aid
description: They make a happy couple, the mother and daughter, riding the subway each morning down from the Bronx.

title: La Prevoy ante, 2d, Is Beaten First Time in 13Race Career
description: HALLANDALE., Fla., March 5Gulfstream Park opened its 48day meeting On a high note today, but La Prevoyante, the unbeaten 2yearold filly champion of 1972, made a lowkey 1973 debut. La Prevoyante was the 15 favorite in the fifth race in her first start as 3yearold.

title: TYPHOID REPORTED AT MIGRANT CAMP
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., March (AP)The public director of Dade County said today that 30 cases of typhoid fever had been confirmed at a migrant labor camp and that he wouldn't be surprised if the total reached more than 100.

title: COMINCO RAISING PRICES FOR ZING
description: Following actions initiated in Europe and elsewhere, Cominco, Ltd., announced yesterday that it had raised its prices for zinc sold in the United States and Canada.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, March 5, 1973

title: Capitalism, for Better or Worse
description: DOWNSVIEW, Ontario, Canada The way Americans define the causes of the Indochina debacle will determine whether they shall be intellectually prepared to anticipate future crises. Conventional wisdom still attributes America's role in Vietnam to accidents or bureaucratic myopia, thereby slighting the real meaning of the consistency of American interventions in the Third World, in suppressing radical forces and preserving semicolonial societies.

title: Driver of Bus Struck by a Train Says He Stopped Before Crossing
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., March 5 The driver of the school bus in which five highschool students were killed when it was struck by a train last year in Congers took the stand at his trial today and insisted that he had stopped his vehicle completely before he proceeded onto the tracks.

title: Women on Right Track, Marathoners Tell Men
description: America's bestknown female marathoner made a strong pitch for longdistance equality yesterday during the weekly track writers' luncheon at Leone's.

title: HANOI IS WARNED ON AID FROM U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Two top Defense Department officials, in separate forums, warned North Vietnam today that it would be advised to live up to ceasefire agreements in South Vietnam and Laos if it expects to receive reconstruction aid from the United States.

title: If Dogs Can Live on It...
description: STILLWATER, Okla., March 5 (UPI)It started out as a bet and turned into a protest against the high cost of food. But now two Oklahoma State University seniors, Terry Arnall and Jerry Dizmang, say they actually like eating dog food.

title: Nixon's Presidency: Centralized Control
description: This is the third of a series of articles on Richard M. Nixon's use of the powers of the Presidency and its effects on the Government and the national life.

title: 3Year Deal for Met Star
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. March 5The New York Mets joined the salary sweepstakes in baseball today by signing Rusty Staub to a threeyear contract for $330,000 and ending their final holdout of 1973.

title: Eastern Hockey League
description: SUNDAY'S GAMES

title: Federal Offer Is Spurned By Indians as Talks Go On
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., March 5Indians holding this crossroads settlement spurned last night's Government peace offer, but negotiations continued here today amid signs of decreasing tension.

title: Books of The Times
description: BOUGHT AND SOLD by Alberto Moravia. Translated by Angus Davidson. 222 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $6.95.

title: Curran Retires as N.M.U. Head; Aide Is Named Acting President
description: Joseph Curran, who for the last 36 years headed the National Maritime Union, retired yesterday, citing medical advice, and his longtime aide was chosen at a special meeting to take his place on an acting basis.

title: VALDES WINS IN 5 ON 3 KNOCKDOWNS
description: Rodrigo Valdes, 158 pounds of South American fury, knocked dawn Jose Rodriguez of Puerto Rico and the Bronx three times in the fifth round last night in the Felt Forum, an automatic victory that clearly established him as a leading contender for the world middleweight championship.

title: Satellite Has Photographed 75% of Earth's Land Mass
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)  The Earth Resources Technology Satellite ERTS1 has photographed 75 per cent of the earth's land mass at least once, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: CONGRESS WARNS 2 SPORTS GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Congress urged the National Collegiate Athletic Association and Amateur Athletic Union today to resolve their differences over an impending American tour by the Soviet national basketball team or face legislation on the administration of amateur athletics.

title: Emanuel M. Simon Dead; Real Estate Broker, 68
description: Emanuel M. Simon a real estate broker here for 48 years and for most of that head of E. Mitchell Simon & Co., died Sunday evening in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: P.O.W.'S PLANNED BUSINESS VENTURE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Some of the senior American pilots agreedwhile still prisoners of war in Hanoito set up acorporation to manage income ncome from publishing, speechmaking and other public appearances upon their return, sources close to the prisoners have disclosed.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Legislator's Brother Killed As 2 Fellow Policemen Err
description: Patrolman Irving E. Wright, a brother of Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright of Brooklyn, was shot and killed by two patrolmen in Harlem early yesterday morning. He was chasing an armed man who had just held up an allnight grocery store where Patrolman Wright was moonlighting.

title: FRAUD IS CHARGED IN GOLDSTEIN CASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Securities and Exchange Commission asked the Federal District Court in Los Angeles today to put a stop to alleged fraudulent operations of Goldstein, Samuelson, Inc., to impound its assets and to appoint a permanent receiver for the firm.

title: COURT DECLINES MERGER REVIEW
description: The Supreme Court declined yesterday to rule on the proposed acquisition of United States Lines by R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc.

title: Poles to Fish Off U.S.
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., March 5 (AP)A Polish research vessel will be fishing inside United States territorial waters off Long Island this week, according to the National Marine Fisheries Service. A spokesman for the service said the Wieczno, a 210foot vessel from the Polish Fisheries Research Institute, would spend tomorrow, Wednesday and Thursday surveying herring and mackerel. The survey is part of a bilateral research treaty.

title: Fidelity and Funds It Manages Reach Accord in Lawsuits
description: A $2million settlement of several lawsuits against the Fidelity Management and Research Company, a Bostonbased concern that operates mutual funds, was filed yesterday in Federal District Court in Boston.

title: Knicks Are Seeking Old Knack For SuperSonics Game Tonight
description: With Dave DeBusschere and Phil Jackson nursing injuries that won't necessarily keep them from playing, the New York Knicks will face the Seattle SuperSonics at Madison Square Garden tonight in a somewhat chastened mood.

title: Ossip J. Walinsky, Union Head And Jewish Leader, Dies at 86
description: Ossip J. Walinsky, who retired in 1957 as president of the International Leather Goods, Plastics and Novelty Workers Union, died Sunday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at 875 West End Avenue.

title: Bracciale Captures 6 Straight at Bowie
description: BOWIE, Md., March 5 (AP)Vincent Bracciale Jr. rode six consecutive winners today at Bowie Race Course, increasing his total for 54 days of the current meeting to a Marylandrecord 100.

title: Briton Is Killed in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 5A 19yearold British Army private was shot dead in a Roman Catholic district of Belfast last night, and today there were two drastically differing accounts of how it happened.

title: RANGERS GIVE PLANS FOR PLAYOFF SEATS
description: A limited number of mezzanine tickets for New York Ranger Stanley Cup hockey games at Madison Square Garden will be made available for public sale through a postcard selection system, the same method that was used for last year's playoffs.

title: Bomb Threat Diverts New YorkLisbon Jet
description: BOSTON, March 5 (AP)A Trans World Airlines passenger jet bound from New York City to Lisbon was diverted tonight to Logan International Airport because of a bomb threat.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A City Councilmen clashed with Dania T. Scannell, senior executive officer for the Transit Authority, when Mr. Scannel appeared yesterday $39.6million for subway and bus facilities. The transit official was appearing before the Council's Finance Committee in a hearing on his agency's proposed 197374 capital budget of $137.4million.

title: BIG NUMBERS RING RAIDED IN HARLEM
description: In a coordinated move, 40 plainclothes men and a policewoman raided eight alleged gambling places in, Harlem yesterday and arrested 13 persons said to be part of a numbers ring handling bets of more than $25million a year.

title: Gravestone Dealer Is Fined $13,000 On Fraud Charges
description: NEWARK, March 5 (UPI)New Jersey's largest gravestone monument dealer, accused of trading on the grief, despair and deaths of thousands, has been ordered to pay almost $13,000 in penalties and restitution for violations of the New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act.

title: State Repays City $133,000 For Prosecution of Morhouse
description: New York State gave the city a check yesterday for $133,000 to cover the costs of the city's investigation and prosecution of L. Judson Morhouse, former Republican state chairman.

title: SAFETY STANDARD FOR BUSES SCORED
description: WASHINGTON, March 5A proposed Federal safety standard for the protection of bus passengers in crashes is under attack by independent safety advocates, who contend that it is inadequate.

title: Plan to Confirm Budget Chief Opposed by New Justice Aide
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Nixon Administration conceded today that Congress had a right to insist on Senate confirmation of the top budget officials in the White House, but declared that it would be unconstitutional to apply the right to the incumbent officials.

title: LAND PLAN ON S.I. GAINS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, March 5  The State Senate today pissed a bill creating the new South Richmond Development Corporation, which would regulate the development of one of the city's last sizable tracts of open land 10,000 acres on Staten Island.

title: Weehawken Teachers Return to Classes at End of TwoWeek. Strike
description: WEEHAWKEN, March 5 (AP)  Teachers at the city's four schools returned to their classes today, ending a twoweek walkout that started when negotiations for a new contract broke down.

title: Lebanese Take Over a Refinery; Oil Pumping to Resume Today
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 5The Lebanese Government decided today to take over a refinery and a pipeline section owned by the Iraq Petroleum Company, a Western consortium. The refining and pipeline sections have been nationalized in Iraq and Syria.

title: LYDIA NIKOLSKAYA GIVES SONG RECITAL
description: Lydia Nikolskaya, a Russian soprano in her middle years, presented a recital late Sunday afternoon in Carnegie Hall. Although her voice has clearly seen better days, Miss Nikolskaya is an engaging recitalist and her program, including songs by Brahms, Mozart, Mahler, Rachmaninoff and Tchaikovsky, was shredly chosen to accent strengths rather than technical weaknesses.

title: Lindsay to Reveal Political Plans Soon; Angered by Nixon's Cuts in Urban Aid
description: Mayor Lindsay, within two weeks, will say whether he will run for reelection and he will be greatly influenced by his anger at President Nixon's sharp curtailment of urban aid programs, according to Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton.

title: ELISBERG JUDGE BARS A DEFENSE
description: LOS ANGELES, March 5The judge in the Pentagon papers trial ruled out today the justification defense, under which the defendants would have argued that the motivation for disclosing the secret study of United States involvement in Vietnam was to get information to Congress.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: SUNDAY'S GAMES

title: Burlington Expected to Replace Head
description: Burlington Industries, Inc., the country's largest textiles producer, is expected to announce the election of a new president this morning, with Horace C. Jones, executive vice president in chrage of home furnishings, replacing Ely R. Callaway Jr.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The first linear, metalrod sculpture by Picasso ever realized on a large scaleand the first such sculpture in any size to enter a public or private collectionhas been erected in the garden of the Museum of Modern Art.

title: PARK NOMINATES 73 TO KOREA ASSEMBLY
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 5  President Park Chung Hee named 73 persons today to be appointed members of the National Assembly, upon approval by the electoral college at regional meetings Wednesday.

title: 8,440, Most Since Fall, Out in Canarsie Boycott
description: Parents in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn kept 8,440 children out of eight schools yesterday on the third day of a new communitywide protest against the busing in of black children from the nearby Brownsville area. The eight schools have a combined enrollment of 9,736 pupils.

title: ZIEGLER CALLS NIXON FIRM ON WAGE LIMIT
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (Reuters)President Nixon is determined to maintain his 5.5 per cent guideline on wage increases this year, the White House said today.

title: Procaccino Loses Suit to Invalidate Primary Runoffs
description: Runoff primary elections in major contests in New York City were found to be constitutional by State Supreme Court Justice Vincent A. Lupiano yesterday after a challenge from Mario A. Procaccino.

title: Shultz to Head U.S. Team At Paris Monetary Talks
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Treasury Department said today that Secretary George P. Shultz is expected to represent the United States at a meeting in Paris next Friday to discuss current foreign exchange problems.

title: New Haven Teachers Vote Strike But Schools Will Be Open Today
description: NEW HAVEN, March 5Union teachers here plan to set up picket lines at all city public, schools tomorrow, having voted to strike after rejecting what was described as the Board of Education's final contract offer.

title: Nixon Names Interior Aide
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)President Nixon named Stephen. A. Wakefield of Houston today to be Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Energy and Minerals. Mr. Wakefield, 32 years old, a Deputy Assistant Secretary since last April 8, will succeed Hollis M. Dole. The White House also announced that C. Langhorne Washburn, 54, of McLean, Va., would be nominated as an Assistant Secretary of Commerce for tourism.

title: A Vietnam Youth Hears War Is Over, But His Way of Life Tells Him It Isn't
description: DA NANG, South Vietnam, March 1  For Nguyen So, the ceasefire has not come. He said he heard it was to happen on a Sunday around Tet, the Lunar New Year, but on that day he heard shells explode at the airfield. He guesses it was just another rumor.

title: Clues Sought in 2 Fires In 24 Hours in Hospital
description: WEST ORANGE, March 5Fire officials are seeking the cause of two fires in 24 hours at the renowned Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation.

title: 10 More Berths Filled for N.I.T.
description: The National Invitation Tournament, with an eye toward increasing attendance in the early rounds, placed a heavy emphasis on local basketball teams and selected Manhattan, Rutgers and Fairfield yesterday.

title: RIGHTISTS REBEL ON ECOLOGY LAWS
description: BOISE, Idaho, March 3Two actions of the Idaho State Senate have focused attention on the growing rebellion of conservatives in the West against the strictures of environmental protection legislation.

title: People and Business
description: The Loews Corporation, which over the last several months has acquired a 19 per cent interest in Gimbel Brothers, Inc., will soon be represented on the departmentstore company's board of directors.

title: Modified Plan for Adirondacks Going to Legislature This Week
description: ALBANY, March 5A modified master plan for the Adirondacks that is less restrictive than the original blueprint for development of the vast area has been approved for submission to the Legislature.

title: Fold No More, Sweet Dollar
description: WASHINGTON, March 5With the dollar undergoing the monetary equivalent of surgical sex change, this is a good time for the Government to do something about coin reform.

title: Joins DiMaggio, Mantle
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 5Bobby Murcer, carrying out a promise he made to Lee MacPhail last year, outlasted the reluctant general manager and today became the third $100,000 player in Yankee history.

title: Defense Completes Case In Atlantic City Extortion
description: CAMDEN, March 5 (AP) The defense in the Federal extortion conspiracy trial of four present and former Atlantic City officials rested its case today, with all but one of the defendants having testified in their own defense.

title: Grading System Proposed To Judge Quality of Tires
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Department of Transportation published today a new regulation to provide guidelines to consumers in fudging the quality of automobile tires.

title: N.B.A. and Players Sign a Basic Pad
description: A comprehensive bargaining agreement, first in the history of the National Basketball Association, has been signed by the Players Association and Commissioner Walter Kennedy on behalf of the league, the Commissioner's office announced yesterday.

title: LAOTIANS CONFER ON A GOVERNMENT
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March Two delegations from the Vientiane Government and Communistled Pathet Lao met today to discuss formation of a new coalition government and carrying out of peacekeeping procedures.

title: Dr. Francis M. Rackemann, Set Up Boston Allergy Clinic
description: Dr. Francis Minot Rackemann, an allergist, died yesterday at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. He was 85 years old and lived in Boston.

title: Soviet Says 6 of Its Ships Have Left Haiphong Harbor
description: MOSCOW, March 5 (UPI)Six Soviet ships blocked in Haiphong Harbor since last May by American mines sailed out over the weekend, the Soviet press agency Tass said today.

title: Buffalo Mayor Sworn In
description: BUFFALO, March 5 (UPI)Stanley M. Makowski, 49 years old, was sworn in today as Mayor of Buffalo, as successor to Frank A. Sedita, also a Democrat, who resigned Feb. 8 because of illness.

title: Standoff in Chile
description: Chile's parliamentary elections, anxiously awaited as a verdict on President Allende's drive to socialism, have ended in a standoff. The Popular Unity Government coalition has polled around 40 per cent of the voteswell below its showing in the municipal elections of 1971 but a few points above Dr. Allende's performance in the threeman 1970 presidential contest.

title: Oxford Union Marks 150th Year With Talk, Naturally
description: OXFORD, England, March 3The Oxford Union, where Britain's leaders sowed their rhetorical wild oats and practiced the techniques used later to cultivate more nourishing political crops such as corn, is celebrating its 150th anniversary.

title: Prof. Samuel Tolansky, 66, Found Moon Rock Mineral
description: LONDON, March 5 (AP)Prof. Samuel Tolansky, who discovered a new uraniumrich material in moon rock brought back by the Apollo astronauts, died yesterday. He was 66 years old. A spokesman for the University of London's Royal Holloway College, where Professor Tolansky was professor of physics, said his death was sudden.

title: New Jersey Briefs Fairleigh Dickinson Tuition Up 50%
description: Fairleigh Dickinson University has announced an acrosstheboard tuition increase of 5 per cent for both its undergraduate and graduate divisions. The rise, effective this fall, will bring charges for each undergraduate credit hour to $63 and for graduate credits to $75 each. Other fees and dormitory rates remain unchanged.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, March 6  Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Killing of Belgian May Slow Air Project
description: BRUSSELS, March 5The culling of a Belgian diplomat by Palestinian guerrillas in Khartoum Friday is expected to delay and possibly cancel plans to build a joint BelgianIsraeliAmerican aircraft and missile factory near Lige, Belgium.

title: Travelers Get Guide on Malaria Risks
description: GENEVA, March 5  World Health Organization doctors have published what they consider to be the first comprehensive guide defining a traveler's risk of getting malaria in all countries.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 6, 1973

title: BORIS UNBEGAUN, N.Y.U. PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Boris O. Unbegaun, professor of Slavic linguistics at the Graduate School of Arts and Science of New York University since 1965 and a leading specialist in Slavic philology, died Sunday of a heart ailment in New York University Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 1 Washington Square Village.

title: SUDAN EXECUTION FAVORED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that he considered the death penalty quite appropriate for the palestinian terrorists who murdered two American diplomats and a Belgian diplomat in the Sudan last Friday.

title: Arthur Daley
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 5Yogi Berra rested his chin on his crossed forearms as he leaned against the batting cage today. His soulful brown eyes kept staring appraisingly at Willie Mays swinging a bat with authoritative elegance. Willie was responding with boyish enthusiasm and he chortled with glee whenever he ripped one. Yogi never changed expression. Finally he sighed, picked up his clip board and wandered off to another diamond the Payson Field complex. By this, time Yogi is coming the realization that he cannot possibly learn Sports anything from watching Willie. Because he is not equipped with Xray eyes, the manof ager of the Mets cannot see what lies below The Times that 42yearold surface. That, is what causing some of his problems. He has more proniems than he cares to admit anyway and Willie merely compounds them.

title: The Changing Mood of Greece
description: ATHENS, March 3  Athenians are in the midst of carnival time, and the confetti horns and masks have transformed the plaka into a sort of mardi Bras.

title: For Stalin's Daughter, a Quiet Celebration
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Once the world knew her as The Little Princess of the Kremlin. Today, at the age of 47, she describes herself as a simple skirtandsweater person and she spends most of her time in the very unroyal pursuit of her energetic 2yearold daughter, Olga.

title: Equity Financing
description: The FMC Corporation yesterday said directors have authorized purchase over an unspecified period of time of up to 350,000 shares of its common stock which closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 19, up .

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: SILVER FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: More confidence abroad about the value of the dollar, along with sharp drops in gold and silver prices in London, led to some substantial sales of silver contracts here yesterday on the Commodity Exchange.

title: Vesco Does Not Appear In Court Over I.O.S. Case
description: Robert L. Vesco, the New Jersey financier who donated $200,000 to the Finance Committee to Reelect the President, failed to appear in court today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SENOR SERVICE The Alameda Room opened, with a Spanish flair, 14 years ago at 118 West 57th Street (CO 5.0535). A lot has happened since. The Great Northern Hotel, in which it occupies the 56th Street end of the ground floor, is not what it used to be and the room is going to close itself off from its parent premises by a separate entrance on the ground floor. Also, the influx of Spanishspeaking people has grown in the intervening years, providing a builtin trade for the. Alameda, one of the few places in New York dedicated to Spanish largerscale floor shows and social dancing. It is a formal club (ties, jackets), yet it is not in the least starchy. The tables are somewhat more spacious than you find in many clubs, but it is a restaurant as well as a show center.

title: KHE SANH AIRSTRIP IS REPORTED IN USE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 5  Highly placed American officials said today that North Vietnamese troops had hurriedly rebuilt the old United States Marine airstrip at Khe Sanh and begun using it for courier flights into South Vietnam in violation of the Paris ceasefire agreement.

title: Patrolman Is Shot in Back By Holdup Man on Street
description: A Transit Authority patrolman was shot during a struggle jearly yesterday with a man who had attempted to steal his service revolver. The victim, Patrolman Benjamin Patten, 35 years old, who was shot in the back, was reported in satisfactory condition in St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (Reuters)Sales of Series E and H Savings Bonds last month combined to reach the highest level since the Series H bond was introduced in June, 1952, the Treasury Department said today. Sales totaled $592million in February, $31million more than January's $561million and 10.3 per cent higher than sales of $537million in February, 1972.

title: Killer Ordered to Meditate
description: AKRON, Ohio, March 5 (AP)  Larry Joseph Via, 28 years old, was sentenced today to life imprisonment for killing a coed and was ordered to spend every Sept. 20 in solitary confinement meditating on the slaying of 19  year  old Jane Maguire of Washington, Pa., last September.

title: 2 Yankees Disclose Exchange
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 5Fritz Peterson and Mike Kekich, the Yankees starting lefthanded pitchers disclosed today details of an exchange of families.

title: Cyrus Johns, 78, Headed American Chain & Cable
description: Cyrus N. Johns, a director and former board chairman of ACCO (American Chain & Cable Company, Inc.), died Sunday in his hometown of Sedalia, Mo. His age was 78.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Market Place: A Prescription To Buoy Stocks
description: More than a quarter of the listed issues set 19721973 lows last week, and many an investor who owned one or more of the 528 Big Board and 412 Amex issues at low points must have felt that things could hardly get worse.

title: White House Urged a Speech by Gray
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The White House urged the acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation to accept a speaking invitation in Cleveland last summer because Ohio was believed to be crucially vital to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: A Swirl of Strings Adds to the Depth Of Bee Gees' Song
description: The Bee Gees are nothing if not lavish. Just a trio, they have never been content with the simplicities of the usual backup rock rhythm. On occasions they have surrounded themselves with massed choirs, symphony orchestras and even the British Royal Air Force Apprentice Band. At Philharmonic Hall on Sunday the group was a little more restrainedonly a 30piece orchestraautux provided the swirling and rumbling counterpoint to the three Bee Gee voices.

title: Jet Crashes
description: DENVER, March 5 (UPI) An American Airlines 707 jet with a crew of three, which was taking off today on a flight to Oklahoma for repairs, lost power in one of its three good engines and crashed at the airport here. The crew escaped injury. The plane had made an emergency landing here yesterday because of engine trouble it developed on a flight from San Francisco to Detroit.

title: Flowers Bloom a Bit Early on 86th St.
description: The street floor of Gimbels East blossomed with flowers yesterday. With good reason. The store was celebrating its first birthday.

title: Museum to Get Grant
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) The Rhode Island School of Design Museum of Art, Providence, will receive a $120,000 grant to install a climate control system, the National Endowment for the Arts announced yesterday.

title: MINNESOTA UPSET BY IOWA, 79 TO 77
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March (UPI)Kevin Kunnert, a 7footer, sank a rebound basket with five seconds to play tonight giving Iowa a stunning 7977 upset victory over Minnesota. The Gophers dropped into a firstplace tie with Indiana in the Big Ten.

title: INTEREST RATES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Interest rates continued their rapid climb yesterday as pessimism over the nearterm outlook spread to almost all sectors of the market for fixedincome securities.

title: Panel in Washington Urges Changes in Marijuana Laws
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (UPI)  A 40man committee appointed by Mayor Walter E. Washington of Washington recommended today that the possession and use of marijuana be decriminalized and the Government regulate its growth, manufacture and supply.

title: Air Collision Kills 68 in France During a Strike of Controllers
description: PARIS, March 5Two Londonbound Spanish jetliners, flying over western France during a strike of air controllers, collided today in clear, fine weather. One exploded and crashed, killing all 68 aboard, and the other made a safe emergency landing with a damaged wing.

title: Bridge:
description: The strength of New York bridge below its glittering surface of international stars was clearly demonstrated during the weekend, when fiVe young men littleknown to fame played with great verve to capture the Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss team championship at the New York Hilton.

title: Baseball Signings
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Case and Williams Urge A State Voice on Ports
description: WASHINGTON, March 5For the second Monday in a row, New Jersey's two Senators, Harrison A. Williams Jr. and Clifford P. Case, went before a Senate subcommittee to urge that the states have a, voice in approving any oil super ports off their coasts.

title: U.S. Dollar Strengthens In MajorCurrency Float
description: World currency markets functioned well in private trading yesterday as the governments of the major industrial nations with official dealings in foreign exchange closed  left their currencies free to find their own levels in the markets.

title: Cambodia Reports Fighting Continues South of Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 5 (Agence FrancePresse) Heavy fighting continued today along Route 2 and Communist forces stepped up attacks on Cambodian positions 25 miles south of the capital.

title: L.I.R.R. Derailment Delays Commuters Along One Line
description: Commuters on the Port Jefferson line of the Long Island Railroad were delayed by as much as half an hour in both morning and evening rush hours yesterday owing to a derailment, of four cars of a train east of the St. James station Sunday night.

title: The Blumenthal Victory
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal gained an impressive personal victory in winning the endorsement of the New Democratic Coalition for Mayor of New York City. An articulate spokesman for urban issues within the State Legislature at Albany, which controls so directly so many aspects of municipal government, Mr. Blumenthal serves as his chamber's Deputy Minority Leader. Well known and well regarded among leaders of various parties, he has been less visible to the citywide electorate at large. The N.D.C. endorsement gives him new stature.

title: New Charges Are Filed In Suit on Rothko Estate
description: Papers newly filed in the Mark Rothko case allege that the estate of the late artist was milked of many millions of dollars in an operation marked by conflict of interest, double dealing, fraud, conspiracy and waste of assets.

title: Jersey Strikes Down Part of Flag Law
description: TRENTON, March 5The New Jersey Supreme Court struck down a key section of the flag desecration law as unconstitutional today, overturning the conviction of a young ice cream vender who celebrated the Fourth of July holiday three years ago by placing peace symbols on American flags displayed on his truck.

title: Tougher Penalties For Whom?
description: Politicians and news reporters are now routinely calling Governor Rockefeller's new plan for combatting the drug traffic a proposal for tougher penalties against drug pushers. No doubt that is a guide to the legislative outcome of the Governor's actual demand, which was for mandatory life sentences, with no possibility of parole or plea bargaining, for anyone caught selling any amount of drugs.

title: Time Inc. Opposes News Panel To Monitor Press Perlormnance
description: Time Inc. announced yesterday that it would not support the National News Council being set up by the Twentieth Century Fund to monitor the performance of the national news media and evaluate complaints about its accuracy and fairness.

title: Population Dynamics
description: The sharp decline in this country's birth rate last year to the lowest level in American history has attracted wide attention. Last year 300,000 fewer babies were born than in 1971, even though the number of women of childbearing age increased appreciably. The demographers who a few years ago were widely prophesying a baby boom are finding that mechanical extrapolations of past trends were inadequate guides in this era of increasing availability of legal abortion as well as wider employment of contraceptive techniques.

title: BRITISH UNIONS PLAN NATIONWIDE STRIKES
description: LONDON, March 5Britain's unions voted today for a day of nationwide strikes and protests against the Government's program of curbing wages.

title: Dismissal of L.I. Schools Chief Ruled Not a Question for Court
description: LEVITTOWN, L. I. March 6 A State Supreme Court justice ruled today that the question of the dismissal of Dr. Edwin F. Klotz as Superintendent of the Island Trees School District can be more properly determined by the Commissioner of Education than by the court.

title: Papp's Sticks and Bones Put Off by C.B.S.
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday postponed indefinitely the telecast scheduled for Friday night of Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival production of Sticks and Bones, a bitter drama about a blinded Vietnam veteran's homecoming.

title: Van Lier of Bulls indicted On Assault, Riot Charges
description: BEAVER, Pa., March 6 (AP) Norm Van Lier, star guard for the National Basketball Association's Chicago. Bulls, was indicted yesterday on charges of assault and battery, resisting arrest and inciting to riot.

title: A Program for Paris
description: Confidence in the stability and viability of the international monetary system has been badly shaken by the events of recent weeks. But the immediate crisis represents the culmination of a long deterioration of faith in the monetary system that has been going on for yearsat least since the American escalation of the Vietnam war, the outbreak of inflation, the worsening United States balance of payments and the weakening of the dollar, the keystone of the system.

title: G.O.P. Nominates Breitel For Chief Judge of State
description: ALBANY, March 6  The State Republican party, castigating Democratic leaders for blocking a bipartisan agreement that would have eliminated primary and election fights over, the chief judgeship of the Court of Appeals, today nominated Associate Judge Charles D. Breitel for the post.

title: 1972 Sales Set High
description: The RCA Corporation reported yesterday record sales for 1972, with net income rising 23 per cent over the 1971 level.

title: Continuity in France
description: Firstround voting in France's election has all but eliminated the possibility that the new CommunistSocialist Union of the Left could win a majority in the National Assembly and claim the right to supplant the Gaullistled Government. As expected, the Gaullist party sustained substantial losses from its artificially inflated showing of 1968 and the Left Union captured more than 40 per cent of the popular vote.

title: EDWARD OELSNER, 84 LED U.S. NAVIGATION
description: Edward C. W. Oelsner, founder and chairman of the United States Navigation Company, died last evening in Malaga, Spain. He was 84 years old and lived in Malaga. He also had homes in Cannes, France; Palm Beach, Fla., and Oyster Bay, L.I.

title: Papp's Dream Enriches a City
description: The New York Shakespeare Festival was begun, as one early observer put it, on nerve and a shoestring. The shoestring, though often frayed almost to the point of breaking, turned into hemp rope a long while ago, but Joseph Papp, has never lost his nerve.

title: $750,000 in Cocaine is Found in Offices Of a Religious Sect
description: Narcotics Division detectives, after a fourmonth investigation, raided an apartment in Upper Manhattan last night and seized seven and a half pounds of cocaine that the police said, was valued at $750,000.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market staged vigorous and broadbased advance yesterday on rising voluble that carried blue chips and glamour stocks to solid gains.

title: FRED WILK
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., March 6 Fred Wilk, president of the Wilk Shirt Corporation since 1935, died today, apparently of a heart attack, in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived in Larchmont and in Hillcrest, Fla.

title: Yankees as Team Hoping Situation Will Not Hurt Them
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 6Since most had been victims of or witnesses to the diabolical practical jokes of Mike Kekich and Fritz Peterson, the Yankee players received the news of their exchange of families with disbelief. It was another joke, they figured.

title: CONNECTICUT SEEKS TO RETAIN PBW SEAT
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) A petition was filed in the United States Circuit Court of Appeals here today on behalf of the state of Connecticut challenging a regulation of the $e urities and Exchange Commission concerning institutional membership on stock exchanges.

title: FELT FORUM CROWD APPLAUDS MRS. MEIR
description: With the rousing Hebrew, greeting of Havenu shalom aleichem (We have brought, peace to you), New York's Jewish community paid tribute last night to Israel's Premier, Golda Meir.

title: New Haven School Strike Brings a Quick Injunction
description: NEW HAVEN, March 6 Public school teachers here, locked for more than half a year in wage negotiations, walked off their jobs today. It was the second teachers' strike in the city in three years.

title: Senate, 47 to 38, Retains A Limit on Open Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The Senate, with its leadership in firm control, rejected today a proposal that would have made most critical committee meetings open to the public. The action placed the Senate in direct contrast with the House of Representatives, where reform forces appear to have the votes to place a sharp limitation on secrecy in committees.

title: Nixon Gives Stag Dinners
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP)  President Nixon is giving blacktie stag dinners at the White House Tuesday and Wednesday nights for business and community leaders and some of his top campaign contributors, the White House announced today. About 80 to 100 guests have been invited each night. No press coverage was permitted and no details were announced.

title: Lockheed Faces New Inquiry on C5A; Use of Untested Materials Is Charged
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 Half a dozen men from the Air Force Office of Special Investigations are questioning workers who helped build the controversial C5A airplane in yet another new inquiry into the costly, troubleplagued project.

title: CORNELL'S SEXTET ROUTS R.P.I., 9 TO 3
description: ITHACA, N. Y., March 6Top  seeded Cornell advanced to this weekend's Eastern College Athletic Conference hockey semifinal with a 93 quarterfinal victory over Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute tonight.

title: New Aftershock Hits Coast
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 6 (UPI)Another aftershock was recorded yesterday from the earthquake that rattled Southern California 13 days ago. It was at least the 14th aftershock since the quake Feb. 21, but the first in the last week.

title: Graziano Punch in Lines Now
description: Four former titleholders doing roadwork here yesterday for their exhibition bouts at Madison Square Garden Friday. From the left are onetime rivals Willie Pep and Sandy Saddler; and Rocky Graziano and Tony Zale.

title: Offer by King Hussein
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 6 King Hussein of Jordan, responding to Arab appeals for clemency, offered today to suspend death sentences against 17 Palestinian commandos if their guerrilla organizations halted subversion against Jordan.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Mine Bureau Is Ordered to Act To Collect Unpaid Safety Fines
description: WASHINGTON, March. 6 The Justice Department has ordered the Bureau of Mines to begin collecting millions of dollars in unpaid cash penalties for mine safety violations by withholding the amount of the fines from, money that Federal agencies owe the coal companies.

title: Scientists Analyzing Metal Content of Water, Soil and Food for Clues to Rise in Heart Attacks
description: GENEVA, March 6World Health Organization scientists are clipping toenails and analyzing the metal content of community water supplies, soils and foods as they seek the causes of the rising number of human deaths from heart attacks.

title: Ohio Buying Coloring Books
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 6 (UPI)The state of Ohio is buying 600,000 coloring books. The State Controlling Board voted yesterday to spend $13,800 for the books, depicting good highway safety practices. State officials intend to distribute them to first and second graders throughout Ohio.

title: Tennessee Five Takes A Dim View of Playoff
description: CHATTANOOGA, March 6 (AP)The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga basketball squad, preparing for its game Friday night with Southeast Louisiana in the National Collegiate Athletic Association collegedivision playoffs, has been practicing in a darkened gymnasium.

title: Underground Press Coverage Shifts From Rock, Sex and Drugs to Politics
description: The brash, polemical underground press, which grew up in the nineteensixties by catering to the youthful counterculture's. tastes for rock music, drugs, sex and radical rhetoric, has begun to turn its attention to more serious political coverage, especially of local governments and local issues in countless communities across the country.

title: Prices Advance on Amex and OTC
description: Sparked by bargainhunters, prices on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market registered their best gains yesterday in weeld.

title: 1972 CRIME TOTAL IN CITY FELL 18% AS VIOLENCE ROSE
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yester. day an 18 per cent decline in serious crimes reported to the police last year, even though in  some categoriesmurder, rape and felonious assaultthe number showed an increase over 1971.

title: Counsel to Nixon Attended F.B.I. Watergate Quizzing
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Acting F.B.I. Director L. Patrick Gray 3d said today that John W. Dean 3d, a Presidential counsel, had been present when. White House employes were interviewed by F.B.I. agents about the Watergate bugging case. He called Mr. Dean's attendance not normal procedure and said that it had occurred against his personal wishes.

title: Family Life When Success Keeps the Father Traveling
description: When Pat Nakasian of Bronxville, N. Y., expects her husband, an international lawyer, home from a business trip, she tells their four children, Line up and pay attentionhere comes Uncle Daddy.

title: Papp's Troupe to Replace Lincoln Repertory
description: Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival, with Mr. Papp as producer and president, will replace the Repertory Theater of Lincoln Center. In a major change of artistic policy at the center, Mr. Papp will emphasize the production of new American plays instead of revivals at the Vivian Beaumont Theater and will turn the 299seat Forum Theater into a yearround home for Shakespeare.

title: Volume Also at Peak
description: Sales and earnings of Gulf and Western Industries, Inc., were the highest of any quarter or halfyear period in its history, according to results reported yesterday for the fiscal quarter and six months ended Jan. 31. The substantial gains reflected increased profits in all eight operating groups and a turnaround performance of the manufacturing sector, the company said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Service resumed on the Port Jefferson branch of the Long Island Rail Road at 5 P.M. yesterday after a halt two days because of a derailment of four cars of a passenger train Sunday night east of the St. James Station. L.I.R.R. official said full service, but at reduced speed, would also continue for this morning's rush hour, with delays of 10 or 15 minutes.

title: David Storey, Work Is Gripping and Unusual
Israeli Environmentalists Appear to Win a Big Battle
description: HAIFA, IsraelAfter a yearlong campaign of protest demonstrations and public petitions, the fledgling environmental forces in. Israel appear to have won their first major battle.

title: BRITISH SAY ICELAND CUTS TRAWLER LINES
description: LONDON, March 6 (AP)Icelandic gunboats are harassing British trawlers fishing in disputed waters around Iceland, the Foreign Office said today.

title: TankTruck Driver Killed; Oil Is Spilled Into Creek
description: MIDDLEVILLE, N. Y., March 6 (AP)A tank truck crashed into a creek bank yesterday, killing the driver and spilling oil into Stony Creek near this Herkimer County community.

title: Caring for Children
description: Working mothers in this and other cities have been expressing concern about the proposed changes in the Federal guidelines which might render their children ineligible for lowcost day care. Unless states and cities make up for the reduction in Federal support, many mothers whose earnings are above the poverty level but too modest to permit expensive unsubsidized private child care would be forced to withdraw their children from any existing centers. In New York the cutoff point would come at an income of $5,400.

title: Two Film Stars Must Testily at Arizona Inquest
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 6A Maricopa County Superior Court judge ruled today that two movie stars, Burt Reynolds and Sarah Miles, and Jane Evans, the governess of Miss Miles's son, must testify at an inquest into the death Feb. 11 of Miss Miles's business manager.

title: PappPlay Off C.B.S.
description: A telecast of Sticks and Bones, produced by Joseph Papp, has been postponed indefinitely by C.B.S. It said that the play, about the homecoming of a blinded Vietnam veteran, might be unnecessarily abrasive... at a time when, prisoners of war and other veterans were returning home. Details, Page 87.

title: Cleveland Quartet Is Young and Talented
description: Add another talented young string quartet, coming fast down the track after Juilliard, Guarneri and the others. The Cleveland QuartetDonald Weilerstein and Peter Salaff, violins; Martha Strongin Katz, viola, and Paul Katz, cellogave a concert (the second of three) on Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hall and amply demonstrated that it is a strong, accomplished group.

title: Knicks Top Sonics, 10694; Reed Collects 21 Rebounds
description: If you consider statistics, the New York Knicks had a big night at Madison Square Garden in beating the Seattle Supersonics, 10694, last night. If you consider the way they played, it wasn't so good.

title: Mill Basin Supports Canarsie Boycott; Court Halts Education Board Hearing
description: The boycott of eight schools in Canarsie spread to a school in a nearby. Brooklyn community yesterday as the Board of Education was legally blocked from hearing an appeal to overturn attendance zones that have touched off the fourday protest.

title: 1972 CRIME TOTAL IN CITY FELL 18% AS VIOLENCE ROSE
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday an 18 per cent decline in serious crimes reported to the police last year, even thougt in some categoriesmurder rape and felonious assaultthe number showed an increase over 1971.

title: Senate, 47 to 38, Retains A Limit on Open Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The Senate, with its leadership in firm control, rejected today a proposal that would have made most critical committee meetings open to the public. The action placed me Senate in direct contrast with the House of Representatives, where reform forces appear to have the votes to place a sharp limitation on secrecy in committees.

title: Governor Hints of Compromise In His Tough Drug Proposal
description: ALBANY, March 6Governor Rockefeller indicated today that another possible area of compromise in his negotiations with the Legislature on his bill mandating life sentences for narcotics pushers might be some consideration of parole for pushers who are also users.

title: Ellsberg Witness Asserts Military Falsified Reports
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6A Central intelligence Agency analyst testified today at the Pentagon papers trial that he had attended conferences, in Saigon and Hawaii and at the agency, in which the military purposely diminished estimates of enemy strength in Vietnam.

title: A.B.A. Loses Case on Balls
description: A Federal judge has rejected the argument that red, white and blue basketballs are a trademark of the American Basketball Association. Judge Kevin T. Duffy on Monday denied an injunction sought by the A.B.A. against one of a halfdozen sporting goods manufacturers that sell such balls; The league had sought royalties from the companies.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Athens University Is Shut for a Week by Regime
description: ATHENS, March 6The police closed Athens University today for a week to avert fresh disturbances; and permission for dissenting students to hold a campus meeting was withdrawn.

title: Papp Play Off C.B.S.
description: A telecast of Sticks and Bones, produced by Joseph Papp, has been postponed indefinitely by C.B.S. It said that the play, about the homecoming of a blinded Vietnam veteran, might be unnecessarily abrasive ... at a time when prisoners of war and other veterans were returning home. Details, Page 87.

title: BRITISH ANNOUNCE NEUTRAL BUDGET
description: LONDON, March 6  The Conservative Government announced today what it called a neutral budget designed to isnure faster growth without feeding inflation.

title: Now the Hot Cars Start Hot Laps at Indianapolis
description: And now the scene shifts to Indianapolis. With the completion of tire tests at more than 200 miles an hour at Texas World Speedway and Ontario (Calif.) MotorSpeedway, the hot cars of the United States Auto Club's championship division have been moved to the venerable Indianapolis Motor Speedway. The Goodyear tire people have engaged Indy for tests this week and the week of March 19 to 24, and Firestone will rent the track the second and fourth weeks of March. Texas and Ontario are all right for tweaking engines and suspension, but Indianapolis is where the testing counts for most.

title: TERRORIST GROUP IS WORRYING MIA
description: NEW DELHI, March 7Indian gunmen guard the embassy gates. Mounted police are seen outside the residences of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and her Cabinet ministers. Plainclothesmen keep vigil in the residential districts favored by foreign diplomats.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: The top 20, with points figured on a 10987654321) basis for first through 10th places (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records through games of last Sunday.

title: James H. Angleton Dead at 84; National Cash Register Officer
description: BOISE, Idaho, March 6James Hugh Angleton, a soldier and former executive of the National Cash Register Company, died Sunday at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 84 years old.

title: BOMBAY WORRIED BY INFLUX OF POOR
description: BOMBAY, IndiaThey arrive at Victoria Terminal gripping sacks and wooden flutes. Within hours the men have set up tents on the pavement while the women and children nervously play the flutes and beg for coins.

title: Strong Credit Demand Pushes Interest Rates Up
description: Interest rates spiraled upward again yesterday under continued strong demand for shortterm credit and, the psychological depressant of the unresolved situation in foreign exchange.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG 60, 63 VICTOR
description: DALLAS, March 6 (AP)Evonne Goolagong needed just, 37 minutes to breeze through, her opening match tonight in the $37,000 Maureen Connolly Brinker women's international tennis tournament.

title: Eximbank Expects Credits for Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 The ExportImport Bank expects to reach an agreement this week for the bank's first export credits to the Soviet Union, official sources said today.

title: ANCORP DEAL IS SET BY GOODRICH REALTY
description: The Goodrich Realty & Development Group, Inc., announced yesterday an agreement in principle for the immediate participation by Goodrich executives in the management of Ancorp National Services, Inc., formerly known as the American News Company.

title: Railroad Buys Grain Cars
description: CHICAGO, March 6 (UPI)The Rock Island Line today announced it had ordered 1,200 new freight cars valued at $21.2million. Included in the order were 500 jumbo covered hopper cars of 100ton capacity for use in hauling grain. Delivery will begin in April.

title: COURT RULE SHIFT OPPOSED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, March 6In a move designed to reassert legislative authority over the judicial branch, the House Judiciary Committee voted today to postpone indefinitely the effective date of new rules of evidence promulgated by the Supreme Court for use in the Federal courts.

title: Belmonte to Resume Riding At Santa Anita Tomorrow
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 6 (AP)  Eddie Belmonte, who was injured in a spill from Autobiography Feb. 19, will resume riding Thursday at Santa Anita. Belmonte has been named to handle Big Spruce in the $170,000 Santa Anita Handicap on Saturday.

title: Music: College Chorus
description: Alexander Woollcott was such a devoted alumnus of Hamilton College that when its choir appeared in New York he used to coerce his many famous friends into attending its concerts. One such event took place in Town Hall on March 5, 1928, and 45 years later to the day what has become the Choir of Hamilton and Kirkland Colleges sang there. The Monday night program was dedicated to Woollcott's memory, with proceeds going to establish a scholarship fund in his name.

title: The Present as Future
description: YANUCA ISLAND, FijiOn visiting such isolated beauty spots as these Pacific islands, unmarred by smog or uncomfortable crowding, one can quietly contemplate the ecological imbalance tarnishing a more familiar world.

title: L.I.U. Sets Back Seton Hall For First Triumph on Road
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 6Long Island University took a 2point halftime lead and stayed in front to beat Seton Hall University, 6259, tonight. It was the first road victory of the season for the Blackbirds.

title: Parents Fight Removal of Foster Boy
description: A Catholic Charities adoption agency failed yesterday to satisfy an order to produce in New York State Supreme Court 7yearold foster boy that the agency had summarily removed from the home of foster parents in New Jersey.

title: W. EDWIN GOFF
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., March 6 W. Edwin Goff, chairman of the board of Boarts International, Inc., 405 Park Avenue, New York, died yesterday at Point Pleasant Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at Leisure Village here.

title: For Australia's Leaders, Test of a New Diplomacy
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 6 Australian diplomacy has entered a new era under the threemonthold leadership of Gough Whitlam, the first Labor party Prime Minister here in 23 years.

title: France's Air Traffic Is off As Dispute Follows Crash
description: PARIS, March 6 (AP)Most European airlines avoided French skies today as controversy flared over who was responsible for the disastrous collision of two Spanish jetliners flying under French military air traffic control.

title: Indians' Truce Ends as Talks Collapse
description: WOUNDED KNEE: S. D., March 6Negotiations between Indians holding this town for the last week and Department of the Interior officials broke down today, the Indians called off their ceasefire, and the Justice Department said its final offer was on the table. However, behindthescenes efforts were going on to seek a way out of the impasse.

title: Police in Bronx Fired On
description: The Third Avenue elevated in the Bronx was shut down for more than an hour during last evening's homeward rush while the police sought two men who had exchanged shots with patrolmen after trying without success to commandeer gypsy cab.

title: 9 SEWAGE PLANTS IN STATE GET AID
description: Federal grants totaling $200,031,620 for nine sewagetreatment projectsone in Staten Island, one in Brooklyn and seven upstatewere announced yesterday, making possible early starts on the longplanned major plants that will treat by 1979 virtually the last of the city's raw sewage.

title: Communists Attend 2 Meetings In Saigon After Boycott Threat
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, March 7Communist delegates to the FourParty Joint Military Commission attended a commission meeting this morning after having threatened to boycott most of the meetings.

title: MAYORS SAY NIXON IS FIRM ON FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, March 6A dozen Mayors met today with President Nixon but failed to break the impasse over funds for social programs.

title: War Veterans Lose Plea
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., March 6 (UPI)United States District Judge Winston Arnow denied defense motions today to dismiss charges that seven members of Vietnam Veterans Against the War and one supporter had conspired to bomb the Republican National Convention last summer.

title: Auto Safety Chief To Quit Government For Job in Industry
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Douglas W. Toms, the Federal auto safety, chief since late 1969, has accepted a job with AMF Indistries Inc., a conglomerate based in White Plains, N.Y.

title: Ah, to Be Able to Wear Those Bustles Again
description: Leg o'mutton sleeves. Changeable silks. Tiny waistlines and bustles. Let's dump women's liberation and get back to all that, said Mrs. William Renchard, enthusiastically. I was born 75 years too late,' said Mrs. Irving Koerner.

title: Accusation in Khartoum
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, March 6President Gaafar alNimeiry today accused the head of the Khartoum office of Al Fatah, the Palestinian commando organization, of having been the key planner of the attack by Black September terrorists on the Saudi Arabian Embassy in which three Western diplomats were slain.

title: Now Jury Groups Sought
description: SANTA FE, N. M., March 6 (UPI)The New Mexico House passed a bill yesterday to make doctors, lawyers, university professors and ministers of the gospel serve on juries like other citizens.

title: Accusation in Khartoum
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, March 6President Gaafar alNimeiry today accused the head of the Khartoum office of Al Fatah, the Palestinian commando organization, of having been the key planner of the attack by Black September terrorists on the Saudi Arabian Embassy in which three Western diplomats were slain.

title: Red Smith
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 6  Lee MacPhail, general manager of the Yankees,, went out to dinner with friends the other evening. They had a few drinks and a pleasant time, so pleasant that when, they parted, MacPhail went to a telephone and called Carl Rosen, Bobby Murcer's friend and business agent. You win, Lee said. A hundred thousand.

title: COLONELS ROUT TAMS BY 131107
description: MEMPHIS, March 6 (UPI)Dan Issel and Artis Gilmore led the Kentucky Colonels to 131107 victory over the Memphis Tams tonight in the American Basketball Association.

title: 1,000 Protest Federal Plan to Cut DayCare Service
description: About 1,000 demonstrators, many of them mothers who brought their children, yesterday protested proposed Federal regulations that would end daycare and other social services, for many present recipients.

title: CALIFORNIA WARY ON SMOG CONTROL
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6  The State of California took the Environmental Protection Agency's drastic proposals for smog abatement in the Los Angeles basin and politely tossed them back into the Federal lap today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 2 L.I. Youths Held In BurglaryRape Of Elderly Women
description: LONG BEACH, L.I., March 6 Two teenagers were arrested here last night in connection with at least 10 house burglaries in the last seven months and the rape of four elderly women.

title: Weaker Impoundment Bill Backed in House
description: WASHINGTON, March 6House Democratic leaders lined up today behind an antiimpoundment proposal that is substantially weaker than, the one nearing a vote in the Senate.

title: Police Capture Man With a Stolen Car In Harlem Chase
description: A car containing three men sped away from plainclothes patrolmen after an exchange of shots on a Harlem street last night and 10 minutes later, after a wild chase, the car came to a stop and one man was captured.

title: Two Cardinals Are Named To Top Vatican Positions
description: ROME, March 6Two new Cardinals, were put in charge of important Vatican departments today. Sergio Cardinal Pignedoli, a 62yearold Italian who is one of the closest friends of Pope Paul VI, became president of the Secretariat for NonChristians.

title: Deadlock on Prisoners Is Broken In Apparent Saigon Compromise
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, March 7An impasse on the exchange of Vietnamese prisoners of war was broken today with what appeared to be a South Vietnamese compromise.

title: CITY SEES A DROP IN YOUTHs' JOBS
description: ALBANY, March 6Human Resouroes administrator Jule M. Sugarman outlined a dismal summer job outlook for New York City today, asserting that the city bad no way of compensating, for the expected loss of all 50,000, job slots in the federally funded summer Youth Corps.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

title: METLIFE REPORTS DECLINE IN SALES
description: Life insurance sales of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company dropped substantially last year, company figures showed yesterday. Although sales to individuals advanced, a significant decline in group insurance pushed the total below the year before:

title: CITY PENSION RULE IS UPSET BY COURT
description: State Supreme Court Justice Sidney H. Asch has ruled that a state law limiting many workers' retirement benefits cannot be applied retroactively.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Killer Loses Bid for New Trial

title: Pearl Buck
description: It is a happy circumstance that Pearl Buck lived to see a renewal of American relationships with mainland China and an upsurge of interest in things Chinese, for n writer did more to make that fascinating country a reality for ordinary American readers. Although she was far more than a onebook author, it was her fate as it is that of many good writers to be forever identified with a single work, in her case, The Good Earth.

title: Offer by King Hussein
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 6 King Hussein of Jordan, responding to Arab appeals for clemency, offered today to suspend death sentences against 17 Palestinian commandos if their guerrilla organizations halted subversion against Jordan.

title: Joint Suits Barred on Bergen G.O.P.
description: HACKENSACK, March 6 Superior Court Judge James I. Toscano reversed himself today and ordered separate trials of two election suits that had been brought by Insurgent Republicans against the Bergen County Republican organization and County Clerk Alexander Allan.

title: MAYOR OF ST. LOUIS LOSES PRIMARY RAGE
description: ST. LOUIS, March 6 (UPI)Mayor Alfonso J. Cervantes lost his bid for a third term today when he was beaten in the Democratic primary by a man who had been his lieutenant for the last eight years.

title: Player in 1971 N.F.L. Bribery Report Likely to Stay Unnamed
description: Player X, wherever you are, relax and continue on your daily rounds without immediate fear of exposure. The day you were to testify that you had been asked to dump three football games has been postponed, perhaps indefinitely. The House of Representatives' Select Committee on Crime. headed by Claude Pepper, Democrat of Florida, has been phased out by the new Congress and it will hold no more hearings before its demise on June 30.

title: Agnew Says News Media Exaggerate Amnesty Issue
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (Reuters)Vice President Agnew accused the news media tonight of blowing out of proportion the issue of amnesty for those who refused to serve in the United States forces in Vietnam.

title: COPPER FUTURES POST SHARP GAIN
description: Copper futures prices rose sharply yesterday and silver and platinum dropped sharply.

title: RIVER BUOY VICTOR WITH KOBUK KING
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 6 (UPI)River Buoy, an 8yearold gelding who carried w $6,500 claiming tag only a few months ago, took the $34,375 first division of the Arcadia Handicap at Santa Anita today. It was his fourth victory in the meeting.

title: New Crisis With Moslem Dissidents Is Foreseen in Philippines
description: MANILA, March 6A new crisis appears to be developing in the southern Mindanao region where an amnesty for Moslem dissidents expired last week.

title: JULIAN T. ABELES LAWYER, 80, DIES
description: Julian T. Abeles, a copyright lawyer who spent most of his life protecting the rights of music publishers and songwriters, died yesterday at Presbyterian Hospital. His age was 80.

title: Another British Soldier Killed In Ulster, the 11th Since Feb. 1
description: BELFAST, Norther Ireland, March 6A 22yearold British soldier was killed by a single rifle shot in the chest today while taking part in a search the Roman Catholic Ballymurphy district of Belfast.

title: Basketball Ratings
Nixon's Presidency: A Nation Is Changed
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 For four years, Nixon Administration officials traveled the nation telling audiences that the Federal Government, over which they were presiding, was flawed in many ways as a means of delivering services to the public.

title: Kissinger's New Assignment
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Henry Kissinger is now quietly reorganizing his White House staff and, on instructions from the President, is preparing for an intensive period of negotiations on U.S. relations with Western Europe, Japan and the Middle East.

title: Union Carbide Sets Price Rises April 1 On Ethylene Glycol
description: The Union Carbide Corporation said yesterday that it would raise its prices for ethyline glycol by 0.5 cent a pound, effective April 1.

title: SCHOOLS ENJOINED ON ETHNIC CENSUS
description: Community School Board 28 in. Queens blocked yesterday the continuation of an ethnic census of teachers in the city schools by obtaining a temporary restraining order in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 7, 1973 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: MISS GOOLAGONG 60, 63 VICTOR
description: DALLAS, March 6 (AP)Evonne Goolagong needed just 37 minutes to breeze through her opening match tonight in the $37,000 Maureen Connolly Brinker women's international tennis tournament.

title: OIL AND GASOLINE PRICES PUT UNDER CONTROL AGAIN; FARM CURBS ALSO WEIGHED
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The Nixon Administration, in a surprise move, reimposed mandatory price controls today on the country's 23 biggest oil companies. Crude oil, gasoline, heating oil and other refinery products, but not natural gas, were covered.

title: F.T.C. Urged to Curb TV Ads By Candy and Cereal Makers
description: WASHINGTON. March 6Critics of television commercials aimed at children filed complaints against candy and cereal manufacturers today and urged Congress to impose a tax on broadcasting advertising to pay for the making of counter commercials.

title: Pathet Lao Says Government And U.S. Sabotage the Truce
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 6The Communistled Pathet Lao accused the Vientiane Government and the United States today of trying to sabotage the ceasefire agreement reached two weeks ago.

title: Women's Lobby, in Albany, Urged to Avoid Separatism Appeal
description: ALBANY, March 6  Representatives of the National Organization for Women gathered today to lobby for a package of bills and were cautioned by a woman member of the Legislature to guard against boxing people into men and women categories.

title: Nominee as U.S. Education Head John Renaldo Ottina
description: The man nominated by President Nixon yesterday to be United States Commissioner of Education has a reputation among those who know him and his work well as a good manager, an honest boss and a decisive executive.

title: 1,200 Housing Units Here To Be Converted to Coops
description: Forty buildings containing nearly 1,200 apartments throughout the city will be rehabilitated and converted to tenantowner cooperatives as part of a major new publicly assisted housing program announced by Mayor Lindsay yesterday.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: House Kills Data Requests
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) The House killed today a move to require the Pentagon to furnish detailed information on the intensive December bombing of North Vietnam.

title: People in Sports: Socko Opening for the DH
description: The American League's new designated  hitter rule made a smashing debut yesterday. Larry Hisle, filling the role for the Minnesota Twins, whacked two home runs, drove in seven runs as the Twins crushed the Pittsburgh Pirates, 124, in baseball's 1973 exhibition opener.

title: City College Names Head of Its Arts Center
description: City College has named Herman Krawitz, a 1949 alumfius and a former assistant manager of the Metropolitan Opera, to head its new multimilliondollar Leonard Davis Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Rogers Voices Confidence on CeaseFire
