description: Who can listen to the voices of Mission Control and the spacecraft and not be struck by the confidence at both ends? And both ends of what? A distance more often than not changing at tremendous speed, while the dry talk proceeds like another dimension unaffected.

title: Army Says It Will Not Punish P.O.W. Captured While AWOL
description: PHOENIXVILLE, Pa., March 10When Pvt. Ferdinand Rodriguez of Brooklyn arrived at Valley Forge General Hospital on a stretcher 22 days ago after nearly five years as a prisoner of war, his infirmities were listed as malaria, exhaustion and apprehension.

title: North Westchester Embracing Adult Communities
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y.An upsurge in special housing for older adults is under way in northern Westchester County, to the distress of civil libertarians.

title: William Smith to Wed Miss Corcoran
description: NEW MILFORD, N.J., March 10  Miss Maureen Corcoran, a speech pathologist with the Ramsey Board of Education, will be married June 2 to William Thomas Smith, a lawyer with the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, in New York.

title: Numismatics
description: THE first of the halfdozen major coin shows (called conventions) that will be held in New York City this year is the Ancient, Medieval and Foreign International Coin Convention. It opens Thursday for a threeday run in the Warwick Hotel, 65 West 54th Street, near the Avenue of the Americas.

title: UNDERSEA NAMES MAY BE PROBLEM
description: UNITED NATIONS, K Y. March 10At the turn of the century wealthy Norwegian brewers financed explorations of the unmapped Canadian northland and named a number of islands after themselves. Today these names are a vexation to many Canadians.

title: Mario Thomas: My Whole Life I've Had My Dukes Up
description: MARLO THOMAS doesn't look like a fighter. For one thing, she's tinya mere 5 feet 3 inches tall. But looks can be deceiving. My whole life I've had my dukes up, says Ms. Thomas, star of the That Girl series. And what the petite Ms. Thomas is punching away at these days is, among other things, Sexism. I've probably been a closet feminist all my lifebut didn't know it.

title: Brooklyn Gets Taste Of Battle On Coops
description: In August, 1971, the 147 tenants in an apartment building in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn received in the mail a 130page booklet entitled A Plan to Convert to Cooperative Ownership.

title: Arthur Daley
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 10When John Matuszak enters a room, he fills it. If he is not the biggest rookie to be performing in the National Football League next season, he will be so close to it that no one ever will be able to notice the difference. It's a certainty, though, that he will be the most impressive physical specimen in all of football and he undoubtedly will be the richest rookie lineman ever. If you never heard John Matuszak, don't be distressed. You are not alone. He is a handsome young man of 22 who is about to intrude himself on public consciousness. He will do it with a crash, or a series of crashes. Big John is a defensive end with the somewhat awesome dimensions of 6 feet 7 inches in height and 280 pounds in weight.

title: Customs In Newark Handles A Big Load
description: NEWARK  The Newark, customs area was officially credited with less than 10 per cent of the New York region's customs collections in 1972, even though it actually garnered far more.

title: Environmentalism, Coloradostyle
description: VAIL, Colo. There was once a quiet valley tucked high in the Colorado Rockies. In summer, ranchers grazed their cattle and sheep in the lush meadows, through which an alpine stream coursed. Cottonwoods grew along its sandy banks, aspen a little farther up the slopes, and alder bushes and dogwood. The surrounding mountains were dense with balsam and lodgepole pine, Engelmann and blue spruce. The wildlifemule deer, elk, even a few mountain lionshad been decimated by foraging miners at the turn of the century, but had multiplied since. With autumn, frost turned the aspen groves bright yellow and the first sharp flurries blew over the peaks to the west. Ice crusted the edges of the creek and snow piled upon snow from November until the next April. Winter left Gore Creek Valley in splendid isolation once upon a timebefore Vail was born 10 years ago.

title: BRAZIL ENACTING POLLUTION CURBS
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 10 Brazilians are beginning to realize there is a bottom to their vast natural resources and are trying to curb their own prodigality.

title: If He Had Taken Stravinsky's Advice...
description: LEON KIRCHNER sits in his centuryold wooden house in Cambridge, Mass., a few steps off Harvard Square, and wonders  as he probably will always wonder  what would have happened if he had taken Stravinsky's advice back there in California in 1953. Stravinsky had recommended the promising young American composer for a vacant professorship at Mills Collegethen quixotically urged him not to take it.

title: S. CAROLINA GAINS IN N.C.A.A. EVENT
description: WICHITA, Kan., March 10 (AP)Kevin Joyce and Danny Traylor broke open a close game with a late flurry that brought South Carolina a 7870 firstround National Collegiate Midwest Regional playoff victory over Texas Tech today.

title: Estimate Board Approves Infill Zoning Plan to Spur 2and 3Family Home Building
description: By a vote of 20 to 2, the Board of Estimate has approved a controversial Infill zoning amendment designed to encourage the construction of two and threefamily hoines  mostly in Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Proxmire Urges a Freeze On Wages, Prices, Profits
description: WASHINGTON, March 10, (Reuters)  Senator William Proxmire, Donocrat of Wisconsin, urged President Nixon today to place an immediate sixmonth freeze on wages, prices end profits.

title: Norwalk Hospital Gets Gift
description: The Norwalk Hospital in Connecticut has announced a gift of $50,000 from the estate of Beulah S. Hinds of Greenwich, Conn., to be used for construction of new facilities. Norman A. Brady, president of the hospital, said the funds would be used to expand its center for respiratory research, diagnois and treatment.

title: 8th Douglass Event Of Urban League To Be Held May 3
description: The New York Urban League has announced that its eighth annual Frederick Douglass Awards dinner will be held on May 3 in the Imperial Ballroom of the Americana Hotel.

title: M.T.A. Plan On Bridge Accepted By Court
description: ALBANY  The onagain offagain proposed bridge across Long Island Sound that would link Rye in Westchester and Oyster Bay, L. I. appears to be on again.

title: PHONERATE SETUP SCORED BY ABRAMS
description: Robert Abrams, the Bronx Borough President, charged outrageous economic discrimination yesterday by the New York Telephone Company against nearly 150,000 subscribers in the North Bronx.

title: N.F.L. to Weigh SuddenDeath Tiebreaker
description: The competitions committee of the National Football League will spend a week in Acapulco, Mexico, before the league's annual meeting deliberating recommendations for changes in rules and other aspects of the game. This committee, the most powerful in the N.F.L. structure, is made up of Tex Schramm, Dallas Cowboys; Al Davis, Oakland Raiders; Paul Brown, Cincinnati Bengals, and Jim Finks, Minnesota Vikings, who are the chief executives of their clubs and regarded as the best brains available.

title: PUZZLES
description: ACROSS

title: Northwestern Stuns Minnesota, Indiana Wins Big 10 Title
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., March 10 (UPI)  Indiana defeated Purdue, 7772, today and won the Big Ten basketball championship when lastplace Northwestern later upset Minnesota, 7974, at Evanston, Ill.

title: U.C.L.A. Trounces Southern California For No. 71 in a Row
description: LOS ANGELES, March 10 (AP)Bill Walton hauled down 20 rebounds and scored 17 points today as the University of California, Lbs Angeles, coasted to its 71st consecutive basketball victory, a 76.56 decision over Southern California, and completed its second straight unbeaten regular season.

title: Thefts of Autos Go Down, The First Drop in History
description: Auto theft is decreasing across the country.

title: Miami Beach Says Water W Be Pure by Tomorrow
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 10 (AP)Drinking water was still being boiled in this resort city today but officials said that a water contamination problem should be solved by Monday.

title: Canadian Railroads Find That Antiques Are Popular
description: MONTREAL, March 10 (Canadian Press)From elegantly appointed directors' cars touring the country to boutiques in Montreal, Canada's major railroads have moved into the antique business and are finding that it is popular.

title: THOMAS JAMERSON IN SHARPLESS ROLE
description: Barring laryngitis or amnesia and given the basic vocal equipment, it does not seem to be too difficult for a baritone to make a sympathetic impression as Sharpless in Puccini's Madam Butterfly. Thomas Jamerson, singing the part for the first time with the New York City Opera Friday night, proved no exception to the rule. He did look a bit young, but he fulfilled the modest vocal demands handily, acted with properly deferential concern and fit neatly into Frank Corsaro's continually inventive, creatively theatrical production.

title: A New Crisis in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, March 10In the last few days, the Pentagon has been complaining that North Vietnam has been moving substantial quantities of military arms, including tanks, into South Vietnam, but it has not made much of the point that this is a clear violation of the truce agreement.

title: Medicine
description: WASHINGTONIf all the 100,000 dentists in the United States restored decayed teeth day and night, 365 days a year, as many new cavities would have formed at the end of the year as were just restored during the previous year. The statement was made by Dr. Abraham E. Nizel of the Tufts University School of Dental Medicine to the Senate Select Committee on Nutrition last week, to emphasize the enormity of this health problem.

title: DIAGRAMLESS PUZZLES 19 by 19, by George W. Frank
description: ACROSS

title: Blues' 3dPeriod Surge Helps Top Islanders, 54
description: ST. LOUIS, March 10 (AP)The St. Louis Blues erupted for three goals in the third period and held off a late surge by the New York Islanders for a 54 victory in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Anne Coleman And Newsman Plan Marriage
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 10  Mr. and Mrs. Robert Spalding Coleman have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Norton Coleman, to Polk Laffoon 4th, son of Mr. and Mrs. Polk Laffoon 3d of Cincinnati. An April 14 wedding is planned.

title: Profile of a Motel Owner: work Is the Key
description: PACIFIC GROVE, Calif.  The Beachcomber Inn here at 1996 Sunset Drive is a pleasant motel, not big but not unnoticeable, neither perfectly situated nor in an unattractive spot: 26 rooms in a long, narrow structure with balconies and a pastel facade facing the ocean a quarter of a mile away. The modern rooms have baths and color television sets, and there are a few rooms with kitchens. There is a heated pool. It is the kind of place that seems to run by itself.

title: The World
description: BELFASTThe balloting in Northern Ireland last week was less spectacular than the bombings in Belfast, less headlinegrabbing than the bombings in London. But it was just as much a part of the Irish war, and about as futile.

title: A LIBERAL FACTION PICKS OWN SLATE
description: In a challenge to the leadership of Alex Rose, a dissident faction of the Liberal party held a convention of its own yesterday and approved its own slate of candidates for Mayor, Controller and City Council President.

title: BUSINESS MOUNTS CONSUMER DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, March 10Big business is mounting a national campaign to improve relations with the man in the street and blunt increasing Federal involvement in consumer affairs.

title: Met Withholds Photos of Vase
description: Officials of the Metropolitan Museum of Art have refused on advice of counsel to turn over to the Federal Bureau of Investigation prerestoration photographs of the Euphronios vase purchased by the museum for about $1million last year.

title: You've Learned to Sing
description: WHEN the New York City Opera was playing its annual fall engagement in Los Angeles last year, Donizetti's Maria Stuarda was one of the works given, and Enrico Di Giuseppe was the tenor. In the audience was Richard Bonelli, one of the Met's first important American baritones, who is now 79 and lives on the West Coast. He had been Di Giuseppe's first teacher at the Curtis Institute in Philadelphia, and he went back to see him after the performance. Well, Enrico, he said, I think you've finally learned to sing.

title: Only the convinced can be persuaded
description: I would like to give Michael Lerner's book an enthusiastic review. Unfortunately, I can't. The New Socialist Revolution is an earnest and serious attempt to relate theory to the practical work of transforming this society, but it fails because it is too narrowly argued, and above all because it does not confront contrary evidence.

title: Miss Johns Hits a High Note
description: I HAVEN'T had a day off for three months, but that's not you fault, is it? Care for a beer? Glynis Johns, looking as warm and as cool as a peppermint stick, was tired but radiantand tired or not, Miss Johns gives off considerable radiation. It was the day after opening night, A Little Night Music was safely in the hitmusical category with a Stack of good reviews, and its leading lady was ready for a good rest and a good party, in that order.

title: Editor Named in Vermont
description: ST. ALBANS, Vt., March 10 (AP)Ronald J. Longto, 36 years old, has been named managing editor of The St. Albans Daily Messenger by Clifton R. Noyes, editor of the Vermont Publishing Corporation.

title: AIR FORCE TO SPEED DOWNEY TO MOTHER
description: WASHINGTON, March 10 (UPI)The State Department said today that as soon as China frees John T. Downey on Monday, an Air Force jet will fly him directly to his ailing mother's bedside.

title: U.S Removes Roadblocks In Wounded Knee Vicinity
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., March 10  Federal guard points outside this occupied village were suddenly pulled back this afternoon, and armored personnel carriers loaded on flatbed trucks rumbled back toward Pine Ridge, 15 miles away.

title: Bridge
description: For the declarer who wishes to solve his problems it is usually sufficient to play the passive part of a Sherlock Holmes, absorbing clues donated by a careless criminal. But occasionally it is necessary to adopt a Perry Mason role, actively pushing circumstances along so that significant clues become available.

title: Notes: Antarctica A la Jacques Cousteau
description: IS there any place left on earth for the traveler who wants to be totally rid of pollution? Antarctica seems to come as close as any last outpost to offering pure air and clean water, but even there the problem of contamination of the environment is beginning to cause concern.

title: They'll Leave You Laughing  and Thinking
description: IF you associate Lily Tomlin with only her LaughIn characters, such as the prunefaced, middleaged Ernestine or the stringyhaired, elfin 5yearold Edith Ann, comes as a surprise that she's conventionally pretty; say, a cross beween Loretta Young and Shirley MacLaine (the former's classy mien, the latter's crinkly eyes). Lily is slender and sassy and 33.

title: Parking Ban for Coop City
description: Starting March 26 alternatesideofthestreet parking will go into effect in Coop City in the Bronx so that the Sanitation Department's mechanical sweepers can clean along curbs, Traffic Commissioner Constantine SidamonEristoff and Sanitation Commissioner Herbert Elish announced yesterday.

title: Patricia E. Burke Becomes a Bride
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., March 10  Miss Patricia Eileen Burke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter T. Burke, was married here this afternoon to Robert Gordon Macionis, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Macionis of Elkin Park, Pa. Msgr. Thomas Moriarty performed the ceremony in the Holy Family Roman Catholic Church.

title: Thoughts out of ChinaI
description: A simple definition of lunacy is inability to perceive the real world, which causes lunatics to live in a totally unreal world. If you accept this definition, however, you are then faced with an unsettling choice. Either the American liberalintellectual community is now lunatic, or Chou Enlai is a lunatic. On the one hand, it is obvious that the currently fashionable liberalintellectual world view totally excludes the possibility of a preventive nuclear attack on China by the Soviet Union. Such harshnesses of history are thought to be utterly impossible  except, perhaps, as results of the wellknown follies of American policy. On the other hand, it is equally obvious that Premier Chou Enlai and the other leaders of China strongly believe in the serious possibility of a Soviet preventive attackwhich would necessarily be a nuclear attack, since China also has nuclear weapons. The felt danger is the mainspring of current Chinese policy, at home as well as abroad. And this fact is an essential key to the understanding all of other both big and little.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IF Bridget Loves Bernie encourages Jews to violate the teachings of their religion as Rabbi Hillel A. Cohen suggests, then I guess The Mary Tyler Moore Show encourages career women to remain unmarried. It's difficult for me to understand, in other words, how a situation comedy which employs outlandish caricatures of not miry Jews but wealthy people ?? Catholics as well, can pose such a threat to Judaism. Even if one accepts the rather implausible assumption that hordes of Jewish males identify with Bernie and therefore look favorably on his relationship with Bridget, how does this pose a threat to the Jewish religion?

title: ROYAL COUNT N. WESTBURY VICTOR
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 10  Royal Count N. successfully challenged highly regarded Myakka Prince tonight, beating him by 1 lengths in the $20,000 secondround race of the Spring Pacing Series at Roosevelt Raceway, The New Zealaridbred import, paced the mile in 2:01, fastest on a halfmile oval this year.

title: Ballet: Green Table
description: Kurt Jooss's The Green Table has proved one of the enduring ballets of the 20th century. It was created more than 40 years ago, and yet its indictment of war remains as hardedged and savage as ever. The City Center Joffrey Ballet brought it back to the City Center 55th Street Theater Thursday night, and its vital energy proved as impressive as ever.

title: Young Socialists Assail Brandt Policy
description: BONN, March 10They call themselves Jusos, an abbreviation for West Germany's Young Socialists. At their annual congress in suburban Bad Godesberg this weekend they are living up to their name: being both young and socialist.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Fair Lawn's Forte Is Organization
description: FAIR LAWNThe growth of this Bergen County community since the end of World War II appears to have been one of the best managed developments in the state. Houses are neatly spaced so that land has been used to the fullest extent, shopping areas are distributed in four sections, industry in one area and community understanding has been maintained. The problems that residents discuss are limited to three subjectsrent control, traffic and an increase in burglaries. But in the main, there are few complaints about the direction taken by local government or by the interest neighbors have in each other.

title: Lindsay
description: Seven years ago, he triumphantly entered City Hall as a fresh new face, a hot political property, the man on the white horse who would smite the municipal dragons plaguing New York and its sister cities around the nation  crime, corruption, middleclass migration, mismanagement and bloated budgets. Last week, John Lindsay bowed to the torments of America's second toughest job and announced that he would not seek a third term.

title: Croton Aqueduct Algae Prompt City to Weigh Water Filtration
description: The Croton aqueduct system, which has supplied New York City with drinking water since before the Civil War, has become so enriched with nutrients and tiny animal life that, for the first time, the city seriously considering the need to filter the water that reaches about a million residents of upper Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: Giant Eye in Suffolk Scans the Sky
description: BOHEMIA, L.I.Imagine an eye that sees across six states and onethird of the North Atlantic at one glance, an ear that simultaneously picks up conversations from Cleveland, Boston and Washington, a voice that can be heard  literally within split second from the Azores to Puerto Rico.

title: CORRECTION
description: In a photograph on Page 82 of last Sunday's New Jersey Section of The New York Times, an inmate at the Rahway State Prison was incorrectly identified as Thomas Trantino. The photograph, above, is of Trantino, who will publish two books of his, writings and drawings this fall.

title: Security Guard at Airport Accused In Bomb Threat
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 10An airport security guard who inspects hand luggage of boarding flight passengers has been charged here with making a false bomb threat to an airline.

title: BOWIE STAKES WON BY SILVER DOCTOR
description: BOWIE, Md., March 10 (AP) Silver Doctor, a candidate for the Triple Crown races, held off the late bid of Big Red L. at Bowie today and captured the $30,000 Prince Georges Stakes by a halflength.

title: Survey Shows Rise In Job Prospects For '73 Graduates
description: WASHINGTON, March 10 Job prospects for college graduates in business and industry are looking up.

title: November Nassau: Unity
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  The Nassau County Republican party, with the assurance of a political organization that has dominated the county for more years than the Nassau Democrats care to admit, named its candidates for county office at a nominating convention in Hempstead last week.

title: MineSafety Penalty System Is Upset
description: WASHINGTON, March 10The system of the United States Bureau of Mines of imposing costly civil penalties on coal mine operators who violate Federal safety standards has been struck down by the United States District Court here.

title: School Funding Viewed As Chaotic and Unjust
description: MEMPHIS, March 10Against a background of mounting public and legal pressure to reform the financing of public schools, a national education group issued a report today portraying the current system in almost all states as char otic and unjust.

title: France and a Matter of Racism
description: PARISRacism, which was pracilcally unknown in France in the eighteenth century, developed during the same period as bourgeois colonization. A colony was forced to sell its agricultural and mineral products to the mother country very cheaply, and to buy manufactured products from it at a high price: this could work only if the colonials were overexploited and paid a wage that tended more and more toward zero. To justify this practice, the ideology of racism was established: the colonials were subhuman and it was acceptable to treat them so. Since 1945, the wars lost in Indochina and Algeria should have opened our eyes: the impoverished and weaponless colonials who have twice defeated us are no more subhuman than we.

title: The Other Prisoners
description: Two young French school teachers, Andr Menras and Jean Pierre Debris, left New York last week to speak in cities across the United States about a matter that stands in sad counterpoint to the return of American prisoners of war from North Vietnam.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, MARCH 11, 1973

title: Church Centers Aid Immigrants
description: When Pietrangelo Masulla and his sons immigrated from Naples to Brooklyn, they found the streets of the New World paved not with gold but with red tape, In September, 1971, Mr. Masulla, a gardener, filed a petition with the United States immigration service to permit his wife and two daughters to enter the country, The process should have taken several weeks. After a year and a half, he is still waiting.

title: LONG BEACH STATE TRIUMPHS BY 8875
description: LOGAN, Utah, March 10 (AP) Long Beach State surrendered a 10 point lead in the first half, but battled back today to defeat Weber State College, 8875, in a firstround National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball playoff game.

title: A heroine that changed, and a family that didn't
description: Marilyn Sachs's thesis that there is no whole truth about any individual, that everyone is a different person to different people, may be valid enough, but as a peg for a story, it presents problems. A reader does, after all, need to discover his own truth about characters in a book indeed, is that not what a book is about? In this case the reader has already reached conclusions about some of the characters, for Mrs. Sachs has written about them before: Veronica Ganz, a hardhitting, oversized, and friendless bully; Mary Rose, her selfcentered, daydreaming sister forever occupied with her boxes of cutout paper jewelry, clothes, hairdos, houses; and Stanley, her little brother.

title: EXG.I. REPORTED TO SUPPORT HANOI
description: CHICAGO, March 10 (AP) The Chicago Tribune said in its Sunday editions that an American soldier, who allegedly defected to the Vietcong in 1968, has been working in North Vietnamese prison camps and preparing propaganda.

title: Knitted Glove, $13.40, Wins By Two Lengths in Oaks
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 10 (AP)Knitted Glove won the $20,000added Fair Grounds Oaks for 3yearold fillies today, running the 1 1/16mile event in 1:46.

title: A Bald Eagle Adopts Oradell
description: ORADELL  During the winter months, sightings of bald eagles are made occasionally on the shores of northern New Jersey's open waterways, but much excitement has been created here by a young eagle that has made its winter home in the heart of this suburban community.

title: Acupuncture in Nevada
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., March 10 (UPI)The president of the Hong Kong Association of Acupuncture has accepted an invitation to demonstrate the ancient Chinese art before Nevada's Senate Committee on Health and Welfare. Committee officials said they had requested the demonstration by Prof. Lok Wyeee Kung because they were considering a comprehensive bill on acupuncture.

title: Bradley's Overtime Goal Gives Raiders 32 Triumph Over Jets at Garden
description: When it all seemed that the Raiders had suffered another defeat at the hands of Bobby Hull and the Winnipeg Jets, suddenly they came alive late in the game at Madison Square Garden yesterday and went on to post their first overtime Victory at home, a 3to2 decision.

title: Arts Center Again Offers Free Shows This Year
description: HOLMDEL  Once Again this year, the generosity of more affluent Jerseyens will allow the Garden State Arts Center to invite hundreds of thousands of the young and the elderly, the blind and the orphaned, as well as disabled veterans to widely diversified programs of free entertainment.

title: GENERAL IN TURKEY IS ONLY CANDIDATE
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 10 With only three days to go until Parliament elects a new President of Turkey, the only candidate in view is the choice of the armed forces, Gen. Faruk Gluier, former chief of the general staff.

title: U. S.Approved Happiness
description: WASHINGTON, March 10  The news is filled with people who know what's good for me.

title: A Fresh Breeze From the Windy City
description: AMERICA, as has often been noted, is a country of symphony orchestrasdespite the everpresent financial crises that beset our musical life, the orchestra continues to be the focal musicmaking institution in hundreds of cities, large and small. And while we have at least six that may rank with any other group in the world today, the Chicago Symphony currently takes pride of place in most people's minds. For those who would care to dispute the point, just try to locate a ticket for the orchestra's New York concertswhen Georg Solti and his musicians come to town, the event can only be compared in prestige and glamour to the opening of starstudded new production at the Metropolitan.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONCongress took further steps last week to reform itself in preparation for a constitutional struggle with President Nixon over war powers, spending authority and secrecy in his Administration.

title: Nixon Back in White House
description: WASHINGTON, March 10 (AP)President Nixon returned to the White House tonight atfter spending two days at his mountaintop retreat, Camp David, getting in some work on ??is continuing series of messages to Congress. The President and Mrs. Nixon flew back to the White House by Hellcopter and arrived at 9:25 P.M.

title: Television
description: THE threehour television special is upon us. A few weeks ago it took the form of Joseph Papp's Shakespeare Festival production of Much Ado About Nothing. This past Thursday it was Abby Mann's The MarcusNelson Murders. And last night Laurence Olivier led a cast of British actors through Eugene O'Neill's Long Day's Journey Into Night.

title: Hilary Gillespie Fiancee Of Hamilton Haddon 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. Kenrick Samson Gillespie of New York and Southampton, L. I., have announced the engagement. of their daughter, Miss Hilary Gillespie, to Hamilton Hadden 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hadden of Jericho, L. I., and Manchester, Vt. The wedding is planned for June.

title: A Correction
description: Due to a typographical error in yesterday's editorial Housing Paradox, President Nixon was incorrectly quoted as referring to 533 old and wasteful programs instead of The old and wasteful programs. Editor, The Times.

title: Camera World
description: CLASSES and workshops for intermediate and advanced students, and a basic class in photography for beginners will be conducted by David Ehrenpreis and Frank Giraldi in their studio at 145 East 49th Street. The beginners or basic course will start this Wednesday evening and will run for four weeks. It will cost $58 and will be limited to five students. The intermediate and basic program is designed for those with specific problems and it will run for eight weeks, with participants meeting on Wednesday evenings by appointment. This program will cost $95. Those interested call (212) 9803735 for more information.

title: Report of Cut in U.S. Forces Stirs Economic Fears Near Taiwan Airbase
description: TAICHUNG, Taiwan  The Grand Ole Opry House, Le Restaurant, Jack Wang's auto dealership, a collection of drinking spots known as Bartown and dozens of other establishments catering to GI's are clustered along the twolane highway running 15 miles from the city of Taichung to Ching Chuan Kang Air Base, called C.C.K. for short.

title: Long Beach Proposes Moratorium On Building By ALICE MURRAY
description: LONG BEACH, L. I.The City Council proposed a moratorium last week on all building here to provide time to shore up crumbling municipal services. Some property owners applauded but others said the proposal would place a further stigma on the city and hobble future property development.

title: CHINA ASKS STEPS ON GRAIN OUTPUT
description: HONG KONG, March 10China is engaged in a campaign to prevent a recurrence of last year's drop in grain production, which was attributed to floods, drought and other natural disasters.

title: Pro Musica
description: The New York Pro Musica is only 20 years old, but its influence has been enormous. It is not our only ensemble devoted to the cause of medieval and Renaissance music, but not long after its founding by the late Noah Greenberg it became a prestigious symbol of the movement in the eyes of the publics and it has retained that distinction ever since: Creative programing and virtuosic performance have kept it vital through changes of personnel and leadership and even through organizational crises that have erupted since thedeath of Mr. Greenberg.

title: Wedding in Autumn For Wendy Bloom
description: FREEPORT, L. J., March 10 Mr. and Mrs. Joseph J. Bloom have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Wendy Bloom, to Dr. Steven Benjamin of Boston. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Benjamin of New Haven and New York. A wedding in the autumn is planned.

title: Dance
THE PAULINE LINE GAINS IN VATICAN
description: ROME, March 10The consensus in the Vatican is that the Pauline line has been considerably strengthened, this week as Pope Paul VI installed 30 new Cardinals, announced a reform of the papal election system and shuffled top administrators of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Payday Doesn't Shortchange You
description: PAYDAY is a brilliant, nasty little chromeplated razor blade of a movie superficially about the last 36 hours in the life of a countrywestern singer. On a deeper level, it is a film about certain forms of American striving and desperation, a road picture that is not, for once, a sentimental odyssey, but rather a cleareyed study of people whose lives are linked to the road, how they behave and what becomes of them. Its clarity is what makes it so extraordinary. It is a work of such, deadhonest realism that it is hard to know how, except as a kind of literal truth, to take it.

title: Letters
description: Superamateurs

title: The World
description: SANTIAGOA day after the official results of last Sunday's legislative elections were announced, former President Eduardo Frei, the de facto leader of the opposition to the incumbent Marxist Government, complained that if the opposition in any other country had scored a clear majority, the entire world would have been astonished at its triumph.

title: Greek Food Abounds In a Store In Irvington
description: IRVINGTONWhen Steve Diamandas became despondent over the poor quality of pastry that Greek bakeries were delivering to his specialty shop here, he turned to his motherinlaw for help. She had just the solution: Why not let her do the baking?

title: Farrell Takes S.I. Track; Daley, Ryan, Walsh Win
description: Monsignor Farrell High School posted four victories at Port Richmond Field yesterday to capture its sixth straight Staten Island winter track championship. Farrell tallied 262 points on a scoring system that gave joints to the first 10 in each events. New Dorp, led by a meet record high jump victory at 6 feet 6 inches by Bill Jankunis, was second with 141. St. Peter's (120) and Wagner (105) followed.

title: Marquette, Austin Peay Gain in N.C.A.A. Mideast
description: DAYTON, Ohio, March 10 (AP)  Maurice Lucas and George Frazier picked up the slack when Larry McNeil fouled out with more than 10 minutes remaining tonight and led sixthranked Marquette to 7762 victory over Miami of Ohio in the first round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Mideast Regional basketball tournament.

title: DON M'LEAN SINGS PLEASING CONCERT
description: Don McLean, the folk singer who filled Carnegie Hall on Thursday evening, is the kind of artist who gives such pleasure to his fans that you hate to knock him too hard. And really there's no need to: Mr. McLean does what he does very well indeed. He sings sweetly in an easy light tenor, plays the guitar and banjo pretty well and has a kind of boyish, bashful handsomeness.

title: Flood Control: Troubled History of the Passaic River Plan
description: WAYNE  For 37 years, the Federal Government has realized officially that the Passaic River often floods its basin after heavy storms.

title: Colorado Rallies to Retain N.C.A.A. Ski Crown
description: HANCOCK, Vt., March 10The University of Colorado ?? tained its National Collegiate Athletic Association skiing crown today by placing three of its jumpersall Norwegian among the first four finishers.

title: Blues Singer Honored
description: MEMPHIS, March 10 (UPI)George Lewis, a blues singer who once played a guitar in W. C. Handy's band, became a Tennessee Colonel on his 80th birthday. The colonel's commission from Gov. Winfield Dunn was presented to Mr. Lewis Tuesday at a birthday party.

title: 2 Panels Press Ethics Reforms
description: TRENTON  The chairman of a key legislative study commission said late last week that he would seek swift legislative approval of a series of broad reforms aimed at ending the widespread corruption that has plagued the state for the last several years.

title: Philadelphia Pairs Defeat New York in Court Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 10 Philadelphia defeated New York, 32, in the intercity court tennis doubles matches today at the Racquet Club.

title: The World
description: ATHENS  The issue as posed by the Holy Synod of the Greek Orthodox Church of Cyprus was religious: Was Archbishop Makarios violating canon law by holding public office as President? Yes, said the synod last week, ordering the archbishop unfrocked.

title: Austrians Sweep Downhill In European Skiing Event
description: ZELL AM SEE, Austria, March 10 (AP)Werner Grissmann sped through the 18 gates of the 2,670  meter Mount Schmittenhoehe men's downhill ski course today in 1 minute 51,96 seconds to lead Austria to a sweep in a race counting toward the European Cup.

title: Solutions Elude Coast Hearings on Curbing Auto. Emissions
description: LOS ANGELES, March 10 A week of Federal hearings has failed to elicit any solutions for the Los Angeles area's smog problem  or guidance for the 36 cities that will have to produce their own transportation control strategies within the next five weeks to comply with Federal law.

title: Curbs Urged to Protect Lake Montauk
description: MONTAUK, L. I.If Dr. Herbert M. Austin, a researcher at the New York Ocean Science Laboratory here had his way, boating and building activities on and around Lake Montauk would be severely limited to protect the area's status as the only piece of Eastern coastline between northern Maine and the Chesapeake Bay unmodified or unchanged by man.

title: Yale Bowl and Palmer Stadium Are Not What They Used to Be
description: When the Yale Bowl opened in 1914, it was acclaimed as one of the nation's greatest architectural and engineering accomplishments, the largest athletic facility in the United States. Nothing much has happened to it since then and its seating capacity, 70,084, has been exceeded many times elsewhere.

title: Charlotte, N. C., Schools Impose Tight Security in Racial Fights
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., March 10A martial law atmosphere has been imposed in schools in Charlotte and Mecklenburg County by an administration disappointed in its hope black and white students had that recurrent outbursts of racial violence would end once la chance to get to know one another.

title: Artists Talk About Their Art
description: You are never diminished multilated or impeached, said Violette Verdy, a principal dancer with the New York City Ballet. When you perform in a ballet, at least for George Balanchine, you are forced to feel like a creator. He gives you a meeting point in the work and you are invited to come to the rendezvous with all you have and all you are.

title: Robin S. Stern Engaged
description: GARDEN CITY, LI., March 10Mr. and Mrs. David Stern have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Robin Sue Stern, to Eli Uncyk, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Uncyk of Brooklyn.

title: Laura Blank Wed To Steven Simkin
description: Miss Laura Jane Blank and Steven Simkin, both of whom expect to receive law degrees in May from the University of Pennsylvania, were married here last evening at the Pierre. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Jerome Davidson of Temple BethEl of Great Neck, L. I.

title: Syracuse Beats Furman In East Regional, 8382
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 10 (AP)Jim Lee sank two free throws in the final minutes as Syracuse held off it late Furman rally for a 8382 victory in a National Collegiate Eastern Regional firstround game tonight.

title: School Board Will Modernize Operation of Its Headquarters
description: The city's Board of Education has approved a major reorganization of its headquarters structurenow regarded as illogical and uncoordinated by some observersin a move to bring central operations in line with the needs of the decentralized school system.

title: Dedicated To Collage
description: THE German artist Kurt Schwitters did not invent the artform on which his reputation is based. But he was one of those modernist artists who managed to take over an earlier innovationin this ease, Cubist collageand so dedicate himself to its practice that his art is synonymous with the collage medium.

title: Victory Gardens Expanding
description: VICTORY GARDENSThis tiny community, which faces an uncertain future, is engaged in its biggest expansion ever, the development of Carmel Gardens, a 184unit gardenapartment complex on 12.4 acres of land.

title: One of the longest, most difficult, most ambitious American novels in years
description: In America in the late 1950's and early 1960's there appeared a series of comic apocalyptic novels organized around picaresque antiheroes or schlemiels and filled with what came to be called black humor. Writers like Joseph Heller (Catch22), John Barth (The SotWeed Factor), Bruce Jay Friedman (Stern) and Kurt Vonnegut Jr. (Cat's Cradle, Mother Night) became celebrities of sorts, cult figures. In 1963 Thomas Pynchon's first novel V. was greeted with enthusiasm: Stanley Edgar Byman immediately identified it with Catch22 and Stern and called it powerful, ambitious, full of gusto, and overflowing with rich comic invention. Three years later came Pynchon's second novel, The Crying of Lot 49, as short and swift as V. was long; it too received high praise.

title: Princeton Gallery Gets Frontier Art
description: PRINCETONThe Squibb Gallery, from today through Friday, will be displaying the Gund Collection of 71 paintings, drawings and sculptures by 23 artists who helped to immortalize the Old West.

title: PENN STATE STARS TAKE 5 GYM TITLES
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 10 (AP)Marshall Avener and Jim Kruest of Penn State domi nated the Eastern Intercollegiate Gymnastics League individual championships today at Temple University.

title: Miss Lucy Stephens Lyden Married to Robert Anderson
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., March 10  Miss Lucy Stephens Lyden, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John M. Lyden, was married here this afternoon to Robert Stephen Anderson, son of Mrs. Nils A. C. Anderson of West Hartford and the late Dr. Anderson.

title: Jingle Writer Pens Cantata
description: PARK RIDGEThe creative mind that has been producing rock jingles for the last nine years for commercials has also been concerned with the New Testament for the last three of those years.

title: Utah State Appoints Coach
description: LOGAN, Utah, March 10 (UPI) Gordon (Dutch) Belnap was named head basketball coach at Utah State University today.

title: He rose to find his costume had become the sky
description: Opening this picture book, we see a child sleeping in bed while a huge and symbolic Harlequinhis costume spangled with starslooms in the window. On the next page, the Harlequin has disappeared and his costume has become the sky. Then the child rises, walks to the window to gaze at the sparkling heavens, and we learn that he is Harlequinthe traditional acrobatic figure of French and Italian comedy. It is a stunning opening to a stunning book, and if there are faults to be found with it, they are definitely minor.

title: Barker Only Seeded Player To Lose in Eastern Tennis
description: Except for Robert Barker, all the seeded players advanced in yesterday's round of the Eastern indoor tennis tournament for men at the Stadium Tennis Center in the Bronx.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Science fiction and the detective story: they have not mixed very well to date, though there have been many attempts to fuse the two. One of the most recent is THE FELLOWSHIP OF THE HAND by Edward D. Hoch (Walker, $5.95). He puts the action into the America of the 21st century: computer technology, irregularities in the voting machine; a group fighting the machine civilization; agents called in; mysterious industrialists; lots of action. The ingredients are all right; the execution is abominable. Hoch writes as though his audience consists exclusively of juveniles, is disorganized in his plotting, and has ended up with a book that cannot be read with pleasure on level.

title: Arrest of Black Civic Leader Arouses Princeton
description: PRINCETON  A confrontation between the state police and a young black civic leader late last month has stirred this quiet university community into a flurry of protests.

title: Music Mailbag
description: DONAL HENAHAN'S review of the recordings of Shostakovich's 15th Symphony contains every canard and clich of what has passed in this country for Shostakovich criticism for the past 30 years  a kind of Socialist Realism in reverse.

title: Texans Will Vote Tuesday On $1.6Billion Canal Plan
description: FORT WORTH, March 10 The fate of a controversial $1.6billion canal proposed on the 384 miles of the Trinity River between DallasFort Worth and Houston will be decided Tuesday by voters in 17 Texas counties.

title: A Widower Sues for Benefits
description: EDISONA woman lawyer from New York and the Women's Rights Project of the American Civil Liberties Union in Newark have joined forces in an attempt to obtain Social Security benefits for a widowed father.

title: Music
description: DA CAPO PRESS, that industrious and important reprint house, has just come out with a series of reprints of American music of the 19th century. This is a field pretty much overlooked by musicologists, and completely overlooked by performing groups and solo musicians. Thus it was with a great deal of interest that I leafed through such oncefamous scores as Horatio Parker's Flora Novissima, George Chadwick's Judith and John Knowles Paine's Symphony No. 1. The series also contains MacDowell songs and piano pieces, a reprint of the Sankey hymns and other such material.

title: The Santa Maria, Sunk 500 Years, Still Obsesses A Devoted Few
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 17, 1972Fred Dickson, who spent the last five years seeking the wreck of Colwnbus's flagship, the Santa Maria, died yesterday during a diving expedition off the coast of Haiti, associates reported here. A spokesman at the Santa Maria Foundation, which Mr. Dickson headed, said he died ... while diving off CapHatien near where historians believe the Santa Maria sank on Christmas Day, 1492, during Columbus's first voyage to the New World.

title: In Washington, the Winners and the Losers Go Separate Ways
description: WASHINGTON, March 10 The contrast was too much to miss between the winners and the losers.

title: POLICE RADIO CAR SHOT AT IN BRONX
description: Three shots were fired last night at a police radio car on patrol in the Hunts Point section of the Bronx, and a 32yearold man was arrested after a struggle.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Many of those who decry business performance and attack business today in the name of consumerism, and other popular causes, assert that business is not to be trusted and that protection of the public interest and consumer rights requires that government set higher and more detailed standards and regulate business more rigorously.

title: Morrison Takes Chattanooga Like Grant Took Richmond
description: When Joe Morrison, the exNew York Giant running back, called his first spring practice session at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga last week, a number of curious townspeople left their jobs early to watch. They wanted a close look at this pro football celebrity who had come to cure a sick football program.

title: Suffern Mayor Stepping Down
description: SUFFERNJames P. Rice will step down as Mayor of this Rockland County village at the end of the month after 16 years and four heart attacks.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER FIRST DIVISION
description: Bayern Munich 3, Einiracht Frankfurt 1.

title: Electral but not electrifying
description: Harry Mark Petrakis is so sincere a writer it's hard to tell how honest he is. The subject of In the Land of Morning is grim, or at least glum, but its treatment is mechanical; its attitudes are earthy but their expression literary; its solemnity is musclebound with clichs, and seems to move with the stamping waddle of a sciencefiction movie monster. Thus, when Alex Rifakis returns from Vietnam to his Greek community in Chicago and kisses his mother hello: Engulfed in her embrace he felt the immensity of her strength, a strength equal to that of a strong man, holding him locked in a vise, his flesh and bones groaning. He felt her breasts, the nipples big and hard as thumbs [she is fully clothed, by the way], the muscles under the slight ripple of fat across her belly, the mound at her loins. When she finally released him, the mask of composure had returned to her cheeks.

title: 2 Share Singapore Lead
description: SINGAPORE, March 10 (AP) Ben Arda of The Philippines, with a oneoverpar 72 in the rain, and Britain's Norman Wood, with 71, shared a onestroke lead at 211 after three rounds of the Singapore open golf championship today.

title: Williams College Names President
description: Dr. John W. Chandler, the president of Hamilton College, was named yesterday to succeed Dr. John E. Sawyer as the president of Williams College at the end of the current academic year.

title: Mediate Captures Sprint At Lincoln and Pays $8.80
description: LINCOLN, R I., March 10 (AP)Mediate fought a stretch duel with two other horses today and won the $7,500 Roger Williams Handicap at Lincoln Downs.

title: 14th Art Show Opens in Union
description: UNIONThe 14th Annual Art Exhibition and Sale at the Y.M.Y.W.H.A. will take place here through Wednesday.

title: GladHanding Foreign Investors
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For many years now, foreign countries have eagerly sought capital investments by United States industrial corporations. Countries like Northern Ireland, the Dominican Republic and Nigeria have extolled their attractions in countless newspaper advertising supplements. American companies have been offered tax advantages and various other concessions to situate their plants abroad.

title: Canarsie Boycott Of Schools May Spread
description: The specter of a wider school boycott that could affect other sections of Brooklyn, perhaps even other boroughs, loomed last week as white Canarsie parents continued to keep their children out of school in the latest protest against the busing of black children from nearby Brownsville.

title: Bill in Rhode Island Calls For Names on Editorials
description: PROVIDENCE, March 10 (AP) The Rhode Island House has approved a bill that would require all editorials in newspapers and periodicals published in the state to carry the name of the writer.

title: Fire Kills Grocer As He Sleeps In To Protect Store
description: The 63yearold owner of a Bronx grocery store who decided to sleep inside to protect it from robbers was killed early yesterday when a threealarm fire swept the store and several others at 880 Westchester Avenue.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: INQUIRY ON MIAMI HALTED BY A SUIT
description: MIAMI, March 10An inquiry into alleged corruption in Dade County's courts and local government has been halted, at least temporarily, by a legal action in Tallahassee.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Should even so poor a book as Donald Weeks's Corvo fall into the hands or so slovenly and irresponsible a reviewer as Philippe Jullian? Herewith a partial list of his errors and absurdities.

title: N.C. STATE TAKES CONFERENCE TITLE
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 10 (AP)David Thompson delivered two free throws with nine seconds to play, clinching unbeaten North Carolina State's 27th victory, 7674, over the Atlantic Coast Conference basketball tournament tonight.

title: Drug Crackdown in Bahrain
description: BAHRAIN, March 10 (AP)The official Gazette of this Persian Gulf state has reported a crackdown on illegal drugs, with possible prison terms ranging up to 10 years.

title: the traveler's world
description: JENSEN BEACH, FLA.The Family Camping Federation, now three years old, held its first two annual conventions in Chicago's Palmer House but for its third congress it chose to meet at a Florida campground. More than 500 men and women representing, through their organizations, roughly 50million people in about 13 million camping families, gathered here at the Nettles Island recreational vehicle resoft to applaud the fastest growing industry in America  recreational camping. Most of the delegates stayed in motor homes and trailers, a few in the adjacent Sheraton ?? Small meetings were held in the resort's bright new recreation hall; the luncheon and dinner sessions were conducted in a blue and white tent suitable for a onering circus or a revival meeting.

title: Steffi Fields Plans Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. John I. Fields of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Steffi Fields, to Paul Callan, son of Dr. James Callan of Auckland, New Zealand, and the late Mrs. Callan. A June wedding is planned.

title: The Turn
description: March rain can be as miserable as any rain that falls, but it is better than March snow, which has to be plowed and shoveled. It seems wetter and colder than any rain should feel; but that probably is because by now our weather nerves are right up at the surface. We want spring fever, not the shivers.

title: Controllers' Moment of Truth
description: BOHEMIA, L. I.The rapidity with which a traffic picture can change at MacArthur Airport here was illustrated recently, as the quiescent radarscope suddenly came life with three, five and then six pinpoints of light.

title: Eggs, Still a Big Food Bargain, Lead Meats in Price Rise Here
description: Eggs, stilldespite their price the biggest bargain on the food list, led seven meat cuts in a new price advance last week and market analysts said they feared that the day was coming soon when eggs would no longer be widely available as a substitute for highpriced meat.

title: Victors Build Early Lead; Archibald Is Limited to 25
description: After polishing off the Kansas CityOmaha Kings with consummate ease, 125102, last night at Madison Square Garden, the Knicks will play the Boston Celtics this afternoon in a nationally televised game at Boston.

title: Allan M. Benton Plans to Marry Helen Heard, Miss Ann Hall Freiberg in May A Legal Aide,
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 10Dr. and Mrs. Albert Daniel Freiberg have announced the engagement, of their daughter, Miss Ann Hall Freiberg, to Allan Morton Benton of New York. He is a son of Mrs. Middleton Lee Perry Jr. of Shawnee Mission, Kan., and the late Kenneth Hiram Benton.

title: Brooklyn College Five Beats Adelphi in Met Final, 7054
description: Brooklyn College scored 7054 victory over Adelphi University last night to win Eastern College Athletic Conference Metropolitan Regional basketball tournament.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: In the Feb. 25 article on the new president of Bell Laboratories, Dr. William O. Baker, he is quoted as having said: For all the gorgeous glory of a Rembrandt, nobody has ever eaten one. I find this remark both amusing and disconcerting.

title: The Aesthetics Of Freud
description: Jack J. Spector, chairman of the department of art history at Rutgers University, has written an exceptionally thorough and absorbing account of Freud's ideas about art and artists. The study is organized in three parts. The first, a discussion of the genesis of Freud's attitudes toward art and literature, examines the role his experiences in 19thcentury Vienna played in formulating his theories.

title: New & Novel
description: You can't beat an outpost as the locus for an adventure novel. And this outpost is clearly a winner. (Or a loser, as the quintessential outpost has got to be.) The Fortress is a porous bastion in German West Africa, circa 1914. The resident colonial administrator is Werner, an aging civil servant with a young, restive wife.

title: Chess: Tal Roaring Along, Heading For a Collision With Fischer
description: Mikhail Tal, who roared through 1972 winning everything in sight, has moved into 1973 without missing a step. He recently mauled the field for still another first prize, this one in the Beverwijk International Tournament.

title: Weeds
description: If there could be such a thing as a 21gun salute for a novel fortuitously rescued from a 50year oblivion, Weeds richly merits it, for Edith Summers Kelley's book is unquestionably a major work of American fiction. A story of life among the poor tobacco farmers of Kentucky about 60 years ago, it is remarkable for its compassionate realism, its narrative pace, its sensitive evocation of character and for its sure literary craftsmanship.

title: Miss Kelley Is Betrothed
description: ARDMORE, Pa., March 10  Miss Marianna Frances Kelley plans to be married here in May to Kevin E. Sullivan, who is with the investment management division of the Chemical Bank in New York. Mrs. Francis H. Kelley has announced the engagement of her daughter to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund B. Sullivan of Rumson, N.J.

title: REPORTERS' OPERA LAMPOONS OFFICIALS
description: ALBANY, March 10 (AP)With shameless puns and parodies, the Legislative Correspondents Association lampooned state politicians tonight in a gridiron show that borrowed from grand opera and The Godfather movie.

title: West Morris High Wrestler Is Victor in Jersey Meet
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 10 Greg Cholish of West Morris High School was named today the outstanding wrestler in the New Jersey high school tournament, capturing the 123pound division title before a crowd of 8,000 in Jadwin Gymnasium. Cholish decisioned Glen Geurin of Randolph High, 104, in the final round of the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association championship.

title: 3 R's of Short Selling: Risk, Respectability, Rules
description: During the jagged stock market decline of recent months, many people missed a good bet. They might have profited handsomely by selling stocks short, rather than buying stocks or resting with their portfolios immobile.

title: Mexico, Venezuela Tie, 11, In Davis Cup Competition
description: MEXICO CITY, March 10 (AP)  Mexico and Venezuela were tied, 11, today after splitting singles matches in the first day of competition of their Davis Cup elimination playoffs.

title: State Seeks 22 to Set Up Bicentennial Celebration
description: TRENTON  Governor Cahill began the search last week for 10 citizen members for the 22member New Jersey Bicentennial Celebration Commission.

title: REPORTERS TWIT U.S. POLITICIANS
description: WASHINGTON, March 10 (UPI)A group of 50 Washington newspaper correspondents poked fun at everything from Democratic disunity to Republican royalty tonight in the annual musical revue of the Gridiron Club.

title: They're Sniping at Galbraith Again
description: Possibly because he is so visible, John Kenneth Galbraith, the 64yearold, 6foot8inch celebrity economist, Harvard Professor and bestselling author is fair game for marksmen from his own learned profession.

title: ODE TO A GRECIAN URN
description: Thou krater by the Hoving eye transfixed

title: STATES ON MOVE
description: Legislatures in more than half the states are considering a reinstitution of the death penalty.

title: GIANT SLALOM TITLE WON BY DARTMOUTH
description: JACKSON, N.H., March 10 (AP)Robert Singer of Dartmouth turned in the best combined time in the giant slalom and the Big Green led the 11 teams in the standing today in the National Intercollegiate Alpine tournament at Wildcat Mountain.

title: MORTON INSISTS U.S. WON'T YIELD
description: WASHINGTON, March 10secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton said today that the Government would not how to threats by militant Indians out would continue to provide a ladder of Federal programs and opportunities on which the Indian can climb out of the bottom of the social barrel.

title: Squires Defeat Rockets As Erving Stars, 106103
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 10 (UPI)Julius Erving scored 38 points, grabbed 12 rebounds and blocked three shots to pace the Virginia Squires to a 106103 victory over the Denver Rockets today.Ralph Simpson led Denver with 32 points.

title: SHOP TALK
description: HACKENSACK  Something inside Anitra Michaels's bridal shop makes women happy. When they leave, they're smiling  even the ones who weren't smiling when they went in.

title: WILL ROLAND DEAD; GODFREY PRODUCER
description: Will Roland, producer and director of Arthur Godfrey's morning show for the Columbia Broadcasting System from 1946 to 1958 and since then assistant director of the London office of National Broadcasting Company International, died yesterday of a heart attack in London. His age was 63.

title: Tapes Aid Firemen in Bergen
description: LITTLE FERRYIn an effort to make firefighting safer for its 60member volunteer department, this Bergen County community has instituted a procedure that is new to the state and, possibly, the nation.

title: GIVES DRUG PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 10President Nixon called on Congress today to restore the death penalty for certain Federal crimes and to enact a. new program of stringent minimum jail sentences for heroin pushers.

title: Lawyer to Marry Miss Krulwich
description: The engagment of Miss Terry Ann Krulwich, assistant professor of biochemistry at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, to S. Paul Posner has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Lester S. Krulwich of New York, parents of the future bride. Her fianc, an associate professor at the New York University School, of Law, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Posner, also of New York.

title: Montego Bay Sail Starts Today
description: MIAMI, March 10  The prerace controversy ends and the sailing begins at noon tomorrow for the Class C fleet in the 811mile biennial MiamiMontego Bay (Jamaica) yacht race.

title: Cheating in Pike's Seance Is Alleged
description: Biographers of the late Rev. Arthur A. Ford, the medium, say they have found evidence that he cheated in the celebrated 1967 television sance in which the late Right Rev. James A. Pike, resigned Episcopal Bishop of California, believed he had communicated with his dead son. Nevertheless, they conclude that Mr. Ford was a gifted psychic.

title: Step to Contain Oil Spills
description: LONDON, March 10 (UPI)British Petroleum Company announced yesterday that it had developed the first practical system for containing and recovering oil spills under open sea conditions. The system uses a speciallydesigned boom that prevents spilled oil from spreading over the sea. Once contained, the Vikoma seaskimmer picks up tile oil on rotating discs and pumps it to a container.

title: POLICE WILL OPEN NEW HOME IN FALL
description: In a day of what promises to be unusual ceremony, Mayor Lindsay will formally open the city's new Police Headquarters in the fall.

title: G.O.P. Eyes Suffolk: Anger
description: BLUE POINT, L. LSuffolk County Democrats very nearly accomplished with one telephone call last week what they have been seeking to accomplish for the last 50 yearsto split the solid front that is the real power of the Suffolk Republican party.

title: Choosing Up Sides
description: The evolution of the Democrats and Republicans into clearly opposed liberal and conservative parties still has some distance to go but the drift of events in that direction is unmistakable. The recent decision of Representative Donald W. Riegle Jr., a fourterm Michigan Republican, to cross the aisle in the House of Representatives to join the Democrats and the widely expected move by former Gov. John B. Connally of Texas into the Republican party are the latest evidence.

title: Mice once came from unwashed laundry
description: Time is long past when anybody could be equally at home in all branches of science. A scientist is perforce a specialist, because scientific knowledge has grown far beyond the capacity of even the most brilliant and retentive mind to absorb it. A specialist has his field of vision more and more restricted the narrower his field of specialization. He is often accused of knowing more and more about less and less. It is more accurate to say that he masters smaller and smaller fractions of the total store of knowledge in order to contribute to the growth of this total.

title: D. N. Kaye Fiance Of Judith L. Teller
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 10 Mr. and Mrs. Oscar B. Teller 2d have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Linda Teller, to David Niles Kaye, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Kaye of New York.

title: Knicks Crush Kings, 125102; Rangers Score Over Penguins
description: PITTSBURGH, March 10 Ed Giacomin thwarted Ron Schock's penalty shot that would have tied the score midway through the final period tonight and the Rangers held on for a 54 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins before 13,100 fans.

title: Beer Sales Proposal Promotes Home Foam
description: To save the city's oncethriving brewing industry from extinction, City Coun cilmen Matthew. J. Troy Jr. of Queens and Fred Richmond of Brooklyn have prepared legislation that is aimed at discouraging the drinking of outoftown beers.

title: Kekich Is Calm in Yankee Debut
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. March 10Mike Kekich made his first appearance on the mound in an exhibition game today and emerged slightly damaged physically and unruffled emotionally.

title: GARDEN/HOME GETTING STARTED
description: THOSE who toil in the soil start to become impatient about this time of year. The first mild day or two in a row brings on urges of spading, raking and digging. But not yet! For the next day that follows may he a plummeter to 10 degrees or so. But spring always follows winter and the planting will soon begin.

title: IndiaPakistan Exchange
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 10Two hundred and fiftythree crewmen and passengers of Pakistani boats and 79 crewmen and passengers of Indian boats were exchanged today at the Wagah border checkpost near Lahore under the auspices of the International Red Cross. The 332 had been taken as prisoners in the December, 1971, war.

title: PUBLICSCHOOL PLAN RESISTED ON TAIWAN
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 10A Government plan to incorporate all private primary and junior high schools into the public educational system next fall has set off heated public debate in recent weeks.

title: Gas Supply Periled By S.I. Tank Blast
description: Next winter's, gas supply in the metropolitan area may be critically short as a direct re sult of last month's explosion of a liquefied, natural gas tank on Staten Island.

title: Eventually she got the message
description: Lou AndreasSalom was a woman famous for the men she knew. The formidable roster of her acquaintances included most of the Central European luminaries of her generation (she was born in 1861), among them Arthur Schnitzler, Ferdinand Tunnies, Gerhart Hauptmann, Frank Wedekind and Martin Buber. The three most notable men in her life, however, were Friedrich Nietzsche, who reputedly proposed to her; Rainer Maria Rilke, who became her lover; and Sigmund Freud, to whose teachings she attached herself from 1911 to her death in 1937.

title: Pistons Defeat Suns
description: PHOENIX, March 10 (UPI)Tre Detroit Pistons fought back from a 10point halftime deficit tonight to defeat the Phoenix Suns, 117110. Bob Lanier led the Pistons with 27 points, including 11 in the third quarter and 19 in the second half. His teammate, Dave Bing, got 16 of his 24 points in the final half.

title: Berner High's Meyer Runs 60 In 6.1 Seconds for U.S. Record
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. March 10 Dave Meyer of Berner High School broke the national interscholastic flatfloor record for the 60yard dash today in the Nassau County indoor track championships at Hofstra University.

title: 8Year Battle for Middlesex Park Still Raging
description: EAST BRUNSWICKEight years ago, Rose Sakel began a fight to save a 1,700acre tract of land for a Middlesex County Park. She fought a tenacious, quiet battle to preserve the land, which lies in East Brunswick, Monroe, Spotswood and Helmetta. Her weapons were gentle persuasion, reason, and sometimes, feminine wiles.

title: Flower Shows This Week
description: THE Philadelphia Flower Show will open today and continue at the Philadelphia Civic Center until next Sunday. Sponsored by the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society, it is the largest horticultural presentation on the East Coast covering more than three acres.

title: Religion
description: Religious passion is as much a part of life, in the Syrian city of Horns as the Levantine sun and the smell of dust.

title: SOME ARABS STAY IN FRENCH ORBIT
description: TUNIS, March 2  More than 10 years after the independence of Algeria and almost 17 years after the independence of Morocco and Tunisia, these former French territories are still unable to affirm completely their Arab identity and character.

title: 5 Killed and Scores Injured in Texas Tornadoes
description: Tornadoes and heavy rain roared through Texas yesterday, killing five persons, injuring at least 141, and damaging or destroying hundreds of homes in eight cities and towns.

title: RELIGIOUS GROUPS USE PROXY POWER
description: Major Protestant denominations and other religious groups have submitted resolutions on social issues that are due to appear on the proxy statements of more than 20 major American corporations this spring.

title: Catholic America
description: America was never Catholic, despite the apostolic visions of the first missionaries and the hopes of the later convertseekers. But there certainly was until very recently something identifiable as Catholic America: a people, places, practiees, beliefs, a culturea counterculture in fact. For a very long time Catholicism provided the chief cultural alternative to Protestant and secular America.

title: Paperbacks
description: THE BUSHWACKED PIANO, by Thomas McGuane. (Warner, 95 cents.) A young man at large in a brilliant, hardedge American landscape: a caustic contemporary picaresque, a virtuoso performance.

title: Sets Wedding
description: SEWICKLEY, Pa., March 10Mr. and Mrs. Drayton Heard Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Helen Hall Heard, to Edwin Sherin Hetherington, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Fenton Hetherington Jr. Both families are from Sewickley. The wedding is planned for Aug. 11 here.

title: A Republican F.B.I.?
description: In his first statement, after appointment as acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation last May, L. Patrick Gray 3d said President Nixon had instructed him to operate the F.B.I. in a totally nonpolitical way. Not long after that virtuous declaration Mr. Gray delivered speeches which could only have had the effect of supporting Mr. Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Ruth Ann McNamara Is a Bride
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., March 10Miss Ruth Ann McNamara, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. McNamara of Merion Station, was married here this morning in St. Thomas of Villanova Roman Catholic Church to Sean Ryder Driscoll, son of Mrs. Catherine Ridder Driscoll of Pelham, N. Y., and John R. Driscoll of Redding, Conn. The Rev. Robert J. Welsh, president of the Washington (D.C.) Theological Coalition and former president of Villanova University, performed the ceremony.

title: POMPIDOU WARNS OF PERIL IF LEFT WINS VOTE TODAY
description: PARIS, March 10President Pompidou told French voters today that they would be making a simple choice in tomorrow's final Assembly elections between Marxist Communism and its assured allies, and all the others.

title: News of the Rialto
description: MICHAEL KAHN is on his way to becoming the most enduring artistic director of the American Shakespeare Festival in Stratford, Conn. No mean achievement, considering the previous mortality rate for artistic directors on the banks of the Housatonic or, for that matter, the life expectancy of artistic directors in general. Kahn took over the reins in 1969, at one of the lowest points of the festival's existence, and now, with a new twoyear contract in his pocket, he is industriously plotting his course for the approaching season, which starts June 12 with Measure for Measure.

title: Miss Kathryn Yuan Du Married
description: NORWOOD, Pa., March 10 Miss Kathryn Yuan Du and Dr. Lester Asa Hart were married here this afternoon in the Immanuel Lutheran Church by the Rev. Robert Nagle.

title: Seminary Adopts Freer LifeStyle
description: DARLINGTONLife used to be regimented and structured here, getting up at 6:30 in the morning and fights out and in bed by 10:15. But now we have the mentor program and it comes down to basic honesty with yourself and mentor.

title: Miss Somerville to Wed
description: SHELDON, Ill., March 10Mr. and Mrs. George W. Somerville, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carolyn Patricia Somerville, to William Lee. Fisher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Fisher of New York and Northport, L.I.

title: BONN WILL SET UP ANTITERROR UNIT
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, March 8West Germany's security authorities are in the process of establishing a special antiterrorist department to counteract foreign and domestic political militants suspected of plotting violence.

title: Stamps
description: AUSTRALIA is on the last kilometer toward a metric system of measurements, and has issued this month an ingenious set of four stamps to ease the change from the imperial system of weights and measures to grams, kilos and meters.

title: Pornographic Shows Spread in Midwest
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 10 Our main hangup in dealing with commercial sex and pornography in Minneapolis is that so many people these days just don't think it's a serious problem, said Sgt. Jon Prentice.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
description: FRED L. GUILES: MARION DAVIES  Hearst ... was ever on the defensive about gifts to Marion. There was always a look on his face, the one he wore when he felt left out of things, a look that suggested a small shy boy leaving Mayflowers on a girl's stoop and running away.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As residents of Seward Park Houses, we have long been aware of a dilemma in urban renewal. People demand better housing, and the cheapest way to use the limited space available is to build highrise apartments in place of the old slums. But that type of construction leads to a different style of living.

title: New GypsyMoth Plague Feared
description: TRENTON  The gypsy moth, a pest with a voracious appetite for leaves, damaged a record 225,000 acres of New Jersey woodlands in 1972 and is expected to inflict nearly an equal amount of tree defoliation this spring and summer.

title: Miss Katz Fiancee Of Stephen L. Roth
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. March 10Mr. and Mrs. Ira Katz have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Ellen Katz, to Stephen Lawrence Roth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Roth of Forest Hills, Queens, and Pattenburg, N.J. The couple plan to marry in December.

title: Why Has Billy Jack Made So Much Jack?
description: ONE of the most financially successful films of the last two years is a drama called Billy Jack, a passionately muddleminded contemporary Western about a halfbreed Indian named Billy Jack and the members of the freedom school he protects from smalltown bigots who hale pacifists, pot smokers and longhaired weirdos.

title: A Druse, the First NonJew, Represents Israel Here
description: The first nonJew in Israel's foreign servicea member of his country's Arabicspeaking Druse minorityis serving as a consul in New York.

title: A HowNotTo Story: Flying, on 1 Bounce, to St. Thomas
description: An Open Letter to:

title: WHALERS VICTORS OVER SAINTS, 31
description: BOSTON, March 10 (AP)Tom Webster, Kevin Ahearn and Larry Pleau scored in the first two periods and a rookie goalie, Bruce Landon, stopped 36 shots tonight as the New England Whalers defeated the Minnesota Fighting Saints, 31, to take undisputed first place in the East Division of the World Hockey Association.

title: On the frontier, civilization was perennially reborn
description: When Frederick Jackson Turner proposed his frontier thesis in 1893, a great epoch of American history was drawing to a close. An obscure Government census pamphlet had noted that the country's unsettled area was no longer discernible, that there can hardly be said to be a frontier line. In short, the westward migration that had occupied Americans for more than two centuries was ending.

title: Stealer Assistant Named
description: PITTSBURGH, March 10 (AP)  Pittsburgh Stealer coach Chuck Noll has announced the hiring of Bob Widenhofer as an assistant defensive coach for his National Football League team. Widenhofer, 30 years old, has coached at the University of Minnesota, Eastern Michigan and Michigan State.

title: 2 Skippers to Keep an Eye On
description: A preview of what could be the final matchup in next year's America's Cup will be taking place starting Thursday in Long Beach, Calif., when the Congressional Cup series begins.

title: World News Briefs
description: RABAT, Morocco, March 10 (AP)The Moroccan Government announced today that it had nationalized foreignowned agricultural land. Informed sources said that a total of about 965 square miles mostly owned by French citizens, were involved.

title: Variety Marks Program at Watkins Glen
description: Watkins Glen is a charming village in the Finger Lakes district of upstate New York that is, among other things, pleasantly unassumingexcept for its roadracing action, which is now 25 years old. For racing, the folks up there forget modesty and throw around superlatives like the most prestigious, the finest, and world's best and no other. Still, they have something there because their 1973 program, now that the details have been buttoned up and contracts have been signed, presages a season that should be quite interesting.

title: In Pro Salaries, N.B.A. Is No. 1
description: Sports salaries have soared in recent years, as even the most casual fan realizesbut not at the same pace, in every sport.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Decentralization may be the watchword in the nation's capital but the numerous associations in the United Statesthe butchers, the bakers and the candlestick makers  are shifting their headquarters to Washington at a rate estimated at about a hundred a year.

title: Cuban menu
description: When she left Cuba with the family valuables concealed in a falsebottomed straw handbag, Isis Wilson carried equally precious gems in her headrecipes for this traditional Cuban meal. The pot roast gets its special taste from long marinating.

title: Jo Ann Calvacca to Wed
