Both men seemed to have lived forever, and had become legends, if not national monuments, in their own lifetime. And, amidst the universal mourning, few dwelt upon the fact that Churchill was repudiated by his countrymen and women in 1945, and that Apsley House, the Duke of Wellington's London residence, was twice stoned by angry mobs during the Reform Bill crisis of 1831. The last great Englishman is low, Tennyson lamented (inaccurately, it turned out) as poets, historians, and biographers replaced undertakers and clergymen as embalmers and enshriners.

title: Mrs. Stauffer Duo Wins
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 17Mrs. Nathan Stauffer of Haverford, Pa., and Tom Poor of Boston gained the semifinals in defense of their United States squash racquets mixed doubles title today by defeating Mrs. James Brogan and Mike Pierce of Philadelphia, 157, 157, 1015, 157. The other winners were Mrs. Howard Stoner and Romer Holleran, Mrs. Carol Thesieres and Peter Pierce,, and Halsey Spruance and Gretchen Spruance.

title: Ann Kritzer Is Bride
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., March 17Miss Ann Helene Kritzer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Kritzer of Hewlett, was married here this evening to William Alan Collins, son of Mrs. Jeanette Collins of Cedarhurst, and the late Seymour Collins. The ceremony was performed in Temple Israel by Rabbi Joel Zion, assisted by Cantor David Benedict.

title: Underground Man.
description: Adolescents and young adult readers of Underground Man may perceive that they have already experienced young Josh Bowen's America of the 1830's, through participating (if only via TV newscasts) in the social and civic disorders of the 1960's. In writing an absorbing story of a young Yank's adventures as a nigger stealer for the Underground Railroad, Milton Meltzer has written a contemporary novel. The cultural, political, moral and ethical issues that troubled young Joshua Bowen are those troubling today's youth. We hear them so.

title: May 14, 1948, with flashbacks
description: May 14, 1948, was a day Jews the world over had awaited for almost two thousand years. The proclamation of statehood read to a hastily assembled group of Zionists in a well guarded Tel Aviv museum that afternoon opened the doors of the Middle East to the 20thcentury  and to a series of wars that may not yet have come to an end. It is surprising that until now no Middle East authority has thought to write a book simply about May 14, 1948.

title: Ruling Appealed On L. I. Church
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I.The long, complicated fight over control of the small Russian Our Lady of Kazan Church here began another round last week as the recent decision awarding control to one group was appealed by the other group in the state's highest tribunal, the Court of Appeals.

title: Brooklyn G.O.P.'s Leader Is Called an Unlikely Rebel
description: What sort of politician would lead a party revolt against the power, prestige and authority of Governor Rockefeller? A week ago, poilticat jaws might have gone slack at the suggestion that such a role would fall to George. L. Clark Jr., the 32yearold, virtually unknown leader of the Brooklyn Republican organization.

title: Denver Man Killed, 6 Wounded In Gunfight at Chicano Building
description: DENVER, March 17 (AP)A young Chicano was shot to death and six other persons, including four policemen, were wounded in a gun battle today at an apartment building owned by a Chicano activist organization.

title: A Season of Weathering
description: When I was a small child in the late forties, my father traveled around the countryside as an evangelist. In the summer, outside rural Southern towns, he pitched his tent and held revival meetings. As a boy I often sat at night behind the screen door of our house trailer and counted the fireflies swarming in the darkness as I listened to my father preach the Gospel and my mother sing the campmeeting hymns. That is gone now, the sawdust and the Gospel tents; and like America it had good and evil to it, solace and fraud.

title: Baeza Rides Linda's Chief to 3Length Victory in San Felipe at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 17 (UPI)Linda's Chief stamped himself as the top Kentucky Derby contender in the Wes today by racing to a threelength victory in the 36th running of the $69,700 San Felipe Handicap at Santa Anita.

title: Northeastern U. President Will Become Chancellor
description: BOSTON, March 17 (AP)Dr. Asa S. Knowles, president of Northeastern University, will resign June 30, 1975, to become phancellor of the university.

title: Arboretum in Morristown Offers New Programs
description: MORRISTOWN  Nature lovers are awaiting spring with even more enthusiasm this year because of the expanded programs at the 125acre Frelinghuysen Arbor etum, which opened for the season last week.

title: 500 Students Get Political Interneships
description: More than 506 students in 19 high schools in New Jersey have cast aside the generationold Problems of American Democracy course for an Innovative program of politics in action.

title: Race issue Emerges on Coast As a Black Challenges Yorty
description: LOS ANGELES, March. 17The racial and religious tensions that plague many American cities are starting to emerge in the Los Angeles mayoral campaign as it moves toward a primary on April 3.

title: MRS. BOGGS IN RACE FOR SEAT TUESDAY
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 17 (AP)Voters in Louisiana's 2d District will choose between I. Mrs. Corinne Boggs and Robert E. Lee, a lawyer, in a special election Tuesday to fill the Congressional seat held by Mrs. Boggs's late husband, the Mouse majority leader, Hale Boggs. Representative Boggs's small plane disappeared over the rugged Alaska coast during a campaign trip for Representative Nick Begich, Democrat of Alaska, last October.

title: Graduate Schools
description: The Ph.D. is the pride of American scholarship, and the past 25 years have been the golden age of the graduate schools which produce the Ph.D.'s But today both the Ph.D. and graduate education are in trouble. The universities, overextended, are reeling under the impact of cutbacks in funds for research and fellowships; students find that in many areas, particularly the humanities and social sciences, jobs are scarce.

title: J.H. Higgins 3d Weds Camilla Vance
description: Miss Camilla Vance and James Henry Higgins 3d were married here yesterday afternoon in the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest, scene of the wedding or the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus R. Vance of New York, in 1947. Mr. Vance, former Secretary of the. Army, Deputy Secretary of Defense and Presidential troubleshooter, is a partner in the New York law firm of Simpson, Thacher & Bartlett.

title: Secretariat Wins After an Inquiry
description: Secretariat, the $6.08million syndicated colt, won his first start of the 1973 season yesterday at Aqueduct. But he had to do it the hard way.

title: CoCaptains for Harvard Six
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 17 (AP)  Harvard University's hockey squad next season will have cocaptains for the first time. The team will be led by Bob Goodenow, a junior right wing from Dearborn, Mich., and Mark Noonan, a junior defense man from Arlington, Mass.

title: No Light From The Top
description: WASHINGTON  President Nixon has demanded the reestablishment of the death penalty for certain crimes, because he says he is convinced it will be deterrent to those who might commit such crimes. He thus gave Presidential authority and support to a propositionthe death penalty as deterrentwhich cannot be proved, which can more nearly be disproved, and which is seriously doubted by many of the toughest and bestinformed minds in the criminal justice field.

title: U.C.L.A. Triumphs Despite Stall, 5439
description: LOS ANGELES, March 17A hustling substitute guard, Tommy Curtis, awoke the sluggish Bruins of the University of California, Los Angeles, and led the defending N.C.A.A. champions to an easy 5439 victory over San Francisco today in the West Regional final of the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament.

title: Story of Esther Read As Jews Mark Purim
description: The colorful Jewish festival of Purim, symbolizing the struggle, for religious freedom, began at sundown yesterday with religious services and ceremonies in synagogues and homes.

title: Newark Bandit Squad Acts in Harmony
description: NEWARK  In a city often characterized in terms of racial polarization, police officials are citing their special bandit squad as an example both of racial harmony and law enforcement expertise.

title: Marian Bender Scores by 4 Lengths at Pimlico to Post 6th Victory in Row
description: BALTIMORE, March 17 Marian Bender, a fleet 3yearold filly owned by Norman Seltzer, chalked up her sixth successive victory and her fourth stakes triumph of the year today as she won the $27,800 Flirtation before an openingday crowd of 18,120 at Pimlico Race Course.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastem Standard Time

title: JAMES C. WHITE
description: KINGSPORT, Tenn., March 17 (APJames C. White, a former director of the Eastman Kodak Company and a member of its executive committee at his retirement in 1969, died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 83 years old.

title: No Need to Worry About the Tenants, the Brownstone Agent Said
description: The following article was written by a brownstone owner in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn whose name has been withheld at his request.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Anyone who has been paying attention to the performance of the press in recent years has to be highly skeptical of its propaganda barrage pro claiming the dire need for legislation, socalled shield laws, protecting reporters sources, frequently cited as authoritative sources, official sources, etc.

title: HOUSING COMPLEX IS PLANNED ON L.I.
description: GARDEN CITY L. I., March 17  A new $50million hotel and condominium townhouse complex has been proposed for the site of the old Garden City Hotel, which is now a large, rubble heap in the center of this affluent village.

title: COMPUTER TRACES MIGRANT PUPILS
description: A nationwide computer network designed to keep track of the education of migrant children has been used to find more than 200 children, scattered through four states, who were potential victims or carriers of typhoid fever.

title: If the Woods Are Inviting, It Must Be Vienna
description: THE Wienerwaldthe Vienna Woods is not like New York's Central Park or even the Bois de Boulogne in Paris, not a precisely boundaried chlorophyll oasis with the city concrete nudging in. It is a dream projection of urban ecology, a true countryside adjacent to a metropolis, a green blessing of woods and meadows, vineyards and country lanes, cushioning the city to the west, toward the Alps.

title: The multinationals
description: The meeting at the Palace of Versailles last March had all the trappings of a diplomatic congress. For three days the 90odd delegates from nine nations held closeddoor meetings to discuss international monetary problems, tariffs and freigninvestment restrictions, and they concluded with a joint communiqu setting forth their views. The delegates did not represent any governments, however. The participants included David Rockefeller, chairman of Chase Manhattan Bank, J. Kenneth Jamieson, chairman of Exxon Corporation, and Giovanni Agnelli of Fiat, as well as the top executives from such giant firms as I.B.M., Caterpillar Tractor and Imperial Chemical Industries. Altogether, the 50 European and 40 American executives represented multinational corporations with assets well over $300billion.

title: The New Monetary System Will Be a Lot Less Liberal
description: PARISA new monetary system is being created out of the crisis of excess dollars in the world. Part of the shape is known; part still has to be defined by time. But one thing seems certain: Financial life under the new system will be a lot less liberal than under the old.

title: Patricia dinneen married to major
description: ?? he is also professor of electrical engineering.

title: Anne Christie Wed To A. P. Waugh Jr.
description: WILMINGTON, Del., March 17Miss Anne Carol Christie and Alexander Paul Waugh Jr. were married here this afternoon in the Westminster Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. John Watson Christie, the bride's grandfather, assisted by the Right Rev. Ambrose J. Clark, a Roman Catholic priest and abbot of The Abbey in Newark.

title: Ridgewood Shows Art of New Guinea
description: RIDGEWOODAn unusual collection of New Guinea Stone Age art has gone on view at the Focus Gallery, of 41 North Broad Street here.

title: Poulidor Wins Bike Race
description: NICE, France, March 17 (AP) Raymond Polidor of France won the ParisNice bicycle race today, taking the overall lead from Eddie Mercxs of Belgium on the last leg.

title: Outsiders Headed for Wounded Knee Are Arrested
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., March 17 Federal officers are on a national alert to prevent people from coming to Wounded Knee to support insurgent Indians who are holding the historic crossroads by armed force.

title: STATE TO OPPOSE L.I. BRIDGE RULING
description: Governor Rockefeller is expected to continue pressing for a bridge over Long Island Sound from Oyster Bay to Rye, and state officials are studying ways to challenge formal objections by the United States Department of the Interior.

title: EASTERN SKIING CANCELED BY RAIN
description: KINGFIELD, Me., March 17An impromptu soccer game, with 18 players on each side, took the focus away from skiing today as a heavy rainstorm caused the cancellation of the second day of racing in the Eastern Alpine championships.

title: I'd Rather Put the Dogs in the Baiement
description: ONE of the art world's most durable natural resources, James Johnson Sweeney goes right on being tapped. The latest post for the 72yearold art historianmuseum directororganizer is Art Adviser and Chairman of the Executive Committee at the sprawling young Israel Museuma job that he considers a  well, challenge.

title: Vestiges of Sea Life Found Underneath Soviet Desert
description: Moscow, March 17 (AP)Geologists have found a coral reef deep below the sands of the KaraRum desert, confirming theories that the desert, the largest in the Soviet Union, was a shallow tropical sea 120 million years ago, according to the official press agency Tass.

title: BLACK STUDENTS GET SCHOLARSHIP
description: EVANSTON,. Ill., March 17The names of 347 black high school students who have won seholarships awarded by the National Achievement Scholarship Program for Outstanding Negro Students have been announced by Edward C. Smith, president of the National Merit Scholarship Corporation.

title: Spring
description: By the almanac, spring doesn't begin until Tuesday afternoon, But the sun doesn't wait. The daylight today will be a shade longer thin the darkness tonight, and it will continue to increase until late June. And the sap doesn't wait for either calendar or equinox. Maple sap has been dripping from the spiles in the hills of New England the last week or two. Not every day and not all day, but enough to justify the tapping.

title: STARS WIN, 112103; JONES PASSES MARK
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 17 (AP)  Jimmy Jones of the Stars became the American Basketball Association's fifth 10,000point career scorer tonight as Utah defeated the Virginia Squires, 11210.

title: 60 MORE P.O.W.'S ARRIVE IN THE U.S.
description: Another group of newly freed prisoners of war came home yesterday.

title: Gregory Gallo Fiance of Deborah J. Gille
description: TEANECK, N. J., March 17  Miss Deborah Jean Gille and Gregory Gilbert Gallo, sportswriter with United Press International in New York, will be married in June.

title: Defense Tries to Limit Yablonski Case
description: ERIE, Pa., March 17 (UPI)The defense suggested today that the burden of guilt in the Yablonski murder case did not extend beyond a former United Mine Workers local president who had confessed to arranging the 1969 slayings.

title: GEORGIA SENATE BALKS GOVERNOR
description: ATLANTA, March 17Gov Jimmy Carter in the last 18 months of his term and unable to succeed, himself, has been frustrated in attempts to push his programs through a legislature dominated by lobbyists, an informal Al opposition Senators and Lieut. GovLester G. Maddox.

title: Eastern Will Extend Air Shuttle To New YorkMontrealFlights
description: Eastern Airlines, whose guaranteedseat air shuttle triggered a fundamental chap a 12 years ago in the way people travel and do business in the Northeast Corridor, plans to extend the shuttle service from New York to Montreal on May 1.

title: Chess: What Makes a Tournament Different From a Match?
description: One of the differences between match and tournament play lies in the arithmetic. In match play against one opponent, a simple majority of the points is enough for victory; in the usual roundrobin international tournament of 16 players. (the number is limited by the organizers' budget as well as by the wear and tear on the players) a 70 per cent score is needed to carry off the first prize. There is, therefore, more reason to play conservatively in a match than in a tournament.

title: Courses for Adults Drew 300,000 in '72
description: MONTCLAIR  Topical classroom attractions from Chinese cooking to yoga have in little more than a decade tripled the number of those taking adult education courses in New Jersey.

title: KENTUCKY BEATEN BY HOOSIERS, 7265
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., March 17 (AP)Indiana lost a 13point halftime lead, but recovered to defeat Kentucky, 7265, in the Mideast Regional final of the National Collegiate basketball championship today.

title: Bears Hold Skull Session
description: CHICAGO, March 17 (UPI)About 25 players, including Carl Garrett, a running back, and top draft choices, gathered today for a briefing session by Chicago Bears' coaches to hear instruction on the over  all pattern of Bears' operations. A Bears' spokesman said that the session was to acquaint newcomers with coaching tactics and with the Bears' approach to National Football League play.

title: Hunter, Fabisiak Capture N.C.A.A. Lifting Crowns
description: YORK, Pa., March 17 (UPI)Gary Hunter of Michigan State won the 148pound class with lifts totaling 550 pounds today in the National Collegiate weight lifting championships.

title: MISS WADE IN FINAL OF NATIONAL INDOOR
description: HINGHAM, Mass., March 17 (AP)  Topseeded Virginia Wade of Britain and Australia's Evonne Goolagong moved into the final $20,000 national women's indoor tennis championship today with convincing victories.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The financial markets churned through an indecisive week awaiting the reopening of the official European currency markets tomorrow. As expected, Wall Street remained closely tuned in to the negotiations in Paris to resolve the monetary crisis.

title: Nightgowns for insomniacs
description: going to little dinner parties, dancing the night. away or playing backgammon inwould you believe nightgowns? The price is right. And the look, well, judge for yourself.

title: Lynn Southwood, Teacher Affianced
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., March 17Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Southwood, of West Hempstead and Shelter Island have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lynn Anne Southwood, to Stanley. Anthony Engelhardt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis G. Engelhardt of Ridgefield, Conn. An Aug. 11 wedding has been planned.

title: Milking Consumers
description: An intricate network of price Supports, Federal and state marketing laws, and restrictions built up by distributors and unions has operated since the Great Depression to keep the retail price of milk artificially high many areas.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENNA, March 17  The world's major oil exporting countries warned their Western industrial customers today against taking concerted action against price increases.

title: CORNELL DOMINATES ALLIVY IN HOCKEY
description: Cornell, Ivy League hockey champion and the top team in the East, dominated the AllIvy selections announced by the league.

title: CAR BOMB KILLS A MAN IN IRELAND
description: STRABANE, Northern Ireland, March 17 (Reuters)One map was killed and at least 50 people were injured tonight whed a car bomb exploded without waming just inside the Irish Republic.

title: Planners Set Hearing for Queens
description: The City Planning Commission has scheduled Minh 28 as the date for its first official public hearing in Queens. The hearing, which will start at 4 P.M., will be held in a courtroom on the main floor of the Criminal Court Building at 12501 Queens Boulevard.

title: New MinorityBusiness Rules Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, March 17The Nixon Administration has backed off somewhat on a set of regulations that minority businessmen protested would destroy one of the Administration's most popular minority captalism programs.

title: Mahler's SufferingsDo They Explain plis Music?
description: DR. NICHOLAS P. CHRISTY is a professor of medicine at Columbia University and director of the department of medicine at the Roosevelt Hospital. He also is a Mahlerin: one of that dedicated kind of Mahlerian who sends letters to musicians and writers when he catches them in misconceptions, clichs or errors of fact about Gustav Mahler. One of the things that seems to drive him wild are those repeated references Mahler's neuroses.

title: I.R.S. Hints Fraud by Tax Preparers
description: WASHINGTON, Match 17One of every five taxpayers who have their Federal returns made out by commercial tax preparers this year may be asking for trouble with the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Library to Honor Victims of Nazis
description: LAKEWOOD  Governor Cahill is scheduled to be the guest of honor today when the Lakewood Hebrew Day School breaks ground for a memorial library dedicated to Jews who died under the Nazi regime.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NAVIAUX IS COACH OF NOB ELEVEN
description: HARTFORD, March 17 (AP)Larry Naviauz, 36yearold football coach at Boston University the last four years, switched today to the University of Connecticut. He replaced Bob Casciola, who left Connecticut to coach at his alma mater, Princeton.

title: Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON For weeks, ever since the signing of the Paris ceasefire agreement on Vietnam, the Nixon Administration has avoided calling attention to the fact that the firing has not ceased. Typically, at his news conference on March 2, President Nixon remarked that all guerrilla wars linger on and expressed confidence that things would work out. Only the South Vietnamese were heard to protest loudly.

title: PRISON STAYS QUIET AS WALKOUT GOES ON
description: WALPOLE, Mass., March 17 (UPI)The state police manned watchtowers at Walpole State Prison today on the third day of a walkout by guards at the maximumsecurity penitentiary.

title: Commodities: Windfall for Poorer Nations
description: The recent takeoff in commodity prices not only has lifted the cost of meals and manufactured goods but also has raised consumer anger and fears of further inflation.

title: Shanahan a CoCaptain
description: Richard Kolbell of East Meadow, L.I., and Richard Shanahan of Winchester, Mass., have been named cocaptains of the Lafayette College lacrosse team.

title: McCusker Is Appointed
description: Oceanport, N. J., March 17Michael J. (Mac) McCusker has been appointed director of admissions at Monmouth Park. A veteran in the field of race track admission, McClusker, 55 years old, succeeds Joseph Toscano, who resigned to become general manager at Garden State Park.

title: Pace, Led by Schreiber, Wins State Archery Title
description: The Pace College archery team, paced by Everett Schreiber Jr., won the New York State intercollegiate championship, held at Pace, in New York, on March 10. The victorious team had a score of 2,381. Second place went to Barnard, with 2,340, and third was Brooklyn College, at 2,225.

title: Westchester Slates Boat Show
description: For thousands of sportsmen and boatminded people in the Westchester area, 13 may turn out to be a lucky number, if Edward L. Ceccolini has anything to do with it. He is the producer of the Westchester Boat, Sport and Camping Show, which will tie its anchor to the Westchester County Center, White Plains, next Friday through Sunday for the 13th year. You'll have your choice of over 3,000 different stock models to choose from, Ceccolini says, which range from a tiny 3foot8inch inflatable cockleshell for $10 all the way up to a 90foot inboard motor yacht that lists for $750,000. News of Boating

title: 2 FINNS TRIUMPH IN NORDIC EVENTS
description: Oslo, Norway, Marhh 17,ReutersFinnish skiers today continued their sweep of Nordic events at the International Holmenkollen meeting here, with Juha Mieto winning the 50  kilometer cross country competition and Rauno Miettinen gaining an unexpected victory in the Nordic combination.

title: Equal Rights Win One Lose One?
description: The women's, rights amendment marched to an uncertain drummer last week as two states exercised what was known in another era as a woman's prerogative and changed their minds.

title: I Won't Tango, Don't Ask Me
description: IF, as my male filmgoing friends assure me, there is such a thing as a woman's picture, i.e., one that plays up to the romantic sexual ?? of housewives, then Last Tango in Paris can surely be regarded as its male counterpart  the perfect macho soap opera. From the film's beginning, when its heman heelhero, Paul, engages a compliant Parisian playgirl, Jeanne, in a genital collision, through the very end, where Jeanne reacts to his aggressions with a violence that metaphorically expresses her own sexual rage, its fantasies comfortably reinforce the misogynist stereotypes that have always enabled men to regard women as something less than emotional peers.

title: Meatpackers
description: With a sales volume of well over $1billion a year, Iowa Beef Processors, Inc., of Dakota City, Neb. is the nation's largest supplier of an item few people can do without. Its clients are Grade A  including such names as A. & P., Gristede, Grand Union, Bohack, Big Apple, DaitchShopwell and First National.

title: For Joan Cabot, F.P. Gardiner
description: BEVERLY FARMS, Mass., March 17St. John's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Joan Graves Cabot, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Cabot of Beverly Farms, to Frederick Prime Gardiner. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Z. Gardiner of McLean Va.

title: The Killing Has to Stop
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaA new kind of neutralism, in which Indonesia plays a vital role, is now advancing in Southeast Asia. With luck, it might be able to absorb the political wreckage of the Indochina war. This neutralism, unlike other varieties as expressed in India or Syria, is in no sense tinged with antiAmericanism. Indeed it appears more sympathetic to the United States than to either the Soviet Union or China.

title: Giants' Search for Home Leads to Nowhere
description: Princeton's aversion to having a pro football crowd invade its tight little cornmunity on Sunday afternoons and the blackout television policy of the National Football League have left the Giants without a home for this season and the next.

title: Rev. Dr. Emory Ross Is Dead; Missionary, 85, Aided Africans
description: ANNANDALE, Va., March 17 The Rev. Dr. Emory Ross, an African missionary who became a leader in national and world efforts to help Africans, died last night in the Fairfax Nursing Home. He was 85 years old and had recently moved here from New York.

title: Chelsea Is Offering MiniFestival
description: The Chelsea Theater Center, the resident theater company of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is offering a socalled minifestival of four productions this season running from this Tuesday through May 6.

title: Mercer of Trenton Takes Junior College Title, 8061
description: HUTCHINSON, Kan., March 17 (AP)  Mercer of Trenton, captured its first national junior college basketball championship tonight with an 8061 rout of Hutchinson, the host team.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER FIRST DIVISION
description: Borussia Moenchengladbach 0, Bayera Munich 3.

title: Giants' Search forborne Leads to Nowhere
description: Princeton's aversion to having a pro football crowd invade its tight little cornmunity on Sunday afternoons and the blackout television policy of the National Football League have left the Giants without a home for this season and the next.

title: Somerset Buying Parkland
description: BRIDGEWATERPark officials expect to begin acquisition of some 900 acreas for Sourland Mountain Park in Somerset County this this spring, despite the possible absence of Federal money to assist them.

title: Jazz Is Kool in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY  The six members of Kool and the Gang are seeking these days to do for Jersey. City what Frank Sinatra did, for his hometown of Hoboken 30 years ago: to put it on the musical map.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Wedding of Miss Lee Wilson And Robert Albro Held Here
description: Miss Lee Webster Wilson was married here yesterday afternoon to Robert Bruce Albro, a senior analyst in the common stock department of the Connecticut General Life Insurance Company of Bloomfield, Conn.

title: Shriver Moyement to Use ExPeace Corps Members
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 (UPI)Sargent Shriver has announced the formation of a new national movement seeking to mobilize the resources and expertise of more than 75,000 former members of the Peace Corps and VISTA.

title: Knicks Beat Warriors by 117108
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 17 Taking full advantage of the absence of Nate Thurmond of the Golden State Warriors and Red Holzman, their own coach, the New York Knicks, put on a blistering secondhalf drive tonight for a 117108 victory that improved their playoff position slightly.

title: Watergate
description: WASHINGTONShortly after midnight on June 17, 1972, a sharpeyed security guard named Frank Wills, making his rounds in the Watergate Office Building, spotted a Piece of tape over a lock on a basement door. But for Mr. Wills's chance encounter with that piece of tape, the World might never have known of the drama call it That Watergate Affair.

title: EVERETT H. HOLMES
description: Everett H. Holmes, a patent lawyer with offices at 15 Park Row, died Friday, apparently of a heart attack, at Overlook Hospital, Summit; N. J. He was 78 years old and lived at 348 Old Short Hills Road, Short Hills, N. J.

title: Weathervane Thieves Caught by State Police
description: The New York State Police have recovered the weathervane taken from the Hall of Fame of the Trotter at Goshen, N.Y., along with 25 other weathervanes stolen in southeastern New York.

title: With a tough skin and a tender core
description: By David Schoenbrun, with Robert and Lucy Szekely. 258 pp. New York: Atheneum. $7.95.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe rapid pace of events in the last several months has reinforced a growing school of thought here that believes it would be a mistake even to start the major international ;ptrade negotiations planned for 1973.

title: Robin Wright Bride Of Reeves Westbrook
description: SHREWSBURY, N.J., March 17Miss Robin Lynn Wright, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Wright of Middletown, was married here this afternoon to Reeves Cecil Westbrook, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cecil L. Westbrook of Marietta, Ga. The Rev. James R. Steele performed the ceremony at the Presbyterian Church. The couple are students at the Yale Law School.

title: AMERICANS STAY FOR A TRUCE ROLE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 17With the withdrawal of American troops less than two, weeks from completion, many of the American civilians who worked with them are remaining behind to help safeguard the ceasefire.

title: 3 ExAddicts star In a Paterson Film
description: PATERSON  A filth entitled Our Town was shot here recently, but its story line is different from that of the Thornton Wilder play.

title: Man's Aggression
description: Since Freud wound up his indictment of human nature with the charge homo homini lupus (man is a wolf to man), observers have been quick to note that this is a slur upon the animal kingdom.

title: Foreign Legion Recruiting Brings Italian Complaint
description: ROME, March 17 (Reuters)The Italian Government has confirmed that the French Foreign Legion had been sending recruiting leaflets to Italy and said it bad asked the French Government to put an end to the practice.

title: N.C.A.A. FENCING IS WON BY N.Y.U.
description: BALTIMORE, March 17New York University celebrated its 50th year of fencing today by capturing its 10th National Collegiate championship, a record.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
Cooking for a crowd
description: How to feed a crowd without wrecking your budget? Or wearing yourself to a frazzle? The answer is arroz con polio, the classic chicken and rice dish. This recipe serves 16 and can be doubled successfully. And to drink? Sangria, another time and moneysaver, since it can also serve as dessert.

title: Slaughter Hotel to Young Tom
description: ACCORDING to a critic's notebook, it was this sort of week: Monday, March 5. At breakfast I was stopped short again by anewspaper ad for a film called Slaughter Hotel. See The Slashing Massacre of 8 Innocent Nurses! the ad screamed. Slaughter Hotel...A Place Where Nothing Is Forbidden! Does that really sell tickets? if so, to whom? The Times, at my suggestion, had not bothered to review the film when it opened at the Penthouse Theater. This morning I began to wonder if I was wrong. Perhaps we should monitor more films of this type, which, if they're like Last House on The Left, deal in knifings, hackings, choppings and complete dismemberments with the sort of resolute earnestness that stag films devote to sex.

title: MERGING IS URGED FOREIGN POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, March 17As a step toward reforming the nation's foreign policy machinery, a panel of prominent citizens suggested today that consideration be given to combining the posts of Secretary of State and the President's Special Assistant for National Security Affairs.

title: Coastguardsman Is Killed In Training Center Blast
description: CAPE MAX, N.J., March 17 One enlisted man was killed instantly and three others were injured, two of them critically, when an explosion rocked the welding shop at the Coast Guard Training Center here today.

title: Psychosurgery Myriad Tough Questions
description: A surgeon can take out tonsils and tumors or transplant kidneys and hearts, and rarely is the appropriateness of his actions challenged. But one kind of surgeon  with a special practice called psychosurgery  has found himself in the middle of an international controversy.

title: Bourguiba Announces Rule For Succession in Tunisia
description: TUNIS, March 17President Habib Bourguiba has announced a change in the Tunisian constitution providing that the Premier serve as interim president in case of his death.

title: Joy on Broad Channel I.
description: When word was passed last week that years of uncertainty and anguish seemed over and that residents of Broad Channel Island in Jamaica Bay would soon be able not only to remain on, but also to purchase their homesites from the city, Daniel Mundy made the community's victory a family affair.

title: MARIJUANA FOUND 3D MOST USED DRUG
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 (AP)  A national commission has reported that marijuana is America's third most popular drug, after alcohol and tobacco.

title: Cornell Dean Named
description: Roger C. Cramton, assistant attorney general in charge of the Office of Legal Counsel in the United States Department of Justice, will become dean of the Cornell University Law School in July. The president of Cornell, Dale R. Corson, said Mr. Cramton would succeed William Ray Forrester, who has held the post since 1963.

title: 2 Swim Records Fall
description: BERLIN, March 17 (UPI)East German swimmers bettered two world indoor times for 25meter pools at their natinal championships in Rostock today, according to the East German news agency, ADN. Hannelore Anke won the women's 200meter breaststroke in 2:37.6, and Hartmut Floeckner won the men's 200meter butterfly in 2:03.1.

title: JAZZ BAND GIVES ANNUAL CONGERT
description: The Preservation; Hall Jazz Band, made its annual visit to Philharmonic Hall on Friday evening. There were the same six musicians, the same clutch of familiar tunes, the same soldout house and the same enthusiastic cheering reception, becoming more and more ecstatic as the evening wore on.

title: The Nomad Wanders Within the Certainty of the Seasons
description: FOR many, Iran implies endless desert. In fact the country is one of the highest in the world; the desert is there, but hemmed in by great mountains. The Elburz in the north rise to 18,000 feet, and in the west the Zagros form an immense wall nearly 800 miles long.

title: Coptic Patriarch Will Meet Pope Paul at Vatican in May
description: CAIRO, March 17 (AP)Coptic Patriarch Shenuda III will begin a weeklong visit to the Vatican on May 3 at the invitation of Pope Paul VI.

title: Peter Serkin Who Is He Nowadays?
description: ETER SERKIN, the counterculture's reluctant envoy to the straight concert world, takes a bunch of green grapes from his duffel bag and places them between us on the table, like a communion offering. He is tall and ascetically thin, with a wispy moustache and glasses, and a disarmingly direct way looking into one's eyes that brings to mind Dostoevski's holy innocent, Prince Myshkin.

title: NASSAU TRACKMEN WIN STATE MEET
description: ITHACA, N. Y., March 17Willie Smith of Uniondale and Mark Belger of Mepham, a pair, of juniors, led Nassau Counay (Section 8) to a record breaking triumph today in the New York State intersectional indoor track championships at Cornell.

title: Linden Facing Issue of Ratabks vs. Clean Air
description: LINDENThe 41,500 residents of this Union County community face something of a dilemma: They are opposed to the industrial development of Tremley Point, on the eastern end of the city, and they are determined to keep the tax rate low. The trouble is that a major part of the city's income stem from Tremley Point, where the pollution has become so intense that one resident described it as unbearable. In all parts of the 11.41 square miles that make up Linden, people talk about the need for some form of control if the pollution is to abate. Still, they acknowledge that they have been able to achieve much because of the revenue the industrial area produces.

title: Francine E. Wattenberg Engaged
description: Dr. and Mrs. Richard Marshak have announced the engagement of Mrs. Marshak's daughter, Miss Francine Ellen Wattenberg, to William Percy Klingenstein, son of Dr. and Mrs. Percy Klingenstein. Both families are of New York. Miss Wattenberg is the daughter also of the late Sidney William Wattenberg. A June 17 wedding has been planned.

title: G. C. Tobin Fiance of Laura Davie
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., March 17The engagement of Miss Laura Jane Davie to Gerald C. Tobin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Tobin Jr. of Albany, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Robert N. Davie of Middlebury. A wedding in July is planned.

title: Danger in Pakistan
description: The Nixon Administration's decision to resume arms shipments to South Asiaprincipally to Pakistanmarks a disturbing step backward toward a policy which in the past has proved damaging both to Pakistan and to American interests.

title: Residents Evacuate in Flooding Along Lake Ontario
description: ROCHESTER, March 17 (UPI)  Some residents evacuated their homes along the southern shore of Lake Ontario today as the water level rose and a warning of possible flash floods was issued.

title: MILLER'S 2 GOALS PACE 64 TRIUMPH
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., March 17 Although they squandered a 3.0 lead during three and a half minutes of the second period, the New York Islanders, finally managed to get into double figures in the victory column tonight by scoring a 6.4 National Hockey League triumph over the St. Louis Blues at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Deborah E. Dillenbeck Is Bride Of 2d Lieut. Charles K. Duncan
description: BLUFFTON, S.C., March 17 The Episcopal Church of the Cross was the setting here this morning for the marriage of Miss Deborah Evans Dillenbeck, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph B. Dillenbeck of Upper Montclair, N.J., and Sea Pines, to Second Lieut. Charles Kirkland Duncan, U.S.A., who is stationed at Fort Benning, Ga. He is a son of Charles Duncan of Brains Point and Charlotte, N.C., and Mrs. Enid Duncan of Charlotte.

title: Democrats In Suffolk Nominate 4 Women
description: PATCHOGUE, L. I.Not to be ?? by the Suffdlk County Republicans, who two weeks ago designated three women for the fall's general elections, Suffolk County. Democrats designated four last Thursday in a somewhat more harmonious carbon copy of the previous week's convention of their opponents.

title: He wrote honestly and well, he told the truth about his time
description: Finis Farr is an experienced journalist but not, to put it charitably, a great biographer. He is not even good biographer when his subject is a literary figure  in this case John O'Hara  since he does not feel qualified to make any but the most perfunctory judgments of literary merit. Many of the judgments are expressed in numerals: so many pages in the novel, so many copies sold in bard cover, so many paperback printings, so many dollars, count them, for the movie rights. He jots the figures down almost as if he were keeping records for the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Karpof Is Named Captain Of Yale's Wrestling Team
description: NEW HAVEN, March 17 The Yale varsity wrestling and squash racquets teams have elected captains for 19731974.

title: Rain Can't Steal Thunder Of St Patrick's Day Here
description: St. Patrick converted the pagans in Ireland, but the unholy elements here gave him a rough time yesterday.

title: Letters: Those 46 Peaks, a Questionable Challenge
description: To the Editor: I have read The Challenging Mountains: Two Men Attempt 46 Peaks in 5 Days, by Winthrop A. Rockwell (Travel Section, Feb, 18) with considerable concern and dismay. As president for the past three years of the Adirondack FortySixers, and based on my personal knowledge of a broad crosssection of our 800plus membership, I must tell you that the article does a real disservice to the FortySixers as an organization and to the hundreds of members who find these recordsetting events repugnant.

title: Janet M. Brown Plans to. Marry In June on Coast
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., March 17 Mr. and Mrs. Leland Scott Brown of Bedford and Chappaquiddick Island, Martha's Vineyard, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Janet Murray Brown of San Francisco, to Henry Gaylord Dillingham 2d of San Mateo, Calif. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Franklin Dillingham 2d of Honolulu and Sydney, Australia.

title: Most Pregnant Women Found Taking Excess Drugs
description: Despite the tragedy of thalidomide, which left in its wake thousands of malformed children, most women have continued to take excessive amounts of drugs during pregnancy, doctors reported at a meeting here last week.

title: Minton Brings Malcolm
description: AUSTRALIA'S latest gift to opera, as far as New Yorkers are concerned, is Yvonne Minton, a mezzosoprano who is making her debut at the Metropolitan as the Octavian in the current revival of Der Rosenkavalier. She had been heard here earlier as soloist with the New York Philharmonic and Cleveland Orchestra, winning high praise. The concertopera sequence pretty much capsulizes her career.

title: WEBER CAPTURES FINAL IN BOWLING
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, March 17 (AP)Dick Weber strung nine strikes together to beat his brotherinlaw, Norm Meyers, 279216, and win the $80,000 Ebonite open bowling tournament today in a replay of the 1971 title match.

title: Crisis Resolution
description: The United States and its major trading partners have reached agreement on how to resolve the international monetary crisis. But the set of compromises reached in Paris and Brussels in the last week will have to be tested and strengthened by experiencestarting tomorrow when the foreignexchange markets reopen.

title: Courts Seek Fair Sentencing
description: NEWARKA college student, with no prior, criminal record, was recently sentenced to one to two years in prison for possessing several marijuana cigarettes. Normally, a similar defendant in a similar situation would be given a suspended sentence and placed on pro. bation.

title: U.S. Faces Stiff Davis Cup Fight
description: This is the year the Davis Cup takes on a new shine and regains its stature as the symbol of world tennis supremacy.

title: Panama Canal Forcing A Tense Issue
description: PANAMA CITYA year or more ago, Aquillino Boyd, Panama's Ambassador to the United Nations, was heard to remark in New York that unless the United States and Panama began to make real progress toward settling their dispute over the Canal Zone, the issue would be brought before the Security Council.

title: U.S. Seeks to End Outside Customs
description: MONTREAL, March 17 Because he was able to go through United States Customs before his flight, it took a Vermont businessman named Eugene Cunningham one hour, instead of all afternoon, to get home from Montreal last week, and that is the crux of an unusual customs arrangement that has suddenly become controversial.

title: Arizona Wins in Track; Joseph High Jumps 73
description: TUCSON, Ariz., March 17 (AP)Behind the recordshattering high jump of Robert Joseph, the University of Arizona defeated four opponents today in a track and field meet.

title: PLAN TO REPLACE OIL IMPORT QUOTA GAINS IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 The Nixon Administration is leaning toward replacing the import quotas on crude oil with a twostep tariff, Administration sources disclosed today.

title: Carrington, Grant Reach Eastern Indoor Tennis Final
description: In a match that lasted nearly four hours, Art Carrington reached the final of the Eastern men's indoor tennis championship yesterday with a 57, 75, 75, 46, 63 victory over 18year old Peter Fleming of Chatham, N. J., at the Stadium Tennis Center in the Bronx.

title: the traveler's world
description: Recreational Vehicles: The Users

title: COLLEGE POLO TITLE WON BY CONNECTICUT
description: DARIEN, Conn., March 17The University of Connecticut moved into a fivegoal lead at the encl of the first chukker and went on to defeat the University of Virginia, 1910, tonight and win the National Intercollegiate indoor polo championship for the second straight year at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club.

title: State to Close Dump in Ranover
description: EAST HANOVERIn this small Morris County township, in a soggy plain just off Route 10, there is a sprawling garbage dump that has been the bane of the two private housing developments that flank it and that was, until last week, the subject of a bitter and protracted legal battle.

title: Bloomsbury: A Good Address in the Geography of the Mind
CITY PANEL SCORES STATE JOB AGENCY
description: The Commission on StateCity Relations that was set up by Mayor Lindsay assailed the State Employment Service yesterday as an ineffective and poorly run agency that has failed to perform its principal function  placing the unemployed in jobs.

title: Duryea Sees Certain Passage Of Statewide OTB Coordination
description: Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea said yesterday that state coordination of offtrack betting operations was essenteal and that the Legislature would undoubtedly pass some form of such control.

title: City Employe's Name Spells Double Trouble at U.STax Time
description: For James Edward Taylor, it's getting to be that time of year againthe beginning of the annual hassle with the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Bermuda
description: HAMILTON, BermudaOne member of Bermuda's House of Assembly said he was sure the slayings were the work of drug traffickers seeking to intimidate the island's government. Others, sensitive to the mood of black militancy brought in by winds of change from the Caribbean and the United States, suspected a political motive.

title: The Guest Word
description: It isn't every day you catch a guest actually reading the author's free copies at a publication partyif he ever reads the book at all. However, embarrassment being one of the real mothers of invention, I found myself doing just that several weeks ago. A magazine space salesman scrutinizing the olive in his fourth martini was trying to pick a conversation with me, and it appeared that the publisher had invited only the author's relatives.

title: New Books Detail Life And Times Of Jersey
description: NEW BRUNSWICKNew Jersey receives top billing in a group of new books bearing the imprimatur of the Rutgers University Press. Subjects range from plant life to mapmaking, from the workings of local and state government to historical events in the state.

title: Home Improvement
description: JUST as most people tend to kick or bang a vending machine that refuses to spew forth its merchandise after the coins have been deposited, so too do most people tend to jiggle the handle frantically on a toilet tank that keeps running or refuses to flush properly after the handle is pressed. While this will sometimes help, at least for the time being, the need for doing this repeatedly indicates that some minor adjustments or replacement of worn parts is definitely required, and the sooner this is accomplished the more positive and efficient the flushing action will be.

title: DiGregorio Has 30Maryland Bows, 10389
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., March 17Although Ernie DiGregorio, one of the nation's best shooting guards, fouled out with 11 minutes remaining, Providence held its lead and even increased it to defeat Maryland, 10389, today in the East Regional final of the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship.

title: State Asked to Pay Tuition for 10,000
description: ALBANY, March 17  A statefinanced voucher plan to encourage as many as 10,000 prospective students of the city and state universities to attend private colleges in New York City and on Long Island at no extra tuition was proposed today with bipartisan support in the Legislature.

title: After Four Years, Rent Stabilization Finds the Critics Have Mellowed
description: Four years after its birth, New York City's rent stabilization program has won general acdeptancepopularity would be stretching itthroughout the city.

title: Mail Box
description: As a classmate of the late Fred Mercur at Lehigh University, I think you should know there was a sequel to Fred's loss to Helen Wills as you stated in a New York Times article (March 4).

title: Headliners
description: Commuters Up in Arms

title: JOFFREY DANCERS PRESENT ABYSS
description: The more things change, the more they do not remain the same. So Stuart Hodes tells us in his ballet, The Abyss, revived Friday night at the City Center by the City Center Joffrey Ballet.

title: HUGHES TO PRESS ALCOHOLISM BBL
description: WASHINGTON, March 17Senator Harold E. Hughes, a reformed alcoholic, has taken the offensive in an effort to change the Nixon Administration's opposition to his bill seeking additional Federal support for alcoholism, programs.

title: Industry Acts to Help In Reforms On Justice
description: HACKENSACK  More than 25 representatives of New Jersey's biggest corporations met here last week to organize the nation's first statewide committee of businessmen to cooperate with the National Council on Crime and Delinquency.

title: Sports Week
description: PRO BASKETBALL

title: 18 in House Demand Masters Invite Black Golfer
description: Eighteen members of Congress, led by Representative Herman Badillo, Bronx Democrat, have urged that Lee Elder, a black professional, be invited to the Masters golf tournament that begins April 5 at Augusta, Ga. No black has been in the tournament, one of the most prominent in golf, since its inception in 1934.

title: Falcons Sign Greg Marx
description: ATLANTA, March 17 (AP)The Atlanta Falcons of the National Football League said today they had signed Greg Marx, 6foot4inch, 260pound defensive tackle from Notre Dame. Marx was an allAmerica choice in 1972.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: Think of Borden and thanees are you think of Elsie, the Borden cow. But over the last few years the matriarch of Borden's bovine family has gone into a corporate eclipse And the dairy operations she symbolized have become a smaller and smaller part of the company's $2billion business.

title: Veterans Backing Move to Close Retail Stores on 3 Holidays
description: CRANFORD  The Men's Wear Retailers of New Jersey won the support of four veterans organizations last week in its campaign for the mandatory closing of all retail stores throughout the state on Independence, Memorial and Thanksgiving Days.

title: Music: Piquant Program
description: Musics Aeterna's concesto series at the Metropolitan Museum of Art ended for the season on Friday night with a program that could be describedwithout condescensionas piquant. The three works in the concert's first half were quasi novelties, in large part agreeable stimulating, and the evening's final work was a Mozart piano concerto.

title: Stage: Musical Seesaw
description: Seesaw, the new musical that opened last night at the Uris Theater, certainly has its ups and downs. Yet it has three fine performances to call its own, a bland yet efficient slickness and a certain New York brashness to it.

title: GORDON MICHLER, 80, OF JERSEY STANDARD
description: Gordon H. Michler, former adviser on foreigngovernment relations to the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died Saturday at St. Joseph's Manor in Trumbull, Conn. His age was 80.

title: PINK FLOYD OFFERS ROCK IN MUSIC HALL
description: Time apparently has no meaning for New York's rock n roll audience. Radio City Music Hall was full yesterday morning from 1:30 to 4:15 as Pink Floyd, a British group, went through its audiovisual paces.

title: Advertising: Best Foods' Shifts
description: McCann  Erickson, which has been staffing up to make itself attractive to more packagegoods clients, has apparently done just that.

title: SHOP TALK
description: A woman walked into the Fairtree Gallery the other morning, looked around with interest for a moment, and then approached a member of the staff.

title: Pakistan Weathers a Slump Against England in Cricket
description: HYDERABAD, Pakistan, March 18 (Reuters)Mushtaq Mohammad rescued Pakistan with an innings score of 93 not out on the third day of the second cricket test against England today

title: AIR VIETNAM PLANE CRASHES, KILLING 59
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, March 19 (Reuters)An Air Vietnam DC4 carrying 59 persons crashed today while flying from Saigon to Ban Me Thuot in the Central Highlands and first reports said all aboard had been killed.

title: WILLIAM H. BAIER, 60, NAVY FIDUCIARY AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, March 18William H. Baier, since 1958 director of fiduciary affairs in the office of the Navy Judge Advocate General, died yesterday at the Veterans Administration Center, Martinsburg, W. Va. He was 60 years old.

title: New Calm Marks Council and EstimateBoard Sessions
description: Obscured by the stampede of Democrats for city office, a change has set in at City Hall that in the long run may be as significant as who is elected Mayor next fall. The era of confrontation at Board of Estimate and City Council sessions is on the wane. There are still times when, early in the morning, wooden horses are set out to cut off most approaches to City Hall, with mounted and foot policemen with walkietalkies positioned behind the barricades.

title: Norell's Name Is Still Magic At Auction of His Belongings
description: His friends thought he would have made a terrific interior designer if he hadn't preferred making clothes. In the nineteenthirties, Norman Norell began haunting the auctions and antiques studios in Paris. He continued his search on Saturday afternoons in New York in the nineteenforties and afterward.

title: Androgynous World
description: The idea of androgyny apparently takes a little getting used to. First responses tend either toward bewilderment or hostility. The word itself is easily enough defined for the bewildered: comprising the Greek words anthro (male) and gyne (female), it suggests the unity rather than the necessary separation of what we have come to think of as masculine and feminine qualities.

title: Country Superstar Rouses White House
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Merle Haggard, the country music superstar whose troubled background includes car theft, bad checks, armed robbery, burglary and San Quentin prison, entertained more than 250 guests at the White House last night.

title: Record for Course Is BrokenVitale Finishes 4th
description: OTSU, Japan, March 18 (UPI) Frank Shorter, the Olympic Marathon champion, captured the 28th Mainichi Marathon today on the eastern shore of Lake Biwa with a time of 2 hours 12 minutes 3 seconds.

title: A ROOSEVELT SON DEFENDS HIS BOOK
description: Elliott Roosevelt, in a magazine article made public yesterday, defended his disclosures about the intimate lives of President Franklin D. loosevelt and Eleanor Roosevelt. He also said President Roosevelt had been angered when Joseph P. Kennedy had suggested the President end his relationship with Marguerite (Missy) Le Hand, a White House aide.

title: National Book Awards Nominates 109
description: Works about women's experiences, the Vietnam war, films and the environment are among the 109 books named today as leading contenders for this year's 10 National Book Awardsthe book world's equivalent of the movie Oscars.

title: Vorster's Witch Hunt
description: South Africa's white minority Government has launched a new drive to silence its critics under a law that would be oppressive even by totalitarian standards. Sixteen student leaders have been banned  eight from the white National Union of South African Students and eight from the black South African Students' Organization.

title: KITTY HAWK CASES FRUSTRATE NAVY
description: SAN DIEGO, March 18The Navy is having difficulty in its efforts to prove, before series of courtsmartial here, that black crew members incited a racial riot aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk during combat operations last October off the coast of North Vietnam.

title: Catholics in Fund Drive
description: Cardinal Cooke, in a letter read at all masses in the Archdiocese of New York yesterday, appealed to all Roman Catholics to support the 1973 Catholic Charities and Education Appeal. The campaign, which begins next Sunday, gathers funds for the relief of the city's aged, drug addicts, the mentally ill and the poor.

title: Senators Urge $860Million More to Fight Hunger
description: WASHINGTON, March 18The Senate Select Committee on Nutrition and Human Needs issued a report today calling for $860million more in Federal food programs than requested by the Nixon Administration.

title: AUTO MECHANICS BEING CERTIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The certified automobile mechanic, wearing an orange, white and blue shoulder patch, will make his debut this week in repair shops and service stations.

title: POLICEMEN HECKLE SUSPECT AT RALLY
description: WESTFIELD, March 18 (AP)  Helmeted local policemen carrying nightsticks escorted 25 offduty Newark policemen from a rally yesterday where a black man accused of killing a policeman was speaking.

title: VERY REV. ALCIME CYR
description: The Very Rev. Alcime M. Cyr, Superior General of the Marist Fathers, a Roman Catholic order, from 1947 to 1961, died Thursday in the orders nursing home in Waltham, Mass. He was 90 years old. Father Cyr, who was ordained in 1910, received a bachelor's degree from St. Mary's College in Van Buren, Me., and a master's from Jefferson College in Louisiana. He was head of the Boston Province of the order before his election as Superior General.

title: Saigon to File Complaints On 2 Attacks Near Capital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 18 (AP)South Vietnamese military officials said today that they would send complaints of attacks on two of their positions north of Saigon to international truce observers because Communist peacekeeping delegates refused to investigate.

title: Miss Love Excels at Met as Pauline in Pique Dame
description: The part of Pauline in Tchaikovsky's Pique Dame is so insignificant dramatically that it can hardly be called a role, but it does offer the opportunity to sing a lovely solo directly to the audience and to participate in a couple of mellifluous duets and is therefore advantageous to a mezzosoprano with an appealing voice.

title: 3.2 MILLION WIVES OUTEARN HUSBANDS
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)Wives earned more than their husbands in 3.2 million or 7.4. per cent of American families in 1970, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Sohio, American Petrofina Planning 100Million Deal ;Dallas Concern to Buy Texas Refinery and 1,150 Service Stations in South as BP Division Is Restructured
description: CLEVELAND, March 18 American Petrofina, Inc., of Dallas, has agreed in principle to buy the Port Arthur, Tex. oil refinery and 1,150 service station properties in Florida, Georgia and parts of North and South Carolina from the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), officials of both companies announced here today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPARE THE ROD Pierre Boulez, whose baton waves over the New York Philharmonic, turns kibitzer tonight at 8:30 in the Juilliard School's theater, 65th Street and Broadway. He will be on the stage, but others will be on the podium. Mr. Boulez, conductor, composer, innovator and so on, will be working as a professional observer, watching two Juilliard student conductors lead the 70piece Juilliard Concert Orchestra through Haydn's Symphony No. 99 in E flat Major and Bach's Brandenburg Concerto No. 1.

title: FLAMES DRUBBED BY BRUINS, 7, TO 1
description: BOSTON, March 18 (UPI) Johnny Bucyk scored two goals in leading a fivegoal, secondperiod outburst tonight as the Boston Bruins trounced the Atlanta Flames, 71, in a National Hockey League game.

title: Mills Urges Strict Phase 4 To Replace Eased Phase 3
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said today that Phase 3 of President Nixon's economic stabilization program was not effective enough and should be re placed with more stringent controls.

title: South Koreans Investing Abroad In Other LessDeveloped Lands
description: SEOUL, South KoreaSouth Koreans, who have been successful in building up their own economy wish foreign financialies help, are now investing their capital resources and knowhow in other less developed nations.

title: WALKER STONE, 68, SCRIPPS OFFICIAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)  Walker Stone, retired editor in chief of ScrippsHoward Newspapers, died today of a heart attack at his country home near here. He was 68 years old.

title: All Those Vanderbilts Hold a Family Reunion
description: NASHVILLE, March 18Why would the Vanderbilts, who are usually associated with Newport and the more expensive reaches of Manhattan, hold a family reunion in Tennessee?

title: SECURITIES UNIT SET L. ON RESTRUCTURING
description: An independent body of publicly owned companies has been formed in, order to communicate to Congress and the Securities and Exchange Commission its concern that the proposed restructuring of the securities industry may be detrimental to the interests of shareowners and companies.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROCKINGHAM, N. C., March 18 (AP)David Pearson shook off a slight challenge from an old adversary, Richard Petty, today and cruised to victory in the Carolina 500 stock car race before a track record crowd of 46,500.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastem Standard Time

title: TV: Offenbach Tribute
description: A program like From CanCan to Barcarolle: A Tribute to Offenbach is one reason why, when other stations parch, WNET/Channel 13 remains a reliable oasis of joy. This onehour musical potpourri goes onand goes down like whipped creamtonight at 8. Repeat viewings are scheduled for Friday night at 10 and Saturday night at 11:30.

title: Cousy Seen as U.S. Coach
description: Bob Cousy, the coach of the Kansas CityOmaha Kings of the National Basketball Association, will probably be named to coach the United States basketball team in a sixgame series against a Soviet Union team.

title: ROYCE HOWES DIES; DETROIT NEWSMAN
description: ROYAL OAK, Mich., March 18 (AP)Royce Howes, former editorial director of The Detroit Free Press, where he won the 1955 Pulitzer Prize for editorial writing, died today in William Beaumont Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: ROCKEFELLER CALLS WAGNER THE MANTO LEAD THE CITY
description: Governor Rockefeller endorsed former Mayor Robert F. Wagner yesterday as a man who can lead and heal this city, and politicians said that his statement sealed the deal that would give Mr. Wagner the Republican and Liberal lines for Mayor in this year's election.

title: Youth Badly Wounded As Shots Disrupt Party
description: One youth was critically wounded and two teenaged girls less seriously injured yesterday when five shots were fired through a basement window in a West Side apartment building.

title: Shortcomings in Training Worry Soviet Military Establishment
description: The training of the brave and durable Russian soldier, who has won wars for czars and Communists alike, is creating problems in the Soviet military establishment, according to qualified military analysts in Washington, London and Bonn and at North Atlantic Treaty Organization headquarters in Belgium. They report that the Soviet Union is encountering difficulties in these main areas:

title: A College Aid Plan
description: The recommendations of the Governor's commission on the financing of higher education will undoubtedly be criticized by the proponents of extensive state aid to private colleges as well as by the defenders of the City University's free tuition. The study, directed by Francis Keppel, fails to satisfy the partisans of fixed opposites precisely because it represents the first major effort to deal rationally with a controversial, emotioncharged and traditionbound situation.

title: $1Million in Hashish Found In Warehouse in Rotterdam
description: ROTTERDAM, The Netherlands, March 18 (AP)A milliondollar cache of hashish, described by the Dutch police as the largest uncovered in Europe, was found in a warehouse packed in cans labeled as food; the police reported today.

title: India Weighs a Ban on Cow Slaughter
description: NEW DELHI, March 18Gandhi once remarked that the protection of the cow means the protection of the whole dumb creation of God. Hindus often revere the animal as go matha, or cow who is mother. And Buddha is believed to have said: Cattle are our friends just like parents and other relatives.

title: Life Improves for Florida's Orange Harvesters
description: FORT PIERCE, Fla.Many things have changed lately for the orange harvesters working in the groves of the CocaCola Company's Minute Maid Divisionmostly for the better.

title: Nixon. Seeking to Abolish Insanity Defense in Crime
description: WASHINGTON, March 18In a move certain to provoke controversy in legal circles, President Nixon will ask Congress to abolish insanity as a defense against murder and related Federal crimes such as treason and kidnapping.

title: Nixon's Legal Expert
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 A friend of John Wesley Den 3d was recently asked to explain the rapid rise of the man who was named chief legal counsel to President Nixon at the age of 31.

title: Mrs. Patricia Fernandez Is. Rewed
description: Mrs. Patricia Ann de FrancescoEstock Fernandez of New York, Nassau Point, L. I., and Bedford Hills, president and board chairman of Gnome Bakers, was married here yesterday afternoon to Hercules Nicholas Asimakopoulos, a former captain in the Greek merchant marine. The Very Rev. Anthimos Draconakis performed the ceremony in the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of New York.

title: RAIDERS TRIUMPH, TAKE THIRD PLACE
Bridge
description: ST. LOUIS, March 18Only one New York group remained in contention in the Vanderbilt knockout team championship when the semifinal stage began here this afternoon.

title: McClellan Says Gun Curbs Would Benefit Bad Guys
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (UPI)Senator John L. McClellan, Democrat of Arkansas, believes, that a strict gun control law would disarm the good guys but not criminals.

title: LON NOL ORDERS STERN MEASURES
description: PHNOM PENH; Cambodia, March 18president Lon Nol ordered a series of stern measures today after an apparent attempt, to assassinatd him in a bombing raid on the presidential palace.

title: Dyce Defeats Winzenreid In 1,000Yard Run in 2:09
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, March 18 (AP)Byron Dyce of Brooklyn passed Mark Winzenreid 20 feet from the finish line and won the 1,000yard run at the annual Highlanders international indoor track meet yesterday.

title: Tenant Power Is a Spreading Slogan
description: It is not as familiar as black power or women's liberation, but the phrase tenant power is sounding more and more across the country as the tenants' rights movement spreads from its more familiar setting among New York City apartment dwellers.

title: CELTICS CAPTURE TITLE IN DIVISION
Big Board Sets Reorganization Aimed at Central Market Role
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday a major reorganization aimed at improving its services and preparing for the. Big Board's role in a central market system.

title: SUDANESE AVOID GUERRILLA BREAK
description: CAIRO, March 18The Sudanese Government and the Palestinian resistance have agreed to avoid the allout break that seethed inevitable when Black September commandos raided the Saudi Arabian Embassy in Khartoum and killed three Western diplomats.

title: Books of The Times
description: WITTGENSTEIN'S VIENNA, By Allan Janik and Stephen Toulmin. 314 pages. Illustrated. Simon & Schuster. $8.95.

title: SEOUL WIILL LIMIT COSTLY, RITUALS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 18Beginning in June, South Koreans will be legally prohibited, from wearing traditional hemp mourning dress or placing more than two floral wreaths at a funeral.

title: Reform of State Sunday Selling Curbs Is Sought
description: ALBANY, March 18Kevin McCarthy dropped by Weston's Discount store in Latham, N.Y., last Sunday and, threading his way through other customers and a maze of merchandise, bought a khakicolored plastic garbage can for his new home in that Albany suburb.

title: Fairfield and Va. Tech Notch Upsets in N.I.T.
description: Fairfield and Virginia Tech won yesterday as upsets con tinued to mount in firstround play of the National Invitation Tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: Shifts in Federal Aid Alarm New South
description: ATLANTA, March 18  The Nixon Administration's current and proposed cutbacks in social services, coupled with rising doubts about the distribution and efficacy of revenuesharing funds, have generated confusion and suspicion in the South, where nearly half the nation's poor and blacks live.

title: 53 P.O. W.'s Get Big Welcome, But 3 Meet a Silent Reception
description: Fiftythree former war prisoners received a rousing hero's welcome yesterday when they returned to the United States mainland, but three men who reportedly belonged to a prisoner peace committee while in captivity were greeted by silence when they got off a medical plane in California.

title: Algeria Region Sets Rise In Natural Gas Output
description: HASSIR'MEL, AlgeriaOne of the world's longest reserves of natural gas lies under the sand, rock and scrub, of this desolate plateau 350 miles south of Algiers.

title: MISS M'GRATH RIDES NIMROD SHOW VICTOR
description: WESTON, Conn., March 18Dani McGrath's Ship's Company was in complete charge of the regular working hunter division at the Nimrod Farm indoor horse show today and won the championship with 13 points.

title: William Benton Dies Here at 72; Leader in Politics and Education
description: Former Senator William Benton of Connecticut, publisher of the Encyclopaedia Britannica and onetime Assistant Secretary of State, died early yesterday in his sleep in his apartment at the Waldorf Towers Hotel. He would have been 73 years old on April 1. His home was in Southport, Conn.

title: Abortion Clinics in City Face Rising Competition
description: One of Manhattan's 12 nonhospital abortion clinics, geared to a capacity of 750 patients a week, is down to an average of 380. If we go below 300, they've got us in trouble financially, a spokesman said.

title: Excommunication Asked for Writers On Confessionals
description: ROME, March 18  A group of Roman Catholic priests and laymen petitioned the Pope's Vicar for Rome today to excommunicate two writers of a book that purports to contain transcripts of taperecorded confessions made in churches throughout Italy.

title: ANCORP WEIGHING SOME WRITEOFFS
description: Ancorp National Services, Inc., the former American News Company, is considering certain writeoffs and the sale of its Crotty Brothers division as a means to raise cash to meet its current financial obligations.

title: MISS HAYNIE TAKES GOLF EVENT BY SHOT
description: SEMINOLE, Fla., March 18 (UPI)Sandra Haynie came from four strokes off the pace today to post an upset victory in the $25,000 Orange Blossom Classic.

title: Carolina Building Burns
description: PEMBROKE, N. C., March 18 (AP)A Pembroke State University building that has been the site of recent Indian proests of Administration plans to demolish the structure was destroyed by fire today. Pembroke University is situated in Robeson County in southeastern North Carolina where a group of Indians of the Tuscarora tribe have held a series of demonstrations for more than a week.

title: Lauritz Melchior Is Dead at 82; One of Great Wagnerian Tenors
description: Lauritz Melchior, one of the era's greatest Wagnerian tenors, died yesterday afternoon of complications following an emergency gall bladder operation at St. John's Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. He would have been 83 years old tomorrow.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Outfielder Connects in Fourth; 4 Pitchers Pounded in 83 Loss
9to5 Division Favorites Stage Two Rallies for 106 Triumph
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. March 18  While the Tigers were amassing a 60 lead over the Yankees today, a Detroit partisan strutted up to a New York follower and said arrogently, 9 to 5 favorites, huh?

title: STRONGARM PLAN LINKED TO BARKER
description: MIAMI, March 18An ass elate of four convicted Wate gate conspirators says he wt recruited for a team that planned strongarm activities against hippies and traitors in various parts of the county last year.

title: MEDICARE REPORTS TO BE MADE PUBLIC
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)The Social Security Administration said today that it would make public all future Medicare survey and investigation reports.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Trampoline Titles Decided
description: LAFAYETTE, La., March 18 (AP)  Kathline Nicholson of Rockford, Ill., won the women's division of the national Amateur Athletic Union trampoline championships at the University of Southwestern Louisiana yesterday. Mason Kaufman of the University of Michigan won the men's honors.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cardinal Ferretto Dies at 74; Chief Penitentiary of Church
description: ROME, March 18Giuseppe Cardinal Ferretto, who until Feb. 28 was Chief Penitentiary of the Roman Catholic Church, died in his home in the Vatican last night. He was 74 years old and had for some time been suffering from a heart condition.

title: Park Ave. Tenants Picket Against Cooperative
description: A group of tenants from an elegant residence hotel at 10 Park Avenue that is owned by the Community Church of New York picketed in the cold yesterday to protest the church's plan to make the building a cooperative.

title: 2 Women Marathoners Abandon Marital Route
description: WESTBURY, L.I., March 18Dick Kuscsik had run more than 20 miles today before he finally spotted his estranged wife, Nina, perhaps this country's most famous distance runner.

title: Every Birth in Asia Limits Hope
Unsafe
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is a small agency in the Department of Transportation which was established by Congress in response to the public furor created by Ralph Nader's book, Unsafe at Any Speed. The agency had barely begun its work when the Nixon Administration took office and for no discernible reason dismissed its capable, nonpartisan chief, Dr. William Haddon Jr. After a hiatus of nearly a year, Douglas W. Toms, head Of the Motor Vehicle Department for the State of Washington, succeeded him. Mr. Toms has not shown much zeal, and the Traffic Safety Administration has turned into another routine, halfforgotten little bureaucracy.

title: Squalls Drive Light Snow Flurries Through City
description: Intermittent snow flurries driven by squalling winds swirled over the metropolitan area through the day yesterday, at times creating the illusion of a big snowstorm. A real snowstorm, with accumulations up to 6 inches, hit western New York State.

title: CHRISTIAN BROTHERS, BISHOP EUSTACE WIN
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 18 A spectacular performance by Bishop Eustace and the third straight state title for Christian Brothers Academy highlighted the parochial school finals of thr New Jersey state high school basketball tournament today at Princeton's Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: Woman Shot in Forehead Found by Stroller on S.I.
description: An unidentified young blonde wearing a yellowmetal ring engraved with the initials, H.G.E. on the inside was, found seriously wounded yesterday morning in a swampy area of the Midland section of Staten Island.

title: Ford Fund Lends City Center a Million
description: The City Center of Music and Drama, faced with a severe financial crisis, will receive $1million from the Ford Foundation in two interestfree loans of $500,000, individually and specifically designated for the New York City Ballet and the New York City Opera. The money is to be used exclusively for the two companies, and not for the City Center Joffrey Ballet or any of City Center's other constituents.

title: Suspect in Florida Tells Investigators He Killed 13 People
description: LAKE CITY, Fla., March 18 (AP)Columbia County sheriff's investigators say that a man they have charged with murder has told them of killing 13 people from Florida to New Mexico.

title: Ervin Suggests Penalizing Aides of Nixon Who Balk
