description: CARSON CITY, Nev., March 20  Gov. Mike O'Callaghan said today that he flew to London last weekend for a twohour private meeting with Howard Hughes over the future of the billionaire's Nevada gambling holdings.

title: Stocks Decline on the Amex and OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exhange and in the overthecounter market slumped again yesterday in continued slow trading.

title: U.S. Says Soviet Improves ICBM's
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Administration military analysts report that the Soviet union has conducted its first successful test of a computer aboard a new intercontinental ballistic missile.

title: Theater: I'm Chelsea
description: With the surprising but not exactly original slogan of I'm Chelsea. Fly Me, the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn is staging at the Brooklyn Academy of Music what it describes as a minifestival of fabricators, innovators, imaginators and troublemakers, being flown in from their own backyards.

title: A Cambodian Diem?
description: Administration hopes for a stable peace in Indochina, already jarred by the reported Communist military buildup in South Vietnam, are further threatened by the deteriorating political situation in neighboring Cambodia.

title: RECALL IS WIDENED BY DRUG COMPANY
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 20 (AP)Cutter Laboratories, Inc., said today that it had expanded its order recalling a dextrose intravenous solution after three women had suffered postsurgery infections at a hospital in Milwaukee.

title: Pool, Cards and Pinball Enliven Canarsie Classroom
description: The classroom at the Canarsie Italian  American Civil Rights League clubhouse, looking like a childhood fantasy of a oneroom school, buzzed with cheer and action yesterday on the 14th day of the community's current school boycott.

title: Disease Thwarts Hopes of Asia's Poor
description: The following article is the fourth of a series on conditions in southern Asia.

title: Senate G.O.P. Backs Nixon on Outlay
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Senate Republicans rallied today behind President Nixon in his effort to hold down spending, but they left themselves free to oppose slashes in individual programs.

title: CARL BENTON REID, ACTOR, DIES AT 79
description: Carl Benton Reid, a stage and screen actor who retired in 1967, died last Friday at his home in Studio City, Hollywood. He was 79 years old.

title: Burger Activates CourtRevision Unit
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Chief Justice Warren E. Burger set into motion today an accelerated highpowered study of Federal court appeals, a move that could, fundamentally restructure the nation's system for delivery of justice.

title: Widow of Boggs Wins His Seat In the House by a Large Margin
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 20 (AP)Mrs. Hale Boggs overwhelmed her Republican opponent today to win a special election and succeed her husband as a Democratic Representative of Louisiana. Mr. Boggs was House majority leader when he vanished last Oct. 16 in an Alaskan plane crash.

title: JOYCE BALINT SHINES IN A STRING RECITAL
description: For the last two years, Joyce Rasmussen Balint has been the unseen mandolin player in Don Giovanni and Otello at the Metropolitan Opera. On Monday night she could be seen as well as heard at Carnegie Recital Hall, playing both the mandolin and violin. In an unusual program of music for two stringed instruments, she was partnered by her husband, Sandor Balint, who doubled admirably on guitar and violin.

title: Police Chief Is Suspended In a Suburb of Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, March 20 (AP) Police Chief Thomas F. Brownell of suburban Ogden has been suspended for 30 days by the Town Board.

title: Bike Hike and Cleanup Is Scheduled for Park
description: Boy Scouts and Girl Scouts from the New York area will participate in a bike hike through Central Park next Sunday, and, with the help of the cast of the film Godspell, Parks Commissioner Richard Clurman and Freda Payne, the singer, will plant shrubs, paint park benches and clean up litter.

title: Suspect Denies Killing
description: BOSTON, March 20 (AP)Anthony J. Jackson, 33 years old, was ordered held without bail today after pleading not guilty to an indictment charging him with murder in the death of Ruth A. Hamilton, one of eight young women found slain in the Boston area since last summer. Mr. Jackson was also indicted Feb. 15 in the murder of Damaris Synge Gillispie, 22, a Boston University coed.

title: Currency Controller Quits
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)The White House announced today the resignation of William B. Camp as controller of the currency. The announcement said Mr. Camp, 59 years old, was leaving Government service for health reasons.

title: Dance: Yvonne Rainer
description: One's daily life is basically the stuff of soap opera, distressing though the thought may be. And while occasionally wallowing in our own particulars, we are secure that artists keep a creative arm's distance from such indulgence in their work. It was with a sense of betrayal to find Yvonne Rainer's two weekend concerts at the Theater for the New City hopelessly sentimental.

title: Asia Has More Clinics, But They Are Still Rare
description: TRIWUNG KIDAL, IndonesiaHealth clinics have been scattered across Asia in recent years, but they are still scarce. Most people who go to them live within walking distance  a mile or two. Transportaion costs money. Yet in East Java clinics are meant to serve people within a radius of 10 or 15 miles.

title: RIKLIS IS BUYING SHARES OF HOST
description: The General Host Corporation has another suitorMeshulam Riklis, chairman of the RapidAmerican Corporation.

title: French Official Says Griffith Used a Drug
description: PARIS, March 20 (UPI) A dope test performed on the former world middleweight boxing champion, Emile Griffith, following his draw March 12 with Frenchman Max Cohen was positive, a French fight official said today.

title: BUTZ SEES SAVING UNDER FARM PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 20Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz said today that the Nixon Administration's proposals for controlling farm production could cut the Federal cost of subsidies in half and under some conditions could wipe out the subsidies entirely.

title: Times Names Deputy Foreign Editor
description: Robert Clurman, editor of The New York Times Week in Review since 1969, will become an assistant foreign editor and deputy to, the foreign editor, James L. Greenfield, it was announced yes terday by A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor of The Times.

title: Poles Rout U.S. in Soccer
description: WARSAW, March 20 (AP)Poland, led by Wlodzimierz Lubanski's three goals, routed the United States, 40, in an exhibition soccer match today at Lodz, Central Poland, before a crowd of 30,000.

title: They Play Seriously, for the Fun of It
description: When you talk about volleyball at all, you must take into account some preconceived notions: That it's a soft game, a recreational game that everyone can play, a game that nobodyparticularly on the East Coasttakes very seriously.

title: PEKING SOFT SELL ON TAIWAN SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, March 20The State Department's leading expert on China said today that Peking seemed convinced that by following a lowkey, softsell approach, it could eventually persuade Taipei to reach an accommodation with it.

title: House Panel Sees Difficulties in a News Shield Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 After listening to the slightly different views of prosecutors from Nassau County on Long Island and Essex County in New Jersey on legislation protecting newsmen's sources, a House Judiciary subcommittee ended 15 days of hearings today with its chairman observing that the drafting of a bill on the subject would not be easy.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: JURY WILL STUDY PRANK IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, March 20  The Albany County District Attorney, Arnold W. Proskin, announced today that a grand jury would Investigate an incident in which a group of legislators undergoing free heart tests allegedly harassed a young female hospital technician.

title: A Palace Is Not a Home To Duke of Marlborough
description: For more than a year the 11th Duke of Marlborough has owned Blenheim Palace but has resisted moving in.

title: CAMBODIA JAILS MORE SUSPECTS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 20 (Reuters)  Newspaper editors were among the latest antiGovernment suspects arrested today under the state of emergency declared in Cambodia after an air attack on President Lon Nol's residence.

title: Double Vision
description: When I was a little girl, my mother told me to wait for the light to turn green before I crossed the street and to cross always at the corner. This I did. Indeed, I was positive as a very young child that I would get mashed like a potato if I ever so much as stepped a foot off the sidewalk while the light burned red. I followed my mother's advice until I realized that she herself jaywalked constantly, dodging in and out of moving traffic and pulling me with her. So after a while I followed her example and not her advice.

title: Records
description: I've been feeling nasty, I even beat up my dog. Such coldhearted and unAmerican sentiments are expressed by June Millington as the lead voice in Polecat Blues on the new album by Fanny  Mother's Pride (Warner Bros. Records, MS 2137, $5.98).

title: News Summary and Index THIJRSDAY, MARCH 22, 1973
description: John A. McCone, the former head of the Central Intelligence Agency who now sits on the board of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation,, repeatedly denied yesterday that the company had anything surreptitious in mind when it offered the Government $1million to help defeat Salvador Allende Gossens as President of Chile. Mr. McCone told a Senate subcommittee that the money was not offered to create economic chaos, but to be used constructively. [Page 1, Columns 57.]

title: Economists See $35Billion G.N.P. Surge
description: The nation's output of goods and services surged by a record amount of more than $35billion during the first quarter of 1973, three leading economic consulting concerns said yesterday.

title: MARY WILLIAMS BACK AT COOKERY
description: When the Cookery began offering jazz with its meals almost two and a half years ago, its first attraction was Mary Lou Williams, at that time emerging from one of her periodic bouts of semiretirement. Since then the Cookery's jazz policy has flourished while Miss Williams has remained unretired, playing the piano steadily around the country. She is now back once again at the restaurant at University Place and Eighth Street, playing with what seems to be even more creative brilliance than one has always expected of this remarkable musician.

title: Chess: Gold, as Well as Glory, Awaits Britain's Next Grandmaster
description: At the opening ceremony of the traditional Hastings International Tournament, Jim Slaterthe British financier who made a lastminute $125,000 contribution to entice. Bobby Fischer to go through with his championship match with Boris Spasskycame up with an offer of 5,000 to the first British player to win the grandmaster title. Current rates made that grandmastership worth $12,250.

title: Liberals Designate Hogan, The Third Party to Do So
description: Frank S. Hogan, the Manhattan District Attorney, received the Liberal party's designation yesterday for reelection to a ninth term.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Olympic Aide to Woo China

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Nature's Way
description: By midMarch, alewives were beginning to nose up Cape. Cod streams to spawn, and the same was true in brooks entering at least one salt pond and one lagoon on nearby Martha's Vineyard Island.

title: People in Sports: Bids Up in Air
description: Dick Sadler, manager of George Foreman, scoffed at reports yesterday that the world heavyweight champion was approached for a title defense against Muhammad Ali, the former titleholder, with each fighter to get $5million.

title: Solzhenitsyn Given Divorce From Wife By Mutual Consent
description: MOSCOW, March 21Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the Nobel Prizewinning novelist, has received a divorce from the wife from whom he has been separated for three years.

title: MAHOVLICH GETS.NO. BOO IN TIME
description: MONTREAL, March 21 (UN) Frank Mahovlich scored the 500th goal of his career as the Montreal Canadiens clinched first place in the National Hockey League's East Division their 16th firstplace finishby defeating the Vancouver Canucks, 32, tonight.

title: A Housewife in Chicago Slays 2 Burglars Who Beat Husband
description: CHICAGO, March 21 (UPI)A housewife freed her hands from electrical cord binding yesterday and shot and killed two masked men who tried to rob her home and beat her husband.

title: Phnom Penh Supply Routes Cut; Sirik Matak Reported Arrested
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 21 (4P)New military reverses outside Phnom Penh and political restrictions inside the capital, were reported here today.

title: England and Pakistan Draw Second Cricket Test Match
description: HYDERABAD, Pakistan, March 21 (Reuters)  England escaptd with a draw in the second cricket test match against Pakistan today.. It was the second draw in the threetest series.

title: For a Shack in Seoul, Only a Single Light Bulb
description: SEOUL, South KoreaPak Noh Yong's neighborhood began about seven years ago as an illegal collection of shacks. There were 70 families then, all plagued by the fear that city officials would throw them out in the effort to halt the rush of villagers into the overpopulated national capital, which had become a symbol of opportunity.

title: Growth Helps Some Poor In a Few Asian Countries
description: SEOUL, South Korea  As usual the tiny coal stove under the floor of Pak Noh Yong's closetsize house could not compete with the winter winds. His sniffling teenage daughter and her preschool brother huddled fully clothed under a blanket at the warm end of the linoleumcoveredfloor.

title: TAX CUT IS URGED ON CAPITAL GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)Congress was told today that it could increase the revenues of the Federal Government and at the same time build a stronger United States economy by easing the the tax on capital gains.

title: Reggio Calabria Goes Back to the Barricades
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, March 21  Young rightists shout Back to the barricades once more,, and police roadblocks and clouds of tear gas have reappeared in this rebellious, resentful city in Italy's deep south.

title: Red Wing Out of Hospital
description: DETROIT, March 21 (AP)Larry Johnston, Detroit Red Wing defenseman, who suffered an eye injury during the Wings' National Hockey League victory over Chicago last Sunday, was released from Henrotin Hospital in Chicago today.

title: U.S. in U.N. Council Vetoes Panama Canal Resolution
description: PANAMA CITY, March 21Expressing its regret and disappointment, the United States tonight vetoed a resolution on the Panama Canal put before the United Nations Security Council, calling the resolution unbalanced andincomplete and therefore subject to serious misinterpretation.

title: Ronan Urges Congress to Help MassTransit Systems
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, urged Congress today to provide operating subsidies for masstransit systems. But he ran into questions on whether the transit systems in the New York area would take the major share of any such aid.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Commissioner Murphy's report on the increase in crimes against pen, sons only confirmed what every New Yorker has known and what too many New Yorkers have experienced.

title: Gypsy Cab Driver Slain In Car in Ozone Park
description: A gypsy cab driver was found shot to death at about 10 o'clock last night in the front seat of his taxi at 111th Avenue and 134th Street in South Ozone Park, Queens, the police said.

title: WEIGHT LAWS STIR TRUCKING GROUPS
description: Trucking industry and labor representatives declared yesterday that they would seek City Council and, if necessary, court action to block new city regulations for weigh and size limits on trucks effective April 16.

title: CATV UNIT PROPOSES RULEON FRANCHISING
description: ALBANY, March 21 (AP) The newly created State Commission on Cable Television made public today a set of proposed rules governing the franchising and operation of new cable television systems in New York State.

title: No Rust on Rusty
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22The Mets were given a day off on Monday. But Rusty Staub was out early at virtually deserted HugginsStengel Field for extra batting practice. After he had worn out three rookie pitchers and a pitching machine, he hopped into a car and had Tom McKenna, the trainer, drive him to the Payson Field complex for still more hitting against live pitching. It would seem that a man would have to love spring training to submit to so rigorous a regimen on his day off.

title: TAMS DROP 14TH AS COLONELS WIN
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 21 (UPI)The Kentucky Colonels handed the undermanned Memphis Tams their 14th straight defeat tonight, 131109, despite a careerhigh 41 points by Johnny Neumann, who hit 18 of 23 shots from the field.

title: Yanks Beats Mets, 62
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21  The New York Yankees and Mets; who will share Shea Stadium next year, shared a little old ball park on Tampa Bay this afternoon with the Yankees winning, 62, despite a home run by Willie Mays.

title: Jersey City Planning Waterfront Housing
description: JERSEY CITY, March 21Plans for a $2billion urban project providing new housing, industry and parkland on a 2,500acre decaying waterfront site on the Hudson River were announced today by Jersey City.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN SLOW TRADING
description: It was glooiny once again on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market yesterday as prices dropped sharply in continued slow trading.

title: Grant Will Pay Court Aides
description: TRENTON, March 21 (AP)The state has received a $318,970 Federal grant to pay for 12 new administrative court assistants. The aides will be assigned to 12 judicial administrative regions in the state with the aim of streamlining or modernizing court procedures. The money was provided by the Federal Law Enforcement Assistance Administration.

title: Advertising: It's a Good Life
description: Babette Colby, attractive, 28yearold mother of two has found financial happiness through total immersion. And, having spent half her young life in pursuit of a theatrical career, she ironically is becoming famous for 30 seconds with her mouth shut and soaking wet.

title: French Scientist Honored
description: WALTHAM, Mass., March 21 (AP)Dr. Boris Ephrussi, director of the Center for Molecular Genetics in France, has been awarded the 1973 Brandeis University Lewis S. Rosentiel Award for research in the field of human genetics.

title: Bar Sought to Mollenhoff's Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Air Force lawyers are attempting to extend the doctrine of privileged communications to cover a former White House aide who has become a central figure in the Civil Service Commission hearings on the layoff of A. Ernest Fitzgerald.

title: Rockefeller Moves to End G.O.P. Revolt
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday assigned Lieut. Gov. Melcolm Wilson and Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz to help crush the last remnants of the Republican rebellion against Robert F. Wagner as Mr. Rockefeller's choice for Mayor.

title: Conductor Hums, Cues, Sings and Says That Security Is Involvement in Music
description: It was probably the greatest home musicale in the history of the West Side, and Eve Queler was conducting it. She sat on a kitchen stool that had a torn seat, and she bent, swayed and looked rapt. She was conducting only a handful of singers and a piano, but she was heating a whole orchestra.

title: Israeli Scientist Reported Tapped for the Presidency
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 21 (AP)Dr. Ephraim Katchalski, an Israeli neuroscientist, left Cambridge today after learning that he would be nominated to be President of Israel by the dominant Labor party, sources at Massachusetts Institute of Technology reported.

title: Sports Today
description: Minnesota vs. Alabama and Fairfield vs. Virginia Tech, National Invitation Tournament, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street. First game, 7 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 10 (cable), 7 P.M.)

title: LoanShark Inquiry Yields Indictments Here Against 10
description: The special Manhattan grand jury investigating a $100million loansharking ring in New York's garment center returned indictments yesterday against 10 men on charges of usury, conspiracy, contempt and perjury.

title: JOB CURB VOTED BY SCHOOL BOARD
description: The Board of Education took action last night to prevent the unauthorized creation of special nonCivil Service job titles that could be filled by personnel who hold certificates of competency rather, than regular school licenses.

title: Election Bill Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)Legislation to hold Federal elections on Saturdays rather than Tuesdays has been introduced by Senator Claiborne Pell, Democrat of Rhode Island. Taking time off from the Job, inconvenience, voter apathy, weather conditions and many other excuses are offered to explain the poor showing at the polls, said Senator Pell. The Senator, chairman of the Subcommittee on, Privileges and Elections, said his bill goes a long way in getting people to the polls.

title: The Wagner Draft
description: You may elect whichever candidates you please to office, said Boss Tweed, if you allow me to pick the candidates. This admirable lesson in blatant bossism now is being applied to the New York mayoralty campaign, so openly that the smokefilled room in which Warren Harding was nominated begins to look like a Sunday school class.

title: Jumpy Food
description: A funny thing about the healthy family appetite: it s somehow never appeased by a steady diet of soothing syrup in place of solid nourishment. It is all very pleasant to be told over and over by Administration experts that, if everybody just waits long enough, food prices will be coming down. But that doesn't fill any refrigerators or any stomachs either. Nor does it make it any easier to stretch the worker's paycheck at the supermarket checkout counter, even in this period of freefloating money.

title: CELTICS WIN 63D FOR CLUB RECORD
description: BOSTON, March 21 (UPI)John Havlicek's 27 points led the Boston Celtics to a hardfought 106105 decision over the Chicago Bulls tonight to give the Celtics the best victory total in their history.

title: Observance at U.N. Marks Sharpeville Anniversary
description: UNITED NATIONS, R. Y., March 21  The United Nations observed International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination with speeches today and by announcing pledges of $1,188,723 to help victims of racial bias in southern Africa. Twentyone countries contributed to the total.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FEDERAL CASEThe National Park Service not only handles such great outdoors, outsize real estate as Yosemite and Yellowstone but it also tends several small parcels in our city. Two of these, representing the great indoors, will be the scenes of concerts for the next nine weeks, free to the public.

title: Utility to Ask Rate Rises
description: BUFFALO, March 21 (AP)New York State Electric and Gas Corporation, which raised its rates two months ago, disclosed today that it would seek further increases next month. The amounts were not mentioned.

title: NAVY REINSTATES RULE TO OLD POST
description: Gordon W. Rule, the Navy procurement expert who was shifted to a minor assignment in December after assailing the White House appointment of Roy L. Ash and then refusing a demand that he resign, was returned to his old job yesterday.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Canada Industrial Index Firm
description: OTTAWA, March 21 (Reuters)  Canada's industrial production index for January was 203.6 seasonally adjusted, unchanged from the upward revised December level but 7.5 per cent above the yearago 189.4, Statistics Canada reported today. The index is computed on a 1961 base period of 100.

title: Long Island Rail Crash Traced To Loss of Brakes on Two Cars
description: LAKE RONKONKOMA, L. I., March 21The director of the Office of Safety of the Federal Railroad Administration said today that the brakes were inoperative on the last two cars of the train involved in last Thursday's fatal Long Island Railroad crash here.

title: Court Rebuffs G.O.P. Insurgents On Bergen Balloting Challenge
description: HACKENSACK, March 21 Superior Court Judge James I. Toscano today dismissed charges by three insurgent Republicans that Bergen County Clerk Alexander Allan had given G.O.P. organization candidates preferential positions on primary election ballots.

title: Gordon Rule Reinstated
description: Gordon W. Rule, the Navy procurement expert who was shifted to a minor post after assailing the appointment of Roy L. Ash to head the Office of Management and Budget, was returned to his old job yesterday. Details, Page 24.

title: Mrs. Margaret Price, 62, Dies; ExNational Head of Girl Scouts
description: ST. LOUIS, March 21  Mrs. Margaret W. Price, who was national president of the Girl Scouts of the U.S.A. from 1963 to 1969, died of cancer today. She was 62 years old.

title: Goals Appear to Be Similar to Nixon Ideas
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Representative Wilbur D. Mills outlined today a set of objectives for new trade legislation that appeared very close to proposals being developed in the Nixon Administration, including some new devices for limiting imports.

title: Students Find Needlepoint a Remedy
description: When Cecile Parker was a student at Barnard College in the 1940's, she and her classmates spent their spare time knitting for the Red Cross.

title: EDUCATION CENTER LABELED RED FRONT
description: WASHINGTON, March 21.The Center for Marxist Education in New York City, which says its brochures publicly proclaim Communist leaders as speakers, was declared today by the Subversive Activities Control Board tote a Communistfront organization.

title: 2 IN CONGRESS SCORE SAFEWAY FOOD CHAIN
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)  Two Democratic Congressmen said today that Safeway grocery stores were cheating, Americans out of millions of dollars annually by fraudulently labeling and pricing meat.

title: McCone Defends I. T. T. Chile Fund Idea
description: WASHINGTON, March 21John A. McCone, former head of the Central Intelligence Agency and now a director of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, denied repeatedly today that a fund of $1million or more that the company had offered the United States Government for use in Chile had been intended to finance anything surreptitious.

title: BECKY GREENE WINS BY LENGTH
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 21Shecky Greene held off Twice A Prince to win by a length today in the $37,650 Fountain of Youth Stakes at Gulfstream Park.

title: Cahill Abandons Program To Levy State Income Tax
description: TRENTON, March 21Gov. error Cahill said today thai he had abandoned his taxreform program, which called for relieving local property taxes through enactment of a state income tax.

title: Xavier Hires Former Jet
description: CINCINNATI, March 21 (AP) Bill Rademacher, a wide receiver for the New York Jets from 1964 to 1968, was named coach of receivers and quarterbacks at Xavier University today.

title: The Ulster Plan: Outlook Dubious
description: LONDON, March 21If logic and reason carried any weight in Northern Ireland, the new British plan for bringing peace to the province could well stand a chance.

title: Protest Disrupts City Hearings On Veterans' Postwar Problems
description: A group of young men, most with beards and long hair and wearing field jackets and blue jeans, gathered around a metal wastebasket in the hearing room of the Jewish Guild for the Blind, 15 West 65th Street, yesterday and tossed typescript documents into the basket, setting the papers afire with a cigarette lighter.

title: NEWMAN M'EVOY, AD EXECUTIVE, 68
description: GREENWICH, Ccmn., March 21 Newman F. McEvoy, a leader in the media advertising field died last evening at Greenwich Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 22, 1973

title: PRESIDENT OFFERS SUMMER JOB PLAN WITH FUND OPTION
description: WASHINGTON, March 21President Nixon announced today that he would make $424million available to provide 776,000 summer jobs for youths, about $3million more than the Federal Government spent for this last year.

title: Burglars Spurn Dollars
description: BRUSSELS, March 21  Two men, identified by the police as Yvon Calu and Marcel Pilette, broke into the office of the Caterpillar Corporation factory at Gosselifs, near Charleroi, on Feb. 25, stealing 120,000 Belgian francs, worth about $3,000. But they left behind $10,000 that was in the same safe When caught by the police yesterday, one explained, We heard on the radio that dollars aren't worth much any more and that they just cause a lot of trouble for people who have them. So we decided to leave them there.

title: BECKY GREENE WINS BY LENGTH
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 21Shecky Greene held off Twice A Prince to win by a length today in the $37,650 Fountain of Youth Stakes at Gulfstream Park.

title: Black and Hispanic Units Fight Present Tests for Police Jobs
description: Organizations representing black and Spanishspeaking policemen sought preliminary injunction in Federal District Court yesterday to halt the Police Department from hiring new patrolmen from existing lists or giving promotion tests.

title: Little Effect Here Seen in Rent Action
description: The reimposition of Federal rent controls, as approved by the Senate on Tuesday, could have a significant impact in holding down rent increases in much of New Jersey, Connecticut and New York State outside New York City, Federal and state officials indicated yesterday.

title: Ankara Panel Backs Sunay
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 21 (UPI) A constitutional committee today passed an amendment extending President Cevdet Sunay's term for two years.

title: Linebacker Is Penalized
description: CINCINNATI, March 21 (UPI)  A Cincinnati Bengals linebacker, Al Beauchamp, was fined $50 and court costs today on a charge of hitting a tow truck driver when the driver attempted to remove the football player's car from a loading dock at a department store.

title: OverAll Climb in Month Is Biggest in 22 Years
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Led by sharply higher food prices, the Consumer Price Index for February posted its largest onemonth increase in 22 years, the Labor Department reported today. Prices of many nonfood items, notably heating oil, also went up.

title: Court's School Ruling Gives States Breathing Spell on Taxes and Reformers a Setback
description: In rejecting by one vote yesterday the challenge to the system used to finance the public schools in Texas, the Supreme Court also gave a breathing spell to 48 other states under pressure to reform school financing, along with a setback to the reformers. Every state but Hawaii, which is one large school district, uses roughly the system that Texas, uses. That system, relies heavily on the local property tax and produces severe inequities between school districts in the dollars available for education.

title: Theater: PoetSenator
description: Leslie Weiner's play An Evening With the PoetSenator, which opened at Playhouse 2 last night, has a number of good and solid qualities to it. It has its flaws, too, but these are not only less interesting, they are also less important.

title: Syracuse Likely to Keep Football as Major Sport
description: Football, which had faced deemphasis or even discontinuation next year at Syracuse University, was given a reprieve yesterday and probably will be retained at its present major, intercollegiate level when Coach Ben Schwartzwalder retires after the 1973 season.

title: ELSEERG BACKED ON ACCESS TO DATA
description: LOS ANGELES, March 21. Dr. Morton H. Halperin, who had general supervision of the Defense Department group that put together the Pentagon papers, testified today that one copy of the papers had been sent to the Rand Corporation for storage and that it did not belong to the United States Government.

title: Stage: Horovitz'z Dr. Hero Arrives
description: High above Canal Street, in a tiny loft, is the Shade Company, an enterprising Off Off Broadway theater, with a small resident company led by Edward Berkeley as director. In its first two seasons the Shade has presented works by, among others, Shakespeare, Ionesco, Brecht, Plautus and, beginning Monday, Israel Horwitz, with a tragic farce called Dr. Hero.

title: Eastern Hockey League
description: TUESDAY'S PLAYOFF GAME

title: Brown's Defense Begins Summations
description: Summing up yesterday in the 10th week of the H. Rap Brown trial, the defense attorney, William M. Kunstler, laid heavy stress on the legal concepts of reasonable doubt and presurnption of innocence.

title: 2 KILLED IN ATTACK ON LEBANESE POST
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 21 Two Lebanese soldiers were killed and a third was wounded early today, when an army checkpoint in the southeastern part of the country came under fire from unidentified armed men.

title: Court Quashes Subpoenas On Watergate Reporting
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The United States District Court for the District of Columbia blocked today efforts by President Nixon's campaign organization to compel 10 reporters and news executives to turn over notes and other unpublished material in the Watergate case.

title: ELLSBERG BACKED ON ACCESS TO DATA
description: LOS ANGELES, March 21Dr. Morton H. Halperin, who had general supervision of the Defense Department group that put together the Pentagon papers, testified today that one copy of the papers had been sent to the Rand Corporation for storage and that it did not belong to the United States' Government.

title: S.E.C. OFFICIAL BACKS ROLE OF 3D MARKET
description: Philip A. Loomis Jr., a memlber of the Securities and Exchange Commission, Said yesterday be doubted whether the New York Stock Exchange would succeed in its avowed aim to abolish the third market.

title: Rupturing of a Steam Main Disrupts Stuyvesant Town
description: A 24inch underground, steam main ruptured yesterday morning on Avenue C near 15th Street, tearing a hole about 18 by 35 feet in the pavement and hurling debris that smashed windows of apartment buildings and parked cars. No serious injuries were reported.

title: Plea on Sealskins Dropped
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)  A New York company has dropped its request for special permission to import sealskins, normally banned under United States wildlife protection laws, the National Marine Fisheries Service said today. An agency spokesman said the Bergner International Coropraiton had earlier requested an exemption from the Marine Mammal Protection Act In order to import 10,000 sealskins from Canada.

title: The Troubling Topic Was Male Failure
description: It was the first Cultural Night of the year at the Mr. SWorD Foundation, and ice cubes tinkled in about 100 drinks as the evening's speaker strode to the front of the room to be introduced.

title: Burns Discerns Acceptance for Float
description: WASHINGTON, March 21There has been a dramatic shift in financial thinking at home and abroad in the direction of more tolerance of floating exchange rates for currencies, Dr. Arthur F. Burns, the Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, told Congress today.

title: I.T.T.'s Brazen Behavior
description: Sordid, even against the dreary backdrop of earlier revelations, are the latest disclosures about the effort of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation to block the democratic election of a President of Chile and to enlist United States Government help for that abortive project. On I.T.T.'s own testimony, it offered the White House and the Central Intelligence Agency a milliondollar contribution to underwrite a plan for preventing the election of Dr. Salvador Allende in 1970.

title: German President in Italy
description: ROME, March 21President Gustav Heinemann of West Germany, accompanied by his wife, Hilda, and by Foreign Minister Walter Scheel, landed in Rome today for a twoday state visit to Italy.

title: East River Change
description: There are no easy answers to institutional change expansion in New York, The hospitals and universities that have made the city great have often had disastrous impacts on their neighborhoods. Local communities, remembering past hurts, bitterly oppose institutions' plans.

title: Pilar Lorengar Shines in Lieder Style
description: Like her compatriot Victoria de los Angeles, Pilar Lorengar is a very winning personality. The Spanish soprano, with her pretty face, radiant smile and warm manner, has only to step onstage to make friends with her audience. A singer here primarily with the Metropolitan Opera, she made a rare appearance as a recitalist on Tuesday night in Carnegie Hall and managed to captivate a large number of her. listeners.

title: Cummins Signs Turbine Pact
description: The Cummins Engine Company announced yesterday that it had signed an agreement with Machinenfabrik AugsburgNuernberg, A.G., to market the West German company's gas turbine engines in North America for truck and industrial applications.

title: SAIGON REPORTS FREEING OUTPOST
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, March 22The Saigon military command said today that it had successfully lifted the siege of a small outpost surrounded by Communist troops for more than a week.

title: Weather Satellite Orbited
description: MOSCOW, March 21 (AP)The Soviet Union has orbited a satellite to gather weather information, Tass, the Soviet news agency, announced today.

title: TwoMonth Rise in City Sharpest on Record
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics confirmed yesterday what shoppers in the metropolitan area already knewthat runaway meat prices sent the cost of living soaring last month.

title: Mays Is Not Nominated For AllStar Balloting
description: ST. PETERSBURG, March 21The names of 128 players were put in nomination today for baseball's 40th anniversay All  Star Game, which will be held July 24 in the Harry S. Truman Memorial Sports Complex in Kansas City.

title: New Books
description: Another Life, by Derek Walcott (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $7.95). An autobiographical poem.

title: Police Say Illinois Man Bought Girl, 12, as Bride
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., March 21 (UPI) A wealthy Illinois resident was held today for conspiracy in allegedly paying $30,000 to the parents of a 12yearold girl whom he intended to take as his bride.

title: INSURANCE CHIEF SEEKS EXTENSION
description: ALBANY, March 21  Declaring that the results had been better than anticipated, the State Insurance Department asked the Legislature today for a fouryear extension of an experimental operating system in which insurance companies set their own premium rates for property and liability insurance.

title: Record Steel Year Predicted
description: The head or the United States Corporation feels that steelindustry production this year could reach a record level of 100 million tons.

title: Shipping /Mails All Hours Given in Eastem Standard Time
description: Today, March 22

title: COURT, 54, BACKS SCHOOLS IN TEXAS ON PROPERTY TAX
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Supreme Court held today that the states could finance their public school systems in part with property taxes that provided more money and better educational facilities for pupils who lived in wealthier districts.

title: 15 U.S. Dead Listed in Germicide Study
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Food and Drug Administration has compiled a list of 15 seriously ill persons in the United States who died after heavy external use of the germkiller hexachlorophene.

title: Sir. Donald Anderson, ExHead Of P. & O. Shipping Lines, Dies
description: LONDON, March 21  Sir Donald Forsyth Anderson, chairman of the Peninsular & Oriental Steam Navigation Company from 1960 to 1971 died yesterday. He was 66 years old.

title: An Open Air Vent Is Clue To Doctor's Office Burglary
description: FREEPORT, L. I. March 21 (UPI)  Two Freeport patrolmen, suspicious about a missing airvent cover, checked closer and arrested two men early today for allegedly burglarizing a doctor's office, the Nassau County police reported.

title: When Worlds Collide: Research and KnowNothingism
description: It would be nice to believe that we now possess all the basic scientific facts needed for the conquest of cancer. We could then set up timetables of expected progress, hire the required hands, and confidently expect this awful scourge to disappear from the human vocabulary. The truth, however, does not fit this fantasy and despite the stunning achievements of the modern biological revolution that has revealed the nature of the gene as well as the operation of the genetic code, huge gaps still exist In our knowledge of the fundamental biology and genetics of normal human cells much less of their cancerous counterparts.

title: A New Representative Corinne Morrison Claiborne Boggs
description: Jubilant with her victory for the Louisiana Congressional seat that her husband held for nearly 28 years, Mrs. Hale Boggs stood amid a cluster of campaign workers in New Orleans Tuesday night, thanking them for their love, interest and hard work and promising them dedicated, conscientious work when she went to Capitol Hill. Always the picture of a gentlevoiced, gracious Southern lady, Mrs. Boggs held a bouquet of spring flowers that her elder daughter, Barbara, had given her.

title: Growth Helps Some Poor In a Few Asian Countries
description: SEOUL, South Korea  As usual the tiny coal stove under the floor of Pak Noh Yong's closetsize house could not compete with the winter winds. His sniffling teenage daughter and her preschool brother huddled fully clothed under a blanket at the warm end of the linoleumcovered floor.

title: Film: '5 Fingers of Death':The Cast
description: A kind of film new to most local audiences, a karate movie called "Five Fingers of Death," written by Chiang Yang, directed by Cheng Chang Ho, and produced in Hong Kong by Run Run Shaw, opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters.The hero, Chao Chi-hao (Lo Lieh), a promising student of the martial arts, enrolls in the school of Sun Hsin-pei (Fang Mien), where he is first put to menial tasks like scrubbing floors and chopping firewood  with the sides of his bare hands, of course. But soon he proves his worth, and Sun entrusts him with the secrets of the Iron Fist, a technique that should win him the All-China Karate Tournament.He does win, despite the vile trickery of a rival karate master, and the film's end sees him firm in the love of his hometown sweetheart, Sung Ying Ying (Wang Ping), and dispatching his enemies bodily into several inches of solid brick wallby means of the Iron Fist method, which he has learned to use for all it's worth.To those who will complain that I've given away the ending, let me point out that I've thoughtfully omitted the middle and that there is more than enough plot in "Five Fingers of Death" for everyone to share. But plot isn't what the movie is all about. It is all about fighting  kendo and judo, but mainly karate and in several styles. It is bloody and rather flashily spectacular  normally pitting one good guy against 20 bad guys, all armed to the teeth with knives, and with predictably happy results.I don't know much about karate, but I know what I don't like. And the karate in "Five Fingers of Death," for all its slow-motion high leaps, its grunts, its whooshing fists, has the look of the bottom of the barrel. It is all too ??? too ???tously wildas if composed for show rather than for attack, defense or any real purpose.It is entirely possible, perhaps intentionally possible, to take the film as a joke. It has been dubbed into inappropriate English, and it is funny enough, say, when a character named Wan Hung-chieh accosts the beauteous Yen Chu-hung after her recital of traditional Chinese music with "Hi there? I love the way you sing." But humor at this level palls very rapidly; laughing at a movie is never fun for long.The net effect of "Five Fingers of Death" is to make me appreciate all the more the stylishness, the solemnity, even the gore, of all those doom-ridden Japanese samurai dramas that used to open so regularly a year or so ago at the Bijou.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: HARRISON, N. J., March 21Soccer is king in this West Hudson community, but the booters had better not look back. They will find that basketball is gaining on MOM.

title: Slim Rise Posted For New Orders In Durable Goods
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)New orders for durable goods and manufacturers' shipments both rose in February but at a much slower pace than in the previous month, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Recital
description: MariElizabeth Morgen, a Canadian pianist who played Bach's Goldberg Variations in her Town Hall debut three years ago, gave a Bach recital Tuesday night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. She began impressively with five Preludes and Fugues from The WellTempered Clavier, in which her flawless fingers, remarkably independent hands and strong analytical gift brought out the manylayered splendors of these pieces.

title: Tanzania Accuses Burundi Of Killing 36 in Bombing Raid
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, March 21  Tanzania accused neighboring Burundi today of having killed 36 persons in a bombing raid on three villages in northwestern Tanzania.

title: American Officids Expect Brezhnev to Visit in June
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Administration officials said today that they expected Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, to visit the United States in June for talks with President Nixon.

title: SOVIET SPACE SHOT IS FORESEER SOON
description: Speculation is mounting that the Soviet Union, after going nearly two years without a manned mission in space, may be preparing to launch a Salyut space station in the next month or soperhaps in time to upstage the American Skylab project.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: CITY U. TEACHERS PICKET O CAMPUS
description: Several hundred professors and staff members of the City University of New York picketed on the Brooklyn College campus yesterday to dramatize their request for higher pay, smaller class sizes, job security and other improvements in work conditions.

title: TROY BACKS SLATE HEADED BY BIAGGI
description: Matthew J. Troy Jr., the unpredictable Democratic leader of Queens, wrote himself a classically balanced New York City political ticket yesterday  Mario Biaggi for Mayor, Paul O'Dwyer for City Council President and Harrison J. Goldin for Controller.

title: Interest Rates Continue Their NewFound Stability
description: Interest rates extended their newfound, stability through a third straight session yesterday despite further disappointing data in the continuing fight against inflation.

title: Emanuel Winkelman, 69, Dead; Former Officer of Lane Bryant
description: Emanuel Winkelman, a director of Lane Bryant, Inc., who had been vice president and corporate merchandise manager until his retirement in 1969, died yesterday in Yokohare% Japan, apparently of a stroke.

title: 8 Arrested on Charges Of Preparing False Returns
description: Eight tax preparers were arrested yesterday on charges of having prepared false Federal incometax returns for thousands of clients in Manhattan, the Bronx and nearby communities.

title: PROFIT OF CHEMICAL OFF 15% IN QUARTER
description: Profits of the Chemical New York Corporation, the parent company of the $15.4billion Chemical Bank, will be down about 15 per cent in the first quarter from the $1.28 a share reported in 1972, Donald C. Platten, chairman, told the annual meeting yesterday. Mr. Platten attributed The drop to expenses connected with the bank's new facility at 55 Water Street, as well as a drastically narrowed spread between the rates earned by the bank on its loans and its cost of funds. But he said that, for the full year, earnings would be up.

title: Knicks Waste Big Lead as Hawks Win
description: In a National Basketball Association game that Coach Red Holzman of the Knicks found distasteful, his team threw away a 20point lead and wound up losing to the Atlanta Hawks, 9893, before the customary capacity crowd last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Lindsay Links Economy To 1975 Emission Rules
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Mayor Lindsay said today that the economic health of New York City might depend on whether the Environmental Protection Agency granted the auto industry's request for a year's suspension of the 1975 Federal standards on emission of carbon monoxide and hydro. carbons.

title: MANILA USES JETS TO FIGHT REBELS
description: COTABATO, the Philippines, March 21  Philippine troops aided by helicopters and jet bombers, fought three sporadic daylong battles today against Moslem secessionist rebels around this provincial capital in central Mindanao.

title: TALCOTT BID ENDED BY GULF & WESTERN
description: The Associates First Capital Corporation, a subsidiary of Gulf & Western Industries, announced yesterday that it would withdraw its tender offer for the shares of the Talcott National Corporation because of the opposition of the Justice Department.

title: Notes on People
description: A man who has known his share of defeats and disappointments but has shown the ability to bounce back played host to a team of gymnasts yesterday. The scene was the White House; the host, Richard M. Nixon, and the guests were women from the Soviet Olympic gymnastic team. Standing next to little Olga Korbut, whose performance in Munich, Germany, last year enthralled millions of spectators, the President said, As I watched the Olympics on television, I was always impressed with your ability to land on your feet.

title: Escalation of Madness?
description: The initial details released by the State Department are too sketchy to permit any solid judgment on the significance of yesterdays reported attack by Libyan Air Force jets against an unarmed United States Air Force plane over international waters. But if the report proves accurate, the attack would represent a dangerous new escalation of madness in the Middle East. It would elevate to the level of overt national policy the brute terrorism that Libyas fanatic leader, Col. Muammar elQaddaft, has thus far practiced only by proxy through the Palestinian extremists whose cause he has made his own.

title: Gray Testifies He Gave Data on Watergate Inquiry to Dean Without Telling Kleindienst or F.B.I. Aides
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 L. Patrick Gray 3d told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that he never notified Attorney General Richard G. G. Kleindienst or anyone else in the Federal Bureau of Investigation or the Justice Department that he was releasing F.B.I. documents on the agency's Watergate investigation to the White House.

title: Spending Control Pushed
description: WASHINGTON, March 21, (AP)An organization to oppose uncontrolled Federal spending was announced here today by former Deputy Secretary of Defense David Packard, who said the purpose was to develop public support on broad scale.

title: SHORT INTEREST CLIMBS IN MONTH
Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: People and Business
description: Come this June, the degree of master of business administration will not be as much of a golden key to a top corporate career as it has been, Lester B. Korn, head of a major executive placement firm, warned yesterday.

title: L.I. POVERTY GROUP UNDER U.S. STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)The Government's antipoverty agency said today that it was investigating allegations that Federal funds were used by a Long Island group to help underwrite a recent Washington demonstration protesting cutbacks in antipoverty funds.

title: Transit Pact in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21. (UPI)The city and the 5,200member Local 234 of the Transport Workers Union reached agreement early today on a contract that will keep buses, trolleys and subways operating. The agreement came a few hours after the local was sched uled to go on strike against the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority.

title: Police Give Rape Victims A Special Phone Number
description: The Police Department, as part of its new effort to make the reporting of sex crimes easier and less humiliating for women, will set up next week a special telephone nureber, 577 RAPE, for women who want to report an assault but are reluctant to talk to a male policeman.

title: TROY BACKS SLATE HEADED BY BIAGGI
description: Matthew J. Troy Jr., the unpredictable Democratic leader of Queens, wrote himself a classically balanced New York City political ticket yesterday  Mario Biaggi for Mayor Paul O'Dwyer for City Counci President and Harrison J. Goldin for Controller.

title: Marathon Ends Suddenly
description: WAUSAU, Wis., March 21 I(UPI)Jim Moellendorf, trying to break the world record of 1,177 for the consecutive number of games bowled, collapsed of exhaustion on his 320th game today and was taken to a hospital. The purpose of the marathon was to raise money for the mentally retarded.

title: Aiding Storm Victims
description: The National Weather Service called the tropical storm Agnes the worst disaster in American history. It affected more than 500 communities in a sevenstate area reaching from Florida to New York and Pennsylvania. The Red Cross was ready for it. Shelters were opened in the path of the storm and volunteers, staff, supplies and emergency vehicles were, moved in from all over the country. Before the operation was completed, 28,950 volunteers  supported by 1,300 Red Cross disaster specialists contributed to the Red Cross job, providing emergency needs and moving toward rehabilitation for storm victims.

title: A.B.A. AllStar Team
description: SPORTING NEWS POLL

title: TV N.B.C. Crime Film
description: There was a time when the hoodlum dominated the screen and the cop was reduced to, at best, an innocuous nice guy doing his job, not too competently. Tough Jimmy Cagney usually stole all the scenes from pleasant Pat O'Brien. On television these days, the cop has been elevated to undisputable stardom, but not without some curious smudges of sociological irony.

title: Fannie Mae Reports Rise For Yields on Its Mortgages
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)  The average yield on fourmonth commitments to purchase conventional mortgages rose to 8.020 per cent from 7.951 per cent in the previous auction, the Federal National Mortgage Association reported today.

title: 14 FOOD PLACES HERE LISTED AS VIOLATORS
description: The Health Services Administration yesterday named 14 foodprocessing establishments as violators of the Health Code.

title: Cunningham Voted Best
description: ST. LOUIS, March 21 (AP)  Billy Cunningham of the Carolina Cougars, playing his first season in the American Basketball Association, was voted the A.B.A.'s player of the year today in a poll of the league's players conducted by The Sporting News.

title: CONGRESS RECEIVES DEATH PENALTY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The Administration presented Congress today with President Nixon's legislative proposal to restore the death penalty for such crimes as aggravated homicide and wartime treason or espionage.

title: Stocks, Led by Glamours, Plummet in Heavy Selling
description: Heavy selling in glamour stocks and blue chips sent the stock market into a tailspin yesterday and pushed most indicators of price action on the New York Stock Exchange to new lows for 1973.

title: TWO CHILDREN DIE IN A HARLEM FIRE
description: Two children, one 2 years old and the other 7, died last night in a fire in a sixstory Harlem apartment building, the police reported.

title: FED RECOMMENDS NEW SAVINGS PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Federal Reserve Board recommended today that Congress authorize all banks and other financial institutions to create family accounts that would give checkwriting privileges on interestbearing savings accounts.

title: Ideology on Decline in Eastern Europe
description: WARSAW, March 11There is only one left, a young Pole said. Nicolae Ceausescu may be the last one in the bloc who thinks the party is shaping society. The others know it's the other way around.

title: Stolen Art Works Worth $750,000 Recovered by Police in Flatbush Home
description: About 300 stolen antiques, paintings and other art objects With an estimated value of $750,000 were recovered yesterday from the basement and attic of a private house in the Platbush section of Brooklyn, the police reported.

title: BEEF PRICES DROP IN HEAVY TRADING
description: In heavy trading live beef cattle futures moved down yesterday, perhaps because of easier supply conditions. Commodity analysts were not ready to say that recent record price levels had brought significant consumer resistance as yet, but at least some was indicated.

title: Work Stoppage Delays Sailing of the Da Vinci
description: A oneday labor stoppage by the crew of the Italian Line passenger ship Leonardo Da Vinci prevented the vessel from saling for the Mediterranean yesterday afternoon.

title: 58,579 Torinos Recalled By Ford for Steering Flaw
description: DETROIT, March 21 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company announced today that it had begun recalling 58,579 Ford Torinos, all 1973 models, to find an estimated 4,100 cars that might have a steering linkage defect.

title: Cahill Will Seek 2d Term: Defies Foes on Corruption
description: TRENTON, March 21Governor Cahill announced his candidacy for reelection today with a heated call to New Jersey's voters to reject him if they believed he or his Republican administration had been corrupt.

title: ARGENTINE POLICE CLASH WITH ARM
description: LA PLATA, Argentina, Thursday, March 22 (Reuters)Thousands of policemen seeking pay increases seized this city's police headquarters yesterday and clashed with the army when tanks smashed into the building last night.

title: U.S. in U.N. Council Vetoes Panama Canal Resolution
description: PANAMA CITY, March 21Expressing its, regret and disappointment, the United States tonight vetoed a resolution on the Panama Canal put before the United Nations Security Council, calling the resolution unbalanced and incomplete and therefore subject to serious misinterpretation.

title: HOWARD HENIG DEAD, EXASSEMBLYMAN, 64,
description: Howard Henig, a former Republican Assemblyman from Manhattan and a consultant to the New York State Senate, died yesterday at his home, 40 East 80th Street. His age was 64.

title: PUBLISHERS FEARFUL FOR SOVIET AUTHORS
description: The board of directors of the American Association of Publishers met yesterday in the General Motors. Building to discuss mew Soviet laws concerning writers and issued a statement that called them dismaying news.

title: Canada Lifts Streak to 5 By Beating Italy in Curling
description: REGINA, Saskatchewan, March 21 (Canadian Press)  Canada extended its unbeaten string to five games in the world curling championship today as the team, skipped by Harvey Mazinke of Regina, outclassed Italy, a newcomer to world competition, 122.

title: Rupturing of a Steam Main Disrupts Stuyvesant Town
description: A 24inch underground steam main ruptured yesterday morning on Avenue C near 15th Street, tearing a hole about 18 by 35 feet in the pavement and hurling debris that smashed windows of apartment buildings and parked cars. No serious injuries were reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: About 3,000 former addicts are expected to be reached in an expanded work support program announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay. The program, as introduced two years ago, covered about 400 former addicts.

title: Loose Wheel Kills Child
description: ROWLEY, Mass., March 21 (AP)A wheel that flew off a nineton refrigerator truck today rolled into a group of children waiting for a school bus, killing one of them. Twelveyearold Barbara C. Merry of Rowley was pronounced dead on arrival at a Newburyport hospital. Several other, children were grazed by the tire, officials said. The police said the driver, John Dabos, had told them the tires were put on Friday.

title: Lazy Dog Owners Keep Him Busy
description: After 24 different jobs in one year, Robert Arey went to the dogs. He hasn't regretted it for a moment. He is now a tycoon in the dogswalking business and recently expanded his activities to include dog day care.

title: West Virginia Jail Revolt Ends
description: MOUNDSVILLE, W., Va., March 21 (UPI)  A prisoner uprising at West Virginia Penitentiary ended today, 26 hours after it began, with the release of five unharmed hostage guards and promises by Gov. Arch Moore that most inmate demands would be considered.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: OverAll Climb in Month Is Biggest in 22 Years
Firebomb Delays Landing
description: LOS ANGELES, March 21 (UPI)A Boeing 747 with 90 passengers aboard was forced to abort its landing at Los Angeles International Airport last night when the pilot saw a fire on the runway. The fire, from an exploding firebomb, was quickly extinguished, the plane landed safely and there were no injuries. The police said there were no suspects.

title: URUGUAY CAPTURES AMERICAN'S KILLERS
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay March 21 (AP)Uruguayan security forces have announced the capture of four of the men involved in the 1970 kidnappingmurder of Dan A. Mitrione, an American police expert. The fifth man was killed in a clash with the police, they said.

title: Ulster Protestants Form Group To Combat London's Proposals
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 21In a Protestant suburb of Belfast last night a man came upon some boys lighting a bonfire, a traditional means of announcing both good and bad news.

title: Sweden Seeks Warmer Tie But Washington Is Chilly
description: STOCKHOLM, March 21 Foreign Minister Mister Wickman said today that it was important to improve Sweden's relations with the United States, frozen since Christmas time when Premier Olo Palme criticized the United States bombing of North Vietnam.

title: Valiant Is the Word for Lancelot
description: A dual champion the rarest of breedscame to the fore last weekend at the year's opening. American Kennel Club field trial on Long Island. He was Sir Lancelot, a vizsla owned by Bill Goodman of Orange, N. J., and handled by Dennis Burjan. The rusty gold ace won both the open gun dog and the open limited stakes at Southaven Park, the event drawing 79 dogs representing all the pointing breeds except the Weimaraner.

title: Books of The Times
description: FLAUBERT IN EGYPT: A Sensibility on Tour. Translated and edited by Francis Steegmuller. 232 pages. AtlanticLittle, Brown. $8.50.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Details Given on SkiLift Accident

title: Time Inc. and Hilton Reach Pact For Pay Movies in Hotel Rooms
description: Time Inc., through its affiliate, Computer Television, Inc., has concluded a longterm agreement to install a paymovie system in 40,000 rooms in the Hilton hotel chain, it was announced yesterday.

title: SMITH STOCKTON VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: ATLANTA, March 21 (AP)Stan Smith swept past Nikki Pilic today to gain the quarter finals of the $50,000 Peachtree Corners international tennis tournament.

title: CRAW HANOVER CHOICE TONIGHT
Nixon to Name Aide
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)  President Nixon announced today that he would nominate Wallace H. Johnson of the White House staff to be Assistant Attorney General in charge of the land and Natural Resources Division. Mr. Johnson, 33 years old, would succeed Dale Kent Frizzell, who is being nominated to be solicitor of the Interior Department.

title: Black Umpire Is Appointed To National League's Staff
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21 (AP)Art Williams will join the National League umpiring staff for 1973, the league president, Charles Feeney, announced today. Williams, 29 years old, will be the first black to umpire a full season in the league. He worked 19 games at the end of last season.

title: Focus Is on Factions in Elections for 32 School Boards
description: You have to submit to vilification and abusesometimes physical abuse. You are shouted at in public meetings. You have to put in at least 20 hours a week. People on our board had problems with their families and with their employers  because the job interfered so much with their other obligations.

title: Linebacker Is Penalized
description: CINCINNATI, March 21 (UPI)  A Cincinnati Bengals linebacker, Al Beauchamp, was fined $50 and court costs today on a charge of hitting a tow truck driver when the driver attempted to remove the football player's car from a loading dock at a department store.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: SYRACUSE, March 21. (AP) Syracuse University officials today called unauthorized and unwise the, showing of the sex film Deep Throat over the university's cable television system two weeks ago.

title: WEIGHTED VOTING STIRS CONFUSION
description: Election officials in the tristate area said yesterday that they were confused over how to administer a United States Supreme Court decision Tuesday that repealed the oneman, onevote concept for special governmental districts.

title: Alabama Needs Heroics Against Gophers Tonight
description: Despite showing excellent balance in its opening game, with six players scoring in double figures, Alabama's basketball team still needed a desperate 25foot shot by Glenn Garrett as time ran out to overcome Manhattan, 8786, Monday night in the National Invitation Tourment.

title: New York and Tennessee Declared Disaster Areas
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)President Nixon today declared Tennessee and New York as major disaster areas as a result of heavy rains and flooding last week that caused widespread damage to public and private property. The President acted at the requests of Governor Rockefeller of New York and Gov. Winfield Dunn of Tennessee.

title: ANGLE LIGHT WINS MILE AT AQUEDUCT
Bridge: Two Bidders Called Right, Though Conclusions Differ
description: Close bidding decisions in highly competitive auctions can swing masses of international match points. In the diagramed deal from the Vanderbilt final played Monday in St. Louis, both North players eventually had some thinking to do. They arrived at different conclusions, but both could maintain in retrospect that they were right: one was right in theory, but the other was right in practice.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: KUWAIT REINFORCES BOUNDARY WITH IRAQ
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 21 Kuwait today sent troop reinforcements to the frontier to face reported Iraqi military concentrations there as several Arab efforts to mediate the border dispute between the two countries were under way.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Foreign Trade for State
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., March 21. (UPI)New York State concerns have had $900 million wotth of foreign business since the State Commerce Department's Division of International Commerce was oragnized in 1962, Clark Galloway, the agency's senior international trade consultant, said in speech here today.

title: Council Is Urged to Pass 2 Bills To Aid Local Companies in Bids
description: Union representatives and merchants urged the City Council, yesterday to pass two bills designed to give local manufacturers an advantage on bidding for city contracts.

title: Meals at the White House: An Exercise in Cutting the Budget
description: Rising food prices have forced most families to stretch their, food budgets to the limit lately. Even in the White House, the Richard Nixons have instructed their kitchen staff to shop carefully.

title: The Gospel According to 'Godspell' Comes to Screen:The Cast
description: In filling in some of the narrative gaps in the Gospel according to St. Mark, St. Matthew took pains with the chronology, which, if you read him closely, makes it seem as if Jesus, on the day after He delivered the Sermon on the Mount and effected three healings, was in such good form that He made two lake crossings, healed five more people and held several lengthy discussions.It is this quality of nonstop busyness that is one of the chief assets of "Godspell," both of the Off Broadway musical (still running at the Promenade Theater on upper Broadway) and of the film adaptation that opened yesterday at the Columbia 2 Theater. Especially of the film.This update ofand variation onthe Gospel according to St. Matthew is less a celebration of the life and teachings of Christ than it is a celebration of theater, music, youthful high spirits, New York City locations and the zoom lens. The movie amounts to one long, breathless production number (some of whose parts are considerably less effective than others), as well as a demonstrations that, in films, what is said is often less important than how it's said."Godspell" pretty much reduces the story of Jesus to conform to a kind of flower-child paranoia that was probably more popular three or four years ago than it is today: the only way to survive in this world is to drop out of it, which, if you think about it, effectively reverses Jesus' instructions to the disciples.That, however, is to mistake what I, at least, understand "Godspell" to be all about. It's not about religion or philosophy but show business, and its framethe life and death of Jesus re-enacted in contemporary Manhattan and environs  is hardly more than a gimmick to allow the show's authors to help themselves to some lovely original material never protected by copyright.At its worst, "Godspell" exalts a kind of simplicity and sweetness that are often the disguises of fierce anti-intellectualism. Luckily, the film constantly betrays itself through its highly sophisticated show-biz manners. Jesus is not simply the androgynous circus clown He looks to be. As played by Victor Garber, He's a tireless hoofer and a most engaging minstrel man. One of the finest production numbers I've seen in years is the exuberant and ironic "All for the Best," which Jesus and John the Baptist (David Haskell) sing and dance all over New York, highlighted by a marvelous soft-shoe done in front of the Bulova Watch sign overlooking Times Square.After a certain point, all of Stephen Schwartz's music begins to sound the same, but there is a momentum in its pacing that carries us over the monotony. Almost every member of the cast has his or her moment of glory at screen center. I think particularly of Robin Lamont, a beautiful honey blonde, who sings "Day by Day," and of several hugely funny parables acted out by virtually the entire company.John-Michael Tebelak, who is credited with having "conceived and staged" the Off Broadway show, is credited as associate director of the film, and David Greene as its director. I have no idea who did what, but the movie has the look of something shot by Richard Lester in an evangelical frame of mind. Ordinarily, this sort of fractured style is something I can easily resist, but it is the only way, I suspect, that "Godspell" could be made to work on film.Every song number is an amalgam of splintery shots against dozens of New York locations, and a lot of them are both funny and beautiful. I can't remember another film that seems to have caught the way New York appears on a lot of hot summer days, when its jagged outlines are softened by a golden smog. The atmosphere may be lethal, but it's also incomparably romantic.I have some of these same feelings of ambivalence about "Godspell." I like its music, its drive and its determination, even when it's pretending to a kind of innocence and naivet that I never for a second believe.

title: Bank on 125th St. Held Up
description: A holdup man fled with $2,500 in cash from a branch of the Chemical Bank at 101 East 125th Street shortly after 11 A.M. yesterday after passing to a teller a threatening note demanding money, the police reported.

title: Immunity for Congress in Danger, Ervin Says
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, said today that Supreme Court decisions restricting the immunity privileges of members of Congress posed a dangerous threat to their continued independence, and freedom to speak out.

title: An Aide to Nixon Reaffirms RightsAmendment Support
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)Herbert Klein, the White House communications director, reaffirmed today President Nixon's support for the Equal Rights Amendment.

title: U.S. INDICTS 23 MORE OVER WOUNDED KNEE
description: WOUNDED KNEE S.D., March 21 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury has returned 23 new indictments on felony charges, bringing to 54 the number of persons indicted in the 22day occupation of Wounded Knee by armed Indians, a Government attorney announced today.

title: Dance: Not Just Mime
description: Life is not a bed of roses, and no one appears to know this better than the Polish Mime Ballet Theater, which wrestled with the human condition in three works on its opening program Tuesday night at Hunter College Assembly Hall. The troupe will perform there through Sunday.

title: EUROPEAN NEWSMAN EXPELLED BY GREECE
description: ATHENS, March 21  The Greek Government said today that it had ordered the expulsion of a correspondent for Dutch and Belgian news media, alleging that he was a political instructor who incited dissident students at Athens University.

title: PATRONS ADVISED TO STOP THIEVES
description: WOODBRIDGE, March 21The patrons of New Jersey's food markets could bring about a swift reduction in food prices. of as much as 20 per cent if they took a hard stand against shoplifting, a security expert said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)Redemptions mutual funds topped sales by $203.7million in February compared with $130.6million in January, the Investment Company Institute reported today.

title: High Court Backs State Primary Registration Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 New York State's requirement that, to vote in a primary, a voter must register in a political party eight to 11 months in advance, was upheld as constitutional today by the Supreme Court. The vote was 5 to 4.

title: TwoMonth Rise in City Sharpest on Record
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics confirmed yesterday what shoppers in the metropolitan area already knewthat runaway meat prices sent the cost of living soaring last month.

title: JERSEY CITY PLANS HARBOR COMPLEX
description: JERSEY CITY, March 21 Plans for a $2billion urban project providing new bousing, industry and parkland on a 2,500acre decaying waterfront site on the Hudson River were announced today by Jersey City.

title: Profit Disclosure Is Back in Control Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 21An unusual legislative move on the Senate floor last night has put back into the Senate's bill extending the Economic Stabilization Act a provision on corporate disclosure.

title: Rockefeller Moves to End G.O.P. Revolt on Wagner
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday assigned Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson and Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz to help crush the last remnant of the Republican rebellion against Robert F. Wagner as Mr. Rockefeller's choice for Mayor.

title: Celebration Rope
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Plans to reenact the hanging of Nathan Hale as part of the American Revolution bicentennial celebration in 1976 have been scrapped because of a computer projection of what would probably happen.

title: EDITORS OPPOSE BILL ON OPEN MEETINGS
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., March 121 (UPI)The New York State Society of Newspaper Editors voted unanimously yesterday to oppose two bills currently before the Legislature dealing with access to public meetings and records.

title: NETS ARE BEATEN; TAYLOR RETURNS
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., March 21 Brian Taylor returned to the New York Nets backcourt tonight after having missed 15 games, but about the only thing that resulted was a good workout for the rookie star.

title: NEWARK CHIEF GETS SECOND 90DAY TERM
description: NEWARK, March 21Police Lieut. Edward L. Kerr was named to a second 90day term as acting Police Director after the City Council failed tonight to confirm his permanent appointment by Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson.

title: Saigon Starting to Resettle 100,000 Refugees Far From Home
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 21  The Government has begun moving the first of a planned total of 100,000 refugees from the northernmost provinces to unsettled land near Saigon, more than 300 miles away, a ranking South Vietnamese official reported yesterday.

title: Court Backs Perjury Conviction Of ExAide to Hudson's Sheriff
description: TRENTON, March 21 (UPI)A state appeals court today upheld the perjury convictions of Gabriel Cattaneo, who held top posts in the Hudson County Sheriff's office.

title: Savings Bank Deposits In State Show a Drop
description: Net deposits in New York State's savings banks continued at a lower pace in the first half of March, according to the Sayings Banks Association of New York State. A sampling of 27 savings banks in the state for the first 15 days of the month showed a net deposit inflow of $85million, or about half of the $163.5million inflow in the 1972 period.

title: A Crisis Not of Energy but of MoneyChangers
description: We are no longer energyrich. We have become energypoor, and until we solve our energy shortage, the world's currency managers will distrust the dollareven when our inflation rate is below that of other nations. They see that we have a new and progressing malignancy that plagues our hopes and even our treadmill efforts.

title: House Democrats to Fight Nixon on Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, March 21House Democrats agreed unanimously today to fight Administration efforts to cut back Federal aid for social services.

title: Soviet Implies It Has Ended Exit Fees
description: MOSCOW, March 21Soviet authorities, in a clear bid for American Congressional approval of trade concessions from the United States, sought to convey the impression tonight that the education tax on Jewish emigrants had been lifted permanently.

title: Patty Cake Is Resting Well in Hospital
description: Patty Cake, the baby gorilla whose right arm was broken during a family tussle Tuesday, was reported to be resting comfortably in isolation in a baby's crib in the Bronx Zoo hospital yesterday.

title: Basic Payments Deficit Lessened in 4th Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The deficit in the basic balance of payments in the United States lessened in the final quarter of last year. For the year as a whole it was $9.2billion, almost unchanged from the $9.3billion of 1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Seiling Loss Imperils Ranger Defense, Playoff Hopes
