description: CHICAGO, March 28  Two Republican Aldermen, Casimir J. Staszcuck and Joseph Potempa, were indicted today by a Federal grand jury for allegedly extorting $9,000 each in payments for obtaining favorable City Council actions on property rezoning.

title: M'CORD REPORTED TO GIVE SENATORS SIGNIFICANT DATA
description: WASHINGTON, March 28James W. McCord Jr., in a carefully guarded closed session today, provided the Senate's select committee on the Watergate conspiracy with information that was described by one Senator as significant.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 The State Department announced today that the Arena Stage Company would put on Our Town and Inherit the Wind during its visit to the Soviet Union this fallthe first dramatic presentations in the 15year history of the SovietAmerican cultural exchange. The department said it was hopeful that eventually plays produced by other American theater groups also could be shown to Soviet audiences.

title: Andretti Escapes Injury As Car Hits Wall in Test
description: INDIANAPOLIS, March 28 (UPI)Mario Andretti escaped injury today when his car hit a wall during tire tests at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS AGENCY'S PENALTY
description: WASHINGTON, March 28In a decision strengthening the authority of Government administrators, the Supreme Court overruled a lower court today and reinstated a penalty imposed on a dishonest stockyard operator by the Department of Agriculture.

title: LEGISLATORS PASS THE STATE BUDGET
description: ALBANY, March 28  The State Legislature approved an $8.77billion state budget tonight in voting that generally followed party lines as the Republican majority rejected Democratic demands for an immediate tax cut as imprudent and premature.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 72hour northeaster last week washed out more sand from New Jersey's beaches than any storm since 1962.

title: Market Place: Share Bonuses Under Scrutiny
description: Those performance share plans under which corporate executives get free shafes for the achievement of earnings goals or, in some cases, merely for making important contributions to the company's success are beginning to come to the attention of shareholders.

title: Nixon Sets Cancer Month
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)President Nixon today designated April as Cancer Control Month to give new emphasis to this serious problem and, to encourage the detenntnation of the American people to meet it. In his proclamation, requested by Congress, Mr. Nixon urged that all Americans reaffirm during the Month our nation's strong commitment to control cancer.

title: BISHOP SCARLETT OF MISSOURI DIES
description: The Right Rev. William J. Scarlett, Bishop of the Protestant Episcopal Diocese of Missouri from 1930 to 1952 and a social and theological liberal, died yesterday at, Boston HospiItal: He was 80 years old and had lived for many years at Castine, Me.

title: Top Me First at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., March 28 (AP)Top Me won the $2,400 Arlington Pace today at Freehold Raceway, returning $5.80, $3.20 and $3 for $2 across the board.

title: Pompidou Will Retain Messmer as His Premier
description: PARIS, March 28  Pierre Messmer was reappointed Premier today after the cabinet submitted its resignation to President Pompidou.

title: Scribner Leaves Office For Terminal Vacation
description: There were no unusual goodbys yesterday when Dr. Harvey B. Scribner left his office at the Board of Education headquarters in downtown Brooklyn, but it was probably the last regular day in office for the 58yearold School Chancellor.

title: COURT BACKS LIMITS FOR SIZE OF HOUSING
description: TRENTON, March 28 (UPI)A state appeals court ruled in a Clifton case today that municipalities had the authority to regulate the size of housing units under their health and welfare powers.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A week agoaddled perhaps by a warm wind that brought with it the sweet aroma of an awakening salt marshthis writer predicted that migrating striped bass would arrive off Cape Cod and the outlying islands much earlier than usual.

title: Screen: Nurevev in 'I Am a Dancer:Beast/Classicist Aspect of Dancer Is Ignored
description: Rudolf Nureyev  onstageis both magnificent beast and great classicist. It is this animal quality held in check by superb discipline that makes hs performances so exciting. No other ballet dancer has this tension of leashed power straining against schooled excellence.Yet this is not the Nureyev you will see in "I Am a Dancer," a firm that attempts to show his versatility in four types of ballets, but perversely ignores the base upon which his reputation rests.For ultimately Nureyev will be remembered not only for the high technical standard of male dancing he brought to the West from Russia in 1961, but as a great clascial dancer in the 19th century ballet classics.Something of the excitement Nureyev can bring to these old ballets flickers through the last minute of this film. He is seen leaping around the stage in a performance of the Royal Ballet's "Sleeping Beauty." All the splendor and brilliance of the classical ballet tradition is there and Nureyev is part of it.This is what Pierre Jourdan, the French director of this French-British production, fails to demonstrate, perhaps because he does not really understand the one full ballet and three excerpts in which he presents Nureyev so uncharacteristically.The first sequence is from "La Sylphide," an 1836 Romantic ballet by the Danish choreographer Auguste Bournonville, in which Nureyev and Carla Fracci, one of today's best Sylphides, establish no rapport whatsoever. "La Sylphide" has only recently entered Nureyev's repertory, and it was perhaps unwise to record him in a Bournonville ballet. This is a delicate work that depends on image more than on virtuosity, and the camera wrongly stresses footwork over atmosphere.A more tedious ballet, paradoxically, provides the film with moments of great interest. Nureyev, now quite anxious to move into the modern-dance field, is seen rehearsing a duet with Deanne Bergama from "Field Figures," by the contemporary American choreographer Glen Tetley, and he brings to it an overwhelming physicality. Of course, all this huffing and puffing is unnecessary, but his refusal to spare himself or his body is absolutely fascinating.There is a hint of what makes Nureyev Nureyev in the complete filmed version of Sir Frederick Ashton's "Marguerite and Armand." Yet Ashton is too good a choreographer to be judged by this schmaltzy reworking or "Camille," and Nureyev and Dame Margot Fonteyn, acting and dancing their hearts out, have more to offer in ballet than hand-wringing and cape-flinging. Having chosen a literary ballet, the film underscores its weakness by providing it with narration.In the fourth sequence, Lynn Seymour and Nureyev appear to be greeted with canned applause in dancing the grand pas de deux of "Sleeping Beauty" on an empty stage ordinarily filled with other dancers. This was Mr. Jourdan's chance to show Nureyev at his best. But the resplendence of a famous ballet showpiece is destroyed through a shabby and dark setting.The dance sequences are linked by offstage glimpses of Nureyev, replete with the nonsense non-Russians say about Russians (for instance, the idea that Nureyev's international bookings can be traced to the nomadic instinct of his Tartar ancestry). Nothing is to be gleaned about Nureyev's personal life here, but he does seem to be a regular fellow in Fonteyn's and Ashton's presence.There is one wonderful flash of spontaeity as he clears a way among his fans by swatting them with a long-stemmed rose. Nureyev is one of those people who make the world more interesting than it often is. Even a bad film about him can't all that bad."I Am a Dancer" opened yesterday at the Ziegfeld Theater.

title: Bolshoi May Get Into the Spirit of '76
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 By coincidence, 1976 marks not only the 200th anniversary of the American Revolution, but also the 200th anniversary of the Soviet Union's Bolshoi Theater.

title: Ray of Hope for Ulster
description: The two most representative political forces of Northern Ireland's Catholic and Protestant communities have given qualified approval to Britain's White Paper. These developments do not mean that volatile Ulster is at last on a fixed course toward stability and peace; but coupled with other recent events, they give badly needed momentum to the British proposals and revive hope for a gradual evolution from current deadlock and bloodshed.

title: A 4TH NEWSPAPER CONSIDERED HERE
description: Plans are advancing for a new afternoon newspaper in New York City.

title: ELLSBERG JURY TOED OF TAPPING
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28Wiretapping on a grand, international scale is an accepted fact of diplomatic life, a detense witness testified today at the Pentagon papers trial.

title: Fannie Mae Resumes Issue Of 12Month Commitments
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (Reuters)  The Federal National Mortgage Association announced today that it would resume the issuance of 12month convertible standby commitments on April 2. Fannie Mae suspended the issuance of these commitments on March 20 due to unsettled market conditions.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: Bangkok  Thanomjit Suithothal, Thailand, outpointed Choi Yongho, South Korea, 10 rounds, bantamweights.

title: Advertising: A Gambler's World
description: Lawrence Bernard played his cards very close to his vest recently when he announced the formation of the Leisure and Recreation Group, whose first project was to be a magazine.

title: BOGGS, MISS POTTER TAKE DIVING CROWNS
description: PITTSBURGH, March 28 (AP) Air Force Lieut. Phil Boggs captured first place in the men's three  meter diving and tiny Cynthia Potter, who broke her foot in practice before the Olympics, took first in the women's open  meter diving tonight in the national Amateur Athletic Union indoor championships at the University of Pittsburgh.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
LAURIN SADDLES AQUEDUCT VICTOR
description: Lucien Laurin, the crack trainer who has the Kentucky Derby favorite, Secretariat, under his charge, is seeking to expand his hopedfor domination of the 3yearold thoroughbred scene. He saddled the Hilistead Farin's Voler for yesterday's feature race at Aqueduct, and the filly scampered to a 4length victory in the sixfurlong sprint.

title: WIFE SAYS BANK WEED A LOAN
description: NEWARK, March 28A financially independent lawyer complained to the New Jersey Division on Civil Rights today that she could not get a bank loan without her husband's signature.

title: College Marks Birthday of First Novel
description: PURCHASE, N.Y., March 28 The state college here turned out today to wish happy birthday tot the English novelspecifically, happy birthday to Master F. J., whose fictitious amorous adventures, chronicled by George Gascoigne exactly 400 years ago, provided the plot for what many authorities regard as the first novel ever written in English.

title: Open Theater Presents a Splendid Mutation Show
description: The joy in theater comes through discovery and the capacity to discover, writes Joseph Chaikin, founder and director of the Open Theater, in his book, The Presence of the Actor. And later, in reference to the creation of the Open Theater's The Mutation Show, he adds, The more baffled and astonished we permit ourselves to be, the more we discover and learn. in the case of The Mutation Show, the joy and the discovery belong to us as well as to the Open Theater.

title: People in Sports: No, Thanks
description: Fred Taylor ended two weeks of speculation yesterday when he announced, he had turned, down an offer from Noithwestern University and would remain as basketball coach at Ohio State.

title: ECONOMIC THREAT IS SEEN IN MIDEAST
description: LONDON, March 28A survey by the International Institute for Strategic Studies found that the threat of the burgeoning power and changing tactics of Middle Eastern oilproducing countries seemed to overshadow almost all military threats to North America, Europe and Japan.

title: Personal Finance
description: Genevieve Pietro has found an answer to a question that must have puzzled many widows: Who is responsible for the mortgage on jointly owned property after a husband dies?

title: Cocker Spaniels Find Home Abroad
description: Fifteen years ago, Mrs. Franceise Firminhac bought a pair of American cocker spaniel's and became the first Frenchwoman to register the breed in her native land.

title: TV: A.B.C. ReCreates Pueblo Story
description: As the second production in the ABC Theater series, Pueblo will be shown this evening, from 9 o'clock to 11, on the network of th American Broadcasting Company. The play was originally produced at the Erera Stage in Washington.

title: Indians Said to Block Surrender by 100
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., March 28One hundred of the Indians holding the historic hamlet of Wounded Knee have offered to surrender, a Government spokesman said today, but hardcore dissidents, vowing to die, are said to be keeping them in the village at gunpoint.

title: C.I.A. Aide Says He Gave AntiAllende Plan to I.T .T.
description: WASHINGTON, March 28An official of the Central Intelligence Agency has testified that in 1970 he proposed to the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation a series of steps that it And other American companies might take to create enough economic instability in Chile to prevent the election of Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens as President.

title: Sharp Decline in Earnings Reported by Halsey, Stuart
description: Halsey, Stuart & Co., the investment banking subsidiary of the Lincoln National Corporation, saw its earnings drop sharply in 1972 to $203,000 from $2.1million 1971, the annual report of the parent company disclosed yesterday. Revenues declined to $13.5million from $18.1million.

title: ExCounsel to Nixon Is Sought as Lawyer
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 At a dinner party here not long ago, an old hand in this city's legal circles was talking about a fellow lawyer who tells clients he has connections at the White House.

title: Jersey's SchoolBus Schedules Will Be Planned by a Computer
description: TRENTON, March 28The operations of New Jersey's gest passenger carrier, the reau of Pupil Transportation of the Department of Education, have become so complex that they are being turned over to a computer program that promises to save time and+money.

title: Sinkholes a Problem for Alabama
description: At about 2 P.M. Dec. 2 Hershel Byrd heard a terrifying roar and the sound Of snapping trees. His house, near Montevallo, Ala., began shaking, and he ran out to see if a tornado was approaching.

title: MALAYSIA REPORTED PLANNING HANOI TIE
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, March 28Malaysia, in keeping with her policy of evenhanded relations with all power blocs, will recognize North Vietnam in the next few days, according to Foreign Ministry sources.

title: Loews Opens Hamburg Unit
description: Loews Hotels, Inc., announced yesterday that it opened West Germany's tallest hotel  32 storiesin Hamburg yesterday. The 570room hotel is Loews' first operation on the European continent.

title: Concorde, in Hangar Mishap In England, Smashes Rudder
description: BRISTOL, England, March 28 (Reuters)The rudder of the Britishbuilt Concorde 002 prototype was smashed against the top of a hangar today as the huge supersonic airliner was being towed out for tests.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 300,000 common shares of the Piedmont Natural Gas Company at $17 a share was made yesterday by White Weld & Co. The company's stock closed unchanged at 17 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Crews Down to Five
description: KEARNY, N.J., March 28Competing in high school crew is no easy task in New Jersey.

title: Injured Chaney Expected To Play in Celtics' Opener
description: BOSTON, March 28 (UPI)The team physician for the Boston Celtics reported tonight that Don Chaney would probably be able to play next Sunday when the Celtics open their playoff series with the Atlanta Hawks.

title: A NEW CONSTITUTION PROPOSED IN SWEDEN
description: STOCKHOLM, March 28The Swedish Government made public today its proposals for a constitution that would remove the King's residual powers but retain him as chief of state, lower the voting age from 19 to 18 and guarantee citizens the right to hold demonstrations.

title: N.C.A.A. Gets a Question: Why Are Only Blacks Investigated?
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)  Senator Marlow W. Cook, Republican of Kentucky, accused the National Collegiate Athletic Association today of limiting its player eligibility investigations to black athletes only. Cook urged a House education subcommittee to demand that the N.C.A.A. answer questions about its criteria for investigation.

title: Mayor Names Backer to Head Tax Panel
description: Alfred J. Ranieri, a Bronx lawyer who got his job on the city's Tax Commission through the intervention of his local John V. Lindsay Association coordinator, was elevated yesterday by Mayor Lindsay to the acting presidency of the commission.

title: Wagner, Wary of Impending Dogfight, Indicates He'll Probably Stay Out of the Democratic Primary
description: Three days after he ruled out a mayoral candidacy under Republican banners, Robert F. Wagner indicated yesterday that he was also inclined to pass up the Democratic mayoral primary.

title: 6Man Advance U.S. Team To Head for China Saturday
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (Reuters)An advance United States team will leave for China on Saturday to make errangements for the opening of the new United States liaison office in Peking in May, the State Dtpartment announced today.

title: British Football
description: WORLD CUP

title: CON ED IS WARNED TO AGREE ON A PACT
description: James Joy Jr., business manager for Utility Workers Local 12, waraned Consolidated Edison yesterday that his union must have a contract settlement by noon tomorrow to avert a strike threatened for midnight Saturday.

title: Fumes in Baker Street
description: Holmes and I were seated in our Baker Street rooms in a blue funk, he swabbing his dottle with cocaine whilst I watched Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce playing Holmes and myself on the telly.

title: Bhutto Facing Pakistan's Worst Crisis Since War
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 28  Amid increasing turmoil and an Opposition boycotf, President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto is facing his most serious political crisis since taking over this deeply troubled nation in December, 1971.

title: Senate Votes LowCost Disaster Loans
description: WASHINGTON, March 28President Nixon's economic priorities were challenged anew today as the Senate voted to reinstate temporarily a lowinterest emergency loan program the Administration halted abruptly last December.

title: Steel Union Weighs No Strike Plan
description: PITTSBURGH, March 28  A plan designed to eliminate strikes and crisis bargaining was presented here today by the executive board of the United Steelworkers Union.

title: COLLEGE IS ACCUSED OF POOR ACCOUNTING
description: ALBANY, March 28 (AP) 22 The office of State Comptroller Arthur Levitt has found that financial preocedures and records of North Country Community College in Saranac Lake were inadequate from 1966 to 1971.

title: Orioles Savor 43 Victory, But Yankees Win a Dinner
description: MIAMI, March 28  Earl Weaver and Frank Cashen, Baltimore's manager and general manager, respectively, watched their team take the lead in this year's Gold Coast championship tonight, then took their Yankee counterparts to dinner as the payoff for last year's spring series outcome.

title: Frigitemp and 4 Aides Enjoined From Violations on Stock Sales
description: WASHINGTON, March 28On a complaint by the Secunities and Exchange Commission today, Federal District Judge George L. Halt Jr. enjoined the Frigitemp Corporation and four of its officers from violating the registration and antifraud provpions of the Federal sechrities laws.

title: Good Riddance
description: Quietly and in no evident fear of an uprising, President Nixon has done to the Subversive Activities Control Board and the Internal Security Division of the Justice Department what Presidents Kennedy and Johnson did not quite dare to do. He has killed themthe first by dropping it entirely from the budget, the second by simple order of his Attorney General.

title: Seaway's Opening Earliest
description: MONTREAL, March 28 (AP) The St. Lawwrence Seaway marked its earliest opening date today. The seaway's 14th season was inaugurated when the first shipthe British freighter David Marquess  passe through the St. Lambert Lock near Montreal shortly before noon.

title: STATE TAX URGED FOR SCHOOL FUNDS
description: A television poll of civic activists throughout New York, New Jersey and Connecticut shows that. 64 per cent of those questioned favor statewide taxes to replace the financing of schools through local property taxes.

title: Bruins Top Rangers, Clinch Second Place
description: With hockey's finest forward putting in the goals, and a 44yearold netminder keeping out the opposition's, the Boston Bruins clinched second place in the National Hockey League's East Division last night by defeating the Rangers, 63.

title: 3Horse Stable Owner Playing Numbers Game
description: WESTBURY, LI., March 28 Considering that Elden Turcotte has only a threehorse stable at Roosevelt Raceway these days, the 31yearold Canadianraised trainer has been faring surprisingly well.

title: Manville Plans Record Expenditures
LEGISLATORS PASS THE STATE BUDGET
description: ALBANY, March 28  The State Legislature approved an $8.77billion state budget tonight in voting that generally followed party lines as the Republican majority rejected Democratic demands for an immediate tax cut as imprudent and premature.

title: Philippines Using Malaria Mosquitoes to Fight Rebels
description: ZAMBOANGA, the Philippines, March 25 The commander of Philippine Government forces fighting Moslem guerrillas in this area said today that routine antimalaria spraying had been stopped on a large guerrillaheld island south of Mindanao so that malarial mosquitoes would thrive and help debilitate the rebels there.

title: VISITORS TO BERLIN REPORT GUN BATTLE
description: BERLIN, March 28Wtsterners traveling through East Germany reported today that they bad witnessed a gun battle in the Thuringian mountains, apparently between Soviet Army deserters and Soviet military policemen. There were reports that at least one military poIiceman had been killed.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Council Committee on Civil Service and Labor approved a measure yesterday giving the city's 5,100 auxiliary policemen and policewomen a $75ayear uniform allowance if they put in at least 126 hours the preceding year.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, March 28 (AP)The United States dollar gained in world money markets today. Gold weakened.

title: Clark Gives the Bullets Firepower and Defense
description: Archie Clark's professional life has been one of almost constant turmoil. In five of his seven National Basketball Association seasons he was either the other guard with Jerry West at Los Angeles or with Hal Greer at Philadelphia.

title: Caliber Becomes 5th Candidate Seeking Controller Nomination
description: State Senator Joseph L. Galiber formally entered the crowded race for the Democratic nomination for City Controller yesterday with a promise to seek performance and accountability at every level of government.

title: U.S. DROPS SEARCH FOR 61 LOST AT SEA
description: The Coast Guard announced yesterday the suspension of its search for two Norwegian freighters and their 61 missing crewmen, pending further developments.

title: Trevino Returning to the Golf Trail Today for a Crack at Greensboro's Gold
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 28Over a course still showing effects of last week's snow, the $210,000 Greater Greensboro open starts tomorrow with Lee Trevino returning to competition. After a twoweek tour absence, Trevino is in the field of 147 that will play the Sedgefield Country Club layout under winter regulations.

title: Books of The Times
description: MACAULAY. The Shaping of the Historian. By John Clive. 499, pages. Illustrated. Knopf. $15.

title: WOMEN'S BASKETBALL A.A.U., AT GALLUP, N.M.
description: Second Round

title: STOCKS ATTEMPT TO SUSTAIN RALLY
description: The stock market tried valiantly to sustain its twodayold rally yesterday and almost lost the battle before buying interest perked up late in the afternoon and enabled most price indicators to close virtually unchanged.

title: CANADIENS DOWN BLACK HAWKS, 43
description: MONTREAL, March 28 (UPI) Jacques Lemaire and Frank Mahovlich scored: in the third period tonight to lead the Montreat Canadiens to a 43 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Policeman Is Sentenced
description: A plainclothes policeman who was said to have sought a payoff from a Harlem numbers entrepreneur was sentenced yesterday to a year in prison. Charles Lee, 40 years old, of 1909 Amsterdam Avenue had been convicted by a jury last January of firstdegree perjury, for which he could have been sentenced to as much as seven years. He was continued free on bail pending appeal.

title: American Airlines Asks 20% Cut in Excursion Fares
description: American Airlines proposed yesterday to cut the cost of excursion fares across the country by more than 20 per cent.

title: L.I. CONCERNS GET SPACE CONTRACTS
description: In a decision that will mean an infusion of at least $53million into the ailing economy of Long Island, two aeropsace companies there have been chosen to build the wings and tail fin for the nation's manned spaceshuttle vehicle.

title: PACE GRADUATES TO A UNIVERSITY
description: Pace College capped its 67year climb from humble origins as a trade school to the top rung in higher education yesterday when the State Board of Regents designated it a fullfledged university.

title: Arthur Daley
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 28His reputation as a redneck had been earned. For seven years, the shorttempered Lou Piniella had gone fuming through the minor leagues, leaving behind him a trail of broken bats, cracked helmets and kicked water coolers. Managers kept inspecting him in spring training before dispatching him to the minors with the empty promise: We'll keep an eye on you.

title: More Hearings Scheduled On Wetlands' Development
description: TRENTON, March 28 (AP) The State Department of Environmental Protection announced today it would hold public hearings on April 6 and April 19 on proposed regulations to restrict development of 6,600 acres of wetlands in Mercer and Camden Counties.

title: Needham Finds Brokers Losing Money This Year
description: Member firms of the New York Stock Exchange lost money in the aggregate during the first two months of 1973, compared with a net profit of about $250million in the same period last year, a closed meeting of New York Stock Exchange members was informed late yesterday.

title: Nixon Plans to Unify Drug Enforcement Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, March 28President Nixon sent to Congress today a reorganization plan designed to make the Government's allout global war on the drug menace as well organized as the heroin traffickers who elude Federal agents every day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The recent introduction of a State Assembly bill by Republican Charles D. Henderson and Democrat Stanley Steingut to restore free tuition at State University could not have come at a better time. With the Keppel Commission's report still being debated and discussed, one wonders if the way both city and state universities could have parity would be for neither system to charge tuition.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 29, 1973

title: Chinese U.N. Diplomats Turn Out for Preview Fete at Museum
description: The Chinese diplomats a the United Nations, as virtu ally everybody knows bynow, are what's socially fas cinating in New York these days, and they don't make many public appearances Last night, however, 10 of them were lured to the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: TRADING IS HALTED IN EQUITY FUNDING
description: Trading in the securities of the Equity Funding Corporation of America was suspended for 10 days yesterday by the Securities and Exchange Commission following a sharp decline in the company's stock.

title: Koch Abandons Mayoral Race, Citing Trouble in Raising Funds
description: Unable to raise enough money to give him a chance of winning, Representative Edward I. Koch said yesterday that he was withdrawing as a candidate for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: Disaster Aid for 2 Counties
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (UPI)Thomas S. Kleppe, administrator bf the Small Business Administration, announced today that the agency would make disaster loans available to flood and storm victims in the Alabama and Mississippi counties designated by the Office of Emergency Preparedness.

title: 49 More Americans Free; One a Prisoner Since '65
description: CLARK AIR BASE, The Philippines, Thursday, March 29The Communists freed 49 more American prisoners in Hanoi yesterday, including a charter pilot held since 1965, one of the civilian American prisoners held Iongest by the Vietcong.

title: TaxExempt Rates Decline As New Bonds Sell Rapidly
description: Interest rates on local government bonds declined yesterday as the taxexempt sector outper ??med the rest of the ??ed  income se??ties markets. Most new taxexempt bond issues sold rapidly, and most of the bonds reportedly were sold to investors and not just to bond dealers who planned to try offer them later at higher prices. The Los Angeles Department of Airports sold a $20million revenue bond issue, and Salomon Brothers, the manager of the winning underwriting syndicate, reported the bonds entirely sold.

title: L.I. Girl, 2, Burned to Death
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., March 28 (UPI)  A 2yearold girl was burned to death today while apparently playing with matches in the back seat of an abandoned car parked in an alley. in Hempstead. Capt. William Meddis, commander of the Nassau County police homicide squad, said an effort to rescue the girl, Latisha Ricks, had failed because the interior of the car was completely engulfed in flames. She had lived at 96 Mason Street.

title: SQUIRES TOP NETS IN SEASON FINALE
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 28 Julius Erving made his debut as a coach today and masterminded the Virginia Squires to a 121106 victory over the New York Nets in the American Basketball Association's season finale tonight.

title: ExG.I. Says Neglect Cost Him an Eye
description: A former infantryman who served in Vietnam charged yesterday that he had lost an eye damaged in combat after the Veterans Administration denied him medical treatment because he had an undesirable discharge from the Army.

title: Saigon Eases Curfew And Lifts Nightclub Ban
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 28Despite the continuing dim outlook for peace in Vietnam, a certain relaxation has begun to appear in the austere life of the country as the first two months of the ceasefire come to an end.

title: Aussies Stop West Indians And Take 10 Cricket Lead
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, March 28, (Reuters)Australia snatched victory from the West Indies in the third cricket test today, winning by 44 runs and taking a 10 lead in the fivematch series. The first two matches were drawn.

title: RICHARDSON SEES CLEAR AUTHORITY TO BOMB CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 secretary of Defense Elliot L. Richardson maintained today that the President had clear constitutional authority to continue bombing in Cambodia to clean up a lingering corner of the war.

title: Test Missile Destroyed
description: WHITE SANDS, N. M., March 28 (AP)An Air Force Hounddog missile launched from a B52 over Green River, Utah, today was destroyed in a test flight because of a malfunction, officials of the White Sands Missile Range said.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FROM THE LATIN A new opera opens tonight, in concert version, with two performances, at 8 and midnight, at Carnegie Hall, Seventh Avenue and 57th Street (CI 77459). It's about a blind and deaf young man, but, no, it's not Tommy, the rock opera done not long ago by The Who. It's Hommy, and it's in a Latin vein, both traditional and salsa, or pop and rock, from the pen of Larry Harlow, who knows the Latin score.

title: 2 Cash Boxes With $11,900 Missing From Savings Bank
description: Two cash boxes containing $11,900 were discovered missing from the Harlem Savings Bank branch at 3815 Broadway, at Fort Washington Avenue, the police reported yesterday.

title: Cuban Studies Center Here Is Damaged by Explosion
description: An explosion last night rocked the thirdfloor headquarters of the Center for Cuban Studies at 186 West Fourth Street, in Greenwich Village, causing extensive damage but no reported injuries.

title: U.S. Study Is Planned Of Commodity Authority
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Senator Richard Clark, Democrat of Iowa, said today that the General Accounting Office would soon begin a through study of the Federal agency that regulates the commodity market.

title: Jewish Congress Opens Drive To Reach Youth on the Campus
description: WASHINGTON, March 28In a move to narrow the gap pus, the American Jewish Conbetween community and camgress initiated today a project entitled Outreach that will bring to Jewish college students challenging information and insights about the contemporary Jewish experience by noted Jewish scholars.

title: Notes on People
description: Four of the recently released prisoners of the war in Vietnam have been selected for promotion to general or admiral, the Defense Department announced. Named for promotion to brigadier general were two Air Force colonels John P. Flynn and David W. Winn. Selected for promotion to rear admiral were two Navy captains, Jeremiah A. Denton and James B. Stockdale. The promotions, the Defense Department said, have been approved by President Nixon and sent to the Senate for confirmation.

title: THOMAS J. O'REILLY
description: Thomas 3. O'Reilly, who retired in 1956 after many years on the legal staff of Texaco, Inc., died at Montefiore Hospital on Tuesday. He was 84 years old and lived at 2869 Bainbridge Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Prices of Meat Futures Tumble
description: Fears of possible Federal action to restrain retail prices and the threat of a consumer boycott of meat next week combined yesterday to further unsettle the nation's commodities markets.

title: 12Year Sentence Reported For Ukrainian Dissident
description: LONDON, March 28Vyacheslav Chornovil, a leading Ukrainian dissident, has reportedly been sentenced, to 12 years' imprisonment and exile on charges of antiSoviet agitation and propaganda. According to information brought by travelers, he was tried in closed court at Lvov and sentenced late last month.

title: Test for the Governor
description: If Governor Rockefeller has as much political stubbornness as he is credited with, the Legislature's action to delay the recommendations of the Adirondack Park Agency gives him a fine opportunity to exercise that attribute in the public good. He has forthrightly opposed the bill; now that it has been passed by both houses, he should veto it without a qualm.

title: Appalachia's Hillbillies Trek North for Jobs
description: DETROIT, March 28The song is sweetly plaintive, almost mournful, its melody suggesting downhome woods and fields, its rhythm just upbeat enough to avoid depression. It can be very affecting to, the transplanted Kentuckians, Tennesseeans, West Virginians and other white Appalachian folk whose feelings it expresses.

title: RICHARDSON SEES CLEAR AUTHORITY TO BOMB CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Secretary of Defense Elliot L. Richardson maintained today that the President had clear constitutional authority to continue bombing in Cambodia to clean up a lingering corner of the war.

title: Key Watergate Figure
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 Ever since the police arrested five men inside the headquarters of the Democratic National Committee last June, investigators and the curious have been asking questions about themparticularly about the chief of the breakin squad, James Walter McCord Jr. Who was McCord working for? What was his role at the Committee for the Reelection of the President? How much did he know about who ordered the Watergate operation? Where did he come from?

title: STRIKE THREATENED AS PATH TALKS FAIL
description: Railway carmen broke off negotiations with the Port Authority Trans  Hudson railway system last night and threatened to strike at midnight Saturday.

title: 2 Months of Truce: Questions and Its Results
description: WASHINGTON, March 28Two months have passed since the Vietnam ceasefire agreement was signed on Jan. 27 in Paris. Following are questions and answers on how the accord has affected the situation in Indochina.

title: Warkentin Wins Decathlon; 2Day Total 7,612 Points
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., March 28 (UPI)John Warkentin of the Southern California Striders captured the United States Track and Field Federation decathlon with 7,612 points today. Roger George of Fresno State was second with 7,557 points.

title: Vietnam Peace Hope Dim As the Last G.I.'s Leave
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 28The 60day first phase of the Vietnam ceasefire came to an end today with fighting continuing, peacekeeping machinery in a state of disarray and the prospects for real peace in South Vietnam apparently remote.

title: Fasco International Buys 1.1 Million Talcott Shares
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier, has purchased about 1.1 million shares of the Talcott National Corporation, which through its subsidiary is primarily engaged in financing and factoring.

title: Inventors Display Latest Gizmos and Widgets
description: Anyone for glassfiber tombstones, selflighting cigarettes, fog eliminators or zipper pullers?

title: SAVINGS BANK ADS HAW CRITICISN
description: Harry W. Albright Jr., the New York State Superintendent of Banks, sharply criticized yesterday some of, the advertising practices of a number of the largest mutual savings banks in the stateincluding by inference, the Bowery Savings Bank the nation's largest.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: The Dance
description: The Negro Ensemble, Company opened its fourweek Dance and Music Festival on Tuesday evening at the St. Marks Playhouse with the Morse Donaldson Dance Theater, it also offered an unexpected bonus, Gylan Kain declaiming some of his verse.

title: Planning Unit Holds Hearing In Queens on Zoning Changes
description: At its first meeting outside the City Hall area, the City Planning Commission yesterday ended its hearings on several proposed map and zoning changes in Queens.

title: ExP.O.W. in Auto Crash
description: PARIS, Tenn., March 28 (AP) Maj. Robert Peel of the Air Force, a former prisoner of war in Vietnam, apparently, fell asleep at the wheel and crashed his new $10,000 sports car against a utility pole early today, the Tennessee Highway Patrol aid. Patrolmen said that Major Peel had not been seriously injured and hed been released from Henry County General Hospital after treatment. The car, an Italianmade Pantera, was wrecked.

title: Steel Trade Unit Outlines Program to Cut Red Tape
description: The steel industry in North America took steps yesterday to do, away with much of the red tape that goes with its sales efforts.

title: CITIZENS QUESTION CLEANAIR TACTICS
description: Doubts were raised here yesterday about whether airpollutioncontrol officials had the political power to reduce autoniobile traffic and implement other controversial strategies designed to bring healthful air back to the region.

title: A Fatal Vacuum In Congress
description: Take your choice, declares the United States Chamber of Commerce in fullpage newspaper ads. Control spending or raise taxes. That, the ads continue, is how President Nixon laid it on the line to Congress and the American people.

title: Opera: Neblett's Poppea
description: In importing Monteverdi's L'Incoronazione di Poppea from the Caramoor Festival, where it was staged in 1968 by Gerald Freedman, the New York City Opera made a great contribution to New York's musical life. But the current version at the State Theater, also staged by Mr. Freedman, not only misses the charm and simplicity of the outdoor production but also makes so many stylistic miscalculations that even the extraordinary richness of Carol Neblett's singing as Poppea does not compensate for the production's failings.

title: F. W. Dodge Charts February Record
description: A big gain in nonresidential building in February increased the Dodge index of construction contract value to a high of 191, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday. The seasonally adjusted index, which is based on 1967 as 100, advanced 6 per cent above the January index of 181.

title: Assembly Approves Bill That Would Order Pharmacies to Post Prices of 150 Prescription Drugs
description: ALBANY, March 28  The Assembly passed and sent to the Senate today a bill that would require every pharmacy to post, a state list of the 150 most frequently ordered prescription drugs and the pharmacy's current retail prices.

title: Protesters Here Say Archdiocese Ignores Needs of Hispanic Groups
description: A committee of priests and lay people charged at a news conference yesterday that the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York was ignoring the needs of its Spanishspeaking parishioners, although they constituted more than half of the 1.8 million people in the archdiocese.

title: Tribute to Rachmaninoff
description: The list of musical marriages that are made in heaven would surely include that of the Philadelphia Orchestra and Sergei Rachmaninoff. The latter was closely associated with the orchestra as a composer (it gave the world or American premieres of several of his works), pianist (he made all his orchestral and concerto recordings with it) and conductor (his American debut as a conductor was made with it in 1909). He called it my very favorite orchestra.

title: Chess: Enduring Strengths Are Fine, But Ephemeral Mate Is Best
description: When Siegbert Tarrasch remarked, more than a halfcentury ago, that before the end game, the gods have placed the middle game, he was objecting to the snobbery of ultrapositional chess. Its extreme partisans, both in Tarrasch's day and in our own, are addicted to the view that enduring advantages (in pawn structure or material) are somehow superior to ephemeral ones (in development, mobility or mating force).

title: Navigation Season Opens On St. Lawrence Seaway
description: CHICAGO, March 28 (AP)The navigation season on the St. Lawrence Seaway opened today, and Great Lakes grain shippers applauded the earliest opening in its 14year history.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Mideast: New Era in the Ancient Struggle
description: TEL AVIV  Should Israel be a Jewish state, or a state with a mixed population? Of course, there will never again be a Jewish state without Arab. minorities. We cannot even think about such an eventuality. An Arab minority has become part and parcel of the reality of this land, just as Jerusalemholy to all religionsexists and remains, and it would be unthinkable for us to consider our title to a united Jerusalem without taking into consideration members of other faiths who, like ourselves, regard Jerusalem as holy.

title: Hogan and vanden Heuvel Give Preview of Campaign
description: A preview of the debate to come between District Attorney Frank S. Hogan and William L vanden Heuvel as they battle each other for the Democratic nomination for the office of Manhattan District Attorney emerged yesterday as each of the men held news conferences in their campaign headquarters.

title: PENTAGON ASKING FUNDS FOR B52'S
description: WASHINGTON, March 28Enthusiastic about the unexpected usefulness the B52 bomber demonstrated in the Indochina war, the Pentagon is seeking nearly $200millon to extend the life of about five squadrons to preserve the plane's nonnuclear capability through the nineteenseventies.

title: A CUSTOMS STRIKE IS UNSETTLING ITALY
description: ROME, March 28  Customs inspectors at all Italian frontier points, seaports and airports began a 12day strike today, embarrassing the Government, irking most of the nation's labor leaders, frightening housewives and delighting smugglers.

title: Japan's Premier to Visit Soviet to Meet Brezhnev
description: TOKYO, March 28Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan accepted an invitation today to visit Moscow for a meeting on SovietJapanese relations.

title: People and Business
description: The obligation to insure that financial statements have integrity written between all the lines rests with management, said Reginald H. Jones, chairman of the General Electric Company.

title: Bridge: Visitors to Israel Encounter Old Friends and Competition
description: New York bridge enthusiasts who visit Israel can count on a warm welcome and may meet some old friends, judg ing by the recent experience of Sol Seidman, who has been in the top rank of New York players and administrators for many years.

title: CORD REPORTED TO LINK MITCHELL TO BUGGING PLOT
description: WASHINGTON, March 28James W. McCord Jr. said in a closed Senate hearing today that John N. Mitchell, the for mer Attorney General, had prior knowledge of the Watergate plot, Congressional sources said tonight.

title: PLAN FOR PARADE AROUSES ISRAELIS
description: JERUSALEM, March 28Israel announced plans today for the largest and costliest military parade in her history to commemorate the 25th anniversary of her independence.

title: Out, But Not Out
description: The expected return today of the last American combat troops and prisoners from Vietnam should be an occasion for universal relief and rejoicing, marking the end of the long and anguished United States intervention in Indochina. To most Americans it is inconceivable that this country would again become militarily involved in a regime so remote from any vital national strategic interest.

title: 3 Former G.I.'s Sentenced To 18 Months for Bombing
description: MADISON, Wis., March 28Three former servicemen were sentenced to 18month prison terms today by United States District Judge James E. Doyle for the bombing of Camp McCoy, a Wisconsin Army Reserve training base, in July, 1970.

title: Brandt Said to Invite Brezhnev to Visit West Germany in May
description: BONN, March 28Chancellor Willy Brandt has invited Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, to visit West Germany, a Government source said today.

title: INTEREST PANEL SOON TO RELEASE DUALRATE PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, March 28The Government's Committee on Interest and Dividends plans to announce in two to four weeks guidelines for operation of a new dual prime lending rate for banks and expects the present prime rate of 6 per cent not to be increased in the meantime.

title: MEANY PROPOSES A PRICE ROLLBACK TO LATE 72 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, March 28George Meany, president of the American, Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, asked Congress today to roll back prices to where they were last December to assure labor's cooperation in Phase 3 of the Administration's wageprice stabilization effort.

title: Weicker Says Plot Leader Is Still on Nixon's Staff
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., a Connecticut Republican, said today that the unidentified mastermind of the Watergate plot was still on the White House staff, being protectednot threatened  by selective leaks of secret testimony to Senate investigators.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Negro colleges were born of desperation. They wereand some still are todaysanctuaries against hatred and prejudice. To white racists, they often seemed the symbol of uppity niggers who had so far forgotten their place that they even wanted a college education.

title: Gulf Oil Revises Figures
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that further calculation had shown that 15.25 million shares were actually tendered in acceptable form under the terms of it offer to purchase shares of its capital stock, and that 13 million shares have been accepted. The company announced March 19 tOhat 15.7 million shares had been submitted in response to the offer of Feb. 22.

title: MRS. COURT UPSET BY MISS ROSSOUW
description: TUCSON, Ariz., March 29 (AP)Laura Rossouw upset topseeded Mrs. Margaret Court, 26, 67, 64, today in the second round of the $25,000 Virginia Slims tennis tournament.

title: His Apartment Says Clyde As If You Couldn't Guess
description: A burgundy RollsRoyce with very wide white sidewalls pulled into the driveway of a luxurious East 54th Street apartment building the other day. The license plates bore no numbers, only the initials WCF.

title: NIXON SETS MEAT PRICE CEILINGS AT BOTH WHOLESALE AND RETAIL; ASSERTS COSTS SHOULD GO DOWN
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 President Nixon announced tonight in a nationally televised speech that the Government was imposing price ceilings on beef, pork and lamb effective immediately and for an indefinite period.

title: Two Are Acquitted Of Having Bombs At O.O.P. Meeting
description: MIAMI, March 29  Two members of the Youth International party were acquitted here today by a Federal judge of charges bf illegal possession of firebombs at the Republican National Convention in Miami Beach last August.

title: U.S. Bombing in Cambodia Shakes Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, March 29 (Reuters)Buildings throughout Phnom Penh shook last night and early today as waves of United States B52's struck at suspected concentrations of Communist troops near the city.

title: Births
description: GORMANMr. and Mrs. Cliff Gorman (nee Stevens) announce the birth of a son, Douglas on March 29th, 1973.

title: STEINBERG CONDUCTS BEETHOVEN'S NINTH
description: Beethoven's Ninth Symphony was the major subject of the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra's concert at Carnegie Hall Wednesday night, and, with William Steinberg conducting, there was no need to fear that the integrity and monumentality of the work would be compromised.

title: ICES UP SHARPLY FOR MEAT FUTURES
Retired U.S. Envoy Is Reported, Missing From a Liner at Say
description: LISBON, March 29 (AP)Henry Endicott Stebbins, a retired American diplomat from Milton, Mass., was reported missing at sea and presumed dead today after the Italian liner Leonardo da Vinci docked here.

title: Baseball Transactons
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: U.S. SAID TO SWAY SOVIET ON EXITS
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Kenneth Rush, Deputy Secretary of State, said today that great progress had been made in persuading the Soviet Union to allow the emigration of Jews.

title: RAIDERS LOSE, 53; PLAYOFF BID FAILS
description: HOUSTON, March 29 (AP)Murray Hall collected three goals and an assist tonight, leading the Houston Aeros to a 53 victory over the New York Raiders and a spot in the World Hockey Association West Division playoffs.

title: Japan And Her Neighbors
description: TOKYOIt would appear from a lengthy conversation with Premier Kakuei Tanaka that Japan's current foreign policy is founded on American security guarantees, Chinese friendship and a relationship with Russia where economic potential is mitigated by political coolness. When assessing the views expressed by the present chief of government it is notable that Western Europe doesn't figure large on his horizon.

title: Radicals Blamed for Attica Riot at House Hearing
description: ALBANY, March 29  The chairman of the United States House of Representatives Internal Security Committee said today that he strongly believed revolutionaries were responsible, in part, for the Attica priprison riot in September, 1971, and other prison disturbances.

title: DR. LESLIE STAUBER, ZOOLOGY PROFESSOR
description: PISCATAWAY, N. J., March 29Dr. Leslie A. Stauber, who retired last year as professor of zoology at Rutgers University, where he had earlier headed the zoology department, died Tuesday of a heart attack near his home here. His age was 65.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: OTB Urges Customers to Join Fight Against State TakeOver
description: Seventeen times a day, the Muzak in the city's 107 offtrack betting parlors stops and a recorded voice crackles:

title: A. T. &T. Seeks Domestic Satellite Network
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Company yesterday joined the growing list of applicants seeking to operate a domestic satellite communications network. The giant company filed with the Federal Communications Commission for authority to operate a system that would serve all 50 states plus Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

title: Landes, Dismissed Umpire, Takes Case to N.L.R.B.
description: MILWAUKEE, March 29 (AP) Stan Landes, who claims that the National League dismissed him last fall after 18 years as an umpire because it considered him a troublemaker, said today that he had referred the matter to the National Labor Relations Board.

title: METS WIN FINALE IN ST. PETERSBURG
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 29  The New York Mets used a flurry of good pitching to produce a 21 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals tonight.

title: Ireland's Navy Seizes Vessel With Arms for I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, March 29  The navy of the Irish Republic today seized a ship carrying five tons of arms and ammunition for the Irish Republican Army.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A mild winter and an early spring have blended to make conditions for Sunday's opening of the New York State trout fishing season the most pleasant in several years.

title: Some Vietnamese Bid G.I.'s Fond Farewell
description: CU CHI, South Vietnam, March 29 The olivedrab statue of an American soldier that stood at the crossroads of this town near Saigon tumbled and disappeared recently  blown away by the wind, according to Vietnamese children here.

title: PRESIDENT WARNS HANOI TO COMPLY WITH TRUCE PACT
description: WASHINGTON, March 29President Nixon, in an address to the nation proclaiming the disengagement of United States ground forces from Vietnam, issued a new warning tonight to North Vietnam against failure to comply with the Paris peace agreement.

title: BLACK BUSINESS IS PROMISED AID
description: Stanley S. Scott, a special assistant to President Nixon, said here yesterday that black business ventures would receive more Federal funds, up to $1.2billion, in the coming fiscal year.

title: Bankruptcy Plea Filed By Johnson's Brother
description: AUSTIN, Tex., March 29Sam Houston Johnson, brother of former President Lyndon B. Johnson, filed voluntary bankruptcy proceedings today in Federal Court.

title: Thousands Watch 67 Prisoners Depart
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, March 29As tens of thousands of North Vietnamese watched and smiled and waved, the last 67 American prisoners flew out of Hanoi to freedom today.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on March 29 were:

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 29At the age of 26, Bill Muse is a soccer chauvinist.

title: CONTRACT AWARD
description: WASHINGTON, March 29, (UPI)  The Thiokol Chemical Corporation of Bristol, Pa., received today a $6.9 million contract from the Labor Department to continue work at a Jobs Corps Center at Clearfield, Utah.

title: S.E.C. White Paper Seeks Stock MarketRestructure
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The Securities and. Exchange Commission today unveiled its master plan to restructure the nation's securities markets. Its aim is to establish central market system. The system would encompass a network of brokers and dealers in offices and on exchange floors across the nation, linked together by electronic communication.

title: A BudgetMinded Casserole
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Guitarist for Rock Group Accused of Having Drugs
description: Jerry Garcia, the lead guitarist for the Grateful Dead rock group, was arrested in Mount Laurel, N. J., Tuesday evening and charged with possession of a wide variety of drugs including LSD, marijuana and cocaine.

title: El Al Is Granted Loan
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (UPI)The ExportImport Ban today announced a direct loan to El Al Israel airlines of $1,589,400 to finance 45 per cent of the purchase of $3,532,000 worth of equipment in the United States. The bank said, if required, it could also provide a financial guarantee of a similar amount from nonU.S. source funds.

title: Writers Name Area AllStar Quintet
description: St. John's and Rutgers gained two berths each on the 10man University Division AllStar basketball squad named yesterday by the Metropolitan Basketball Writers Association for the New YorkNew Jersey area.

title: A drmial Reports 11,000 Mines Dropped in the North's Waters
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The Defense Department said today that the United States had dropped about 11,000 mines in North Vietnamese waters.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Supreme Court Justice Xavier C. Riccobono yesterday ordered at least a partial reopening of the case William A. (Tony) Maynard, convected in 1967 and sentenced to 20 years in the shooting of Marine Sgt. Michael Kroll, a muchdecorated Vietnam veteran who was killed M Greenwich Village. The judge's order will allow socalled new evidence and allegations of misconduct officials to be heard.

title: The High Cost of Politics
description: WASHINGTON  In recent years there has been much comment about the high cost of politics, The rise has been dramatic. I estimate that $400million was spent in 1972 for all elective and party politics in this country at all political levels, in campaigns for nomination and for election. This represents a 33 per cent increase from 1968. It represents an increase of almost 300 per cent since 1952, when the first national total was estimated.

title: Gibson Surprises Newark With a PropertyTax Cut
description: NEWARK, March 29 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson, who has been warning residents of Newark of a huge increase in property taxes to make ends meet this year, announced today the first propertytax reduction in my three years in office.

title: Bridget Loves Bernie Dropped From C.B.S. Schedule for Fall
description: Bridget Loves Bernie, The Doris Day Show, Mission: Impossible and The New Bill Cosby Show have been dropped from the Columbia Broadcasting System's primetime schedule for the fall.

title: Kennedy Center Drops Disputed Film
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The American Film Institute has decided to withdraw a movie that the institute's director said was an inappropriate choice for the opening of a new film theater at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

title: NOSTRIKE ACCORD REACHED ON STEEL
description: PITTSBURGH, March 29 The United Steelworkers of America approved today an unprecedented agreement that virtually assures labor peace in the basic steel industry through July, 1977, and perhaps longer.

title: How the West Was Won In N.B.A.: On Coin Toss
description: Amid comicopera confusion seldom exceeded even in its own bizarre 27year history, the National Basketball Association settled its Western Conference championship and playoff alignment by the flip of a coin yesterday. Milwaukee won.

description: AMER. BASKETBALL ASSN.

title: Silver Polish Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)The recall of 2,000 bottles of silver polish containing deadly cyanide salts was announced today by the Food and Drug Administration. In declaring soluble cyanide salts a banned hazardous substance last spring, the agency said death occurs so quickly after accidental ingestion that first aid is virtually precluded. The 2,000 bottles of AG 25 Pure Silver PlatePolishing Solution were distributed between Jan. 1, 1972, and Feb. 9, 1973, to retail stores in New England, land, Buffalo, N. Y., Baltimore and Coconut Grove, Fla.

title: Advertising: Dutch Treatson TV
description: Although R. J. Reynolds under Congressional pressure agreed to stop broadcast advertising for its Winchester little cigar, Consolidated Cigar is now moving into national distribution with its Dutch Treats by Dutch Masters and TV will play a major role in its advertising.

title: ORIOLE HOME RUN BEATS YANKS, 32
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 29George Medich won a job with the Yankees and he was thrilled for many reasons, including the fact that as a member of the Players Association he'll be entitled to maternity benefits for his pregnant wife.

description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: DOLLAR IS STEADY IN TRADING ABROAD
description: LONDON, March 29 (UPI)The dollar held steady or gained fractionally on most European foreign exchange markets today and the price of gold dropped.

title: Mr. Nixon And His Friends
description: WASHINGTON, March 29President Nixon is in personal trouble over the Watergate case, not because there it any evidence that he knew about the conspiracy, but because he has not handled it in accordance with the candor and fair moral principles he insists he represents.

title: U.S. HOPES TO KEEP EQUALIZATION TAX
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)The Treasury today said it hoped to continue the interestequalization tax on purchases of foreign securities byl Americans, even though the tax is due to expire at midnight, Saturday.

title: U.S. Forces Out of Vietnam; Hanoi Frees the Last P.O.W.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 29The last American troops left South Vietnam today, leaving behind an unfinished war that has deeply scarred this country and the United States.

title: What the Students Taught in Greece
description: LONDONThe head of the Greek junta is right in being frantic with anger. The harm done by the students' revolt cannot be mended. The police, on order, can break young skulls, torture and even kill. This will only strengthen the students' reaction.

title: U.S. Forces Out of Vietnam; Hanoi Frees the Last P.O.W.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 29The last American troops left South Vietnam today, leaving behind an unfinished war that has deeply scarred this country and the United States.

title: A 50Week Protest Ends At U.S. Embassy in London
description: LONDON, March 29 (AP)One of London's longest political demonstrations ended yesterday when opponents of the Vietnam war furled their banners outside the United States Embassy for the last time.

description: The leader of the nation's home builders urged a Congressional committee yesterday to embargo the export of logs until domestic prices and supplies stabilize.

title: People and Business
description: William D. Moran was sworn in yesterday as New York regional administrator of the Securities and Exchange Commission. The man who swore him in was his predecessorand former boss Kevin Thomas Duffy, who is now a Federal judge.

title: BOYCOTT BRINGING LAYOFFS, ANXIETY
description: Shrunken paychecks, early vacations and layoffs in the wholesalemeat industry and the many related, interdependent industries loom as possible side effects of the meat boycott planned for next week.

title: KNICKS WILL OPEN PLAYOFFS TONIGHT
description: Pro basketball's championship playoffs erupt on five fronts tonight, two of them involving the New York representatives.

title: Minister and 4 Other Men Slain in Detroit Apartment
description: DETROIT, March 29 (AP)The bodies of five slain men, including a minister, were found in a Detroit apartment today.

title: Bridge: Two Young Players Attract Attention in Vanderbilt Play
description: National championships frequently bring to light young players who can be relied on to make their presence felt on many future occasions. In the recent Vanderbilt Cup in St. Louis, the Play of Mark Feldman and Bart Bramley of Waltham, Mass., who are both in their early 20's, attracted much attention.

title: Acupuncture Is Supported
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., March 29 (UPI) The State Senate lunanimously approved a bill lyesterday to permit the practice of acupuncture. The bill, which now goes to the assembly, was strongly opposed by the Nevada Medical Association.

title: Equity Financing
description: Castlewood International Corporation filed with the S.E.C. in connection with a proposed sale of 346,800 common shares by underwriters managed by Oppenheimer & Co. The company's stock was down  at 15 on the Amex.

description: CANYON, Tex., March 29 (AP)Ron Ekker, 37 years old, head coach at Hillsdale College in Michigan for the last two seasons, was hired today as head basketball coach at West Texas State University.

description: NATIONAL TOURNAMENT

title: Records: A Son's Tribute
description: Hank Williams, the country music singer who died Jan. 1, 1953, of a heart attack, is still very much a presence as far as the recording industry is concerned. Despite the fact that Williams's recording career was only four years longhis first hit record, Lovesick Blues, was made in 1949the records he made (all for MGM Records) have been issued and reissued, packaged and repackaged over the years.

title: Johnson Registers 64 And Wins Satellite Golf
description: KERNERSVILLE, N. C., March 29 (AP)George Johnson, one of the few black players on the pro tour, fashioned a sevenunderpar 64 today and won the $2,000 first prize in the Pine Tree golf tournament, a satellite event for players who did not qualify for the Greater Greensboro open.

title: McCord Testifies His Fellow Plotters Linked High Nixon Aides to Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 james W. McCord Jr. has testified under oath that his fellow conspirators in the Watergate affair gave him the impression that they had cleared their clandestine operations with ranking officials in the Nixon Administration.

title: GENE ALDRICH DIES; NAVY RAFT SURVIVOR
description: SAN DIEGO, March 28 (UPI) Gene Aldrich, who won fame in World War II as one of three navy fliers who survived 34 days adrift in the Pacific on a raft, died of cancer Tuesday. His age was 53.

title: USM Reports a Sharp Recovery In Net for 4th Quarter and Year
description: The USM Corporation made a sharp recovery in the quarter and fiscal year ended Feb. 28, reflecting increased revenues and continued strong international operations and profitable domestic operations in the last half of the year, its report disclosed yesterday. The nation's largest manufacturer of shoe machinery also produces heavy machinery for the rubber and plastics industries.

title: DIFALCO PLANNING STRONG CAMPAIGN
description: In an unusual move in politicswhere big spending usually is concealedassemblyman Anthony G. DiFalco has disclosed the details of an ambitious advertising campaign under the heading We're in to win.

title: CONSUMERS RALLY FOR MEAT BOYCOTT
description: The nationwide movement to boycott meat next week to protest high food prices gained momentum yesterday as cornmunity and women's groups began holding rallies and handing out leaflets to mobilize housewives' support.

title: House Passes Bill Extending Peace Corps 2 More Years
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (UPI)The House passed and sent to the Senate today a bill to extend the life of the Peace Corps another two years and authorize $157million of its activities during that period.

title: OLGA MOROZOVA UPSET BY FRIEND
description: Marina Kroshina, who is studying to become a sports writer in the Soviet Union, found plenty of future material last night following a 64, 46, 64 upset victory over her third  seeded countrywoman, Olga Morozova, in the opening round of the $30,000 Lady Gotham tennis tournament.

title: Rap Brown Guilty
description: Rap Brown and three codefendants were found guilty yesterday of armed robbery and assault in the holdup of a West Side bar. The jury said it was hopelessly deadlocked on the charge that the defendants had also tried to murder three policemen after the holdup. Page 14.

title: NOSTRIKE ACCORD REACHED ON STEEL
description: PITTSBURGH, March 29 The United Steelworkers of America approved today an unprecedented agreement that virtually assures labor peace in the basic steel industry through July, 1977, and perhaps longer.

title: G.O.P. Supports Racing Report
description: ALBANY, March 29  Governor Rockefeller and the Republican majority leaders of both houses of the Legislature issued a joint statement today in which they said they strongly endorsed the findings of a state commission recommending a restructuring of the state's horse racing and offtrack betting laws.

title: Vatican Broadens Role of the Laity In Communion Rite
description: ROME, March 29The Vatican, broadening existing practice, ruled today that any Roman Catholic bishop may permit members of the laitymen or womento give communion as extraordinary ministers.

title: Albany's Budget Script
description: ALBANY, March 29The debate that attended the passage of the state's new $8.77billion budget last night was a perfunctory performince in contrast to the flaming, angry rhetoric of recent yearsa bit like a tired road company in the provinces bombastically but routinely going through the paces of a hit Broadway show. There were reasons for it: there were no requests for new taxes this year, something that always provokes high emotions, and there were no major cuts in such volatile areas as education and welfare. But most important of all, the script contained only the first two acts.

title: Trade Dispute Seen In Scrutiny by U.S. Of European Pacts
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 The United States set the stage today for yet another trade quarrel with Western Europe.

title: Marburger, on Way Out, Delays 2 Touchy Cases
description: TRENTON, March 29Dr. Carl L. Marburger, who will put in his last day as State Commissioner of Education tomorrow, sidestepped today two controversial cases involving racial integration in public schools.

title: The Restaurant Has Survived and That Means Something
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

description: A mild winter, and an early spring have blended to make conditions for Sunday's opening of the New York State trout fishing season the most pleasant in several years.
